title: On, Then Off, Then Back on the Map
description: LIKE Kep, many coastal idylls are discovered, lost, and then found again. Sometimes it is the end of a civil war or political turmoil that puts them back in commission. In other instances, new or repaired infrastructure makes them more accessible. Here are a few destinations that have recently reentered the travel mix.

title: One Day, One Deliveryman, $40 in Tips
description: Saturday dinner rush, as recorded by a reporter on a bicycle who sometimes struggled to keep up. Including lunch, Lin Dakang said he made about $40 in tips.

title: Spain Adjusts Deficit-Reduction Target at European Summit
description: BRUSSELS  Spain announced Friday that a deepening recession meant it would have to abandon its deficit-reduction targets for this year, and a European summit meeting that had looked to be surprisingly routine after two years of crisis ended with another test for the credibility of the euro zone.

title: Hitting the Slopes to Recover From the Wounds of War
description: WHITEFISH, Mont.  From a distance, Billy, a Green Beret, looked like any other snowboarder, traversing the slopes with apparent ease. Only up close could other winter revelers see that he had a prosthetic leg.

title: For a Game in Costa Rica, Friendly Is a Relative Term
description: Whatever future preseason plans the Philadelphia Union of Major League Soccer have, they are probably unlikely to include a return trip to Costa Rica (notwithstanding the clubs announcement on Jan. 27 of a Friday of a working relationship with Deportivo Saprissa, the countrys top club team).

title: Book Review Podcast: The Young Man and the Sea
description: In The New York Times Book Review, Eleanor Henderson writes about Amber Dermonts debut novel, The Starboard Sea, in which a talented young sailor named Jason Prosper leaves a boarding school under troubling circumstances. Ms. Henderson writes:

description: MOSCOW  Russia made an unexpected offer to Georgia late Friday to re-establish diplomatic relations that were severed when the neighboring countries went to war in 2008.

title: Vote Planned on 40-Foot Outdoor Sculpture at Philadelphias New Barnes Foundation
description: The Philadelphia Art Commission is expected to vote on Wednesday on plans to erect a 40-foot-high stainless steel sculpture by Ellsworth Kelly at the end of a reflecting pool in the garden of the new Barnes Foundation. The art museum, on Benjamin Franklin Parkway in downtown Philadelphia, is scheduled to open in May.

title: Vintage New York Scenes in Kodak Archives
description: In the fall of 1943, a Harlem resident named Sidney Bernstein took a street portrait of Earl Johnston, a young boy in Far Rockaway, Queens. Someone named J. Johnston  presumably one of Earls parents  signed a release that allowed Mr. Bernstein to submit the photo to a picture contest.

title: Rescued Journalists Describe Conditions in Syrian City
description: Updated | 5:39 p.m. As my colleagues Neil MacFarquhar and Alan Cowell report, the Syrian authorities on Friday went back on a promise to allow a Red Cross convoy with food and medical supplies into Baba Amr, a rebellious neighborhood in the city of Homs where thousands of residents have endured weeks of heavy bombardment.

title: Breaking Up Bank of America, in Song
description: Public Citizen has a message for Bank of America: Size matters.

description: Subjects include an early bloom for flowers, the debate over a Whole Foods in Brooklyn, and the closing of a legendary Doo Wop record store.

title: N.F.L. Inquiry Says Saints Set Bounty for Hits
description: During the past three seasons, while the National Football League has been changing rules and levying fines in an effort to improve player safety, members of the New Orleans Saints defense maintained a lucrative bounty system that paid players for injuring opponents, according to an extensive investigation by the N.F.L.

title: The Munchkins Are a Problem: One Mom's Struggle to Direct the Fifth-Grade School Play
Union Rat Lands at Manhattan School of Music
description: Nearly three years after forming a union, teachers of pre-college students at the Manhattan School of Music are locked in a dispute with the administration over wages as they seek their first collective bargaining agreement. On Friday, they brought out the inflatable rat and distributed leaflets near the schools entrance on Broadway and 122nd Street.

title: A.O. Scott on Dr. Seuss Books and Adaptations
description: In his review of The Loraxin todays paper, A.O. Scott writes:

title: Leader of the Pack
description: Years of traveling have taught Bruce Pask exactly what to bring  and where it all fits.

title: How Head Start Can Make a Difference
description: Head Start, the governments program for giving preschool training to children from low-income families, has become something of a political football as both parties champion their efforts to spend government funds more efficiently.

title: Santorum Remains Modest Favorite in Ohio
description: In Michigan, the betting market Intrade always had Mitt Romney favored  even when he fell behind Rick Santorum in the polls. That prediction looked prescient in the end.

title: The Evidence on E.M.D.R.
description: This week, readers of the Consults blog posed questions about eye movement desensitization and reprocessing, or E.M.D.R., a psychological therapy pioneered by Francine Shapiro that uses eye movements and other procedures to process traumatic memories. The therapy has been used increasingly to treat post-traumatic stress disorder and other traumas. You can learn more about how E.M.D.R. therapy is done here. Below, Dr. Shapiro addresses reader questions about the current state of research on E.M.D.R. therapy.

title: Editors Letter
description: Timelessness, when it comes to matters of style, is a misguided virtue. You dont really want clothes that are timeless (and we all know that the years can get the better of any garment: that leather aviator jacket you swore youd have forever? suddenly looks like Indiana Jones, the first go-round); you want to wear things that are relevant to, but not necessarily restricted by, the way you live now. Its that tough trick of being on trend without being trendy.

title: In the Company of Animals: Art, Literature, and Music at the Morgan
description: A new exhibition at the Morgan Library & Museum explores the relationship between animals and the artistic imagination.

title: The Beasts Without and Within
description: When Odysseus, disguised as a beggar, returned home after 20 years of war and wandering, his aged dog, Argos, knew him instantly. Infested with ticks, half dead with neglect and lacking the strength even to drag himself toward his master, Argos thumped his tail, nuzzled low, and dropped his ears in grateful recognition. Then the dark shadow of death closed down on Argos eyes.

title: Big Datas Grass-Roots Revolution
description: The Big Data revolution may be raising more questions than it is answering. Who owns my behavior? Where does my government begin and end? Should I be able to bet on the outcome of a trial?

title: Yucking It Up on Yahoo, Like a Grown-Up
description: LIKE any network executive Erin McPherson spent the winter half-crazed over content decisions. She sifted through pitches, sat through pilots, took conference calls over the Christmas holiday from a bedroom in her parents Colorado home.

title: Looking Back at Complaints About Saints Dirty Play
description: Some fans wont be shocked by Fridays news about the Saints defense:

title: Baseball Officially Expands Playoff Format
description: Major League Baseball expanded its playoff format to 10 teams Friday, adding a second wild-card in each league.

title: What to Watch This Weekend
description: Go to any what to watch this weekend post and it will immediately sing the praises of another North Carolina versus Duke matchup. What could be better than that? The bitter rivals are ranked No. 6 and No. 3. Duke won the first meeting in Chapel Hill on a wild tell-all-your-friends-to-watch-the-highlights 3-pointer by Austin Rivers (with dad Doc in the stands cheering) after the Tar Heels squandered a huge lead. Yes, the Tar Heels will be motivated to rectify that but will have to do it in the bandbox that is Cameron Indoor Stadium.

title: Springsteen: More Fanfares for Those Common Men
description: The New York Timess pop critics Jon Pareles and Jon Caramanica discuss Bruce Springsteens album Wrecking Ball, to be released Tuesday by Columbia.

title: Iranian News Media Portray Elections as a Blow to the U.S.
description: Irans state news media reported that voting in parliamentary elections in Iran on Friday was a huge  even epic  success.

title: Dreaming Small
description: Steven Kaplan of Rego Park, Queens, spent six years building a replica of his desired car, a tiny Morgan three-wheeler.

title: Beets? Arugula? Make a Smoothie!
description: In the latest Recipes for Health, Martha Rose Shulman creates smoothies for grown-up tastes. Using ingredients commonly found in salads or on a dinner plate, Ms. Shulman creates unique and refreshing smoothies that can work as a snack or a meal.

title: Cables New Pack of Girls, Trying on the Woman Thing
description: WASNT this supposed to be the television season of the young woman? It was only last September when the arrival of network sitcoms like Whitney, 2 Broke Girls and New Girl heralded the possibility that the urban exploits of women in their 20s, once largely invisible to television programmers, would become a genre as established as the gross-out crime procedural. But while those comedies found their followings, they also took criticism for their crassness, their fixations on punch lines about lady parts and their oddly inauthentic depictions of the women at the heart of those shows.

title: What Do Beethoven and Stravinsky Have in Common? Listen Closely
description: The New York Philharmonic is devoting most of March to the Modern Beethoven, a festival with two potentially illuminating, if not particularly novel, goals. One is to explore the connections among Beethovens symphonies and three worthy but less traveled 20th-century works. The other is to make the Beethoven symphonies sound fresh, even to listeners who have been hearing them their whole lives.

title: TimesCast | Russia to Vote
description: Prime Minister Vladimir V. Putin is expected to win a third presidential term in Sundays Russian election.

title: TimesCast | Ruling on a Hijab Ban
description: March 2, 2012 - A panel that dictates international soccer rules will decide on Saturday whether women can wear a hijab while competing at the World Cup and Olympics.

title: With Citigroup Stabilized, Parsons Decides to Retire

title: Greek Official Warns Debt Holdouts
description: MADRID  For the hedge funds who are looking to sue Greece instead of taking a 75 percent loss on their bonds, the head of Greeces debt management agency has some blunt advice: Think twice before racking up those big legal bills.

title: DealBooks Week in Review
description: The average Wall Street bonus was down to $121,150; the biggest buyout was a Texas-size bust and Gordon Gekko is cooperating with the F.B.I. A look back on our reporting of the past weeks highs and lows in finance.

title: A World Away, a Wish Answered
description: EIGHT years ago, when I was 22, I woke up next to a man I realized I didnt love and wondered what I was doing with my life. I have to go, I thought. But it was Christmas Eve, and I was expecting him to propose the next morning.

title: Teslas Official Word on a Customers Battery Failure
description: A letter from Teslas vice president of service to a Roadster owner, explaining the companys decision to decline a warranty replacement of the cars battery.

title: Digital Notes: Online Distributor Makes Deal With Universal for Physical Sales
description: A Digital Distributor Gets Physical: INgrooves, a distributor for digital music, is moving into physical sales through a deal with the Universal Music Group to take over Fontana, Universals independent arm in North America. Terms were not disclosed.

title: Little Mermaid Goes Punk
description: SHOUT out to Tumblr, said Zombelle, a blue-haired singer who performed last weekend at an unnamed warehouse in Williamsburg, Brooklyn. The concert was billed as the citys first Seapunk Alien Disco Indie Rave, but only a handful of the 20-somethings clutching cans of Budweiser seemed to know precisely what seapunk even meant.

title: An Older Beauty Sings Over Spilt Beer
description: ZURICH  About 15 years ago the mezzo-soprano Cecilia Bartoli seemed to be taking New York by storm. Featured in three new productions at the Metropolitan Opera from 1996 to 1998, she even had a book to seal the stardom deal: Manuela Hoelterhoffs Cinderella and Company, published in 1998, told the story of the contemporary opera industry through the lens of Ms. Bartolis career.

title: Do the Right Thing
description: Intolerance and character assassination are so ubiquitous in political discourse that its important to take note when someone calls out bad behavior, withstands it, or bothers to apologize for it.

title: Time to Pick the Winner of the Pulp Fiction Contest
description: Update, March 7, 4:30 p.m. | The polls are now closed. You may continue to recommend your favorite story-ettes, but the voting is now done. We have our winner. Details soon.Update, March 5 | Click to read the actual opening of Atlantic Avenue and a profile of its author.

description: TESTED 2012 Buick Regal GS

title: Pro-Am Winners Are Helped by Imperfect Bidding and Play
description: The Night of the Stars tournament was held on Feb. 23 at the Wimbledon Bridge Club in London.

title: Why Tuition Has Skyrocketed at State Schools
description: I have an article today about the states long-term divestment from public higher education, and what that means for students.

title: Laliques Glass Menagerie, Too Cool to Ride on Radiators
description: PART weird bestiary, part alien zodiac, the crystalline characters of Ren Lalique appear far too ethereal to ride on the noses of mere motorcars. Perhaps that is why these automotive mascots  hood ornament is too mundane a characterization  are among the most treasured automotive accessories.

title: Amelia Concours Is Also a Birthday Party
description: AS the first major concours dlgance each year, the winter event at Amelia Island, Fla., gets the first shot at celebrating automotive milestones. Such is the case this year with the 50th anniversary of the Ferrari GTO and the Shelby Cobra.

title: Wedding Q&A
description: A Bridal Shower Without the Bride

title: Auto Ego: Three Wheels and a Spare
description: Steven Kaplan, a semi-retired assistant director at Head Start, spent seven years rebuilding his cherry-red, three-wheel Morgan replica.

title: Yohji Yamamoto: Fall 2012 RTW
description: Paris

title: Super Tuesday Voters: Whats Driving Your Choice?
description: Do you live in one of the states holding nominating contests on March 6, Super Tuesday? What are the issues close to home that are driving your vote?

title: Out There | Live From the Whitney Biennial
description: var data;function jsonSlideshowCallback(response){data = response;}NYTD.options = {source: data,cropType: 'blog480',appendTo: 'fullScreenSlideShow',showHeadLine: 'false', renderstyle: "embeddedSlideShowTmag"}

title: Now Online | T Spring Mens Fashion 2012
description: The mens spring fashion issue of T is filled with actors of every stripe. Our cover star Dustin Hoffman dissects his career with Giles Foden, Paul Dano brings morning into midday with a pajama shirt, and Willem Dafoe talks about his distinctive features with Joan Juliet Buck. Theres also a behind-the-scenes look at Of Men and Mavericks, the Curtis Hanson-directed film about surfing, starring Gerard Butler. Inside you will find cocktail-inspired grooming products, a primer on how to pack smarter and our must-haves: Italian suits, canvas kicks and weekend watches. When youre done shopping, read the essay by the photojournalist Trevor Snapp about his assignments around the globe, Suzy Menkes on the runways military moment and Will Self on the hip-hop star Azealia Banks. And dont forget our fashion portfolios: Freshly Pressed, with the likes of Martin Amis and Richard Ford, showing off the seasons stand out shirts, and Riffraff Revisited, in which the art collective Still House cleans up cool. See more from the issue >>

title: Pace of Ocean Acidification Has No Parallel in 300 Million Years, Paper Says
description: A new scientific paper suggests that the ocean is acidifying at a rate that is many times faster than at any time in the last 300 million years. The change is occurring so rapidly that it raises the possibility that we are entering an unknown territory of marine ecosystem change, said the paper, published this week in the journal Science.

title: Fitting, in Many Ways
description: A SURPRISING number of people harbor a secret fondness for their grandparents  or at least for their grandparents things, that is. Whether it is Granddads old leather box for his collars or Grandmas battered alligator handbag, the attraction is usually the same: the object represents a time when men and women dressed and lived with greater dignity and elegance than Mom (in mom jeans) or Dad (in dad jeans) do. Some grandparents had grandeur.

title: Pictures of the Day: Iran and Elsewhere
description: Photos from Iran, Syria, South Korea, South Carolina, Washington, China, India and New York.

title: Attack by Limbaugh Awakens a Stop Rush Campaign
description: Some of the same activists that persuaded advertisers to boycott Glenn Becks television show on Fox News in 2009 are now mobilizing against Rush Limbaugh in the wake of his verbal attacks on a Georgetown University law school student this week.

title: Dinner? Paris? Invite Everyone!
description: BEFORE Facebook, Couchsurfing.org, and even before the Internet, Jim Haynes was helping the world connect. In the late 1980s, he wrote five travel books, each containing short biographies of people from Russia and Eastern Europe who were willing to accept travelers into their homes.

title: Racing (Briefly) Along the Iditarod Trail
description: THE dogs howled and barked and moaned with excitement. The noise grew to a crescendo; they were ready to run. I listened, transfixed, beside the sled.

title: Restaurant Review: MeroToro, Mexico City
description: With their first restaurant, Contramar, in the Colonia Roma neighborhood of Mexico City, Gabriela Cmara and Pablo Bueno accomplished what must have seemed impossible: they had satisfied the high-altitude, landlocked citys taste for straight-from-the-boat, beachside-style seafood.

title: Hotel Review: St. Regis Princeville Resort
description: THE UPSHOT

title: Fliers Reading List
description: To the Editor: Regarding High-Brow Lit for High Fliers (Feb. 19), Im glad the writer discovered the value of contemporary mystery and thriller writers for modern plane travel. Ive got my Nook, and its the only way to remove oneself from the tedious experience of flying. I can take half a dozen books without weighing down my handbag.

title: Rum and Reggae? Not Here
description: OUTSIDE Treasure Beach, on Jamaicas rural southern coast, a half-dozen oxen are blocking the one potholed road into town. When the taxi driver honks, they turn, stare and stand their ground.

title: Hut-to-Hut Skiing
description: To the Editor: Regarding A Cool Glide (Feb. 19), sounds like a nice hut system in the works. A word of advice: If youre the type who starts a trip at 9 p.m. without a headlamp, treks in winter without a sleeping bag and finds a 200-foot vertical gain over a half-mile steep, you may want to stay away from the 10th Mountain Division huts and other Western hut systems. We dont want you to get in trouble, or put others in danger trying to rescue you. Adam Serafin

title: Solentinames Distinctive Art
description: Paintings by local artists depict the islands as a paradise of impossibly lush flora, exotic birds and people happily going about their daily lives.

title: In Lush Nicaragua, Legacy of a Priest
description: THE Solentiname Islands in Nicaragua are familiar to aficionados of primitivist art. Paintings by local artists depict the islands as a paradise of impossibly lush flora, exotic birds, distinctive hanging birds nests and people happily going about their daily lives.

title: Overnighter | Bratislava, Slovakia
description: The Slovak capital offers rich history, unusual local flavors, stunning architecture and vibrant restaurants and night life.

title: A Vienna Getaway Minus the Crowds
description: ATMOSPHERIC churches, romantic cobblestone lanes, cool new cafes or quirky museums: What do locals in the Slovak capital of Bratislava recommend visitors see first?

title: Terry Richardsons Photographs Provoke and Reveal
description: Mr. Richardson has become known for a kind of glossed-up 1970s porn chic that is popular in high fashion.

title: Open but Undeveloped
description: The area around Kep in Cambodia is still in that travelers sweet spot  mostly itself, but with roads and a few boutique hotels here and there for those who want them.

title: The Naughty Knave of Fashions Court
description: AT 10:45 a.m. on Valentines Day, Terry Richardson arrived at the Smile, a farmhouse restaurant near his Lafayette Street studio. The fashion photographer was wearing a blue plaid shirt he bought for $5 on eBay, his hair a halo of speckled gray framing his customary black glasses. He is taller than he appears in photographs, usually alongside someone famous, his thumb turned up in what has become a signature gesture. Accompanied by Amanda Silverman, a friend and publicist, he sat at a table in the back and ordered a bowl of granola with honey.

title: A Kit With Few Instructions Inspires an Improv Act
description: LIKE many homes in the Rego Park section of Queens, the one owned by Steven Kaplan and his wife, Dalia, is made of red brick and has a short driveway that slopes down from the street to a small garage below.

title: Tesla Battery Failures Make Bricking a Buzzword
description: AN uproar recently ignited on automotive blogs over a post about a Tesla Roadster whose battery needed replacement after its owner parked the car, low on charge and unplugged, for more than two months. The battery, which had fully discharged, could not be revived.

title: Prunes and Pork, Still in Season
description: BY the time it gets to be March, we can be fooled into thinking winter has passed (especially this year). And whether the winter has been mild or frightful, we start to yearn for spring and lighter fare.

title: Top Obama Adviser to Appear at Super PAC Meeting
description: David Plouffe, a top political adviser to President Obama, is scheduled to appear at a West Coast fund-raising meeting Friday for the super PAC backing President Obamas re-election bid, according to several people familiar with the event.

title: Frolicking With Bubbly Saints and Marching With the Band
description: As choreographers go, Mark Morris isnt particularly mysterious. The starting point of all of his dances is a nearly religious adherence to music, but beneath that surface, its the range that makes you wonder, what drives such a fervent mind?

title: The Week in Culture Pictures, March 2
description: A slide show of photographs of cultural events from this week.

title: Does Couples Therapy Work?
description: WEVE all had that horrible experience: you throw a party or invite a couple over for dinner, and they start fighting, right there in front of you  the character assassination, the barely controlled anger, the neurotic transference of their cooled sexual attraction onto, say, the hygiene of the family dog, all of which makes you want to fake choking and hide. Surely bearing witness to couples quarrels feels less bad to the pros, those credentialed and compensated marriage and family therapists whose job it is to help significant others work through issues and pain?

title: G.M. Again Pauses Production of Chevy Volt
description: DETROIT  General Motors said on Friday that it planned to halt production of the Chevrolet Volt for five weeks beginning later this month because dealers had more than they needed.

title: Never Fear: The Rock Stars in Blue Will Zoom in, by Van, to Save the Day
description: Im not proud of this opening line, but Im going with it anyway: Its not easy being blue. At least on TV.

title: Meet the Mushrooms
description: Melissa Clark demonstrates how to clean and work with different kinds of mushrooms.

title: Barley, Celery Root and Mushroom Salad With Scallion Vinaigrette
description: Time: 90 minutes

title: Jump-Starting Spring With Mushrooms and Barley
description: MUSHROOM barley soup, as nubby as oatmeal, is the kind of thing my grandmother used to simmer on the stove all winter long. The barley partly dissolved after a few hours, thickening the broth until it was dense and shiny and slightly sticky.

title: Have An Unlimited Data Plan With AT&T? Tips on Watching Your Data Usage
description: AT&T on Thursday clarified the limitations of its unlimited data plan. You can use a certain amount of gigabytes, and after that, your smartphones Internet speeds are subject to being slowed down, a practice known as throttling. Just how much you get slowed down is a mystery, but people who have been throttled say the Internet connections on their phones became so slow they were unusable.

title: As Wolves Diminish, Moose Flourish
description: John Vucetich, a wildlife ecologist from Michigan Technological University, leads the wolf-moose Winter Study at Isle Royale National Park.

title: More Fluoridated Water, but Not in New Jersey
description: In a federal study of 2008 data, New Jersey and Hawaii were the only states where less than a quarter of the population using a public water supply received fluoride in the water.

title: The Week in Culture Pictures, March 2
description: More Photographs

title: Tacos That Fit in the Palm
description: Before Taquera Autntica, a full-service Mexican restaurant seating 27, opened in August in Bloomfield, it had a yearlong rollout in Newark. The restaurant grew out of a food truck there, having started life as a stand at the Montclair Farmers Market in 2009.

title: Adventurous Addition to the Pizza Landscape
description: OSTERIA PROCACCINI has aspirations. It aims for something beyond the culture of the slice: a pizza topped with clams; salads with beets and arugula or pear and gorgonzola. Though not perfect, it is a success. The restaurant, which opened early last year in Kingston, several miles northeast of Princeton, is a worthy addition to the pizza landscape in central New Jersey.

title: Saints Vilma and Others React to Bounty Report
description: It seemed as if it was going to be a pretty average Friday afternoon in Jonathan Vilmas off-season.

title: Lanvin: Fall 2012 RTW
description: Paris

title: Friday Night Music: Feist
An Interview With Gareth Pugh
description: Suzy Menkes speaks with the designer about the power of fashion films, his latest collection and his mentor Rick Owens.

title: Mets Prospects Get First Chance to Impress
description: PORT ST. LUCIE, Fla.  The Mets played their first intrasquad game of the season on Friday, giving their coaches, front office officials, and a smattering of their fans an up-close view of some of the organizations top prospects.

title: Powerful Storms Cut Across Southern and Midwestern States
description: Last Updated | Saturday | 10:16 a.m. | Rescue workers in southern Indiana were still sifting through mountains of debris from demolished homes and buildings this morning to look for more victims from Fridays deadly tornadoes, which killed at least 31 people in Indiana, Kentucky and Ohio.

title: The Art of Making Beer: Not Just for Professionals
description: PORT JEFFERSON, N.Y.

title: A New Look, but Is It Dior?
description: PARIS

title: The Packard Plant, a Symbol of Bygone Detroit, May Be Demolished
description: DETROIT  Decades removed from the era when its 3.5 million square feet hummed with activity, the historic but derelict Packard Motor Car Company plant appears closer than ever to a date with the wrecking ball.

title: Moving Military Newspaper to Base Raises Concerns on Independence
description: WASHINGTON  The military newspaper Stars and Stripes, a hometown daily for troops deployed from Bastogne to Long Binh to Baghdad, has been ordered to vacate its headquarters here and move to a military base 30 miles away. It is a cost-cutting effort that has outraged staff members worried that they will lose their journalistic independence and also has attracted new high-level attention from Congress.

title: Amid the Informality, Inspired Italian Flavors
description: NEW CANAAN has attracted several new restaurants, one of which  the Tuscan Osteria and Mercato  has taken over a large and comfortable space formerly occupied by a furniture store. Guests enter through the mercato, past baskets of produce and gleaming cases of fresh meats; in the dining area (separated from the shop by a charming brick archway), banquettes, brick walls and arches provide a rustic contrast to the white-tablecloth formality. Behind the dining area is a barroom, with tables and television screens placed off to the side of the long and lively bar.

title: At Lanvin, the Delights Come Before the Party
description: Friday night was the 10th anniversary of Alber Elbazs role as the designer of Lanvin, a period in which he transformed the label from a dusty whatsit to an in-the-know commodity. Everybody in fashion loves Mr. Elbaz, too. Hes a self-effacing, charming, utterly enthusiastic designer who likes his audience to have a good time, so he invited every guest at his runway show to his big birthday party that followed:

title: Too Many Medical Tests, Too Little Care?
description: To the Editor:

title: A Memorial to Eisenhower: The Commissions View
description: To the Editor:

title: Photos of the Moment | Isabel Marant
description: var data;function jsonSlideshowCallback(response){data = response;}NYTD.options = {source: data,cropType: 'blog480',appendTo: 'fullScreenSlideShow',showHeadLine: 'false', renderstyle: "embeddedSlideShowTmag"}

title: In Debut on Market, Yelp Stock Surges 64%
description: Yelp may not yet be profitable, but investors still gave the company rave reviews in its debut.

title: Pork and Prunes, a Classic Duo
description: In this weeks City Kitchen, were featuring the classic French bistro duo of roast pork and prunes. Though it is often made with pan-fried chops or larger pork roasts, I decided to use the popular and user-friendly cut called pork tenderloin. Even though it can be a bit pricier than other cuts, especially if purchased from a better butcher, there is no waste. Ive found that a lean trimmed tenderloin weighing about a pound provides enough meat for four generous portions.

title: To Rinse or Not To Rinse?
description: For years, I never allowed raw mushrooms, which figure prominently in my column this week, to touch water. I feared theyd bloat up and become enormous, waterlogged things that would never crisp in the pan. I wasnt alone. This was the prevailing wisdom as passed down from veritable Chefs. And it may have been wrong.

title: Calling for an End to Phony Military Discharges
description: To the Editor:

title: Video Imagines Syrian First Ladys Outrage Over Gaza War Applied to Killing in Homs
description: A video blogger has remixed footage of an interview Asma al-Assad gave to CNN in 2009, in which Syrias British-born first lady decried the Israeli bombardment of Gaza, to make it seem as if she was speaking out against the violent crackdown on dissent currently under way in Syria.

title: Old-World Charm, Maybe a Tableside Torch
description: ITS easy to miss La Catena, which occupies one of the unprepossessing storefronts lining a long shopping strip in Ardsley. But youll need a reservation if you want to go there on a Saturday night. Diners have discovered this wonderfully old-fashioned Italian restaurant, which still operates in yesteryears formal yet friendly European style, delivering unrushed service from a gracious, attentive staff.

title: Weekend Preview: Liverpool-Arsenal Is a Good Start to the Day
description: Rob Hughes previews the top matchups in Europe this weekend.

title: Afghanistan and Vietnam
description: To the Editor:

title: A House in the 40s, Songs of Today
description: Suavely dragging on their cigarettes, tippling from their pocket flasks, and striking grandly languorous poses, the characters in the new musical February House look as if they stepped out of some fabulous movie Bette Davis forgot to make. But dont be deceived. As soon as they open their mouths, its clear that while their outfits, the masterly work of Jess Goldstein, speak nostalgically of the 1940s, their songs absolutely, unconditionally sing of today  and herald the arrival of a major talent on the musical theater scene.

title: Rocky Mountain Watering Holes
description: In Denver, quirky state alcohol laws, a storied brewing culture and a patchwork of well-carved neighborhoods have created ideal conditions for start-up breweries.

title: Craft Brewing Finds a Welcoming Atmosphere
description: DENVER  Each time Scott Witsoe opens up his one-man brewery in a drab industrial park near downtown, he gets a rush of euphoria, a sensation quickly eclipsed by panic.

title: French Journalists Return Home After 9 Days Trapped in Syria
description: VILLACOUBLAY, France  After escaping from the central Syrian city of Homs, where for nine days they were trapped in the besieged neighborhood of Baba Amr, two French journalists returned to France on Friday evening.

title: Making Prints, and Leaving an Impact
description: EAST ISLIP, N.Y.

title: The Weeks Business News in Pictures
description: The European debt crisis unfolded further, with Greece adopting emergency measures for borrowers and Spain abandoning its deficit-reduction goals. Gasoline prices rose, but the Federal Reserve held to its forecast for modest economic growth. Yelp had its initial public offering.

title: CBS and MSG Looking Into Broadcasting Dodgers
description: CBS and Madison Square Garden are separately exploring the possibility of making a media rights deal with the Los Angeles Dodgers, two people briefed on their strategies said on Friday.

title: Sounds Creamy and Abrasive
description: The voice of the St. Louis cabaret performer Craig Pomranz comes in two flavors.

title: The Imperishable Presence of Citizen Hearst
description: William Randolph Hearst was born in California in 1863. William Randolph Hearst died in California in 1951. His most famous home, at San Simeon, is in California. His tomb is in California. And it was in California, 125 years ago Sunday, that he laid the foundation stone of his media empire, when his name appeared for the first time in The Daily Examiner of San Francisco as W. R. Hearst, Proprietor.

title: Officials Tell of Fake Labels Hidden Beneath Fake Labels
description: NEWARK  With skin fashioned like hightop moccasins, they looked like popular UGG brand boots. But tags on their heels read XMX, and they had generic tread on their bottoms.

title: A New Tenant, a Ruckus and a Corpse on the Stairs
description: The little landlady turned 89 years old last year in the house where she spent more than 50 of those years, the sort of warm home that breathed like a person, inhaling and exhaling loved ones.

title: American Music Influenced by Europe
description: OVER the past decade, Copland House and the Caramoor Center for Music and the Arts, two of Westchester Countys leading cultural institutions, have forged a collaborative relationship. But on March 11, that relationship will briefly turn competitive. By chance, both institutions have scheduled concerts on that day, and both concerts explore perspectives on America that are framed, implicitly or explicitly, by views of Europe.

title: At Angies List, the Reviews Are Real (So Is Angie)
description: INDIANAPOLIS

title: Idaho Senator to Push Gay Rights Bill From the Outside
description: BOISE, Idaho  Lawmakers next door in Washington State just voted to legalize same-sex marriage. Here, they will not allow a bill to be formally filed that would protect gay people from basic forms of discrimination in areas like education, employment, public services and real estate transactions.

title: Your Reviews of Angies List
description: All of the attention on Friday was on Yelp and its successful initial public offering. But I find Angies List to be much more intriguing from a consumer perspective.

title: The Lin Songs Remain the Same: They Fall Short
description: There was Jeremy Lin on Wednesday night, blood streaming from his nose after taking a hit from Omri Casspi during the Knicks victory over the Cavaliers. Walking off the court, he tilted his head back, two red streaks spilling into his mouth  a hero defeated. But before long he was back in the game, and it was clear: here is a man in need of a worthy theme song.

title: Theyre Young, in Love and Willing to Commit (Minus Any Strings)
description: The hero and heroine of the Bollywood romance London Paris New York, written and directed by the newcomer Anu Menon, talk a lot about freedom. And as the title suggests, they search for it far from India and home.

title: A Fox Hunt, With a $205,000 Prize
description: In Sundays Automobiles section, I write about a rare complete set of Lalique glass radiator ornaments consigned by RM Auctions for its coming sale, scheduled for March 10 in conjunction with the Amelia Island Concours dlgance in Florida.

title: Of Bricks and Batteries: The Anatomy of a Controversy
description: In Sundays Automobiles section, Bradley Berman writes about bricking, a term that describes whathappened to the battery pack of a Tesla Roadster electric sports car that had been left unplugged for an extended period and rendered useless  in other words, a brick.

title: Albee Is Ready to Revisit His Past
description: When Edward Albee wrote The Lady From Dubuque in the late 1970s, at the time his most explicit play about mortality, he was coming off his second Pulitzer Prize for drama (for Seascape) and was deep in the throes of alcoholism. He lashed out at actresses like Ingrid Bergman, who were offered the title role but questioned the works surrealist dimensions; at the same time, as he later told his biographer, Mel Gussow, he was too drunk too often to fix problems that even he saw in the second act.

title: Week in Pictures for March 2
description: Here is a slide show of photographs from the past week in New York City and the region. Subjects include an early bloom for flowers, the debate over a Whole Foods store in Brooklyn, and the closing of a legendary doo-wop record store.

title: Santorum Calls for Investigation of Michigan Republican Party
description: Rick Santorum has asked the Republican National Committee to investigate the actions of the Michigan Republican Party, which on Thursday switched its decision to award a delegate to Mr. Santorum, giving it to Mitt Romney instead.

title: Why Dont We Read About Architecture?
description: Buildings are everywhere, writes Alexandra Lange, large and small, ugly and beautiful, ambitious and dumb. We walk among them and live inside them but are largely passive dwellers in cities or towers, houses, open spaces, and shops we had no hand in creating.

title: A Grammy Winner Tests Himself
description: Writing for musical theater is the hardest thing the Grammy-winning songwriter Mike Reid, of Nashville, has ever done, he says, adding, Im not smart enough to know why, but it is.

title: When a Road Opened Under the Hudson
description: Hoboken, N.J.

title: Starving Iran Wont Free It
description: THERES an old saying, attributed to the British Foreign Office in colonial days: Keep the Persians hungry, and the Arabs fat. For the British  then the stewards of Persian destiny  that was the formula for maintaining calm; it still is for Saudi Arabian leaders, who simply distribute large amounts of cash to their citizens at the first sign of unrest at their doorstep.

title: Contest Whose Winners May Not Succeed
description: New Yorks BigApps contest, now in Version 3.0, has won no small amount of praise. Using data supplied by public agencies, Web developers compete for $50,000 in prizes, awarded based on voting by the public and a panel of judges. Voting on this years entries ends on Thursday.

title: A Twist on Posthumous Baptisms Leaves Jews Miffed at Mormon Rite
description: When you hear that your zayde, who died in Auschwitz, has become a Mormon, well, baruch ha-shem!  blessed be God!  thats just what he always wanted.

title: Only Crippling Sanctions Will Stop Iran
description: Brussels

title: Reviewing the Buick Regal GS
description: In Sundays Automobiles section, Lawrence Ulrich drives the 2012 Buick Regal GS, the sportiest version of a sedan that began life as a European corporate relation, the Opel Insignia.

title: Satellite Images From Syria
description: Sometimes pictures are worth much, much more than a thousand words.

title: Israel Guards Against Increased Terror Peril From a Laxly Patrolled Sinai
description: NEGEV DESERT, Israel  For decades, the striking ridges and shady passes of the western Negev Desert along Israels border with Egypt were an alluring gateway to the pristine beaches of the Sinai Peninsula.

title: Rules Board to Consider Ending Ban on Hijabs
description: The long-disputed issue of whether Muslim womens soccer players should be allowed to wear headscarves in games will be addressed Saturday at a meeting of the sports international rules board.

title: The Poverty of an Idea
description: Clinton, N.Y.

title: A Chinese Voice of Dissent That Took Its Time
description: BEIJING

title: Before Games, Religious Questions
description: With 500 students, increasing academic prestige and an established soccer team, Iman Academy SW, an Islamic school in Houston, was seeking membership in 2010 to the Texas Association of Private and Parochial Schools, a group that organizes competition among more than 200 schools in the state.

title: In Stormy Weather, Grey Goose and Halibut
description: Hints of spring send hopeful diners in search of outdoor space, but when cold rain blows in, windows overlooking the street are the next best thing.

title: In Washington Caucus, Expect the Unexpected
description: Only one pollster has been brave enough to survey Washington, which will hold its Republican caucus on Saturday. That firm, Public Policy Polling, polled the state once in mid-February and again this week.

title: Model-Morphosis | Ginta Lapina at Lanvin
description: The photographer Greg Kessler captures the transformations of the Fall 2012 Fashion Week in Paris. Here, the model Ginta Lapina of Women Model Management before (left) and after (right) transforms, with makeup by Pat McGrath and hair by Guido Palau.

title: Furor Over Report Hints at a Chinese Policy Debate
description: SHANGHAI  When the World Bank and a Chinese research organization called on Beijing policy makers this week to scale back the power of state-owned companies, reform-minded economists offered praise. But not everyone is pleased.

title: In New Jersey, a Battle Over a Fluoridation Bill, and the Facts
description: For all its renown as an engine of pharmaceutical and biotechnology progress, New Jersey has long lagged in what public health officials call one of the 10 biggest health advances of the last century: fluoridating its water.

title: From Police Beat to Prayer Beads
description: FOR more than 20 years, he was Officer James Georges of the New York Police Department. Now he goes by the ancient Egyptian name Baba Heru Semahj.

title: Out of the Bronx, a Gymnast Sets Sights on Gold
description: It would usually take an hour or more, depending on traffic, for Damaris Orozco to drive her youngest son a world away, from the far edge of the Bronx to World Cup Gymnastics in suburban Westchester County. At first it was a couple of times a week. But John Orozco was 9 when coaches saw Olympic potential. Soon, it was six days a week, even seven.

title: You Cant Spell Bowling Without L-I-N.
description: Fans and news media, still ever-hungry for new factoids on all things Jeremy Lin, got another morsel at Friday nights 13th Annual Knick Bowl on Pier 60 of Chelsea Piers.

title: Putin Gains as Foes Offer Little Threat
description: MOSCOW  The subject up for discussion was Russias educational system. But for Vladimir V. Zhirinovsky, who will challenge Vladimir V. Putin in Sundays presidential elections, it was just another occasion for a jaunt into crazy land.

title: For Stroller Maker, Bankruptcy Is Latest Setback
description: For years, Maclaren strollers have carried babies  along with a certain prestige  on the sidewalks of well-heeled neighborhoods from Park Slope to Palo Alto.

title: Gillis Leads and Woods Rescues His Round
description: PALM BEACH GARDENS, Fla.  Tom Gillis may hold a share of the 36-hole lead at the Honda Classic, but he has no illusions about his place in golf.

title: Deadly Tornadoes Pound the South and the Midwest
description: A frantic day and night of fast-moving tornadoes and severe thunderstorms churned across the South and the Midwest on Friday, leaving behind at least 27 deaths, hundreds of injuries and countless damaged buildings in several states.

title: The Yankees Explain Their Fiscal Austerity
description: TAMPA, Fla.  On Thursday, Hal Steinbrenner, the Yankees managing general partner, declared that the Yankees would cut roughly $20 million from their payroll over the next two years. That would get them under baseballs $189 million luxury-tax threshold, which serves as a kind of soft salary cap.

title: Crushing Homs
description: After a month of merciless bombardment, the forces of President Bashar al-Assad of Syria have taken Homs, the main rebel stronghold. Many of the brave residents have fled the city or been killed, adding to a death toll now estimated at more than 7,500 since the unrest began.

title: Apps Seek to Help Phone Users Track Data
description: BARCELONA, Spain  Cellphone carriers are forcing customers to think about how much data they are slurping up as they watch YouTube and stream music from Pandora. In the United States, customers with unlimited plans who use a lot of data have found themselves forced into a network slow lane.

title: How Graffiti Goats Became a Symbol of ... Something
description: KINGSTON, N.Y.  The red goats of Kingston came from nowhere. One day there were new, clunky white planters in the stockade district and then, mysteriously, in October they became canvases for about 37 stenciled goats, red on white, like ghost goats from another world.

title: Builders of Casino Empire Split, and the Bitter Accusations Fly
description: MACAO  For more than a decade, they were the odd couple of gambling.

title: Balancing Parenthood and Politics
description: Weekends are rarely a respite for Scott M. Stringer, the Manhattan borough president and a likely contender in the 2013 mayoral race; he has treated politics as a 24/7 job since he was a teenager rounding up votes for his cousin, Congresswoman Bella Abzug. But a recent entry into fatherhood has forced Mr. Stringer, 51, to reconsider Sunday priorities. His schedule of parades and rallies now must make room for feedings and naptime with 3-month-old Max, his son with Elyse Buxbaum, 39, an associate director at the Cooper-Hewitt National Design Museum. The couple, who married in 2010, live on the Upper West Side.

title: How to Pay for Pensions
description: State and local governments everywhere are in sticker shock over the rising cost of public-employee pensions and scrambling to manage those obligations. New York State has taken a reasonable approach that allows public employers to pay a portion of their yearly contributions to New Yorks $140 billion public pension fund and to pay the remainder in installments, with interest, over a decade.

title: A Better Chance to Succeed
description: The Obama administration is rightly pushing colleges to raise graduation rates and to make sure that more students graduate on time. To help achieve those goals, the community college systems that enroll about 11 million students need to end the practice of shunting students who are prepared for college into non-credit remedial classes that chew up financial aid while making it far less likely that they will ever graduate.

title: Archives on a 20th-Century Diaspora Are Being Put Online
description: Jews are known for their wanderings, even if those have not always been at their own instigation, and one of the most sweeping chronicles of their migrations has been stored at the American Jewish Joint Distribution Committee, a relief and rescue organization that is almost 100 years old.

title: Carlyle Acquires Stake in Brazilian Toy Chain
description: The Carlyle Group, a private equity firm in Washington, said Friday that it had acquired an 85 percent stake in Ri Happy, Brazils largest toy chain, for an undisclosed amount. The firm plans to invest 200 million Brazilian reais ($116.8 million) in the toy retailer over the next three years. This is a segment with significant growth potential in Brazil, said Juan Carlos Felix, Carlyles managing director for Brazil. Since its first Brazilian investment in late 2009, Carlyle has steadily increased its exposure to the countrys consumer market. It owns major stakes in CVC, a tourism operator, and Scalia, a major Brazilian lingerie retailer. With Ri Happy, Carlyle is trying to find opportunity in Brazils fragmented toy market. The company has an online store, 114 brick-and-mortar locations and 2,300 employees.

title: In the Sky Above
description: Sometime in the next few nights, if the sky is clear, go out and find the western horizon just after dark. Look for the Moon and the two bright objects below it  the planets Jupiter and, closer to the horizon, Venus  all in a rare moment of alignment. Mercury will have just set, and in the east, Mars will be rising. If youre able to watch the sky for several nights in a row, into early March, Jupiter and Venus will appear to be getting closer and closer to each other while the Moon drops behind, even as it swells toward full moon on March 8.

title: Zollie Volchok, an N.B.A. Showman, Is Dead at 95
description: Zollie Volchok, a onetime theater manager and entertainment promoter who as general manager and president of the Seattle SuperSonics lured legions of fans to their arena and helped lead the franchise to its only N.B.A. championship, died Sunday in Seattle. He was 95.

title: An Amateur Snapshot of Kodaks Early Days
description: Was this the first Kodak moment?

title: Saved by Taco Bell
description: SATURDAYS PUZZLE  Welcome back, Byron Walden. Its been quite a while since weve had the pleasure of doing one of your puzzles, but we understand; youve been a busy guy, what with holding down a full-time job as a math professor and welcoming your first child into the world.

title: Rooting for Santorum
description: Im rooting for Rick Santorum to win the Republican nomination. Seriously.

title: In Court Filing, Taymor Says Spider-Man Producers Are Trying to Ruin Her Reputation
description: 1:11 p.m. | Updated  Julie Taymor, who filed suit after she was fired as director of the $75 million Broadway musical Spider-Man: Turn Off the Dark last March, said in court papers Friday that the producers counter-suit was highly sensationalistic, false and misleading and aimed at assassinating her character and professional reputation.

title: James Q. Wilson Dies at 80; Originated Broken Windows Policing Strategy
description: James Q. Wilson, a wide-ranging social scientist whose broken windows theory of law enforcement laid the groundwork for crime reduction programs in New York, Los Angeles and other cities, died on Friday in Boston. He was 80.

title: Santorum and the Sexual Revolution
description: Rick Santorum wants to bring sexy back ... to the 1950s, when he was born.

title: With Lin and Davis, Knicks Look to Spread the Wealth
description: GREENBURGH, N.Y.  As their practice drew to a close Friday, the Knicks conducted a full-court scrimmage. Nearing the end of a stretch of the schedule in which they have played only one game in nine days, the players competed passionately and vigorously. Amare Stoudemire attacked the rim. Carmelo Anthony was vocal. Iman Shumpert and J. R. Smith oozed confidence.

title: A Pipe Dream Comes to Life
description: IN 1976, my membership certificate for Keens English Chop Houses Pipe Club arrived in my parents mailbox, a gift from my godfather, James Elkins McIlvain. I hadnt yet turned 2. I never did ask Uncle Jim whether the gesture was a hope that I, too, would one day puff away at his favorite hangout, or if he merely giggled at the image of an infant inhaling from such an instrument  it looked as if it should be filled with opium rather than aged tobacco  like some sort of diaper-clad burgher.

title: Harvard Avoids Upset at Columbia
description: With Harvard in town and the Knicks off, fans crammed into Columbias sold-out Levien Gym using their deductive reasoning: might Jeremy Lin show up?

title: Colorful Owners White Horse Is the Bettors Favorite
description: A blue horse has never won the Gotham Stakes, and that will not change Saturday at Aqueduct. The field consists of four bays, four dark bays, four chestnuts and a nearly white horse, Hansen, who is drawing all the attention because he is the 2-year-old champion and because his co-owner and breeder wanted to color his mane and tail blue for the race.

title: Tornadoes Hit South and Midwest
description: Several tornadoes, spawned by powerful storms that steamrolled across multiple states in the South and Midwest on Friday, caused critical injuries and widespread damage from Alabama to south-central Indiana.

title: Bill Cunningham | To a Man
description: The most innovative fashion statements made by guests at the recent New York fashion shows came not from women but from creative young men.

title: Democratic State Senator, His District Threatened, Focuses on Partys Future
description: Michael N. Gianaris, a Democratic state senator from Astoria, Queens, was in bed at 11:30 one night in January when a reporter called. Republicans were drafting new Senate districts to reflect the 2010 census, and word had leaked of what they had in store for Mr. Gianaris: his neighborhood would be appended to the district of a fellow Democratic senator.

title: Romney Trying to Recast Wealth to Be Seen as Asset
description: BELLEVUE, Wash.  Mitt Romney is best known as a private equity specialist, but he is trying to transform himself into a primary care physician for an ailing nation.

title: Lottery Numbers
description: March 2, 2012

title: Events in Connecticut
description: A guide to cultural and recreational events in Connecticut. Items for the calendar should be sent at least three weeks in advance to ctcal@nytimes.com.

title: Events in Westchester
description: A guide to cultural and recreational events in the Hudson Valley. Items for the calendar should be sent at least three weeks in advance to westweek@nytimes.com.

title: Documenting the Wanderings of 20th-Century Jews
description: The vast archives of the American Jewish Joint Distribution Committee contain documentary and photographic records of the migration of the Jewish people since the World War I years.

title: Events in New Jersey
description: A guide to cultural and recreational events in New Jersey. Items for the calendar should be sent at least three weeks in advance to njtowns@nytimes.com.

title: Events on Long Island
description: A guide to cultural and recreational events on Long Island. Items for the calendar should be sent at least three weeks in advance to lical@nytimes.com.

title: Food Co-op Politics Leave a Bad Taste
description: Many years ago, after graduating from college to a $15,600-a-year job as an editorial assistant, I moved to Park Slope, celebrating my pioneering spirit. It was the late 1980s, long before the affluent enclaves of Brooklyn had become an ever-expanding temple to all the different things that might be done with Tuscan kale. The Park Slope Food Co-op was the center of culinary interest, such as it was. I wanted to love it, but a brief flirtation confirmed my suspicions that the co-op was a place where people in overalls behaved unpleasantly toward you and where arriving at consensus over the price of a plum took longer than the first and second phases of the Strategic Arms Limitations Talks.

title: Super PACs, Not Campaigns, Do Bulk of Ad Spending
description: The crucial role the super PAC now plays in modern presidential politics has been on vivid display in the week before the Super Tuesday primaries, as these outside groups have all outspent the campaigns and become their de facto advertising arms.

title: Bruce Pask on Packing
description: Bruce Pask, a world traveler and the mens fashion director for T Magazine, checks in to the Ace Hotel in New York to talk through eight travel tips.

title: Accord Reached Settling Lawsuit Over BP Oil Spill
description: BP and the lawyers for plaintiffs in the trial over the 2010 oil spill in the Gulf of Mexico have agreed to settle their case.

title: Amid Tension, a Day to Vote
description: Iranians took part in the first national vote since the disputed presidential election of 2009.

title: British Premier Changes Horse Stories Mid-Scandal
description: LONDON  British papers have dubbed it horsegate.

title: Canada: Agency Investigates Complaints of Mass Irregularities in 2011 Election
description: The independent federal elections agency, Elections Canada, said Friday that it was investigating more than 31,000 complaints of voting irregularities related to automated telephone calls during the last election. While it gave no details in its brief statement, accusations that the governing Conservatives used such calls to suppress voting during the May 2011 election have dominated the political debate recently. Court documents indicate that calls claiming to be from Elections Canada were made to supporters of other parties, telling them falsely that their voting stations had been moved, often over great distances. Those documents also suggest connections between the calls and the Conservative Party. Prime Minister Stephen Harper and other Conservatives have denied any wrongdoing.

title: Maurice Andr, Trumpeter, Dies at 78
description: Maurice Andr, a virtuoso credited with having transformed the trumpet from a workaday cog in the back of the orchestra into a seductive solo instrument in front, died on Feb. 25 in Bayonne, in southwest France. He was 78.

title: Mapping the N.B.A.
description: The world of sports geekdom has always been about the numbers. Increasingly, though, it may be about the maps.

title: Newswallah: Bollywood Edition
description: Irrfan Khan: In Paan Singh Tomar, Irrfan Khan plays a sportsman who becomes a bandit. The actor discusses his lifes most demanding role.

title: Updated: Goal Line Technology Takes Another Step Forward
description: 8:46 a.m. | Update On Saturday in Bagshot, England, the I.F.A.B. decided to proceed with the testing of two-goal line technologies before a vote in July, which could lead to the use of the winning system in the 2014 World Cup in Brazil.

title: Virginia: Court Rules for University
description: The Virginia Supreme Court ruled Friday that the state attorney general, Kenneth T. Cuccinelli, does not have the authority to demand records of e-mails or grant applications sent by a climate scientist who taught at the University of Virginia. Mr. Cuccinelli since 2010 has sought to force the university to release documents for five grant applications made by the scientist, Michael E. Mann, and related e-mails, saying he suspected that Dr. Mann used fraudulent climate data to secure grants. A lower court also denied the request, saying Mr. Cuccinelli presented nothing to back up his accusation. Dr. Mann, the author of influential research charting a marked rise in global temperatures, has long been a target of climate change skeptics like Mr. Cuccinelli. The State Supreme Court agreed with the university that Mr. Cuccinelli exceeded his authority. Today, the court effectively held that state agencies do not have to provide state-owned property to state investigators looking into potential fraud involving government funds, Mr. Cuccinelli said in a statement critical of the ruling. Dr. Mann said he was pleased, adding, Its sad, though, that so much money and resources had to be wasted on Cuccinellis witch hunt.

title: Study Shows Danger of Diesel Exhaust
description: Miners exposed to high levels of diesel exhaust have three to five times the risks of lung cancer as workers in occupations where diesel exhaust exposures are less intense, according to a study by government researchers. The study, by researchers from the National Cancer Institute and the National Institute for Occupational Safety and Health, shows the dangers of diesel exhaust not only in workplace settings but also for anyone living in urban areas, the researchers said. The study will be published Monday on the Web site of the Journal of the National Cancer Institute, despite letters sent by a lawyer for a mining consortium warning of legal consequences to publishing the results.

title: Corrections: March 3
description: FRONT PAGE

title: Newswallah: Bharat Edition
description: Jammu and Kashmir: The first-ever winter festival in the hill station of Gulmarg will be held March 9-11. The three-day event will include adventure sports and performances by bands from across the country. The organizers expect a crowd of 2,000 people to attend the festival (The Indian Express).

title: On the Lanvin Express With Alber Elbaz
description: I had such a sinking feeling after the Lanvin show on Friday night: I didnt want it to end. The last dozen or so models were really decked out in party wear  furs, jewels, over-the-top patterns, real babes  and I was just getting into it when the house lights dimmed.

title: The Weekend Word: Into the Fray
description: Todays Times

title: Apocalyptic Vision of London Rankles the Locals
description: LONDON  Oh, dear. We Londoners appear to have abandoned our proverbial good manners and even our legendary chirpy sense of humor in response to a New York Times Magazine special that offers a dystopian vision of our great city just months before it hosts the Olympic Games.

title: This Sunday: London in Pictures
Reagan, Obama, Austerity
description: A followup on the effects of austerity at the state and local government level, which have led to a decline in government purchases of goods and services that stands in stark contrast to earlier recoveries. I pursued this a bit more, and have a startling calculation to offer.

title: Japanese Prime Minister Says Government Shares Blame for Nuclear Disaster
description: TOKYO  Prime Minister Yoshihiko Noda of Japan acknowledged on Saturday that the government shared the blame for the disaster at the Fukushima Daiichi nuclear power plant, saying that officials had been blinded by a false belief in the countrys technological infallibility, even as he vowed to push for the idled reactors to be restarted.

title: What Theyre Saying About the Saints Bounties
description: Why did the Saints pay players to injure opponents? Because they, like other franchises that have used a similar system, thought it would help them win. And by all appearances it worked: The Saints won the Super Bowl in the 2009 season, and their defense during that playoff run was as violent and intimidating as had been seen in the league for quite a while.

title: Backstage Beauty Report | Christian Dior
description: Slick and tight, is how Orlando Pita described the low ponytails backstage at Dior. He was careful to use his T3 Control Hairspray to make sure the deep side part was secure with hair scraped diagonal across the forehead  no comb indentations or wet-looking strands. The difference between this ponytail and others was that it was really low, lying against the neck and perfectly coiffed with a strand wrapped around the band. Pita gestured to a model in her street clothes and a bright red bag. Theyre wearing their scarves and kissing friends, he said of the girls potential to create flyways while running around backstage. By the time theyre ready to hit the runway, he would be certain the look was once again perfect. Makeup was more understated  no lip, full lashes and CoverGirl 1-Kit Eye Enhancers in Swiss Chocolate with Mink shadow and gold shimmer all the way to the temple. For the face, it was Lush Berry and Plush Peach CoverGirl & Olay Simply Ageless Blush. We played with many versions of natural, Pat McGrath said. This is very fresh, very pretty.

title: Towns Search for Survivors After Widespread Storms
description: MARYSVILLE, Ind.  Here in this small farmland community, a single water tower emblazoned with the towns name  the most commanding structure in the town  appeared to be the only thing not battered by the storms that cut a swath through southeastern Indiana.

description: PARIS

title: Face Time | Kristin Chenoweth
description: This past New York Fashion Week, I popped by Kristin Chenoweths apartment to help her with her makeup and chat before she darted off to Nanette Lepores Fall 2012 ready-to-wear show. She thought a simple ponytail and sweet pink cheeks and lips would compliment her dress, so I whipped out my Clinique Chubby Stick in Woppin Watermelon and LOral True Match Blush in Tender Rose. Kristin effortlessly applied a strip of lashes  my favorite Andrea Modlash in #53perfection! As she got ready, she told me how excited she was about the season opener for her new ABC show, GCB (Good Christian Belles). I know where Ill be this Sunday evening at 10 p.m.  glued to my television!

title: Tourism Up, Mexico Aims for Non-U.S. Visitors
description: Last year 22.67 million travelers visited Mexico, breaking the record set in 2008. The United States was the source of the largest number of visitors, but the increase was also driven by travelers from other countries.

title: That Well-Lighted Agent of Desire
description: THE seven films in which Josef von Sternberg directed Marlene Dietrich constitute one of the most dazzling runs of creativity in the history of the movies. Released by Paramount Pictures between 1930 and 1935, these are works of breathtaking formal beauty, profound moral philosophy and devastating wit.

description: Paris

description: Hundreds of lawyers, victims families and survivors of the wreck of the cruise ship Costa Concordia, which capsized off the Tuscan coast in January, converged on Grosseto, Italy, on Saturday for the first evidence hearing in the criminal investigation against the ships captain and others.

title: Duke and North Carolina Prepare to Write Another Chapter
description: One of the most heated rivalries in college sports will add another chapter to its storyline Saturday evening, this time with a regular-season championship hanging in the balance. North Carolina (26-4, 13-2 Atlantic Coast Conference) and Duke (26-4, 13-2 A.C.C.) will face off in historic Cameron Indoor Stadium at 7 p.m., as the Tar Heels will try to atone for their collapse against the Blue Devils in Chapel Hill nearly one month ago, and win their fifth regular-season title in the last six years. The last time Duke hosted North Carolina to end the season, in 2010, the Blue Devils won by 32 points in what was the most one-sided victory in the history of the rivalry  something that Duke senior Miles Plumlee will be hoping to replicate in his final game on Coach K Court.

title: Variety: A Sharp Diagramless
description: SECOND SUNDAY PUZZLE  When I finished this one, I thought it looked, minus the blood, sweat and tears, like a midcentury painting with its scattered, chunky rectangles of black space.

title: High School Players Forced to Choose in Soccers New Way
description: Professional sports leagues in the United States have long relied on high schools to help cultivate the countrys best athletes. Rosters in Major League Baseball, the N.F.L. and the N.B.A. are filled with former scholastic stars, many of whom hold tightly to their quintessentially American memories of homecoming, letterman jackets and games played under the Friday night lights.

title: Only 19, Harper Is Dealing With Expectations as the Next Big Thing
description: KISSIMMEE, Fla.  Bryce Harper grew up in Las Vegas, far from a major league ballpark, but he was so busy playing that he could not have seen many games anyway. For inspiration, he looked backward. His favorite players were Pete Rose and George Brett. He admired their hard-nosed style of play.

description: LYUBERTSY, Russia  It takes little more than a half-hour train ride from Moscow and a few hours walking the muddy streets of this raw, working-class suburb to get a sense of why Vladimir V. Putin will almost certainly win Russias presidential election on Sunday.

title: Bearing Witness in Syria: A Correspondents Last Days
description: It was damp and cold as Anthony Shadid and I crossed in darkness over the barbed-wire fence that separated Turkey from Syria last month. We were also crossing from peace into war, into the bloodiest conflict of the Arab Spring, exploding just up the rocky and sparsely wooded mountain we had to climb once inside.

title: Star-to-Be Who Never Was
description: STONY CREEK, Va.  On an otherwise lazy Sunday, dinner took hours to prepare, filling the small one-story house on a remote and wooded street with the aromatic smell of chicken, ribs and all the trimmings. The extended family would soon be arriving, in full, hungry force.

description: Paris

title: Keeping Score: James and the Heat Put Failure Behind Them
description: For most teams, a trip to the N.B.A. finals would be considered a success, win or lose. But after the Miami Heat landed LeBron James and Chris Bosh in the 2010 free-agent frenzy, expectations were sky high for the teams 2010-11 season. But then came a stunning N.B.A. finals defeat against the Dallas Mavericks, followed by plenty of hand wringing and amateur psychoanalysis.

description: PALM BEACH GARDENS, Fla.  In his first two months on the PGA Tour, John Huh has picked up a victory and a nickname, the Question Mark.

title: Glimpses of the Armed Opposition in Syria
description: The Free Syrian Army, mostly military defectors, are outnumbered and outgunned. Yet, support for the uprising is strong in Idlib Province, even as residents endure hardships.

title: Steady Rangers Ready for Up-and-Down Bruins
description: Brandon Dubinskys positive response to a benching  a tying goal late in regulation in the Rangers 4-3 overtime loss Friday night at Tampa Bay  is the latest example of the contrast in late-season approaches by the Rangers and the Boston Bruins. As the teams head into their game Sunday afternoon at Madison Square Garden, Bruins Coach Claude Julien has been patient with his defending Stanley Cup champions, while Rangers Coach John Tortorella relentlessly pushes buttons.

title: Baseball Player No More, but Longtime Met in Spirit
description: PORT ST. LUCIE, Fla.  Tommy Neiman moved to St. Lucie County at age 1, after his father, Don, discovered a cache of gold from the Spanish galleons that wrecked along Floridas eastern coast in the 17th century. The windfall enabled the family to buy a home.

title: Enjoying the Lin Craze, but Not Finding Much Funny About It
description: Robert Klein landed in the middle of Linsanity only as a matter of luck, the Knicks having called to ask if hed like his usual  but only occasional  courtside seat at Madison Square Garden several weeks before Jeremy Lin pierced anybodys consciousness. As a Knicks fan since he was a child growing up in the Bronx, Klein could not have been more delighted to find himself in the middle of the craze.

description: To the Sports Editor

title: A Metamorphosis on the Wrestling Mat
description: Wrestling saved my life. That may be an overstatement, but only a slight one. It also helped me learn to be an actor.

title: 30 Seconds With Rod Gilbert: Out of Game, Not Out of Goals
description: In the 1960s and 70s, Rod Gilbert played wing on the Rangers Goal-a-Game, or GAG, line, with Jean Ratelle and Vic Hadfield, compiling 406 goals and 1,021 points over 16 seasons, with 34 playoff goals. Gilbert, who wore No. 7 and was the first Ranger to have his number retired, was inducted into the Hockey Hall of Fame in 1982.

title: When Living in Limbo Avoids Living on the Street
description: ORLANDO, Fla.  Forced by the harsh realities of the real estate market, lenders are increasingly likely to allow defaulting owners to remain in their homes  a change in attitude and strategy that is helping to buoy some neighborhoods while further slowing the nations foreclosure process.

title: In Bertuzzis Last Stop, Hopes for a Makeover
description: DETROIT  If ever there was a team that could rehabilitate Todd Bertuzzis legacy, it is the Detroit Red Wings. A perennial Stanley Cup contender, the Red Wings are known as a clean team, ranked among the bottom four N.H.L. clubs in penalty minutes in seven of the last eight seasons, and among the bottom four in fighting majors in each of the last 15 seasons.

title: Under Construction, Michigans Renaissance
description: ANN ARBOR, Mich.  John Beilein acknowledged he might have underestimated the task ahead when he became the Michigan mens basketball coach in 2007.

title: Plagued by Crime, Food-Truck Vendors Unite for Protection
description: Every morning, Gabriel Martinez slides a black 9-millimeter pistol into a leather holster over his jeans and thinks about his son.

title: Recounting a Journey Into Syria
description: An article in Sundays New York Times, written by Tyler Hicks, a staff photographer, recounts the journey he and Anthony Shadid, a Times reporter, made to Syria last month. Mr. Shadid, 43, died during the assignment after interviewing Syrian resistance fighters.

title: Severe Storms Tear Through the Midwest
description: A string of violent storms demolished small towns in Indiana and cut off rural communities in Kentucky as an early season tornado outbreak killed more than 30 people, and the death toll rose as daylight broke on Saturdays search for survivors.

title: Headscarves for Womens Games Near Approval
description: Soccers international rules board on Saturday unanimously supported a proposal to reverse a 2007 decision that barred women from playing with headscarves.

title: Romney Advisers Chide Santorum on Delegates
description: DAYTON, Ohio  Mitt Romneys campaign has said from the very beginning that the Republican nominating contest would likely be a long slog to get the 1,144 delegates needed to win the partys nomination. And as the campaign made clear in a conference call on Saturday afternoon, it believes that Rick Santorum made a crippling stumble going into Super Tuesday, the March 6 primaries in which 10 states are in play.

title: Now Screening | Cass Birds Video for Maiyet
description: In this exclusive video directed by the T contributor Cass Bird, the model Daria Werbowy goes for a springtime stroll wearing pleated dresses and lightweight separates from the American label Maiyet. The line recently landed in stores (its spring collection is available at Barneys New York) and will present its fall collection in Paris tomorrow, March 4.

title: Mission Control, Built for Cities
description: NOT far from Copacabana Beach here is a control room that looks straight out of NASA.

title: Things to Fear and Loathe
description: A friend recently told me about a new app for the treatment of phobias. You stare at pictures of dental drills, snakes or airplane interiors, depending on your affliction, and these totems of menace  interspersed with reassuring images of teddy bears  gradually cease to provoke you.

title: Dolan Urges Catholics to Become More Active in Politics
description: HICKSVILLE, N.Y.  Cardinal Timothy M. Dolan told Roman Catholics on Saturday that in an era when the church was fighting the government on several fronts, they needed to make their voices heard more clearly in the political sphere.

title: A Guard Emerges: Sound Familiar?
description: Jeremy Lin is not the only N.B.A. player to be an immediate success in his teams starting lineup. With the emergence of Sacramento point guard Isaiah Thomas, Lin was not even the only player to do so in February.

title: Trying to Feel Like a Million Bucks, Too
description: THERES a place on East 58th Street in Manhattan, with no outdoor sign, where George Soros, David Geffen, Paul Volcker, Jules Kroll and other big names in the business and financial world are regulars.

title: Santorum Woos Ohio as G.O.P. Field Focuses on Tuesday
description: BLUE ASH, Ohio  Rick Santorum promised this old industrial state on Saturday that as president, he would transform its depressing moniker of Rust Belt to the brighter Stainless Steel Belt.

description: Paris

title: 0.2% Interest? You Bet Well Complain
description: STOP your bellyaching.

title: The Port Huron Statement at 50
description: THEY are mostly in their 70s now, those quixotic college students who drafted the Port Huron Statement at a ramshackle A.F.L.-C.I.O. education retreat northeast of Detroit in 1962. Today, their agenda for a generation survives most famously as a punch line from the 1998 film The Big Lebowski in which the stoner protagonist proclaims himself an author of the original Port Huron Statement, not the compromised second draft. Purists like Jeff The Dude Lebowski might dissent, but last month the historian Michael Kazin pronounced the final draft the most ambitious, the most specific and the most eloquent manifesto in the history of the American left.

title: Confessions of a Bad Teacher
description: I AM a special education teacher. My students have learning disabilities ranging from autism and attention-deficit disorder to cerebral palsy and emotional disturbances. I love these kids, but they can be a handful. Almost without exception, they struggle on standardized tests, frustrate their teachers and find it hard to connect with their peers. Whats more, these are high school students, so their disabilities are compounded by raging hormones and social pressure.

title: U.S. Backers of Israel Pressure Obama Over Policy on Iran
description: WASHINGTON  On the eve of a crucial visit to the White House by Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu of Israel, that countrys most powerful American advocates are mounting an extraordinary public campaign to pressure President Obama into hardening American policy toward Iran over its nuclear program.

title: Mistakes That Wont Go Away
description: Re The Error Iceberg (Feb. 26):

title: Wright Sits as Precaution, and Hairston Is Hurt

title: Tim Phillips
description: Tim Phillips is president of Americans for Prosperity, a conservative issue advocacy group with 34 state chapters and 1.9 million grass-roots activists fighting for limited government, free markets and the defeat of President Obama in this years election. The organization raised and spent $50 million in 2011 and this year is expected to exceed that.
