title: Has This Non-Winter Changed Your Cooking?
description: In this weeks Dining section, David Tanis and I both write about winter dishes to make during this very mild non-winter weve been experiencing in New York City. His view is, weather be darned, cook up your favorite hearty dishes and eat them anyway (as evidenced in his wonderful-sounding pork roast with prunes).

title: Runway in Review
description: AkrisDesigner: Albert KriemlerDate and Location: Sunday, Mar. 4,Thtre de Chaillot, 1, place du TrocadroPhotos: slide show

title: Romney Makes Economic Pitch to Ohio Voters
description: CANTON, Ohio  Standing in a guardrail manufacturing factory, Mitt Romney on Monday laid out in stark terms what has been his campaign strategy from Day One  a laser-like focus on jobs and the economy.

title: Chlo: Fall 2012 RTW
description: Paris

title: Scandals in Hong Kong Raise Fears About China
description: HONG KONG  A string of scandals involving both the current leader of Hong Kong and those vying to succeed him is threatening to stain what many residents here consider a source of pride: a city largely free of corruption.

title: A Capitol Dilemma
description: By the end of February 1862, construction of the enlarged Capitol building in Washington had been suspended for nine and a half months. The federal government had begun the project 12 years earlier, intending to add new House and Senate wings at either end of the original building, topped by a majestic cast-iron dome above the old central section. But now the country was deep in civil war, and the building was left towering but unfinished.

title: Obama Presses Netanyahu to Resist Strikes on Iran
description: WASHINGTON  With Israel warning of a possible military strike on Irans nuclear facilities, President Obama urged Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu at the White House on Monday to give diplomacy and economic sanctions a chance to work before resorting to military action.

title: Theres Gambling, Floor Shows ... and Full Auto in Las Vegas
description: LAS VEGAS  For Vegas die-hards bored with the $750 tasting menu at Guy Savoy, the $250 Elton John tickets at Caesars or the $200,000 baccarat bet at the Bellagio, this city is serving up a new way to find high-priced thrills.

title: Backstage at Sonia Rykiel
description: Scenes from the Sonia Rykiel show at Paris Fashion Week.

title: Mixed Emotions From Favre on Bounties
description: In Peter Kings Monday Morning Quarterback at SI.com, Brett Favre says the only thing that really bothers him about the Saints-Vikings playoff game in 2010 is that the Vikings lost.

title: Kohlrabi: A Dinner Ally in Disguise
description: Every time I work with kohlrabi I wonder why I dont buy it more often.

title: Santorum Strikes Populist Tone Before Ohioans Vote
description: MIAMISBURG, Ohio  Rick Santorum cranked up his image as a populist fighter on Monday as he pleaded for votes the day before the primary in Ohio, considered a must-win state if he is to maintain his political viability.

title: Out of Community Colleges and Into For-Profits
description: Last week I wrote about how cash-strapped state schools are cutting courses that cost more to teach, which unfortunately also happen to be the classes that are most likely to get students jobs (nursing, engineering, etc.).

title: TimesCast | March 5, 2012
description: President Obama and Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu of Israel meet at the White House | Mitt Romney makes his final pitch in Ohio ahead of Tuesday's primaries.

title: They Pledge Allegiance to the Frat: Animal House Musical Is Planned
description: On Monday, the 30th anniversary of the death of John Belushi, his fans and former colleagues are commemorating the occasion in different ways: with solemn reflections on his loss, lively celebrations of his talent and the announcement of a new project based on one of his best-known films.

title: Former Iceland Leader Tried Over Financial Crisis of 2008
description: LONDON  Iceland opened a criminal trial on Monday against its former prime minister, Geir H. Haarde, becoming the first country to prosecute one of its leaders over the financial crisis of 2008.

title: The Frankies New Daughter: Francesca
description: The two Franks of Italian cuisine, Falcinelli and Castronovo, are going to Spain, as Mr. Castronovo put it. They are turning one of their three signature Frankies Spuntino restaurants  the one they call  Frankies 17, on the Lower East Side, into Francesca, a Basque-style bar and restaurant serving pintxos, the popular tapas-style snacks from northeastern Spain.

title: Speaking of the Dead
description: Early last week, Katie Roiphe wrote a piecefor Slatebemoaning the increasing fashion for  negative obituaries, in which critiques of the deceased, from Jan Berenstein to Christopher Hitchens, are timed as the dead persons possessions are still being retrieved in plastic bags by their relatives from the hospital. By weeks end, the death of Andrew Breitbart had inspired not only a variety of examples of exactly this form, but also a number of eloquent defenses of its virtues. Here is David Frum:

title: Accounts and People of Note in the Advertising Industry
description: Baha Mar, a resort in Nassau, Bahamas, that is scheduled to open in late 2014, chose SK&G, Las Vegas, as advertising agency of record, to handle assignments like brand strategy, creative and media services. Billings were not disclosed.

title: Q. and A. With Stuart Elliott
description: Stuart Elliott, the advertising columnist, answers questions from readers each week. Questions can be sent to stuarte@nytimes.com.

title: Chevy Volt and Opel Ampera Are Jointly Named European Car of the Year
description: GENEVA  In a ceremony Monday that opened the 82nd Geneva auto show, the Chevrolet Volt and Opel Ampera, the European version of the Volt, were jointly named the European Car of the Year.

title: Palace Coup | Jaipurs Literary Festival
description: Jaipur, India, may be called The Pink City, but in truth its gray and dusty, a wonderful place of crumbling beauty. Now in its fifth year, the DSC Jaipur Literature Festival, which was held inside a 200-year-old palace at the end of January, is breathing new life into this very old town. The event draws an increasingly curious cross-section of Indias vibrant literary scene: authors, publishers, readers, schoolchildren, old poets, young journalists, socialites, minor royalty, major art collectors, literary aspirants, Nosy Parkers  in short anyone who has ever felt the power of a good book.

title: A Fantasy Fiction Writer on Londons Real-Life Dystopia
description: China Miville wrote one of the articles in this weeks issue on London. He is the author of award-winning fantasy fiction, including Embassytown, Kraken, The City & the City and the Bas-Lag series. We spoke about being an Olympic dissident, a genre novelist and a lifelong Londoner.

title: Ads for Lawn-Care Brand Take a Highland Fling
description: A new campaign is celebrating the green, green grass of home with a new brand character who is meant to bring to life a familiar line of lawn-care products.

title: Understanding Shoreline Erosion
description: A vehicle carries radar and light detection and ranging (lidar) instruments that measure water movements at the surface and use the data to calculate even small movements of sand beneath the waves.

title: A Surf-Worthy New Tool to Study Erosion
description: DUCK, N.C.  Researchers who study the beaches of the Outer Banks have long noticed that storms cause particularly severe erosion in areas they call hot spots. But at first they did not know why.

title: A North Carolina Lifeline Built on Shifting Sands
description: RODANTHE, N.C.  Last August, when Hurricane Irene sliced across the Outer Banks, it cut Highway 12, Hatteras Islands lifeline, in two places. Engineers rushed to repair the damage, filling and repaving a washed-out stretch of roadway here and building a bridge over a newly formed inlet a few miles to the north.

title: Tate Modern Buys 8 Million Works by Ai Weiwei
description: The Tate Modern in London announced on Monday that it had purchased one of Ai Weiweis famous installations of life-size, hand-painted porcelain Sunflower Seeds. It bought 8 million of the 100 million seeds that were on view in a giant installation at the museum a year and a half ago. The mini-version was bought directly from the artist, officials at the Tate said, and the remaining 92 million seeds have been returned to Mr. Ai.

title: Expect a Wild Big Ten Tournament
description: A rough Big Ten regular season has finally settled things, sort of, having ended Sunday with a three-way tie for the title when Michigan, Michigan State and Ohio State all finished at 13-5.

title: Syria Permits U.N. Visits, but Escalates Its Attacks
description: Syrias government made diplomatic gestures on Monday toward seeking an end to the uprising that has convulsed the country, agreeing for the first time to allow visits by the top United Nations relief official and by the newly designated envoy who represents the United Nations and the Arab League.

title: Mealtime Moneyball: Hacking Seamless
description: For young Wall Street types, few deals matter more than the ones taking place at 7 p.m. on Seamless.

title: Lincoln Center Theater to Stage Odets Revival and New Durang Play
description: The Tony Award-winning director Bartlett Sher will stage a revival of Clifford Odetss 1937 drama, Golden Boy, on Broadway in November for Lincoln Center Theater, and a new Chekhov-inspired play by Christopher Durang will also run this fall at that companys Mitzi E. Newhouse Theater, executives for Lincoln Center Theater announced on Monday.

title: Germany Not Amused by Belarus Leaders Better a Dictator Than Gay Jibe
description: One day after President Aleksandr Lukashenko of Belarus rejected criticism of his authoritarian rule from Germanys gay foreign minister by saying it was better to be a dictator than gay, the German government fired back, sarcastically welcoming the Belarussian leaders apparent confirmation that he is indeed a dictator.

title: Santorum Slumps in Super Tuesday Polls
description: Rick Santorum got a rough result in the Washington caucuses on Saturday, finishing third in a state he had seemed to have a reasonable shot of winning. Now, Mr. Santorums slump is carrying over into the polls in crucial Super Tuesday states.

title: As Advertisers Recoil, Limbaugh Says, So Be It
description: Defending himself against a growing ad boycott, Rush Limbaugh told his audience on Monday that the companies that have defected from his radio program have decided they dont want you or your business anymore.

title: Muslim Leaders Rally in Support of Police Dept.
description: About three dozen American Muslim leaders and activists assembled outside the headquarters of the New York Police Department on Monday morning to defend and commend the Police Department for its surveillance of Muslim communities.

title: Super Tuesday Primaries
description: Mitt Romney edged out Rick Santorum in Ohio, but failed to deliver a knockout punch as Mr. Santorum picked up several states.

title: Are Women Enemies of Our Own Free Time?
description: Old-timers, counseling the young on investments, used to advise buying land. Theyre not making any more of it, went the refrain. Maybe thats one reason were so perpetually interested in talking about time: how we spend it and how it slips away. Not only arent they not making any more of it (you get what you get, even if you do get upset), but it cant be bought at any price.

title: McCain Calls for U.S.-Led Airstrikes Against Syria
description: Senator John McCain, a leader among Senate Republicans on military matters, called on Monday for the United States to lead airstrikes against Syrias armed forces to protect the rebels and civilians there, much as it did in Libya last year.

title: London, Illuminated
description: Chris Levine refers to himself as a light artist; he signs off his e-mail with Light or With Light and Good Feelings. And it was this e-mail that inspired us to commission him for the London issue:

title: Conservatisms Limbaugh Problem
description: Whether hes right or wrong about the value of negative obituaries, David Frum is right about this, in a column on the comparison between Rush Limbaughs slut comments and the similar remarks that have befouled the careers of various left-wing entertainers:

title: Photo Replay: March 5
description: The day in sports included the British Gas swimming championships in London and the Canadian curling championships in Saskatoon, Saskatchewan.

title: Large Private Sector Investors Agree to a Swap of Greek Debt
description: LONDON  Greece moved closer Monday to avoiding default when a large group of private sector bondholders said that it would participate in a restructuring through a bond swap.

title: RelayRides Takes Peer-to-Peer Car Sharing Nationwide
description: Peer-to-peer car-sharing services have only been active in a few American cities. RelayRides, a start-up financed in part by General Motors, announced Monday that it had expanded its offering nationwide. An owner of a qualifying car can earn cash, in any state, by renting out a personal vehicle on a short-term basis.

title: A New Way to Blow Off Steam in Vegas
description: Machine Guns Vegas  an upscale, indoor shooting range complete with skimpily dressed, gun-toting hostesses  opened last week a half-mile from the Strip, with an armory of weapons.

title: At a Harlem Transfer School, a High-Tech Celebration of Student Achievement
OBama Shirt Gets More in Touch With Irish Roots
description: Update, March 13, 9:40 a.m. | The link to the shamrock T-shirt on the Obama Web site, which was dead for a few days, has now been restored. Though the link to the two-pack offer is still dead.

title: For Hoyas, a Fight in China Forged Team Unity
description: WASHINGTON  On the night of Aug. 18, hours after the Georgetown mens basketball team was involved in a disturbing brawl with a Chinese professional team, many of the Hoyas gathered in the hotel room of a team manager at the St. Regis Beijing.

title: The Daily Shoe | Stella McCartney
description: T plucks the best shoes right off the runway.

title: A Granddaughter Returns to Pakistan
description: The last time I wandered the dust-laden streets of Karachi, in 2007, Benazir Bhutto was still alive, Pervez Musharraf was president, Imran Khan was more renowned for his cricket career and former lovers than for his politics, and Asif Ali Zardari was in intermittent self-imposed exile, desperately dodging corruption charges. Pakistanis were wildly paranoid about India, blamed their extremist undercurrents on Afghan refugees and were deeply suspicious of the United States. I returned for a visit late last year, and as soon as I set foot in the gritty city of Karachi again, I knew that everything had changed and nothing had changed.

title: For Jewish Sabbath, Elevators Do All the Work
description: Dont get in that one! a woman cried, standing in front of an open elevator door, a quiet toddler in her arms.

title: On First Anniversary of Tsunami, Looking Back Through a Canny Lens
description: Reporters pride themselves on finding stories that they believe should be told. Sometimes, however, a photo enhances and amplifies a report so much that it eclipses the written record.

title: A New Credit Card Lets Customers Make The Rules
description: Updated 6:10 p.m. | To provide more details.

title: Rush Limbaugh Is Really Sorry That He Had to Apologize
description: Last Friday, I wrote about people who actually bother to apologize for offensive and harmful behavior. Sincere admissions of guilt deserve special attention, in part because its now standard for national figures to either hide from their mistakes or just go through the motions of pretending theyre sorry.

title: Reader Idea | Debates on Persuasive Language That Extend Outside of Class
description: Here is another in our Great Ideas From Readers series.

title: Once Upon a Time and GCB Help Lift ABC
description: The continued steady performance of Once Upon a Time, combined with a decent showing for the series premiere of GCB, gave ABC a ratings win on Sunday. That network drew the most viewers in the 18-to-49-year-old demographic for the night, while CBS finished first in total viewership.

title: In China, Sobering Signs of Slower Growth
description: GUANGZHOU, China  The nights are a little darker now here in the main metropolis of southeastern China, at the center of one of the countrys largest export hubs.

title: Cline: Fall 2012 RTW
description: Paris

title: Childbirth: Identical or Fraternal? Not Always Clear
description: A British study suggests that many parents of twins are misinformed as to whether their babies are fraternal or identical because doctors themselves are confused.

title: Too Often, Doctors Overlook Narcolepsy
description: Clea Howard is hardly a tuned-out, uninterested high school student. She likes to be busy: In addition to maintaining an excellent scholastic record at a demanding high school an hour from her Brooklyn home, she studies art, takes dance classes and plays soccer.

title: Amateurs Are New Fear in Creating Mutant Virus
description: Just how easy is it to make a deadly virus?

title: A Temporary Eco-Minded Restaurant Pops Up in Milan
description: The Cube, the temporary, eco-sustainable restaurant atop Milans Galleria Victor Emanuel designed by the Milanese architects Park Associati, opened its doors late last year. Conceived by Electrolux, a Swedish appliance brand, the Cube is a four-month project in which Michelin-starred chefs assume two-week residencies to experiment with locally sourced ingredients and regional cuisines.

title: Answers in Medicine Sometimes Lie in Luck
description: The hospital I work at has no 13th floor.

title: Pregnancy Prevention and the Taxpayer
description: Between the flap at the Susan G. Komen for the Cure and the squall about the Obama administrations directive that health insurance plans cover the cost of birth control, contraception is shaping up as one of the years biggest political land mines.

title: TimesCast | Romney's Momentum
description: Mitt Romney makes his final pitch in Canton, Ohio ahead of the Super Tuesday primaries, when 437 delegates from 10 states are at stake.

title: Soccers Sound of Team Spirit
description: BUENOS AIRES  Arsenal must score five goals more than the visiting Italian powerhouse A.C. Milan on Tuesday to advance to the quarterfinals of the Champions League, Europes most prestigious soccer tournament. Though such a comeback has happened only three times in the tournaments 57-year history, some know better than to rule it out.

title: Caucus Video: Romneys Momentum
description: Mitt Romney makes his final pitch in Canton, Ohio ahead of the Super Tuesday primaries, when 437 delegates from 10 states are at stake. Ashley Parker reports.

title: Mental Health: Use of Statins May Lower Depression Risk
description: The use of statin drugs to lower cholesterol in people with stable coronary artery disease is associated with a significantly reduced risk for depression, a new study reports.

title: Sizing Up the Top 25
description: New to the rankings: No. 24 Gonzaga, No. 25 Iowa State

title: Regimens: Antibiotic Dosage May Vary in Pregnancy
description: A new study suggests that the correct dose of antibiotics in pregnancy may be different for African-Americans from what it is for other women.

title: Not Again With The Pivot
description: Steve Pearlstein is a good guy; thats why the piece he posted on Ezras blog fills me with such despair.

title: Is There Still a Place in Business for a Handshake Deal?
description: Even though I was a girl, my father taught me early in life that nobody likes a wimpy handshake. As I got older, I found myself agreeing with him, especially in a business setting. While we try to decipher clues about personalities based on the firmness  or lack thereof  of someones grasp, studies have gone as far as linking the strength of ones handshake to life expectancy. But do handshake deals lead to healthy relationships in business?

title: Kovalchuk Demonstrating to Devils How Star Can Also Be Team Player
description: NEWARK  Brayden Schenn, a Philadelphia Flyers rookie center, found out the hard way last month that Ilya Kovalchuk was not just on the ice to draw a big paycheck, or even to score lots of goals. Schenn challenged Kovalchuk to a fight after a scrum. Kovalchuk took him on.

title: Romney in Ohio: Want College? Cant Afford It? Too bad.
description: YOUNGSTOWN, Ohio  The high school senior who stood up at Mitt Romneys town hall meeting here today was worried about how he and his family would pay for college, and wanted to hear what the candidate would do about rising college costs if elected. He didnt realize that Mr. Romney was about to use him to demonstrate his fiscal conservatism to the crowd.

title: Triceratops Quiet Cousin, the Torosaurus, Gains New Legitimacy
description: NEW HAVEN  Growing up in Calgary, Alberta, Daniel Field idolized John R. Horner, the well-known paleontologist who helped inspire Michael Crichtons novel Jurassic Park and won a MacArthur genius award in 1986.

title: Super Tuesday Delegate Projection Update
description: There has been enough movement in the polls in the past 24 hours to warrant revisiting our delegate projections from Sunday. I now have Rick Santorum trailing Mitt Romney by about 150 delegates, and also falling behind Newt Gingrich, who has some favorable momentum in the delegate-rich Southern states.

title: Venture Capitalist Pioneer Talks Taxes, Tech and Facebook
description: Even as the market remains wobbly and the economy weak, Frederick R. Adler, the venture capitalist pioneer, is optimistic about the countrys prospects.

title: No Sign of Progress in Afghanistan Talks Embittered by Koran Burnings
description: KABUL, Afghanistan  The United States and Afghanistan appeared to make no headway here on Monday in high-level negotiations on a long-term strategic partnership that have been embittered somewhat by the Koran burnings last month. Elsewhere, further violence left three people dead, including two children killed in a suicide attack on the main NATO military base where the Korans were desecrated.

description: Paris

title: A Challenge to Make Science Crystal Clear
description: What is a flame?

title: Nigeria to Import Morphine in Pain Relief Initiative
description: Nigerias health minister announced last week that the country would immediately buy 55 pounds of morphine for the nations hospitals and would form an alliance with a new nonprofit organization, the Global Access to Pain Relief Initiative.

title: Seasoned in Boston, Hopeful in Houston
description: Kissimmee, Fla.

title: Pictures of the Day: Russia and Elsewhere
description: Photographs from Russia, Congo, India and Iraq.

title: Backstage Beauty Report | Chlo
description: Recall that picture of Kate Moss in a loose pink tank top surrounded by Christmas lights? It was images like this one  shot in the 1990s by Corinne Day  that inspired the beauty look at Chlo. Backstage before the show, the stylist Camille Bidault-Waddington stood near the hairstylist Paul Hanlon as they worked together on perfecting center-parted tousled, mussed hair. Shake it, Hanlon said to the model. Its nice with a little shape around the face, no? he asked Bidault-Waddington. As for makeup, Aaron De Mey channeled what he called a girl with supercool clothes on the streets of Paris, with no makeup  undone. This meant M.A.C. Strobe Cream on cheeks with hardly any concealer, and the rest of the face matte. Lips were covered in Peach Stock from the Pro Line, a sort of 70s watercolor. Eyebrows were the emphasis, filled in with pencil and gel.

title: Syracuses Next Challenge: the Dreaded Double Bye
description: Although Syracuse powered through its regular season with just one loss  a feat matched by Kentucky, making them the first and second teams to do so in a major conference since 2004-5  there is one drawback to the Oranges success as it heads to the Big East tournament: the vaunted double bye.

title: Town and Country From Pedro Loureno
description: Town and country has been a popular theme among designers this season. Lets see, there was Christopher Baileys mens wear show for Burberry in Milan in January, when the models wore tight tweeds and carried umbrellas with molded animal heads for handles. Then there was Tommy Hilfiger, at his womens show in New York, calling his collection town and country and showing models in tailored military coats.

title: City Reverses Policy on Tutoring Limits
The battle of the Outer Banks; a cry in the dark; and falling asleep too easily.
description: The battle of the Outer Banks; a cry in the dark; and falling asleep too easily.

title: Where L Stands for Large, Fiat Traditionalists Grant 500L Cautious Approval
description: POSITANO, Italy  The 500L nameplate is greatly admired by members of the Positano 500 Club, a small owners group here that seeks to preserve, protect and defend the classic Italian microcars of 1957-75.

title: Red-Tailed Hawk Found Dead in Central Park
description: A red-tailed hawk was found dead in Central Park on Sunday, a week after the body of Lima  a companion of the much-watched red-tail Pale Male  was discovered under a tree.

title: A Heart Helper May Come at a Price for the Brain
description: After a heart attack and quadruple bypass surgery in 2010, Steve Colburn of Portland, Ore., began taking a cholesterol-lowering statin at the maximum dose. Soon, he began experiencing memory problems.

description: Thirty-two years ago, 9-week old Azaria Chamberlain disappeared from a campsite in the Australian outback, and her mothers claim that a dingo took the child caused a storm of public outrage and disbelief.

title: Hunger Pangs as Nations Pie Shrinks
description: Things are bad and unlikely to get better any time soon.

title: Is Copenhagen Brilliant?
description: How is a relatively small north European capital supposed to compete with the likes of London, Berlin, New York and Shanghai  well, Berlin, New York and Shanghai anyway, after what we learned about London from the China Miville piece in this weeks The New York Times Magazine.

title: Study Linking Abortion and Mental Health Problems Is Called False
description: The Journal of Psychiatric Research, which in 2009 published a research article purporting to show a a link between abortions and long-term mental health problems, this month offered a critique of the research, saying that the authors analysis does not support their assertions that abortions led to psychopathology.

description: WINE lovers rarely agree on the best methods of serving and drinking. Case in point: decanting, the practice of pouring wine from the bottle into another container before serving.

description: At JPMorgan Chases investor day last week, Jamie Dimon told a roomful of investors and analysts what was supposed to be a joke.

description: BAMIYAN, Afghanistan  Khalil Reza is a champion. His mother calls him a hero. He calls himself a skier.

title: Sharing the Goods
description: It is a family feud as longstanding and reliable as the swallows return to Capistrano: Congressional campaign committees want more fund-raising help from the president, and the president, despite fat coffers, is reluctant to give it.

title: Super Tuesday, State by State
description: The closest that Americans get to a national presidential primary comes every four years when a large group of states hold their primaries and caucuses on the same day.

title: Rutgers Defendant Wrote of Keeping Gays Away
description: NEW BRUNSWICK, N.J.  A former Rutgers University student sent a message to a friend about wanting to keep the gays away and urged her to watch a feed from a webcam that he had trained on a bed where he expected his roommate to have a tryst with another man, according to text messages shown in court on Monday.

title: Talking Out of Turn
description: Q. I watch television through a small antenna attached to my HDTV. Sometimes the sound and picture get increasingly out of sync as a show goes on. The sound usually precedes the picture. Why does that happen?

title: Todays Scuttlebot: Soaring E-Book Prices and Pinterest Photos
description: Here are some interesting things that the tech reporters and editors for The New York Times found on the Web recently. There are more here.

title: 3 Arrests in Beating Death Overheard by Landlady
description: Two men and a woman have been arrested in the beating and strangulation death of a Bronx construction worker, the police said Monday. The woman told investigators that she was a prostitute and had been hired by the victim, Gene Lewis, 40, but felt threatened by him and called the men to hurt him.

title: Lactose Intolerant, Before Milk Was on Menu
description: Since it was discovered in 1991, preserved in 5,300 years worth of ice and snow in the Italian Alps, the body of the so-called Tyrolean Iceman has yielded a great deal of information. Scientists have learned his age (about 46), that he had knee problems, and how he died (by the shot of an arrow).

title: Ricardo Morales, Star Clarinetist, Reverses His Decision to Join the New York Philharmonic
description: The New York Philharmonic appeared to have scored a coup nearly a year ago when Ricardo Morales, the stand-out principal clarinetist of the Philadelphia Orchestra, agreed to jump ship. Now, the Philharmonic said he has changed his mind. The orchestra announced on Monday that Mr. Morales, who was to have started in the position in September, has decided to stay in Philadelphia for family reasons.

title: A Stand-Up Joke Is Born
description: The night after Christmas, the comedian Myq Kaplan did something most people would find terrifying. He told around 20 minutes of new jokes to a packed audience.

title: Her Name Was Eileen. His? Halper. Albert Halper.

title: Gingrich Campaign Asks Judge to Dismiss Eye of the Tiger Lawsuit
description: Lawyers for Newt Gingrich and his presidential campaign have asked a federal judge in Chicago to dismiss a copyright infringement lawsuit brought against the candidate for using the song Eye of the Tiger to pump up crowds at campaign stops and political conferences dating back to 2009, according to court documents filed on Monday.

title: A Quest to Understand How Memory Works
description: At 82, the Nobel Prize-winning neuroscientist Dr. Eric R. Kandel is still constantly coming up with new ideas for research.

title: Creating a Cableless Living Room
description: A guide to canceling your cable and replacing it with a computer.

title: Old Collaborators Tension and Release
description: The conductor Lorin Maazel and the Vienna Philharmonic, though both have complex and sometimes prickly personalities, have through 50 years of collaboration maintained a warm professional friendship. That was made clear in the Playbill for their three Carnegie Hall concerts over the weekend.

title: Rivera Hits the Mound
description: TAMPA, Fla.  Mariano Rivera threw his first batting-practice session Monday and is scheduled to throw one more, possibly Friday, before he pitches in a Grapefruit League game. Rivera threw 28 pitches on Field 2 at the Yankees complex, and declared afterward that he would be ready for both his first spring training game and opening day, April 6.

title: No Animals Were Harmed in the Making of This Fossil
description: The famous feathered dinosaur archaeopteryx seems to have had a penchant for fossilizing in painful positions, with its head cranked backward at a severe angle. The contorted posture is so common in dinosaur fossils that it has its own name: opisthotonus, from the Greek tonos, meaning tightening, and opistho, behind.

title: Garca Lorcas Favorites Enliven Flamencos World
description: In addition to being a great poet and playwright, Federico Garca Lorca was a folklorist who sought to defend Spanish culture against commercialization. He was also a musician, and in 1931 he recorded a seminal collection of Spanish folk songs, reharmonized, with himself at the piano and the dancer La Argentinita singing.

title: New Albums From Todd Snider, Nite Jewel and Floratone
description: TODD SNIDER

title: Election Year Offers Students Livelier Civics Lessons
New Works for a Moody Continent
description: AMSTERDAM  Even in plush economic times, a festival of new ballets is a risky undertaking. How to find studio hours for all the dancers and choreographers? How to get a collection of new pieces working technically  lighting, dcor, staging  at the same time? And then the crucial issue: Will the works be any good?

title: All in the Framing: The Schoenberg That Isnt Scary
description: Musicians eager to persuade audiences that Schoenbergs music is not so fearsome usually accomplish that by cheating a bit. Instead of performing the post-tonal works that most people have in mind when they say they dislike Schoenberg, they choose youthful scores like Verklrte Nacht, Pelleas und Melisande or, if they have the budget, Gurre-Lieder  intensely Romantic works, composed long before serialism was a glint in the composers eye.

title: Knotty Challenges in Health Care Costs
description: The numbers, the projections, make health economists shudder.

title: Recapturing Chlos Charm
description: Clare Waight Keller may have found her groove at Chlo. After a tepid start last season, the designer came back with a very strong collection full of distinctive color  pale pink, lemon, dusty blue, deep red, camel  and standout, pretty sportswear. Although she had a few clunker coats (too heavy) and weird leather culottes with crinkled hems, she created a look with cute jogging pants, airy sweaters with an underlayer of white lace showing, coats based on quilted linings, and some lovely lace tops and dresses. I especially liked that Ms. Keller was comfortable with the notion of a sweater and a skirt, doing them in the Chlo spirit.

title: French Laundry
description: White was a big trend at the New York fall shows. London designers loved vivid digital prints, Milan feminine colors and matte finishes. But laundry-fresh white has again surfaces at the Paris shows, with the shock of white at Cline (in an oversize coats and wide trousers) and at Stella McCartney (in cotton shirts and embossed double-crepe trousers and short, full skirts).

title: Hawaii Five-0 Star Seeks Treatment
description: Alex OLoughlin, below, the star of the CBS drama Hawaii Five-0, will miss the production of at least one episode this month, potentially creating a challenge for the shows writing and producing staff. A representative for the actor, who plays a state police detective, told news organizations that after a recent shoulder injury, Alex is taking a short break to receive supervised treatment for problems related to prescription pain medication. CBS Television Studios, which produces the drama, said in a statement that it respected and supported Mr. OLoughlins decision to take time off and declined to comment further. The remake of Hawaii Five-0, now in its second year on CBS, has filmed 19 episodes this season and has 4 more to go. Despite Mr. OLoughlins absence, CBS said that it expected the show to complete its season order.

title: Footnote
description: Pinchas Zukerman, the violinist and conductor, said on Monday that he would step down as music director of Ottawas National Arts Center Orchestra after his contract expires at the end of the 2014-15 season.

title: How We Used to Eat: Baby Boomers and Sugar
description: To the Editor:

title: Coal Mine Safety
description: To the Editor:

title: Shadids Last Story
description: To the Editor:

title: Young Soprano Turns Out to Be a Pro
description: The George London Foundation Awards competition, named after the renowned bass baritone, has been one of the most reliable purveyors of young talent since its founding in 1971. The competition, whose laureates include stars like Joyce DiDonato and Eric Owens, offers cash prizes and performance opportunities, sometimes pairing young singers with veteran artists in recital.

title: The G.O.P. Landscape on Super Tuesday
description: To the Editor:

title: Cost of a College Education
description: To the Editor:

title: Tagliabue Honored
description: The former N.F.L. commissioner Paul Tagliabue, who was instrumental in the leagues efforts to diversify its coaching and front office ranks, has been honored by the Jackie Robinson Foundation with its Robie Humanitarian Award. Tagliabue was to receive the award at the foundations annual gala in New York City on Monday night.

title: Disposal of 9/11 Remains
description: To the Editor:

title: Protesters Urge Mayor to Spare Programs for Children
David Hollander
description: The latest installment in Vincent Dilios series of portraits from the art scene in Marfa, Tex.

title: Tempting With Hints Instead of Signposts
description: PARIS

title: Students Protest Tuition Increases
description: A noisy protest mostly from public college students from New York State upset with legislation that would allow tuition increases.

title: Merriment, Mischief and a Few Dead Critters
description: The ultimate American id boy is up to his old tricks in The Adventures of Tom Sawyer at the New Victory Theater, an amiable if slightly too well-behaved adaptation of Mark Twains novel, by Laura Eason.

title: Report: N.C.A.A. Investigates Syracuse Over Failed Drug Tests
description: Syracuse announced Monday that the N.C.A.A. was investigating its mens basketball program after Yahoo Sports reported that at least 10 former players since 2001 had failed tests for a banned recreational substance or substances and that the program did not adhere to the universitys drug policy when it came to disciplining them.

title: In Rejection, F.D.A. Wants More Data From Merck
description: The Food and Drug Administration on Monday rejected an application by Merck to combine a cholesterol-fighting pill with the generic version of Lipitor.

title: Video of Anti-Putin Protests in Russia
description: Thousands of protesters rallied in Moscows Pushkin Square on Monday to condemn the election of Vladimir V. Putin as illegitimate, chanting Russia without Putin! and Putin is a thief! before the riot police moved in and made hundreds of arrests. Hundreds of anti-Putin protesters were also detained in St. Petersburg earlier in the day.

title: Chris Christie Endorses Scott Brown in Senate Race
description: Gov. Chris Christie of New Jersey on Monday endorsed Senator Scott P. Brown, the Massachusetts Republican locked in a high-profile race against Elizabeth Warren, a Democrat.

title: Kenzo Would Not Be Upstaged
description: PARIS

title: Coping With a Snarled City
description: In May, a NATO summit meeting will bring thousands of visitors to Chicago. The mayor, Rahm Emanuel, has already apologized to residents for any disruption. But all the extra people and traffic will surely also affect business travelers visiting the city at the same time.

title: Ex-F.D.A. Chemist Sentenced to 5 Years in Insider Case
description: A federal judge sentenced a longtime chemist with the Food and Drug Administration to five years in prison for using confidential information about drug applications pending with the agency to make nearly $4 million in illegal trading profits.

title: "On Air"
description: Winning Our Future, a "super PAC" backing Newt Gingrich, released a new ad on Monday arguing for Mr. Gingrich as the most electable candidate.

title: Boras Says Mets Need New Ownership
description: Scott Boras, considered baseballs most prominent player agent, strongly suggested Monday night that the sport and the Mets themselves would be better served if the teams current owners are replaced.

title: Knicks and Rangers Prices Rise Again
description: Success breeds success, according to one saying. In sports, it also breeds higher ticket prices.

title: Selling Gingrich, the Fighter
description: Winning Our Future, the pro-Newt Gingrich super PAC responsible for the commercials that featured a computer-animated, bobble-headed President Obama, is at it again with a new ad that promotes the former House speakers moxie. Or, as the ad puts it, The guys a fighter, and he aint afraid to hurt nobodys feelings.

title: White House to Host Group of 8 Meeting at Camp David
description: President Obama has boasted for months about hosting the annual summit of the Group of 8 industrialized nations this May in his hometown of Chicago, but on Monday, the White House without explanation announced a shift to the secluded setting of the Camp David presidential retreat in Maryland.

title: Digital Records May Not Cut Health Costs, Study Cautions
description: Computerized patient records are unlikely to cut health care costs and may actually encourage doctors to order expensive tests more often, a study published on Monday concludes.

title: U.S. Law May Allow Killings, Holder Says
description: WASHINGTON  Attorney General Eric H. Holder Jr. asserted on Monday that it is lawful for the government to kill American citizens if officials deem them to be operational leaders of Al Qaeda who are planning attacks on the United States and if capturing them alive is not feasible.

title: Protests Over Tuition Increases Jolt the Capitol
description: ALBANY  About 300 students, most of them from public universities in New York, rattled the Capitol on Monday with an outburst of loud protests, in the gallery of the Senate Chamber and outside the governors office.

title: Apple and Google to Meet With Senator Over Privacy
description: Senator Charles E. Schumer, New York Democrat, says Apple and Google have agreed to meet with him to discuss a privacy loophole on smartphones that gives apps unfettered access to peoples personal photos.

title: Jurors Told to Keep Talking in Financiers Fraud Trial
description: The judge in the fraud trial of the financier R. Allen Stanford ordered the jury on Monday to return to deliberations after it said it could not reach a unanimous verdict in its fourth day of reviewing the evidence.

title: 2012  Presidential Race Is the Worst Ive Ever Seen, Barbara Bush Says
description: Barbara Bush, the former first lady, is back on the campaign trail  this time for Mitt Romney  and once again, shes not biting her famously sharp tongue.

title: The View from Bay Ridge, 1960
description: As is well known, even notorious by now, the Republican presidential candidate Rick Santorum recently stated that he almost threw up after reading JohnF. Kennedys famous 1960campaign speech on the proper relation between church and state in American politics. Santorum has become the most highly visible face of culturally and politically conservative Catholicism as a result of this and other statements. A cradle Catholic myself, I was moved to re-read that speech and as a result I didnt almost cry  I flatout cried. Criedin gratitude to J.F.K. and his speechwriter Ted Sorensen for being so transcendentally right and for erasing, with some 1,500 well-chosen words, a vile cloud of suspicion that had hung over our nations Catholics.

title: News Corp. Faces Inquiry of Ex-Arm for Bribery
description: As News Corporation seeks to contain a widening investigation into illegal information gathering at its British publishing unit, the company may face fresh allegations at another problematic subsidiary.

title: Keep Up the Pressure on Myanmars Generals
description: Milan

title: Texas Teacher Pension Buys Bridgewater Stake
description: The Teacher Retirement System of Texas just went from hedge fund investor to hedge fund owner.

title: For Richardson, a Former Jet, Teenage Friends Dream Comes True
description: Tony Richardson met Tyler Nelson in 2009, at a Make-a-Wish Foundation event before the Super Bowl that February.

title: Leadership Rift Emerges in Pakistani Taliban
description: ISLAMABAD, Pakistan  The Pakistani Taliban faced the prospect of a damaging leadership rift on Monday when the abrupt dismissal of a senior commander provoked an angry reaction in the militants ranks, offering the Islamabad government a fresh opportunity to weaken a foe that in recent years has killed thousands of Pakistanis and tried to detonate a crude car bomb in Times Square in 2010.

title: At Chechnya Polling Station, Votes for Putin Exceed the Rolls
description: GROZNY, Russia  While there were charges of fraud in Russias presidential election Sunday, officials throughout most of the country appeared to be on notice to avoid the appearance of cheating in obvious ways like ballot stuffing. But some here seem not to have gotten the memo.

title: Camp David, Not Chicago, to Host G-8
description: WASHINGTON  President Obama has boasted for months about playing host to the annual summit meeting of the Group of 8 industrialized nations this May in his hometown, Chicago. But on Monday, without explanation, the White House announced a shift to the secluded setting of Camp David, the presidential retreat in Maryland.

title: After Ratings Drop, Ford Reworks Touch Screens
description: DEARBORN, Mich.  The Ford Motor Company began adding touch-screen control systems to some of its most popular models two years ago as a way to stand out from the rest of the industry and draw in new customers.

title: India: Italians Jailed in Two Deaths
description: An Indian court on Monday ordered that two Italian marines who were accused of killing two Indian fishermen last month be moved to a jail from a guest house while officials investigate. The Italian government, which has argued that Italy should investigate because its sailors were involved and the episode happened in international waters, called the decision unacceptable. Indian officials say the marines shot at the fishermen near the coast of Kerala State after mistaking them for pirates.

title: Maker of a Hair-Straightening Product Settles Lawsuit
description: The manufacturer of the popular hair-straightening product Brazilian Blowout, the subject of government inquiries and health complaints, said on Monday that it had agreed to settle a class-action lawsuit for about $4.5 million.

title: Airlines Have a Manifesto, and Travelers Should, Too
description: AS they say in the Navy when seas get rough, stand by for heavy rolls. If you think that airplanes are crowded now, if you worry about service to smaller and midsize cities, if youre alarmed by rising airfares, just wait.

title: A Friendlier Cellphone Brand
description: DECLARATIONS of love for cellphone companies are few and far between. Dropped calls, rising prices, spotty service and strict contracts make many customers want to throw their hands  and their phones  in the air.

title: After Barnard Gets Obama for Speech, Tensions With Columbia Bubble Up
description: Ivy League schools usually cloak their jealousies in politesse, but President Obamas decision to give the commencement speech at Barnard, and not Columbia, his alma mater across the street, has unleashed online exchanges as nasty as any hair-pulling, eye-gouging schoolyard brawl.

title: Lins Star Turn Demands Learning in the Spotlight
description: DALLAS

title: Santorum Sticks to a Bare-Bones Style
description: WESTERVILLE, Ohio  On the eve of Super Tuesday, more than two full months into the presidential nominating season, Rick Santorums campaign is still a bare-bones operation, with little of the slickness that many presidential campaigns exhibit by this time in the process.

title: Wide Sentencing Disparity Found Among U.S. Judges
description: A new analysis of hundreds of thousands of cases in federal courts has found vast disparities in the prison sentences handed down by judges presiding over similar cases, raising questions about the extent to which federal sentences are influenced by the particular judges rather than by the specific circumstances of the cases.

title: Rick Santorum Isnt Crazy
description: Media pundits have been beating up on Rick Santorum for saying that the assertion of an absolute separation of church and state makes him want to throw up, for attacking John F. Kennedys pledge to be a president whose religious views are his own private affair and for declaring that the idea that the church can have no influence in the operation of the state is absolutely antithetical to the objectives and visions of our country.

title: Healthy Labels, Not Stealthy Labels
description: Research suggests that consumers spend only about one second looking at nutrition information when making myriad choices. A parent dashing through the grocery store aisles with kids in tow has to decide, in that one second, which is better: Triscuit vs. Saltines vs. Wheat Thins vs. Ritz? This is why Americans need a simple, standardized and truthful label on the front of all packaged foods.

title: Officers, Why Do You Have Your Guns Out?
description: White Plains

title: Welcome Trend in College Tuition
description: A small but growing number of private colleges are freezing tuition and rethinking policies that have driven up prices to unsustainable levels. According to the National Association of Independent Colleges and Universities, which represents more than 950 private colleges, 15 have announced tuition freezes for the 2012-13 school year. The group includes two well-known, selective schools, Mount Holyoke College and Sewanee, the University of the South. Before the recession, such freezes were rare.

title: Diving Board Is Set to Begin a Second Career in the Theater
description: Juliets balcony may never be the same.

title: Fed Study of Student Debt Outlines a Growing Burden
description: A report released Monday by the Federal Reserve Bank of New York renews concerns about the growing debt load of college students and graduates.

title: Poorly Told Political Fortunes
description: With his time served on the trail in 2008 and the money he had going into 2012 and his momentum coming out of Florida, Mitt Romney was supposed to be turning much of his attention to the fall by now, not looking over his shoulder and sweating Ohio.

title: Making the Flight, Missing the Airport
description: IM one of those lucky people who never have a nervous thought when flying. Once Im up in the air, I think its absolutely delicious. Sometimes seatmates recognize me and may want some real estate advice, and thats fine. I dont mind talking on occasion. But Im usually focused on what I have to do when I get to where Im going.

title: A Weakened Miranda Rule
description: The Supreme Court recently did significant damage to the Miranda rule, which requires that suspects in custody be told of their right to remain silent and to have a lawyer present, and that any statements they make could be used against them in criminal proceedings.

title: Ralph McQuarrie, Artist Who Helped Bring Star Wars to Life, Dies at 82
description: Ralph McQuarrie, the artist who transformed George Lucass rudimentary concepts and earliest scripts into lush, vivid images of intergalactic expanse and light-saber combat that became the visual core of the Star Wars saga, died on Saturday at his home in Berkeley, Calif. He was 82.

title: Former Independent Governor to Run for Snowes Senate Seat
description: Former Gov. Angus King of Maine, an independent who served two terms from 1995 to 2003, announced Monday night that he would run for the seat that Senator Olympia Snowe is giving up.

title: Chandler Says Hell Tape Up and Play On
description: DALLAS  Knicks center Tyson Chandler is coping with multiple injuries to his left hand and wrist and will probably be playing through pain for the rest of the season.

title: The Rediscovery of Character
description: The obituaries for James Q. Wilson, the eminent social scientist, generally emphasized his broken windows theory on how to reduce crime. Thats natural. This strategy, which contributed to the recent reduction in crime rates, was his most tangible legacy.

title: As an Adviser, Goldman Guaranteed Its Payday
description: Lloyd C. Blankfein had a script for his phone call.

title: Judge Cebulls Racist Joke
description: Apologizing for atrocious behavior is better than not trying to apologize. Rush Limbaughs nonapology to Sandra Fluke for calling her a prostitute was a good example. But sometimes even a seemingly sincere apology is not enough.

title: Iran, Israel and the United States
description: President Obama and Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu of Israel share responsibility for the strains in their relationship. But there should be no doubt about Mr. Obamas commitment to Israels security. When he warns that an Israeli attack on Iran could backfire, and that there is still a window for diplomacy, he is speaking for American and Israeli interests.

title: Ronnie Montrose, Hard-Rock Guitarist, Dies at 64
description: Ronnie Montrose, an influential guitarist whose band, Montrose, was a mainstay of hard rock in the 1970s and the launching pad for the singer Sammy Hagar, died on Saturday at his home in Brisbane, Calif. He was 64.

title: A Union Stands Up for Players
description: I hate bullies, said DeMaurice Smith.

title: Senate to Choose an Insider Trading Bill
description: WASHINGTON  Senate leaders, eager to avoid a freewheeling, unpredictable debate on Congressional ethics, are considering simply accepting a House-passed bill to ban insider trading by lawmakers.

title: A Dutch Angels Cellphone Number Is in Demand
description: S HERTOGENBOSCH, the Netherlands  High on the cathedral in this trim Dutch town, amid a phalanx of stone statues of local noblemen, crusaders, saints and angels, one figure stands out. Smiling faintly, with lowered eyelids, one of the angels wears jeans, has a laptop bag slung over one shoulder and is chatting on a cellphone. The angel gets about 30 calls a day on the phone.

title: Lottery Numbers
description: March 5, 2012

title: Charges Weighed for Lawyer Who Revealed Witnesss Name
description: A federal district judge in Brooklyn has asked the United States attorneys office there to review whether to pursue criminal contempt charges against a lawyer who revealed in court papers in 2010 the identity of a businessman who had pleaded guilty in an organized-crime case and cooperated with the government.

title: Report Links Ex-Detainees to Terrorism and Insurgency
description: WASHINGTON  National security officials on Monday reported that the number of confirmed cases in which former detainees previously held at the prison at Guantnamo Bay, Cuba, engaged in terrorist or insurgent activity after their transfer had risen to 95 from 81  out of the 599 prisoners released  from October 2010 to December 2011.

title: Chinese Heroism Effort Is Met With Cynicism
description: FUSHUN, China  Some national heroes are born in the crucible of war. Others have far less dramatic origins.

title: In Caucus States, a Chance for (Almost) Every Candidate
description: The states holding Republican caucuses on Tuesday have received little attention as compared with high-profile primary states like Ohio and Georgia. But the caucuses in Alaska, Idaho and North Dakota  in addition to awarding 87 delegates  will help decide how the overall Super Tuesday scoreboard is reported and may seem more important in the rear-view mirror. In 2008, Barack Obamas wins in the caucus states on Super Tuesday helped him to win more delegates from the evening, and turned what was initially perceived as a relatively poor performance for him into one that gave him some degree of momentum.

title: Yankees Think That for Pineda, Changeup Is in Good (and Big) Hands
description: CLEARWATER, Fla.  From the base of the palm to the tip of the middle finger, Michael Pinedas right hand approaches 10 inches long, meaning his hand is almost a foot.

title: So What?
description: TUESDAYS PUZZLE  One of the nice things about constructing crossword puzzles as a hobby is that you are not under any deadline pressure and can ruminate on theme material or how to stack long entries in a themeless puzzle as much as you like. Wesley Johnson is just such a constructor, and he is back today after a seven-year absence.

title: Who Am I? Why Are We Here? Oh, Hello, Death
description: Edward Albee throws a mean party. Just check out the elegant, savage soiree taking place at the Pershing Square Signature Center, where Edward Albees The Lady From Dubuque opened on Monday night in a scintillating revival. One small thing you should probably know, though, in case youre not on speaking terms: Death is on the guest list.

title: Rematch for UConn and Notre Dame
description: HARTFORD  The hard-working Connecticut sophomore center Stefanie Dolson took an uncontested back-door pass from Tiffany Hayes, banked in a layup, and broke into a big smile as she headed upcourt, as if the Huskies had reasserted themselves a little too easily Monday.

title: Update on New York Redistricting
description: With just 16 weeks until its Congressional primary, New York still has no approved political districts, causing increasing consternation among elected officials, potential challengers and government reform groups. New York is now among the last states in the nation to tackle the redistricting required as a result of the 2010 census. And the urgency is growing: the states Congressional primary is scheduled for June 26, and its legislative primary for Sept. 11.

title: Former Staten Island Ferry Springs Leak and Lists
description: A former Staten Island ferry, decommissioned in 2007 after more than four decades of service, was tilting sideways on Monday after springing a leak last week about 60 miles north of New York City, and it might have to be dismantled, the authorities said.

title: U.S. Remains Opposed to Drug Legalization, Biden Tells Region
description: MEXICO CITY  Vice President Joseph R. Biden Jr. delivered a blunt message on Monday to leaders in Latin America who are contemplating opening the door to the legalization of illicit drugs: The United States will not budge in its opposition.

title: Japans Women Repeat Their Win Over U.S.
description: In the teams first meeting since the exhilarating final of last summers Womens World Cup, Japan on Monday again vanquished the United States again on Monday.

title: Antics Aside, Coach Gains His First Berth in N.C.A.A. Tournament
description: SPRINGFIELD, Mass.  Long before Loyolas Jimmy Patsos became a college coach best known for drawing technical fouls, pirouetting along the sideline and sitting 10 rows deep in the stands during games, he worked at a place where his antics fit better.

title: Was That Twitter Blast False, or Just Honest Hyperbole?
description: WASHINGTON  Mark W. Miller did not think Cincinnati should be spending money on a streetcar project, and he said so on Twitter. He urged his hundreds of followers to vote against the project, which was on the local ballot last November.

title: Oblivious to Court Battle, Mets Drop Their Opener
description: PORT ST. LUCIE, Fla.  If Mets players were at all unsettled by the legal tribulations of their owners, which continued to unfold Monday morning in Manhattan, they did a fine job hiding it.

title: How Powerful Is Russia?
A Tribe Confronts Its Neighbor Over Liquor
description: The Oglala Sioux Tribe has filed a federal lawsuit against stores that sell beer in Whiteclay, Neb., Anheuser-Busch and several other American brewers, accusing them of encouraging consumption of beer.

title: At Tribes Door, a Hub of Beer and Heartache
description: WHITECLAY, Neb.  Four rickety metal shacks that line the main road in this town of maybe 10 people sell an average of 13,000 cans of beer and malt liquor a day. The nearest sizable city is two hours north. But just 240 yards north  across the state line in South Dakota  is the sprawling Pine Ridge Indian Reservation, where alcohol has been banned since the 1970s.

title: McCain Calls for U.S.-Led Airstrikes in Syria
description: Senator John McCain called on Monday for the United States to lead airstrikes against Syrias armed forces to protect the rebels and civilians there, much as it did in Libya last year. Mr. McCain said, however, that the stakes were much higher in Syria. In a post on The Caucus, John H. Cushman Jr. writes:

title: Candidates Hammer Obama Over Iran, but Approaches Differ Little
description: WASHINGTON  To rein in Tehrans nuclear ambitions, Mitt Romney says he would conduct naval exercises in the Persian Gulf to remind Iran of American military might. He would try to ratchet up Security Council sanctions on Iran, targeting its Revolutionary Guards, and the countrys central bank and other financial institutions. And if Russia and China do not go along, he says, the United States should team up with other willing governments to put such punitive measures in place.

title: Should U.S. Food Aid Be Made in China?
description: HONG KONG  Somewhere, presumably, ships are about to be loaded with protein bars, animal crackers and oatmeal, the cargo bound for North Korea as part of a new diplomatic bargain with the United States. The bare bones of the deal are this: The North has agreed to a monitored shutdown of its main atomic reactor in exchange for a quarter-million tons of U.S. food aid.

title: Corrections: March 6
description: FRONT PAGE

title: Numberplay: Math as a Spectator Sport
description: Move over, Super Bowl, the MoMath Masters Tournament is here! Well maybe not, but the final rounds of the First Math Masters, which enlivened the highly successful fund-raising gala for the Museum of Mathematics, provided the same thrills, tension, quick thinking under pressure, and the collective sharp intakes of onlookers breaths, as a true sports event does. At the end of it all, as with professional athletes, you had to admire the skills of the finalists and their amazing ability to perform so well in front of an audience and under intense time pressure.

title: Milestones: Dennis J. Kucinich
description: Mr. Kucinich has made a career championing progressive causes in the United States Congress.

title: A Possible Last Hurrah for a Liberal Lion of Ohio
description: TOLEDO, Ohio  Representative Dennis J. Kucinich, a liberal icon who tried twice to win the Democratic nomination for president, was fighting for his political life in a mostly empty meeting hall in central Toledo.

title: Names of the Dead
description: The Department of Defense has identified 1,891 American service members who have died as a part of the Afghan war and related operations. It confirmed the deaths of the following Americans recently:

title: Jazz at Lincoln Center Announces 2012-13 Lineup
description: The highlights of Jazz at Lincoln Centers 2012-13 programming season will include six separate mini-festivals dedicated to major jazz figures, styles and institutions of the past and present, the organization announced Tuesday.

title: Word of the Day | termination
description: termination \tr-m-na-shn\ noun

title: Black Students Face More Discipline, Data Suggests
description: Black students, especially boys, face much harsher discipline in public schools than other students, according to new data from the Department of Education.

title: Cato Institute Is Caught in a Rift Over Its Direction
description: WASHINGTON  From its perch in a spacious brand-new headquarters blocks from the White House, the Cato Institute has built on its reputation as a venerable libertarian research center unafraid to cross party lines.

title: Champions League Preview: Arsenals Wenger Going for Broke
description: Given the 4-0 first-leg deficit his team is seeking to overcome, it would not have been surprising if Arsenals Arsne Wenger had announced that he was planning to start St. Jude up front against A.C. Milan. Instead, he hinted that he had something more exciting in mind.

title: Supreme Court Seeks Clarification on Jurisdiction in a Human Rights Case
description: WASHINGTON  Six days after hearing arguments in a major human rights case about whether corporations may be sued for complicity in torture abroad, the Supreme Court on Monday instructed the parties to address an even broader question.

title: Preschoolers in Surgery for a Mouthful of Cavities
description: SEATTLE  In the surgical wing of the Center for Pediatric Dentistry at Seattle Childrens Hospital, Devon Koester, 2  years old, was resting last month in his mothers arms as an anesthesiologist held a bubble-gum-scented mask over his face to put him under. The doctors then took X-rays, which showed that 11 of his 20 baby teeth had cavities. Then his pediatric dentist extracted two incisors, performed a root canal on a molar, and gave the rest fillings and crowns.

title: Running Robot Breaks Speed Record
description: A design firm financed by the Pentagon has broken a 23-year-old speed record for legged robots. Boston Dynamics, founded by Marc Raibert, a former M.I.T. roboticist, released a video on YouTube on Monday of its four-legged Cheetah prototype running on a treadmill at 18 miles per hour. The treadmill is designed to support speeds up to 50 m.p.h., but the company said it planned to test the Cheetah outside the lab as soon as possible. The previous record was 13.1 m.p.h., set at M.I.T. in 1989. Boston Dynamics, based in Waltham, Mass., has designed a range of mobile robots with financing from the Defense Advanced Research Projects Agency. Previous designs, like BigDog, have been machines intended to follow walking soldiers in the field with loads of up to 1,000 pounds. The company said that while Cheetah was a research project, both military and civilian applications were possible, including emergency rescue and the navigation of rugged terrain.

title: NYT Front Page for 03/06/2012
description: NYT Front Page for 03/06/2012

title: Election 2012: In Uttarakhand, Congress Edges Out BJP
description: Total seats available: 70

title: State Elections 2012: What They Said
description: Indias state assembly election results, considered a dress rehearsal for the 2014 general elections, drew huge voter participation and resulted in massive upsets in some states.

title: March 6, 1857 | Supreme Court Issues Dred Scott Decision
description: On March 6, 1857, in its Dred Scott decision, the Supreme Court ruled that Mr. Scott, a slave who had spent part of his life in non-slave territory, could not sue for his freedom in a federal court because, as the March 7 New York Times summarized, Negroes, whether slaves or free, that is, men of the African race, are not citizens of the United States by the Constitution.

title: Governing Party Is Set Back in Indian State Elections
description: MUMBAI, India  The governing Indian National Congress Party and the Nehru-Gandhi dynasty suffered a defeat on Tuesday in a pivotal election in the countrys largest state, Uttar Pradesh, calling into question their political mandate at a time when the party and the family are already struggling to advance their agenda in the capital.

title: Test Yourself | English, March 6, 2012
description: This question was written by Shannon Doyne. It comes from the article For Deliverymen, Speed, Tips and Fear on Wheels.

title: News Quiz | March 6, 2012
description: See what you know about the news below. To prepare, you might scan the articles or summaries on todays front page. Good luck!

title: Making Magic at Saint Laurent
description: Stefano Pilati has given his last show for Yves Saint Laurent, a seven-year journey of triumphs and flops that ended on Monday evening at the Museum of Minerals and Geology with a respectful ovation led by his boss, Franois-Henri Pinault, chairman of PPR. Mr. Pinault stood between his wife, the actress Salma Hayek and the YSL muse extraordinaire, Catherine Deneuve.

title: Even Dairy Farming Has a 1 Percent
description: Last month, after immersing myself in Brooklyns artisanal-food scene, I felt the need that many in my home borough have these days: to get out on a farm and smell the manure. So I drove an hour and a half southwest of New York City to spend the day with three generations of dairy farmers.

title: What Have You Done to Earn Money?
description: Joshua Johnson tap dances on the New York City subways to pay for college. Cameron Stephens knew he was unlikely to find paid work in a poor economy, so he just worked at an Atlanta farmers market, free, until someone noticed  and started paying him. What have you done, at any point in your life, to earn a bit of money  or to gain valuable job skills, even if you worked with no pay?

title: More Violence in Syria as Forces Scramble to Scrub Signs of Assault on Homs
description: BEIRUT, Lebanon  With the Syrian militarys wholesale assault on the central city of Homs over, antigovernment protests descended into skirmishing in several towns and cities across the country on Tuesday, while opponents and supporters of President Bashar al-Assad traded barbed remarks about ending the violence.

title: What Mandate For Indias Congress Party?
description: The crushing defeat by the ruling Indian National Congress Party and the Nehru-Gandhi dynasty in Uttar Pradesh calls into question their political mandate at a time when the party and family were already struggling to advance their policy agenda in New Delhi, Vikas Bajaj and Hari Kumar write in The New York Times.

title: Iranclad
description: On Friday, Iran held its first parliamentary election since 2009, leaving Supreme Leader Ayatollah Ali Khamenei with a commanding majority and undermining President Mahmoud Ahmadinejad. What will this change?

title: Counselors Calendar | March Checklist for Seniors
description: On Monday, The Choice introduced an occasional series called Counselors Calendar, which is intended to keep students on track as they go through the admissions process.

title: Fantasy Focus: The Industry Weighs In
description: Twenty-five of the best fantasy players in the industry flocked to Arizona during the weekend for the League of Alternative Baseball Reality auctions. This year was the first to include a mixed-league format (that 15-team draft was held online a week earlier), but the American League-only and National League-only leagues provide the first true data points in the industry for what players are likely to cost in similar settings throughout the next month.

title: Fanning the Flames of Class Warfare
description: Bruce Bartlett held senior policy roles in the Reagan and George H.W. Bush administrations and served on the staffs of Representatives Jack Kemp and Ron Paul. He is the author of The Benefit and the Burden: Tax Reform  Why We Need It and What It Will Take.

title: World Powers Agree to Resume Nuclear Talks With Iran

title: Easy Typing With a Little-Used iPhone Feature
description: When texting or e-mailing from a phone, I have conflicting desires. One desire is to type as little as possible, which argues for using abbreviations such as u r, for you are. The competing desire is not to look like an ignoramus. That argues for typing the complete word.

title: Who Should Be on Trial for the Global Financial Crisis? Send Us Your List.

description: Almost six months ago I wrote about a new program that I expected to sharply expand our recycling efforts and possibly even shift our entire business model. The program, I thought then, was about two weeks from its introduction.

title: The Jeremy Lin Design Winner
description: Alex Medina, the readers pick in our Jeremy Lin design competition, wasnt always a Knicks fan. Although he grew up in Washington Heights, Medina spent his childhood rooting for the Chicago Bulls and more recently jumped ship for the Miami Heat. It was all about Jordan, then all about LeBron. And now, its all about Lin.

title: Miniature E-Books Let Journalists Stretch Legs

title: A Dispatch From the Barricades
description: As I noted in a recent article, the debate over climate science has come to resemble other angry battles in the nations culture wars. Much as one might dislike the idea of the earths future being decided in a shouting match, that seems to be the reality of the situation we are in.

description: As if losing re-election is not punishment enough, politicians are becoming targets of criminal prosecution for their roles in the financial crisis. Foshee, chief executive of the El Paso Corporation, the big energy company that last fall was in talks to be sold to Kinder Morgan, Andrew Ross Sorkin writes in his DealBook column.

title: Volkswagen Cross Coupe TDI Concept: VW Previews a Diesel-Hybrid Crossover
description: GENEVA  An updated Tiguan crossover is coming from Volkswagen in 2014, and although the final details of the production model are not available, the company continues to tease auto show audiences with conceptual hints like the Cross Coupe.

title: Scouting the Draft: South Carolinas Stephon Gilmore
description: Another day, another cornerback prospect. I have already provided scouting reports forL.S.U.s Morris Claiborne,Alabamas Dre Kirkpatrick,Georgias Brandon Boykin,North Alabamas Janoris Jenkins, andVirginias Chase Minnifield. Today, I will try my hand at cornerback Stephon Gilmore of South Carolina.

title: Leisure Island
description: When it comes to hedonistic pleasures  clothing-optional beaches, mega-yachts  St. Barts isnt exactly lacking. But until recently, the island had one curious deficiency: a scarcity of high-end spas. (Htel Guanahanis Clarins center was the only game in town.) Then last fall the Isle de France spa overhauled its treatments with the help of Natura Biss, a company known for its anti-aging technology. Le Sereno added a Christian Liaigre-designed spa with an indoor-outdoor waterfront pavilion (above) and a menu heavy on products from the local brand Ligne St. Barth. And the Hotel Christopher just opened a spa with sea-facing treatment rooms and 15 different massages.

title: John Galt Wants Price Support
description: Lots of people have been having fun with the latest Max Abelson piece on whiny Wall Streeters. One thing Mike Konczal points out is that this is in part the whine of rentiers, angry that their wealth isnt yielding the return they want:

title: Almost Dawn in Libya: A Shared War
description: Dark storm clouds and a raging sea greeted the photographer Bryan Denton when he first arrived in the eastern Libyan city of Benghazi. It was the afternoon of Feb. 24, 2011, just days after the citys residents had expelled troops and officials loyal to Col. Muammar el-Qaddafi, marking the birth of Libyas uprising.

title: Image of the Day: March 6
El Paso Corp. Chief Defends His Actions in Kinder Morgan Deal
description: After taking heat from a Delaware judge over his role in selling the El Paso Corporation to Kinder Morgan for $21.1 billion, El Pasos chief executive is publicly defending himself.

title: Donald M. Payne, First Black Elected to Congress From New Jersey, Dies at 77
description: Representative Donald M. Payne, a former chairman of the Congressional Black Caucus who achieved a long-held goal of becoming the first black congressman from New Jersey, died on Tuesday in Livingston, N.J. He was 77.

description: Two boutique investment banks announced the hiring of senior-level executives on Tuesday, picking up veteran investment bankers to bolster their ranks.

title: From Believers, and Nonbelievers, a Showing of Political Muscle
description: Religion has been wrapped up in New York civic life to an uncommon degree of late, with all the Abrahamic faiths involved. The combination of the sacred and the secular is inevitably combustible.

title: Obama Has Turned His Back on Israel, Santorum Says
description: Rick Santorum on Tuesday called Iran a nightmare for all freedom-loving people in the world, promising that if he is elected president, we would find no gap between Israel and the United States because our interests are united.

title: Santorum and Romney Court Blue-Collar Voters in Ohio
description: COLUMBUS, Ohio -- Republicans cast their votes in 10 states on Tuesday to help decide how to award the biggest batch of delegates so far in the partys presidential nominating contest, with Mitt Romney and Rick Santorum engaged in a particularly competitive fight in Ohio.

title: Your Misguided Search for a Money Guru
description: Carl Richards is a certified financial planner in Park City, Utah. His new book, The Behavior Gap, was published earlier this year. His sketches are archived here on the Bucks blog.

title: Points West
description: For Yodit Eklund, the 26-year-old designer behind Bantu swimwear, the beaches along Africas West Coast are a source of inspiration  so she photographed her recent collection there (including the suits above, on the road to Assinie-Mafia in Ivory Coast). She wonders why some of the best beaches in the world are surfed only by locals. Here, Eklunds favorite spots.

title: The Economic Impact of the Pill
description: The recent controversy over contraception and health insurance has focused on who should pay for the pill. But there is a wealth of economic evidence about the value of the pill  to taxpayers, as my colleague Motoko Rich writes, as well as to women in general.

title: What Were Reading
description: The San Francisco Chronicle: In the Santa Rita Hills of western Santa Barbara County, Jon Bonn sees evidence of a stylistic change, as he finds more wines that are lively, structured and leaner rather than hefty and opulent.  Eric Asimov

title: Former Apple Executive Plots Next Wave of Mobile Ads
description: Lars Albright helped Apple begin its first foray into mobile advertising after the company bought his company, Quattro Wireless, for nearly $300 million in 2010. Now Mr. Albright believes he has come up with a plan to offer mobile ads that are tougher for users to ignore than traditional promotions.

description: Its the day before Apple is expected to unveil the newest version of its iPad, and the rumor frenzy shows no sign of abating.

title: Hope Is Not a Foreign Policy, Romney Says
description: Mitt Romney vowed on Tuesday to bring the current policy of procrastination toward Iran to an end if elected president, saying at a huge conference of the American Israel Public Affairs Committee that he would impose crippling sanctions, station carriers and warships at Irans door, and suspend all diplomatic relations.
