title: At Amelia Island Concours dlgance, Exceptions Are Made for Exceptional Cars
description: While gathering notes and photographs for a recent article in The Times about the Gatto, a bespoke sports car hand-built by Steve Moal of Moal Coachbuilders, I spent a fair amount of time in the family-owned shop in Oakland, Calif.Though I endeavored to give a sense of the vehicles remarkable workmanship, images and words fall short of seeing the cars up close.

title: Theater Talkback: For Off-Broadway Theater, the Perils of Prosperity
description: The lamentations over the slow death of commercial Off Broadway theater have subsided, at least for a while. Its true that over the past decade the city has lost at least a half-dozen spaces once devoted to presenting new work unsuitable for Broadway, including the Variety Arts in the East Village, the Promenade Theater on the Upper West Side (now a Sephora) and the Century Center off Union Square. I suppose we can consider it a happy coincidence that none has become a Duane Reade. The result has sometimes been a stampede to Broadway by shows that by all rights should remain Off Broadway. Witness the recent quick flop of the musical Lysistrata Jones.

title: For Bobby and Rosie, One Egg in the Nest
description: There is an egg in the nest.

title: The Campster | Cold Spring, N.Y.
description: Even during this mild winter, there is on occasion enough snow on the ground for a little snowshoeing in the Hudson River Valley. And Bull Hill, just north of Cold Spring, N.Y., makes for an especially tranquil outing. Also called Mount Taurus, its as pretty as any of the peaks that Thomas Cole, a founder of the Hudson River School art movement, painted in the early half of the 19th century. Its also relatively close to several bars, where any late-winter outdoor activity should end. (Hey, I dont make the rules.)

title: Health Reasons Force Klugmans Withdrawal From Twelve Angry Men
description: The Emmy Award-winning actor Jack Klugman, best known for playing Oscar on the 1970s television series The Odd Couple, has bowed out of the George Street Playhouses upcoming production of Twelve Angry Men, the theater announced this week. Mr. Klugman, a throat cancer survivor who will turn 90 next month, is withdrawing due to health reasons after concluding that he needed to stay close to his Los Angeles home and his physician there. (George Street Playhouse is in New Brunswick, N.J.)

title: What Doctors and Patients Dont Want to Talk About
description: There are lots of well-intentioned efforts to improve health care out there. But whether its a patient centered initiative, a public listing of hospital complication rates or reimbursement linked to patient satisfaction, the subtext is always the same: Were different from generations past because our patient-doctor relationship is less paternalistic and more transparent.

title: Government Pressuring Publishers to Adjust Pricing Policy on E-Books
description: 9:37 a.m. | Updated

title: Bin Ladens Wives Charged With Illegal Entry to Pakistan
description: ISLAMABAD, Pakistan  Pakistans interior minister said on Thursday that Osama bin Ladens three wives had been charged with illegally entering the country, in the first legal action against them since they were taken into custody after their husbands death in May.

title: Fantasy Focus: Last Years Bums
description: A colleague of mine, Mike Salfino, once suggested youd be better off drafting from your previous years cheat sheet instead this years  in this case, from 2011 instead of 2012. Of course, he didnt mean for you to ignore that Victor Martinez is out for the year, or that Jordan Walden is now an experienced closer, but for players who have essentially the same roles (and as good or better health) as last season, youre almost better off pretending last year didnt happen. At the very least, you should give it less weight than your league-mates inevitably will.

title: Closer Look: Deep Poverty in Retreat, Even Through the Great Recession
description: This is as close to a palindrome as a truism can get:

title: The Things They Did for Love (and Attention)
description: THE BALLAD OF GENESIS AND LADY JAYE

title: Caucus Click: Santorum in Space
Feathers Worth a 2nd Look Found on a Tiny Dinosaur
description: Sexual drive, not flight, may have been the main reason for the feather color and pattern of Microraptor, a four-winged dinosaur that lived some 130 million years ago in what is now northeastern China.

title: Opposition, to Its Surprise, Wins a Bit of Power in Moscow
description: MOSCOW  While many in Russias protest movement have been searching for direction in the wake of Vladimir V. Putins victory this week in the presidential election, a splinter group of Kremlin opponents in Moscow has been drawing up plans for new park benches, pedestrian walkways and more efficient parking.

title: Star Struck | Oliver Peopless New Sunglasses
description: While Belle de Jour was all about Gallic beauty (starring Catherine Deneuve in Yves Saint Laurent and Roger Vivier Pilgrim pumps), Jean Aurels 1968 film, Manon 70, has the actress wearing Emanuel Ungaro with statement sunglasses, a pair of which inspired Oliver Peoples to create the new Mande frames, shown here. In a pivotal scene, Deneuves character, Manon, exits the airport wearing cat-eye frames just as she decides to abandon one lover for another she met right before boarding the plane. Mad for luxury  and men  shes a free spirit who needs the perfect amber shades to hide the intention in her wide eyes, or preserve the mystery that adds to her characters allure. Surely, the Peoples people know the type.

title: RIM Tries Being Funny
description: OTTAWA  Shortly after trying, and then swiftly abandoning, cartoon characters as a marketing tool for BlackBerry smartphones, Research in Motion has a new plan: humorous mockery.

title: The Abortion Excuse
description: When right-wing politicians and activists go after Planned Parenthood, which has been one of their favorite pastimes in recent years, they often say they are fighting against abortion.

title: Drawing on the Past
description: The scientific illustrator Mick Ellison is one of the authors on a Science paper released Thursday describing sex drive as a possible reason for Microraptors feather color.

title: Straussian Social Conservatives?
description: In a recent post, the Cato Institutes Julian Sanchez puzzles over Rick Santorums comments implying some link between a contraceptive culture and rising out-of-wedlock birth rates, and concludes that conservative critiques of the sexual revolution ultimately amount to a kind of Straussian social conservatism,dependent on the idea that (in the provocative words of Irving Kristol) there are different kinds of truths for different kinds of people, and that the masses cant be trusted with the real case for traditional values:

title: Building Silent House
description: The filmmaking team Chris Kentis and Laura Lau drew notice with their 2004 shark thriller Open Water. While their latest release, Silent House, takes place on dry land, its lead character still finds herself in too deep.

title: Conflicts in Deal-Making, the Judge and Banker Perspective
description: NEW ORLEANS  For a little while, a panel on investment banker conflicts here looked like it might be the Second Battle of Del Monte.

title: Swiss President Wants Tax Accord From U.S.
description: BERN, Switzerland  In the view of Switzerlands president, her country would sign a deal on banking secrecy with the United States tomorrow if not for an impasse created by Washington.

title: Obama Campaign Video Highlights First Term
description: Coming soon from the Academy Award-winning director Davis Guggenheim: The Road Weve Traveled, an action-packed film for the Obama campaign that puts a Hollywood shine on President Obamas record.

title: The Constant in Notre Dame Basketball
description: Zach Hillesland was a forward at Notre Dame from 2005 to 2009.

title: Sixth Man Provides Big Lift as Syracuse Advances
description: Syracuse has proved all season it is capable of keeping off-court issues from derailing a remarkable season.

title: The Motherlode Book Club: Anne and Sam Lamotts Some Assembly Required
description: March marks the welcome reintroduction of the Motherlode Book Club. Im looking for six panelists Im talking to you, readers to join me in reading a book I feel as if Ive been waiting for years: Anne and Sam Lamotts Some Assembly Required, arguably the sequel to her beloved Operating Instructions.

title: No Word Yet on Review of Polices Crime-Tracking System
description: It has been 14 months since Police Commissioner Raymond W. Kelly, in January 2011, appointed a panel of former federal prosecutors to study the integrity of the departments internal crime-reporting system.

title: Why a Nuclear Duck?
description: As the BBCs Iran correspondent James Reynolds reported on Wednesday, Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahus visit to Washington this week raised many important questions of war and diplomacy, and one about the art of rhetoric: why a duck?

title: Side-by-Side Look at Destruction and Renewal in Japan
description: Toru Yamanaka, a photographer for Agence France-Presse, visited places in Japan destroyed by the March 2011 tsunami, photographing them from the same perspective that other photographers captured a year earlier.

title: Japan: Then and Now
description: When Pedro Ugarte and a team of editors for Agence France-Presse considered how to revisit the areas devastated last March by Japans tsunami and earthquake, they sought to illustrate how the place has changed. With a selection of about 50 photographs taken by Agence France-Presse photographers in mind, they asked the Japanese photographer Toru Yamanaka to go back to the communities that were seared into the global collective memory. Some of those places had been destroyed.

title: Afghan Officer Sought in Killing of 9 Colleagues
description: KABUL, Afghanistan  An Afghan policeman on late-night guard duty at a checkpoint allowed Taliban insurgents to enter and kill nine other policemen as they slept in their beds, an official in the Ministry of Interior said on Thursday.

title: Visa Troubles Force Two European Acts To Cancel U.S. Gigs
description: 5:11 p.m. | Updated Visa processing snags have forced two European acts to cancel performances in the United States scheduled for this week. The rising Spanish flamenco-soul singer Pitingo was to have made his U.S. debut Friday night at the Manhattan Center, and the avant-garde Czech theater troupe known as Tantehorse had a two week-plus run at a theater in the Washington D.C. area cancelled after four of its six members were told they would have to resubmit their applications.

title: House Backs Aid to Small Businesses
description: The House on Thursday overwhelmingly approved legislation to ease small businesses access to investments and capital markets, a sign that the shadow of the November election is pressing Congress into action.

title: A Bad Year for Billionaires
description: It was a bad year for some big billionaires. Well, as bad as life can be for an upper 1 percenter.

title: Are Western Activists Really Reducing Child Labor?
description: In my Economic Scene column on Wednesday I discussed how anti-sweatshop campaigns in the West to improve the lives of workers toiling in dismal conditions in the third world often do more harm than good  turning low-wage workers into no-wage workers by inducing multinational companies to pick up shop and move somewhere else.

title: Fashions Playground | The Colette Carnaval
description: Colette, the cultish multibrand concept store on rue Saint-Honor in Paris, will celebrate its 15th anniversary this weekend with a free carnival open to the public in the Jardin des Tuileries. The store is known for thriving outside of the box, and its co-founder Sarah Andelman was intent on raising the bar for the milestone, having thrown a more predictable invite-only party for Year 10. I wanted to do something fun for our clients, fans and friends, something like when we were kids, she explained. Ive always fantasized about it being in the Tuileries.

title: Wendy Whelan Adds Performances With Petronio Company
description: The ballerina Wendy Whelan will add a performance on Saturday and two on Sunday to her run with the Stephen Petronio Company at the Joyce Theater, the company said. Ms. Whelan this week has been performing Ethersketch I, a 3  minute solo derived from Mr. Petronios 2003 work Underland. The original run was to have ended Friday.

title: Cerberus Said to Be in Talks to Acquire AT&Ts Yellow Pages
description: The private equity firm Cerberus Capital Management is known for buying businesses that others have left for dead. Its latest potential deal would only burnish that reputation.

title: All the News Thats Fit to Click: Analyzing New York Times Design
description: Overview | How is The New York Times designed, and how does its look and feel, both in print and online, contribute to the readers experience of the content? What design theories inform the layout of newspapers and their Web sites? In this lesson, students learn about design principles and elements and compare the way The Times and other media outlets use those elements to create both a design look and an organizational structure readers can navigate.

title: The Pentagon Emails
description: Attorney General Eric Holder Jr. and Jeh Charles Johnson, the general counsel for the defense department, both delivered speeches recently on national security and the law. On Tuesday I wrote about the parts of these speeches that I found sensible, including Mr. Holders defense of using civilian trials to prosecute terrorists. But I specified that I was not as enamored of military tribunals as Mr. Holder and Mr. Johnson.

title: Wheelies: The Unseen Edition
description: In which we bring you motoring news from around the Web:

title: What the Psychic Knew
description: YEARS ago  panicked, on the cusp of 30, between jobs and wondering where life would take me  I consulted a psychic. I remember staring at the sea of green carpet in her home as she addressed the usual concerns.

title: White House Ethics Hub Goes Live Online
description: The Obama administration introduced a central online hub for information about ethics, lobbying and campaign contributions on Thursday, making good on a campaign pledge President Obama made in his 2008 campaign.

title: In Cobble Hill, Continued Resistance to New Charters
How to Safely Delete or Save Tax Documents Online
description: Its tax time, which means millions of Americans are probably in the midst of collecting the many documents needed to prepare their returns.

title: Hemingway/PEN Award Goes to Teju Cole
description: Teju Cole, writer in residence at Bard College, has won the Hemingway Foundation/PEN Award, which honors outstanding first works of fiction, for his novel Open City. Previous winners of the prize include Bobbie Mason, Renata Adler, Ha Jin, Jhumpa Lahiri and Dagoberto Gilb.

title: TimesCast | From Dissident to Politician
description: Daw Aung San Suu Kyi, the leader of Myanmars democracy movement, seeks a seat in her countrys Parliament.

title: Comcast Declines to Offer Netflix to Its Customers
description: Netflix may have hit a snag as it negotiates with cable operators.

title: M.L.S. Preview: Five M.L.S. Players Klinsmann Should Call
description: Major League Soccer boasts a number of players who have gotten  and will most likely continue to get  significant playing time for the United States national team. Juan Agudelo, Kyle Beckerman, Edson Buddle, Landon Donovan and Brek Shea all have a dozen or more caps and are firmly entrenched in Jurgen Klinsmanns plans. Outside of this core group of stalwarts, however, there exists a handful of Americans who play in M.L.S. but remain on the fringe of the U.S. squad. Here is a quick look at five such players who could play a significant role in 2012  if Klinsmann gives them a call.

title: Photo Replay: March 8
description: Photos of the day in sports, including the color and pageantry of college basketball tournaments.

title: Look of The Moment | Catherine, Duchess of Cambridge
description: The Look: Royal Ruffle. A crisp jacket with this springs favorite trend  the peplum  redefines a to-the-knee sheath.

title: Solar Bursts Spray Earth, With More to Come
description: Solar storms like the one that buffeted the Earths magnetic field on Thursday will soon become a common occurrence.

title: Idol Fares Better as Competitors Offer Reruns
description: A new episode of American Idol on Fox was the beneficiary of a weakened broadcast slate filled with repeats on Wednesday night. The show jumped 12 percent in the 18-to-49-year-old demographic compared to last Wednesday and averaged 18.5 million total viewers over a two-hour period, according to Nielsen data. Its main competition, ABCs Modern Family, was a rerun, as was the majority of the programming from ABC and CBS.

title: 2 Spins Offered by Latest City Jobs Data
description: If MayorMichael R. Bloomberg were running for office again, he could use the jobs data released on Thursday to his advantage. And so could his opponents.

title: Injured in Fight, Rangers Dubinsky Is Out for Ottawa Game
description: OTTAWA  Rangers forward Brandon Dubinsky will miss Thursdays game against the Senators after being injured in a fight with the Devils Ryan Carter during Tuesdays 4-1 loss in Newark. Dubinsky sustained a hand injury and a cut to the nose in the fight and is experiencing sinus pressure. He is listed as day to day.

title: A Pippin Directed by Diane Paulus Heading to Cambridge
description: The director Diane Paulus, now represented on Broadway with The Gershwins Porgy and Bess, and the Montreal circus company Les 7 Doigts de la Main (or 7 Fingers) will collaborate on a new production of the Stephen Schwartz musical Pippin that will begin performances at the American Repertory Theater in December, the Cambridge, Mass.-based theater announced on Thursday.

title: Cast of Characters Grows, as Does the Intrigue, in a Chinese Political Scandal
description: BEIJING  Dynamic, ruthless and once seemingly bound for the highest echelon of Chinese leaders, Bo Xilai, the Chongqing Communist Party secretary, saw his prospects dim last month after a corruption scandal prompted the citys vice mayor, a trusted ally, to seek refuge at an American consulate.

title: A Bloomsbury Love Triangle
description: As historical source material goes, can there be a sharper double-edged sword than the Bloomsbury group, that spectacular, fractious tribe of British writers, thinkers and artists who came together in London in the early 20th century?

title: 2 Manmade Marshes: One Planted, One Left to Nature
description: Wetlands development has always been a bit of an oxymoron. So perhaps it comes as little surprise that when Ohio State University studied two manmade wetlands  planting marsh varietals in one and letting nature take its course in the other  it found that over a 15-year period, both produced nearly identical plant life. Still, the natural one managed to sequester more carbon.

title: 2 Die and 7 Are Wounded in a Shooting in Pittsburgh
description: A gunman opened fire in the lobby of a psychiatric hospital in Pittsburgh on Thursday, killing one person and wounding seven, including a police officer, officials said. The gunman was also said to have died.

title: Bounteous Closet Space and Park Views for $77.5 Million
description: CHRISTOPHER M. JEFFRIES, a founding partner of Millennium Partners, which in 2002 opened a Ritz-Carlton hotel with condominiums above at 50 Central Park South, has put his 10,882-square-foot duplex in the building on the market for $77.5 million.

title: Jorinde Voigts Measured Approach
description: Jorinde Voigts large-scale graphite drawings look like a dizzying but elegant network of flight routes or seismographic data, notated with directional arrows, writing and, more recently, collaged with colored paper. Informed by musical structure  the lithe,nearly six-foot-tall artist played the cello from age 9 to 26  Voigt applies statistical algorithms to observations and emotions. Or as she likes to say, she measures the invisible.

title: Scenes From a Dying Empire
description: Any time wall texts are mounted next to the works in an exhibition, a familiar tension arises between words and images, reading and seeing. The information might be crucial to understanding the images, but spend too much time reading, and you feel as if youve visited a textbook rather than an art show.

title: Cantor Picks a Favorite in Illinois Primary
description: In an unusual nod from a Republican House leader in a member-on-member primary, Representative Eric Cantor of Virginia has endorsed Representative Adam Kinzinger, a freshman from Illinois, over Representative Donald A. Manzullo, who was elected in 1992.

title: Former Coca-Cola Bottling Executive Charged With Insider Trading
description: The Securities and Exchange Commission charged a former executive at a Coca-Cola bottling company with insider trading on Thursday, saying he acted on nonpublic information about a pending deal with the Coca-Cola Company.

title: A Collection of Many Hands to Be Sold in Sothebys Auction
description: There was a time in the 1980s and early 90s when Henry Buhl was a wedding photographer who collected what he called little things.

title: Measures to Speed Pipeline Fail
description: Two measures that would have expedited, in different ways, the construction of the Keystone XL pipeline failed in the Senate on Thursday.

title: Across Aisles, Accidental Pas de Deux
description: As newer art fairs crowd the spring calendar, the Art Show wears its age proudly and well. Now in its 24th year, this annual showcase of the Art Dealers Association of America combines polish and relevance. It offers current hits from the museums and galleries as well as historical goodies in one tasteful and increasingly manageable package.

title: Pictures of the Day: Syria and Elsewhere
description: Photographs from Syria, the West Bank, Egypt and Russia.

title: Museum and Gallery Listings for March 9  15
description: Art

title: Paul Graham: The Present
description: The Pace Gallery and Pace/MacGill

title: Antoine Catala: I See Catastrophes Ahead
description: 47 Canal

title: Guy Goodwin: Recent Works
description: Brennan & Griffin

title: Ryan McNamara: Still
description: Elizabeth Dee Gallery

title: Sam Moyer
description: Rachel Uffner

title: Hong Kongs Corporate Boys Club
description: HONG KONG  Hong Kong considers itself  rightly  to be one of the most developed cities in Asia. It is a global banking and trading center. Its subway system is a dream. Its medical and education systems are on par with those of many a Western nation.

title: Vista Visionaries Who Open Your Eyes
description: THE scape has come a long way since the 19th century, when it tended toward purple mountains majesty, soul-stirring seas and fields of transcendence, with God or Nature  take your pick  beaming in the background. Our cultural sense of the scape expanded throughout the 20th century and continues to evolve: cityscapes and microscapes, starscapes and bodyscapes, dreamscapes and inscapes (as clarified by Jung and Freud) and todays soundscapes, Webscapes, datascapes and an infinity of futurescapes.

title: Selling the Hideaways of a Reclusive Heiress
description: THE real estate mysteries surrounding Huguette Clark, a reclusive copper heiress and senators daughter, swirled for years before she died at age 104 last May.

title: Convergences
description: One thing that struck me about the 9/11 footage shown during last years anniversary was that in 2001, the people on New York Citys sidewalks had no smartphones with which to record the events of the day. History may well look back on 9/11 as the worlds last underdocumented mega-event. But aside from the absence of phone cameras, the people and streets of September 2001 looked pretty much identical to those of September 2011: the clothes, the hair, the cars. I mention this because it has been only in the past decade that we appear to have entered an aura-free universe in which all eras coexist at once  a state of possibly permanent atemporality given to us courtesy of the Internet. No particular era now dominates. We live in a post-era era without forms of its own powerful enough to brand the times. The zeitgeist of 2012 is that we have a lot of zeit but not much geist. I cant believe I just wrote that last sentence, but its true; there is something psychically sparse about the present era, and artists of all stripes are responding with fresh strategies.

title: Hard-Working Bearcats Win After 2 Extra Shifts
description: Georgetowns defense was cheating toward the interior, and Cincinnati guard Cashmere Wright said he saw an opening. He had little time to hesitate.

title: Inequality by County
description: New York County  that is, Manhattan  is the third-most economically inequitable county in the United States, according to a recent report from the Census Bureau.

title: Stylized Dancing Cogs in a Surreal Machine
description: Never for a moment of Ohad Naharins 2009 Hora  it lasts one hour  can you be in doubt that a choreographer has been hard at work. Everything is very fixed, planned, controlled. The 11 Batsheva Dance Company performers, barefoot and wearing simple dance attire, never leave the stage.

title: How to Write a Lives Essay
description: The Lives essay has been running in our magazine nearly every week since 1996. For those who dont know, it is a place for true personal stories, running about 800 words long, and in the print edition, its the last bit of editorial content, right inside the back cover. Though we do solicit professional writers, it is open to anyone with a good tale to tell, and we try as best we can to keep up with the steady torrent of submissions. At the risk of making our jobs utterly impossible, I want to encourage even more writers to take the plunge  because the more stories we get, the higher the quality of what ends up on the page. In doing this, it is not our intention to set people up for failure. The truth is, while getting published is a wonderful achievement, the process of writing a story is itself a rewarding experience. You wont be sorry for having tried.

title: Senate Democrats Ask I.R.S. for More Scrutiny of  Nonprofit Political Groups
description: Senate Democrats on Friday will ask the Internal Revenue Service to institute a bright line test to ensure that tax-exempt organizations devote less than half their activities to politics and to prevent corporate donors from deducting super PAC contributions from their taxes.

title: Renowned Wine Dealer Accused of Trying to Sell Counterfeits
description: Rudy Kurniawan had ascended to the upper reaches of the wine world on both coasts, renowned as much for his palate as for his eye, fixed often on the highest of high-end bottles.

title: A Little Sweet, a Little Bitter, a Little Broadway
description: Among singers with light, childlike voices, there is a fine line separating natural buoyancy from an insufferable cuteness. The engagingly sunny cabaret singer Marissa Mulder stayed on the right side of that line in her opening-night show at the Metropolitan Room on Thursday. Her ingenuousness is real and never cloying.

title: Getting to Carnegies Podium With Little Time to Practice
description: Last week John Oliver, an esteemed choral conductor long associated with the Boston Symphony Orchestra, had no idea that he was about to make his Carnegie Hall debut at 72. But on Tuesday night Mr. Oliver conducted the orchestra, the Tanglewood Festival Chorus and four exemplary vocal soloists in a glowing and sensitive account of Beethovens Missa Solemnis, an elusive late-period work lasting 80 minutes. He stepped in for Kurt Masur, who was to have conducted but withdrew late last month because of illness.

title: The Daily Shoe | Runners-Up
description: var data;function jsonSlideshowCallback(response){data = response;}NYTD.options = {source: data,cropType: 'blog480',appendTo: 'fullScreenSlideShow',showHeadLine: 'false', renderstyle: "embeddedSlideShowTmag"}

title: Leading Men
description: A look back some of Hollywoods biggest male stars and the projects that began their rise to fame.

title: Amid Calls to Quit, Gingrich Seems More Subdued
description: JACKSON, Miss.  Introducing Newt Gingrich on Thursday morning, a local official said: I can tell you right now, hes tired. He needs your prayers.

title: Paying on Time
description: FEWER homeowners have been falling behind on their mortgage payments over the last two years, yet even with the improvement, a significant number still are delinquent or in foreclosure.

title: Support From Across the Country
description: Donations to Elizabeth Warrens campaign for the United States Senate in Massachusetts.

title: TimesCast | Syrian Refugees Seek Safety
description: March 8, 2012 - Syrians face difficult choices as they cross into Turkey in search of safety and freedom.

title: Fashion History, Just a Click Away
description: Todays runways, stores and sidewalks are teeming with 20th-century fashion references, from peplums to pencil skirts. And for this reason, a collaboration between two of New York Citys cultural institutions could not be better timed. After two years of planning, the Picture Collection of the New York Public Library and the Special Collections & FIT Archives of the Fashion Institute of Technology Library have recently started a digital archive of fashion drawings and sketches by Andr Fashion Studios. The collection, Andr Studios 1930-1941: Fashion Drawings & Sketches in the Collections of the Fashion Institute of Technology and the New York Public Library, includes more than 5,000 original drawings.

title: Brooklyn, in Thick and Thin (Crust)
description: THE big white bus is leaving. If youre one of those ignorant souls who thinks New York City is limited to Manhattan and its cold, imperious skyscrapers, you should hop aboard.

title: Empowerment, Through a Lens
description: She is a pillar of strength. Her eyes tell the story of grace and humanity. She will always endure and transcend whatever obstacles life brings her.

title: The Wild, Wild West of a Certain Red Planet
description: The cast of John Carter includes a bunch of actors best known for the parts they play on television  Detective McNulty from The Wire, Walter White from Breaking Bad and, most prominently, Tim Riggins from Friday Night Lights (Texas forever!)  but the movie itself evokes a much older vintage of popular culture. Directed by the Pixar fixture Andrew Stanton (Finding Nemo, Wall-E) and based on a 1912 magazine serial by Edgar Rice Burroughs, it is a potpourri of arcane and familiar genres. Mash-up doesnt begin to capture this hectic hybrid; its more like a paintball fight.

title: Horsehair Completes the Outfit
description: Georgina Bloomberg, 29, the daughter of Mayor Michael Bloomberg and Susan Bloomberg, is a professional equestrian in Wellington, Fla., and New York. Recently, she released her second novel for teenagers, My Favorite Mistake, which she wrote with Catherine Hapka. She is dating Justin Dalles, a baseball player. BEE-SHYUAN CHANG

title: Nesting Lovebirds
description: My daughter, who is a freshman in college, is bringing her first boyfriend home for spring break. Im a single mother, and she is an only child. We live in a small apartment, without a guest room. Im thrilled she wants to visit (and bring him), but I dont know what the sleeping arrangements should be. Should I put him on the couch, or look the other way and let him stay with her? Patti, Chicago

title: Creative Sheik Wants to Stock Desert With Fish
description: The director Lasse Hallstrom is a shrewd commercial alchemist with a soft heart. More than a decade ago he turned chocolate into Chocolat, a sugary trifle that, with help from Harvey Weinstein, received five Oscar nominations, including one for best picture. And in his newest feat Mr. Hallstrom and the screenwriter Simon Beaufoy (The Full Monty) have transformed Paul Tordays absurdist political satire, Salmon Fishing in the Yemen, into a whimsical romantic comedy. It is the cinematic equivalent of turning salt into sugar.

title: Giving Some Muscle to a Growing Fitness Trend
description: Once the fitness craze was Richard Simmonss Sweatin to the Oldies. Then, other workouts like Billy Blankss Tae Bo caught on.

title: The Old New Here, the New New There
description: Many people think that art fairs represent the erosion of art by forces of the marketplace. I suggest that the opposite might be the case. Maybe art is using available systems of training, display and distribution, as well as artists themselves, for its own mysterious ends.

title: A Stately Exploration of Capital Punishment Surfaces in a Tabloid Sea
description: Investigation Discovery is a particularly lurid precinct on the cable television grid, home of shows like Nothing Personal: Murder for Hire, Facing Evil With Candice DeLong, Nightmare Next Door and Deadly Sins, which uses a religious theme to explore the depths of depravity.

title: Slouchy Rock Cruisers, With New Bassist in Tow
description: Its pretty easy to overthink the Men, and pretty tempting. The Men are a loud, slouchy rock band with two guitars and a dust cloud around their sound. We went through this 25 or 30 years ago. You can wonder why the men in the Men dont want to be better: better singers, better players, better riff writers. Reduce this band to its parts, and all the charm drains out of it. Maybe you shouldnt. Ill disregard my own wisdom in a minute, but Im telling you now.

title: When Elegance Sold Art
description: THE sudden closing last fall of the venerable Knoedler gallery marked an end to one of New Yorks great private art dealers, part of a cohort that included Duveen, Wildenstein and Durand-Ruel. To impress their clients, each built a sumptuous art palace, and Knoedler built two.

title: Classical Music/Opera Listings for March 9-15
description: Full reviews of recent classical concerts: nytimes.com/classical.

title: Spare Times
description: TORN IN TWO: THE 150TH ANNIVERSARY OF THE CIVIL WAR (Tuesday; display continuing Friday through April 28) For an exhibition consisting largely of maps, pictures are worth a thousand words. This display at the Grolier Club, organized by the Norman B. Leventhal Map Center at the Boston Public Library, includes period maps, newspapers and other items related to the Civil War that tell the stories behind the conflict, from the tensions that led to it to the battles that defined it. (Included, above, is an 1864 Currier & Ives lithograph with Lincoln and the Confederate leader Jefferson Davis tugging on a map of the United States held by Gen. George B. McClellan, a Union Army general who unsuccessfully ran for president against Lincoln.) Other pieces include a map used by Lincoln to plot troop movements; the war itself led to a remapping of major battle areas. On Tuesday at 6 p.m. Ronald Grim, curator of the Leventhal Map Center, will talk about the significance of the maps; the talk, like the show, is free, but reservations are requested by e-mailing mbrennan@grolierclub.org, or calling (212) 838-6690. The exhibition can be seen Mondays through Saturdays from 10 a.m. to 5 p.m., 47 East 60th Street, Manhattan, grolierclub.org.; it will be on view at Fords Theater in Washington, beginning in December. Map-folding skills will not be tested. (Anne Mancuso)

title: Promising Tyros Join an Art Fair Club
description: In its third incarnation, the Independent, perhaps New Yorks most exclusive, self-consciously hip contemporary-art fair, continues to disdain that term. Once more, it calls itself a temporary exhibition forum, as if it were some kind of seminar. It is, however, more of an art fair than ever, more professional, more dotted with small, framed, salable works. The playpen-like obstreperousness of its two previous incarnations has quieted.

description: Movies

description: Here are some interesting things that the tech reporters and editors for The New York Times found on the Web on Thursday. There are more here.

title: Maybe a Lady Taught Christopher Wren
description: WILLIAMSBURG, Va.  John Fitzhugh Millar, an architectural historian here runs a small inn while defending the reputation of a 17th-century British tastemaker, Elizabeth Wilbraham. He is convinced that in the 1660s Lady Wilbraham quietly set up an architectural office near Birmingham and eventually designed 400 buildings.

title: Holder Disturbed by Reports on New York Police Surveillance of New Jersey Muslims
description: Attorney General Eric H. Holder Jr. said Thursday that he found disturbing recent disclosures about the New York Police Departments surveillance of Muslim communities in New Jersey.

title: Cyclists in Two Cities
description: To the Editor:

title: Landscapes in Extremis
description: Two recent books of photography wrestle with the tension between official forgetting and the populist urge to remember.

title: Remodeling the Empty Nest
description: IT used to be that remodeling a home involved adding on at least as often as not. Instead, said Raymond Derrien, a contractor in Sea Cliff who often retrofits homes to sell to downsizing empty nesters, he finds himself combining, rearranging or eliminating rooms.

description: TWO recent books of photography wrestle with the tension between official forgetting and the populist urge to remember.

title: Child Fatality Reports

title: Warm Winter, Cool Sales
description: SKIING down the mountain in the morning and golfing on the fairways in the afternoon, with just a five-minute drive in between? How can that be possible?

title: Thats Amore
description: Pizza and a Wonder Wheel make pre-hip Brooklyn go round.

description: To the Editor:

title: Theater Competition Rescues Students From Their Own Dramas
description: Performing Shakespeare can save childrens lives. That is the persuasive argument of Alex Rotarus documentary Shakespeare High, an inspiring, if too short and overcrowded, examination of the competition among high schools at the 90th annual Drama Teachers Association of Southern California Shakespeare Festival.

title: A Place More in Keeping With the Plan
description: WHAT with medical school, internship, residency, fellowship and work, Christopher Leggat moved often  10 times in 10 years.

title: Art City
description: Images from art shows around New York City, including the Armory Show at Piers 92 and 94.

title: New York States Campaign Against Smoking
description: To the Editor:

title: A Bad Impression Outlasts a Bridges New Paint
description: The Hell Gate Bridge looks like hell.

title: Quandary Considered: Pregnant, When a Friend Is Struggling With Infertility
description: M., who has the happiest of quandaries  from her point of view  has a phone call to make.

title: Searching for Herself, Shes Odd and Familiar
description: Movies and literature do not lack for coming-of-age stories about young women in odd circumstances, but Attenberg, Athina Rachel Tsangaris new film, belongs in its own category. With an eccentric, beguiling blend of detachment and empathy  the camera sometimes lurking like a spy, sometimes trailing along like a shy, devoted friend  Ms. Tsangari observes the curious activities of Marina, a 23-year-old in the midst of an identity crisis that feels both highly idiosyncratic and weirdly familiar.

title: The Lease: A Contract With Muscle
description: YOU loved your apartment when you first moved in. But now your girlfriend has joined you, and the charming space the ad promised has started to feel intolerably cramped. Or the street noise, once a minor distraction, has become an infuriating obsession. Or youve landed your dream job  in Los Angeles.

title: Highest Court in Mississippi Upholds 9 Pardons
description: Bringing a definitive close to the legal controversy that has swarmed since former Gov. Haley Barbour of Mississippi gave pardons to nearly 200 felons in his last days in office, the Mississippi Supreme Court ruled on Thursday that the judicial branch did not have the power to void those pardons.

title: For Florida State Center, Military Was a Steadying Influence
description: Bernard James, a 6-foot-10 Florida State forward, truly could not walk down a sidewalk and chew gum at the same time when he was 12. He wore size 15 shoes, and his hands were the size of a catchers mitt at the end of scraggy arms, which added to his imbalance. He referred to his feet as clowns feet, and schoolmates referred to him as St. Bernard, as if he were a big goofy dog.

title: Silence Goes Beyond Golden; It Could Save Two Lives
description: Among the many lessons in A Thousand Words is how to manufacture a slick and generic Hollywood comedy-drama. In the simplicity of its premise it embodies the notion of high-concept entertainment. In its execution it demonstrates how technical efficiency can drain the life from a story.

title: Schools, Shops and Transit, in a Pretty Package
description: THE hot spot here seems to be the Mall at Short Hills, a posh center with 160 stores covering 1.3 million square feet. Off an exit ramp of State Route 24, it has a Bloomingdales, a Macys, a Neiman Marcus, a Nordstrom and a Saks Fifth Avenue, plus dozens of specialty shops  and, of course, valet parking.

title: Syrian Kurds Flee Into Iraqi Refugee Limbo
description: QAMISHLI, Iraq  Inside a muddy village named for a failed revolt against Syrian authorities, a history of flight and exile is repeating itself.

title: An Industrys Failure to Verify, After Trusting
description: As the financial crisis intensified in mid-2008, the largest of the monoline insurance companies that had guaranteed payments on complicated securities retained an investment bank to evaluate the risks it had taken on in a small part of its portfolio  a group of 15 collateralized debt obligations.

title: Molycorp, a Rare Earth Mining Firm, Is to Merge With a Processor, Neo Material
description: HONG KONG  One of the Wests two main rare earth metal mining companies announced on Friday that it was buying one of the worlds two main rare earth processing companies for $1.3 billion, the latest in a series of deals that are rapidly consolidating the industry.

title: What Is the Place of Unions Today?
description: To the Editor:

title: Immersed in Anger and Smothered by Loneliness
description: Thematically somber but visually luminous, Dissolution, the remarkable new work from the Israeli-American filmmaker Nina Menkes, explores a soul stained by blood and smothered by loneliness.

title: Boldface Buildings in the Cold Light of Now
description: AT the height of the condo building boom in Manhattan, when it seemed as if a shiny new building was being announced every week, developers took a page from the motion picture industry and seized on star power to sell their projects.

title: Trial Shows Benefit in Using Prostate Cancer Drug Early
description: Johnson & Johnson said Thursday that its new drug for prostate cancer was effective when used earlier during treatment than it is now, potentially broadening its use and also posing a competitive threat to a rival drug, Dendreons Provenge.

title: Setback on AIDS Drug Is Re-evaluated
description: The failure of a daily pill to protect healthy African women against AIDS may not have been the pills fault but the womens reluctance to take it, scientists at an important AIDS conference in Seattle were told this week.

title: The Perils of Piecemeal Intervention
description: SYRIAS rebels are in retreat, President Bashar al-Assads loyalist forces are laying waste to their former strongholds, and the death toll is mounting: the latest United Nations reports put it around 7,500. As the body count has increased, so, too, have calls for outside intervention. Its time for the West to step in  but only after honestly debating what it will take to stop the carnage.

title: A Dinner Date With the Obamas
description: President Obama and Michelle Obama shared dinner with three campaign supporters on Thursday, the third event in his Dinner With Barack contest and the first that included the first lady.

title: Anarchist Percussionists and a Belly as an Instrument
description: Should my colleagues Allan Kozinn and Anthony Tommasini, classical music critics both, take on this review? Theyd assess the efforts of a gang of anarchist percussionists out to thwart the establishment with their revolutionary piece Music for One City and Six Drummers. The musicians skullduggery, in four movements, sends them to a hospital where a patient with a resonant belly and his medical equipment become their instruments. But I dont think this bunch would care about reviews; theyre committed to their outsider status, as good outsiders are.

title: Hands Off the Heavens
description: OUTER space has become the next frontier for American national security and business. From space, we follow terrorists and intercept their communications, detect foreign military deployments, and monitor a proliferation of unconventional weapons. Our Global Positioning System gives us targeting and tactical advantages, spacecraft create image-rich maps, and satellites beam data around the world.

title: In a Park Fountain, All of Those Coins Add Up
description: One at a time, those coins people toss into the pink granite fountain at Bryant Park add up: penny, penny, nickel, quarter, euro.

title: Childrens Events
description: A DAY OF REFLECTION

title: Spare Times
description: TORN IN TWO: THE 150TH ANNIVERSARY OF THE CIVIL WAR (Tuesday; display continuing Friday through April 28) For an exhibition consisting largely of maps, pictures are worth a thousand words. This display at the Grolier Club, organized by the Norman B. Leventhal Map Center at the Boston Public Library, includes period maps, newspapers and other items related to the Civil War that tell the stories behind the conflict, from the tensions that led to it to the battles that defined it. (Included, above, is an 1864 Currier & Ives lithograph with Lincoln and the Confederate leader Jefferson Davis tugging on a map of the United States held by Gen. George B. McClellan, a Union Army general who unsuccessfully ran for president against Lincoln.) Other pieces include a map used by Lincoln to plot troop movements; the war itself led to a remapping of major battle areas. On Tuesday at 6 p.m. Ronald Grim, curator of the Leventhal Map Center, will talk about the significance of the maps; the talk, like the show, is free, but reservations are requested by e-mailing mbrennan@grolierclub.org, or calling (212) 838-6690. The exhibition can be seen Mondays through Saturdays from 10 a.m. to 5 p.m., 47 East 60th Street, Manhattan, grolierclub.org.; it will be on view at Fords Theater in Washington, beginning in December. Map-folding skills will not be tested. (Anne Mancuso)

title: Webers Future Uncertain After First-Round Loss by Illinois
description: INDIANAPOLIS  With the outside world talking about his vanishing job security, Bruce Weber showed his team a motivational video on the eve of what could have been his last game as coach at Illinois. Weber said the video showed a Carnegie Mellon professor, who had been dying of cancer, talking about his new outlook on life.

title: High School Star Is in a Hurry, Leaving Records Behind
description: NEWARK  One recent morning at St. Benedicts Prep, Edward Cheserek was asked how long it took him to get to a practice at Branch Brook Park, about a mile away.

title: Mastering Fish as an Edible Art Medium
description: Opens on Friday in Manhattan.

title: A Throwback Player, With a Wardrobe to Match
description: Marty Reisman wears vintage Borsalino fedoras because no one makes a good hat anymore.

title: The Trees Are All Right
description: In most of the American West, the trees are not the right height, which may frighten Mitt Romney, and some of them are so old as to challenge the biblical view of creation that Rick Santorum wants taught in schools.

title: Arrests Prompting Hard Look at Top Hockey Program
description: BOSTON  The students, trustees and employees of Boston University received an e-mail from Robert Brown, the universitys president, on Wednesday concerning the mens hockey team. He was not congratulating the Terriers on their 21-win season or wishing them luck in their opening game in the Hockey East playoffs Friday.

title: Amid Finger-Pointing, Hurricane Relief Lags
description: Nearly four years after Hurricanes Ike and Dolly wreaked havoc on the Texas coast, thousands of Texans are still waiting for housing assistance. The long-term disaster recovery effort financed by the federal government has made little headway. But where two state agencies faltered, another is stepping in.

title: A Smug Education?
description: THE Republican presidential candidate Rick Santorum recently set off a ruckus when he attacked Americas colleges as indoctrination mills from which God-fearing Americans should keep their distance. Calling President Obama a snob for urging all Americans to go to college, he joined a long tradition that runs from Andrew Carnegie, who more than a century ago described colleges as places that prepare students for life upon another planet, to Newt Gingrich, who has claimed that alumni donations are often used to subsidize bizarre and destructive visions of reality.

title: Israel: Soldier Is Stabbed and Fires Back
description: An Israeli soldier was stabbed in the neck on Thursday while trying to make an arrest in a West Bank village, the Israeli military reported. The soldier opened fire on his Palestinian assailants, killing one man and wounding another, the military said. It was not immediately clear whether the man who was killed had taken part in the knife attack. The soldier was part of a force that had gone to Yatta, south of Hebron, to rearrest a Palestinian man, Khaled Mahamra, who had been released from prison in the fall as part of an exchange for Gilad Shalit, the Israeli soldier who was held captive for five years in Gaza. Palestinian news reports said that the Palestinians were shot during clashes as they tried to prevent the arrest. The military said that Mr. Mahamra was suspected of transferring funds to establish a terrorist network in the West Bank.

title: Haunted Home Looks Great by Lantern Light
For Knicks, Distraction by Addition
description: The optics are troubling for any Knicks fan who has spent a moment poring over the standings or pondering the counterintuitive influence of Carmelo Anthony.

title: Lets Have a Baby and Look for Love Later
description: Like the girly sitcoms currently speckling the television schedule, Friends With Kids comes fully equipped with jokes about vaginal elasticity (in this case lack thereof) and other formerly unmentionable female concerns. As limiting in their way as the football-watching, belly-scratching preoccupations of the sitcom man of yore, these quips have become de rigueur in a certain kind of entertainment directed primarily at women, badges of progressiveness that often serve only to veil the retrograde themes lurking behind them.

title: Activist Investor Charts Plan to Revitalize Yahoo
description: Daniel S. Loeb is getting back into the activist arena.

title: Ignorance Is Strength
description: One way in which Americans have always been exceptional has been in our support for education. First we took the lead in universal primary education; then the high school movement made us the first nation to embrace widespread secondary education. And after World War II, public support, including the G.I. Bill and a huge expansion of public universities, helped large numbers of Americans to get college degrees.

title: With November in Mind, House Passes a Jobs Bill
description: WASHINGTON  The House overwhelmingly approved legislation on Thursday to ease small businesses access to investments and capital markets, a sign that the shadow of the November election is pressing Congress into action.

title: Here Comes the Brides Understudy
description: Ive gone man vegan, Katie (Kelly Macdonald) says early in The Decoy Bride, explaining that she has given up on ever finding love. They say after the first six years that you dont miss them anymore.

title: Couples Mutual Attraction and Mutual Disaster
description: Sacrificing clarity in favor of atmosphere, Apart watches the romantic spasms of a disturbed young couple bedeviled by muddled plotting and impenetrable lighting. Bathed in the bilious hue of a 7-Eleven parking lot at 3 a.m.  a look favored by all too many digital-camera wielders  almost all of the films remarkably static scenes reveal too little and confuse too much.

title: Iran Is Pressed on Access for Nuclear Inspectors
description: The six world powers that have agreed to resume negotiations with Iran over its disputed nuclear program issued a blunt request on Thursday that the Iranians allow international inspectors unfettered access, most notably to Parchin, a large restricted military complex that the inspectors suspect may house a testing chamber for explosives used in atomic weapons triggers.

title: Rising G.O.P. Star From Staten Island Draws on Political Gifts to Fend Off Critics
description: Working his way down the St. Patricks Day parade route on Staten Island last Sunday, Representative Michael G. Grimm stopped to talk to nearly every reveler. An aide in an Irish fishermans sweater proffered Mr. Grimms tiny Yorkie, Sebastian, for people to pet. Mr. Grimm stopped regularly to exchange brotherly greetings with fellow Marine veterans.

title: City Is Ordered to Provide Back Pay in Fire Department Bias Case
description: New York City must pay as much as $128 million in back wages to minority candidates who took the Fire Departments screening test but were never hired, according to a ruling by the federal judge who had deemed the test discriminatory.

title: Hey, Mets! I Just Cant Quit You.
description: In 2005, I wrote a column saying that maybe it was time to abandon the New York Mets and become a fan of the Washington Nationals. My reasoning was sound. We were raising our kids in Washington. We had Nats season tickets. We were acquiring Nats paraphernalia. It would be so easy to join the fold.

title: Perry Pledges to Finance Texas Womens Health Program
description: Responding to intensifying criticism about the Texas governments decision to exclude Planned Parenthood from a health care program for low-income women  a move that the federal government considers illegal  Gov. Rick Perry said at a news conference on Thursday that the state would use its own money to operate the program if Washington stops financing it.

title: Referee Steers Clear of A.C.C. Tournament
description: ATLANTA  When the referee Karl Hess called John Clougherty, the supervisor of officials for the Atlantic Coast Conference, and said he did not want to be a distraction at the tournament here this week and would not officiate, Clougherty tried to talk Hess out of his decision.

title: Google Remixes Old Campaigns, Adding a Dash of Digital Tools
description: GOOGLE is going all Marty McFly on Madison Avenue, sponsoring a back-to-the-future project that reimagines classic campaigns from the Mad Men age for modern sensibilities  and technologies.

title: Uncertainty at UConn
description: Connecticut has become the most fascinating team in college basketball in March. No program flashes its range of extremes, from winning the N.C.A.A. tournament last season to a program that may be spiraling toward oblivion this year.

title: Lottery Numbers
description: March 8, 2012

title: Spanish-Language TV Dramas Heat Up Miami
description: MIAMI  Blanca Soto moved to Los Angeles from Mexico to make a better life. After a decade of struggling there, she relocated to Miami where she works 10-hour days, six days a week.

title: Telling the Truth Like Crazy
description: One summer day in 2009, a woman walked into the police station house of the 81st Precinct, in Brooklyn, to report that her car had been stolen. She was well into her second day of trying to file a report, having already spoken to five or more officers in two precincts and was waiting, exasperated, for a lieutenant to turn up as he had promised.

title: State Cuts Squeezing the Elderly Poor and Their Doctors
description: After Dr. Javier Saenz completed his family-medicine residency in 1985, he returned home to the Rio Grande Valley to open a practice in the impoverished town of La Joya.

title: What Do I Know About Poverty?
description: Whats real-world experience worth? Does it matter?

title: M.L.S. in Midst of Stadium Games in N.Y.C.
description: For nearly all of his 13 years as the commissioner of Major League Soccer, Don Garber has evangelized in all corners of North America for what he likes to call soccer-specific stadiums. And in nearly ever city from Toronto to Houston, and hamlets in between like Chester, Pa., and Frisco, Tex., the drill was basically the same: award a franchise, then get a deal done for a stadium  eventually  by cajoling local governments to foot at least part of the bill.

title: At Doral, a Career Reflected in a Round
description: DORAL, Fla.  If not for the throng of Spanish-speaking fans who threw their voices behind Sergio Garca on Thursday, he would have been the forgotten player of this W.G.C.-Cadillac Championship.

title: New Apps Connect to Friends Nearby
description: Smartphones have become indispensable for some people to find nearby cool new places for a bite or a drink.

title: Vacant Queens House Used for Sex Crimes, Police Say
description: In January, with a team of contractors renovating his three-family home in Ozone Park, Queens, Tsung Chen came by to inspect the work. What he saw surprised him: the locks had been changed.

title: A Not-Quite Confirmation of a Memo Approving Killing
description: WASHINGTON  For months, the Obama administration has refused to confirm or deny the existence of a Justice Department memorandum that approved the targeted killing of a United States citizen, Anwar al-Awlaki, who died in a drone strike in Yemen last September.

title: Cathy Horyn's Runway Report
description: Cathy Horyn reports on the trends from Paris Fashion Week, including collections from Comme des Garcons and Chanel.

title: Edith Pearlman Wins National Book Critics Award
description: Edith Pearlman won the National Book Critics Circle Award for fiction at the Tishman Auditorium of the New School on Thursday for Binocular Vision, (Lookout Books), a story collection that has elicited praise from reviewers for its delicate and wry character portraits.

title: Yankees Hope Relievers Foot Injury Is Just a Sprain
description: TAMPA, Fla.  The Yankees have enjoyed a smooth first few weeks of spring training, but the relative calm of camp was given a jolt Thursday when one of the teams best pitchers sustained a foot injury in a household accident.

title: Sexual Violence and the Military
description: The rate of sexual assaults on American women serving in the military remains intolerably high. While an estimated 17 percent of women in the general population become victims at some point in their lives, a 2006 study of female veterans financed by the Department of Veterans Affairs estimated that between 23 percent and 33 percent of uniformed women had been assaulted. Those estimates are borne out in other surveys, and a recent Pentagon report on sexual assaults at the service academies found that in the 2010-11 academic year, cadets and midshipmen were involved in 65 reported assaults.

title: Trucking Company Workers Are Indicted in Fraud Scheme
description: Five trucking company employees used an elaborate scheme to steal more than $5 million in union benefit money, according to an indictment unsealed on Thursday in Federal District Court in Brooklyn.

title: We Thought They Were Worried About Costs
description: As part of their broader campaign to repeal health care reform, House Republicans are determined to kill off an independent board that is supposed to help rein in federal spending on Medicare.

title: Second-Seeded Marquette Sent Home by Louisville
description: After its best finish in seven seasons in the Big East, second-seeded Marquette opened the conference tournament in disappointing fashion, making an abrupt exit Thursday night, falling to seventh-seeded Louisville, 84-71, in the quarterfinals.

title: The N.Y.P.D. and Muslims
description: Mayor Michael Bloomberg of New York, Commissioner Raymond Kelly of the New York Police Department and their supporters have reacted with defensiveness and hostility to the disclosure of constitutionally suspect surveillance of law-abiding Muslims in New York City, Long Island, New Jersey and beyond.

title: The G-String Brigade Faces a Destitute Age
description: The bravery-in-theater award this year goes to ... no, not one of those flying masked men from Spider-Man: Turn Off the Dark. The winners are Tina Shepard and Jack Wetherall for fearlessly recreating their 1983 performances in the Talking Bands Hot Lunch Apostles at La MaMa.

title: Wide Open Spaces
description: FRIDAYS PUZZLE  Wow. Thats a lot of white space.

title: Florida Prep School Copes With Shock and Loss
description: JACKSONVILLE, Fla.  Stretching out along the banks of the St. Johns River, the Episcopal School of Jacksonville is where the citys elite send their children for academic success steeped in spirituality.

title: Typhoon
description: There is a boat in my barn. I put it there last October, yet it surprises me every time I go down to get a bale of hay. A previous owner called it the Judy of Gloucester  still painted on the stern  but its manufacturer called it a Typhoon, a name I like to think was taken from the novel by Joseph Conrad. You can pack a lot of plans and illusions into a dirt-cheap, 40-year-old sailboat only 19 feet long in a barn 140 miles from the sea.

title: Pelfrey Has Rough Outing in Spring Training Debut
description: PORT ST. LUCIE, Fla.  Normally, a rough spring training start by a veteran pitcher would not be worth a second thought.

title: Police Officer Guilty of Falsifying Information
description: A New York City police officer was convicted on Thursday of lying under oath and filing false information to obtain a search warrant, the second conviction in what prosecutors described as a scheme to cover up illegal searches of vehicles.

title: E-Book Undercutting
description: Book publishers are frustrated with Amazons strategy of pricing e-books low.

title: As Stars Rally for Candidate, Rival Objects
description: BOSTON  Elizabeth Warren may be running for the United States Senate in Massachusetts, but her campaign is getting deep support 3,000 miles away in California, where the other day, Cher was speaking glowingly of Ms. Warrens candidacy.

title: Weekend Miser
description: The alternative punk-pop group Betty has been together a long time. While most garage acts dont last more than a year or two, this all-girl, now all-woman group is celebrating its 25th anniversary. And with a series of $10 performances at 92YTribeca, the Miser can afford to celebrate with them.

title: Devils and Kovalchuk Show Signs of Surging
description: NEWARK  The game was stopped early in the third period Thursday so a crew could use shovels to clear the ice of hundreds of baseball caps. Ilya Kovalchuk had his second hat trick in less than a month, and the Devils had fired a warning shot to the N.H.L.

title: Loss to Minnesota Is a Big Blow to Northwestern
description: INDIANAPOLIS  Northwestern guard Reggie Hearn sat in the corner of the locker room sniffling back tears. A few seats away, Alex Marcotullio stared blankly. And Drew Crawford told reporters no, the pressure to become the first team in program history to make the N.C.A.A. tournament had not gotten to them.

title: Online, a Distant Conflict Soars to Topic No. 1
description: KAMPALA, Uganda  Jason Russell said he never knew he was driving into a war zone. At 24, he had just graduated from the University of Southern California after studying film, he said, and was out looking for a story to tell.

title: Music Is the Stuff That Runs the Jalopy
description: The Jalopy was conceived as a space where artists could collaborate and make money through teaching, as well as performing.

title: Jubilation Amid Banjos and Harmonies
description: LIKE some soulful machine stalled at the mouth of the Battery Tunnel, the Jalopy brings a joyful ruckus to the edge of Red Hook, Brooklyn. In rowdy roots-music style, this theater, bar and clubhouse conservatory dares visitors to be carried, shouting and singing, toward jubilation.

title: Illegal Immigrants Get Scholarships While Aid Bill Idles
description: Among all the numbers that populate Nataly Lopezs life  including phone digits, addresses, pass codes and friends ages  there is one that she never forgets: the cost of a semesters tuition at Baruch College, where she is a sophomore.

title: Court Blocks Parts of Law on Migrants in Alabama
description: A federal appeals court has blocked two parts of a tough new Alabama immigration law.

title: Hacker, Informant and Party Boy of the Projects
description: In his Lower East Side apartment, the nights were racket-filled and without end. Neighbors lived with the pounding music and the sound of a pit bull being chased around the living room. The revelry sent scores of calls to the citys complaint line.

title: Benedict Freedman, Author of Mrs. Mike, Dies at 92
description: Benedict Freedman, whose first novel, Mrs. Mike  based on the true story of a young womans life in the Canadian wilderness at the turn of the century  was a sensation after it was published in 1947 and inspired a Hollywood feature film, died on Feb. 24 at his home in Corte Madera, Calif. He was 92.

title: Biron Is Flat as Rangers Find Reason to Worry
description: OTTAWA  When a team has as big a lead in its conference as the Rangers have had for the last several weeks in the East, there is a tendency to manufacture crises just to keep things interesting. The latest involves the recent performance of Martin Biron, the backup goalie.

title: Corrections: March 9
description: FRONT PAGE

title: Jimmy Ellis Dies at 74; Lead Singer in Dance Band Trammps
description: Jimmy Ellis, the soulful lead singer of the Trammps, whose 1970s hit Disco Inferno was immortalized in the film Saturday Night Fever, died on Thursday in Rock Hill, S.C. He was 74.

title: Should Israel Accept a Nuclear Ban?
GTT
description: Our quirky, discerning picks for the most interesting things to do around the state this week.

title: An Update on New York Redistricting
description: New York is now among the last states in the nation to tackle the redistricting required as a result of the 2010 census. And the urgency is growing: the states Congressional primary is scheduled for June 26, and its legislative primary for Sept. 11.

title: Now Latino and Black Voters Fight for Map Power in Redistricting
description: Ross Ramsey, the managing editor of The Texas Tribune, writes a regular column for the Tribune.

title: A Professor, a Thriller, Not a Microchip in Sight
description: Before she was an author, Ellen Ullmanworked in the late 1970s as a programmer during the formative years of Silicon Valley, writing code to help insurance companies and their agents communicate electronically. This may seem like a surprising move for someone who graduated from Cornell University with a degree in English, but it has led to a singular career.

title: In a City With Record Housing Prices, Nowhere to Go but Up
description: Scott James is a columnist for The Bay Citizen.

title: East Bay Oil Exports Have Become Huge Business
description: The Bay Area is known for the Golden Gate Bridge, technology start-ups and California cuisine, among other things. Oil does not usually make the list.

title: On Idol, a Standout Performance from Whitney Houstons Songbook
description: Jeremy Rosado, the 19-year-old receptionist with a sweet voice from Valrico, Fla., was booted off American Idol on Thursday after a week in which female contestants were asked to sing Whitney Houston songs and the male contestants had to perform songs from Stevie Wonders catalog.

title: Controversy Tests Bold Freeway Project
description: This spring, construction crews will demolish Doyle Drive, the elevated freeway between San Francisco and the Golden Gate Bridge.

title: Bank of America Reaches Deal on Housing
description: Bank of America will provide deeper-than-anticipated principal reductions for about 200,000 homeowners under newly-disclosed terms of last months foreclosure settlement with state and federal authorities.

title: Pondering a Threat, but Taking Panic Off the Table
description: JERUSALEM  As Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu landed back in Israel this week after his fateful visit to Washington and days of newspaper headlines about the prospects of a military confrontation with Iran, the Israelis were gearing up for a party.

title: Unesco Backs Dictators Divisive Prize
description: PARIS  After almost two years of debate and hand-wringing, the executive board of Unesco approved a scientific award on Thursday sponsored by a repressive West African dictator, despite the pleadings of Western nations and a finding by the organizations lawyers that the prize would violate internal bylaws.

title: The Early Word: Plan of Action
description: In Todays Times:

title: New Republic Gets an Owner Steeped in New Media
description: The newest owner of The New Republic magazine is Chris Hughes, a new-media guru who co-founded Facebook and helped to run the online organizing machine for Barack Obamas presidential campaign.

title: Word of the Day | agape
description: agape \-gap also -gap\ adjective

title: NYT Front Page for 03/09/2012
description: NYT Front Page for 03/09/2012

title: In China, Inflation Eases as Growth Slows
description: BEIJING  The Chinese government announced on Friday a significant drop in inflation, which gives leaders more leeway in managing the economy and continuing with a policy of loosening lending or cutting interest rates to help sustain economic growth.

title: Next Time, Greece May Need New Tactics
description: LONDON

title: How the Kony Video Went Viral
description: Since three young filmmakers first traveled to Uganda in 2003, they have been determined to use film and activism to help stop the rebel leader Joseph Konys brutal tactics and the use of children as soldiers. But it was not until this week that their nonprofit organization,  Invisible Children, helped make Mr. Kony, the leader of the Lords Resistance Army, a household name.

title: Are Men Useless? (Government Says Yes)
description: Are men useless, at least when it comes to caring for a family?

title: White House Works to Shape Debate Over Health Law
description: WASHINGTON  The White House has begun an aggressive campaign to use approaching Supreme Court arguments on the new health care law as a moment to build support for the measure seen as President Obamas signature legislative achievement, hoping to shape public opinion on an issue at the center of the battle for the White House and Congress.

title: U.S. and Afghanistan Agree on Prisoner Transfer as Part of Long-Term Agreement
description: KABUL, Afghanistan  Seeking to break an impasse on a broader strategic arrangement, the United States agreed Friday to greatly accelerate its transfer of imprisoned insurgents to Afghan government control, but will retain a veto over which ones can be released, American officials said.

title: News Quiz | March 9, 2012
description: See what you know about the news below. To prepare, you might scan the articles or summaries in todays paper.

title: March 9, 1862 | The Monitor and Merrimac Face Off in Battle of Hampton Roads
description: On March 9, 1862, during the Civil War, the Monitor and the Virginia (also known as the Merrimac) clashed to a draw at Hampton Roads, Va., in the first battle between two ironclad warships.

title: Going Viral Against Vice
description: Kony 2012, a 30-minute video about the Ugandan war criminal Joseph Kony, has become an unlikely viral hit. In the hope of seeing the leader of the Lords Resistance Army captured before the end of the year, it calls on viewers to support the U.S. Special Forces troops currently helping with the hunt for Kony in Central Africa.

title: Test Yourself | English, March 9, 2012
description: This question was written by Shannon Doyne. It comes from the article Aging Stars in a New Role: TV Pitchman.

title: Preschool Cavities
description: WHEN did you last have a cavity?

title: Since the Tsunami, Fewer Tears
description: A little less than a year ago, the photographer Hiroko Masuike was living with a group of Japanese tsunami and earthquake survivors who had found shelter inside an ancient Buddhist temple after their community was destroyed.

title: How Well Do You Think Standardized Tests Measure Your Abilities?
description: Standardized tests, like the SAT, the ACT or other national, international or state exams that measure all students at a certain educational level, are increasingly being used to judge how countries, states, schools and even individual teachers are doing. What standardized tests have you taken in your school career? How have your teachers prepared you for them? How well do you do on those kinds of tests in general? How well do you think the ones you have taken have measured your intelligence and abilities? Why?

title: The Politics of Pandering in India
description: Defeat is usually an orphan, Dan Morrison wrote for Latitude blog in The New York Times. But the election debacle of Congress, Indias ruling party, in Uttar Pradesh on Tuesday has a clear patrimony: pandering to the states 36 million Muslims, he writes.

title: U.N. Relief Chief Tells of Horrific Destruction in Syria and Official Resistance to Aid Plan
description: BEIRUT, Lebanon  The top United Nations relief official offered a somber view on Friday of the aid crisis caused by the uprising in Syria, saying she had witnessed horrific destruction during her two-day visit and had encountered resistance by the government to accept her emergency aid proposal, which would give United Nations relief workers unrestricted access to stricken areas.

title: Q&A: Repairing Personal Folders in Microsoft Outlook
description: Q. Windows keeps giving me a message about an error in my Outlook file and that I should use an Inbox Repair Tool to fix it. Is this for real, and if so, what do I do?

title: To Close a New Class Divide, Author Suggests Higher Education Reforms
description: Charles Murray, the author of Coming Apart, which addresses the divide between the professional and working classes in white America, has outlined a few ways to narrow the gap. In his Op-Ed piece for The New York Times, he suggested four steps that might weaken the isolation of at least the children of the new upper class. Among them:

title: Scouting the Draft: Clemsons Brandon Thompson
description: The featured prospect of todays scouting report will probably be higher on my board than anyone elses. Clemson defensive tackle Brandon Thompson is a very athletic lineman who will be a run-stuffer from the start, yet he still possesses the skills needed to turn into a dominant pass-rusher.

title: SXSW Interactive 2012: Saddle Up and Geek Out
description: Every year, thousands of entrepreneurs, venture capitalists and techies migrate to Austin, Tex., for South by Southwest Interactive, a whirlwind week of discussions, panels, parties and breakfast tacos and the latest innovations from the start-up world and tech industry.

title: The Merits of a Corporate Tax Overhaul
description: Laura DAndrea Tyson is a professor at the Haas School of Business at the University of California, Berkeley, and served as chairwoman of the Council of Economic Advisers under President Bill Clinton.

title: Fantasy Focus: One Mans N.L.-Only Roster
description: I traveled to Phoenix last weekend to participate in L.A.B.R., a prominent industry league that has been around for 19 years. I was in the N.L.-only league, which is extremely deep, with 13 participants and 10 pitching slots to fill. Here are the full results, and heres my roster:

title: A Conversation With: Chief Minister D.V. Sadananda Gowda
description: D.V. Sadananda Gowda became the chief minister of Karnataka state, of which Bangalore is the capital, last summer amid a $3.5 billion scandal involving the illegal mining of iron ore. He recently visited Mumbai to meet investors and corporate executives.

title: Tax Cheats Become Italys Public Enemy
description: ROME  When five officials from Italys internal revenue service entered the Dal Duca restaurant in Romes trendy Trastevere neighborhood one night two weeks ago, they were not there to eat.

title: Radioheads Runaway Guitarist
description: On the morning of Sept. 12, 2011, a white Land Rover with a dragon on the door ferried the Radiohead guitarist Jonny Greenwood, his longtime recording engineer Graeme Stewart and Radioheads co-manager Chris Hufford to Alvernia Studios, about an hour outside Krakow, Poland. For several years, when hes not recording or touring with Radiohead, Greenwood has pursued a second career as a composer of orchestral music, and this day he was cutting new versions of two of his classical pieces, Popcorn Superhet Receiver (17 minutes, inspired in part by the sound of radio static) and 48 Responses to Polymorphia, both of which are unabashed tributes to the early-60s output of the Polish composer Krzysztof Penderecki, whose compositions abandoned melody in favor of dense, dissonant tone clusters. Greenwoods recordings will be featured on an album due out in March on Nonesuch Records, along with two new performances of Pendereckis work conducted by Penderecki himself.

title: Playing the Customer Service Rating Game
description: I have a good friend who recently had to do one of the most painful and stressful things we have to do in life. She had to make funeral arrangements for her husband, who had died unexpectedly. At the end of an unpleasant meeting at a funeral home where several attempts were made to up-sell her on funeral-related items, the undertakers concluded with this request: You are going to be getting a survey from J.D. Power and Associates, and its important that we get a good rating.

title: Ziggo Plans I.P.O. to Raise $983 Million
description: LONDON The Dutch cable company Ziggo said on Friday that it was planning to raise up to 774 million euros ($983 million) through an initial public offering, the largest listing in Europe this year.

title: Europe Doesnt Like Sarkozy Either  And Few Other Leaders
description: LONDON  A political opinion poll with a difference was released on Friday, offering some intriguing insights into the popularity of Europes top national leaders.

title: Barclays Awards $10.3 Million to C.E.O.
description: LONDON  Barclays said on Friday that it had awarded its chief executive, Robert E. Diamond Jr., 6.3 million ($10.3 million) in compensation for last year, a reduction in pay as profit at the British bank slipped.

title: London Stock Exchange to Buy Stake in Clearinghouse
