description: Here are some interesting items that the tech reporters and editors of The New York Times found on the Web on Tuesday. There are more here.

title: The Checklist | Top 10 Polyvore Pages
description: Last month, T introduced a shopping page called The Checklist and in partnership with Polyvore.com, the social fashion site that lets users become virtual editors, asked readers to style the storys star pieces into outfits. Nearly 2,000 people participated in the challenge (1,986, to be exact), submitting a terrific range of looks from the 77 items on tap. Among the most frequently used were the Converse sneakers and the structured handlebar Prada bag (although no one recommended wearing these things together). One user created two pants-driven layouts that made our list (tinker23, from Turkey, apparently loves pointy-toed pumps and hoop earrings  so easy to get behind this spring). Another user, catv41, proposed a mustard/navy color combination anchored by black accessories that I would wear tomorrow if I could. These looks  and all that didnt make the cut  were a delight to discover. I look forward to more incredible outfit-making with even more fashion must-haves next month.

title: The Line Drawn by the 82 Bordeaux
description: This year is the 30th anniversary of the 1982 vintage in Bordeaux, possibly the most significant wine vintage ever. Well, maybe thats an exaggeration, but certainly the most significant of the last 50 years, and arguably of the 20th century.

title: H.P. to Merge Business Units
description: SAN FRANCISCO  Hewlett-Packard said Wednesday it will merge its personal computer and printing divisions in an effort to cut costs, improve its designs and become more efficient.

title: Pictures of the Day: Egypt and Elsewhere
description: Photographs from Egypt, Iraq, France and Syria.

title: Updates From the Illinois Primary
description: The Times is covering Tuesdays primary and providing live updates and analysis. Follow along on the live dashboard and on Twitter (@thecaucus), get real-time results and dig deeper into the numbers with FiveThirtyEight.

title: Raising Multilingual Children (or Not)
description: Marcus Mabry, editor at large at The International Herald Tribune, is raising his twins to be trilingual, an act of parental aggression that Im having a hard time not taking personally. Its not even that either he, or his partner, speaks another language as a native. Its just that hes trying to do whats best for them, and so he speaks to them only in French, while their nanny speaks to them in Mandarin, and his partner speaks English.

title: Must-Have Gadgets for the Kitchen? Think Again
description: EVERY kitchen has one. The ingenious asparagus peeler. The automatic paper-towel dispenser. The whiz-bang electric pepper grinder.

title: What Kitchen Tools Have You Bought and Barely Used?
description: In this weeks Dining section, William Grimes has rounded up tales of kitchen-gadget woe  home cooks and even pros who enthusiastically bought a milk frother or a salmon poacher only to let it languish, unused, in a closet or drawer. Do you have kitchen equipment that you bought and then barely touched? Neglected tools that are hidden away in the closet or the basement, or even kept in plain view on the countertop, a monument to ambitions unrealized?

title: Upending Notions of Gender Identity
description: MONTCLAIR, N.J.  The clothes make the man, as that old saying goes. But they also unmake, obfuscate and misdirect  not just the man but also the woman, and the entire spectrum of gender and sexuality between and beyond those two poles.

title: Newest Knick in the Spotlight: The Bench
description: In his six, mostly middling seasons at the helm of the Atlanta Hawks, Mike Woodson wasnt exactly known as a coach prone to freelancing or experimentation. Famous more for his isolation-friendly offensive system  a steadfast reliance on Joe Johnson helped earn it the description Iso Joe  and point guard leashes that bordered on choke collars, Woodson leaned heavily on his stars, and rarely delved very deeply into his bench.

title: Printed Ballots Were Too Wide for Scanners in Some Illinois Precincts
description: Some of the printed ballots in 25 of 110 Illinois jurisdictions were slightly too wide to fit into the optical scanners and will have to be trimmed or hand counted, officials said Tuesday afternoon.

title: Woman Suspected in Midtown Trash-Can Fires Turns Out to Be a Man
description: The police search for a middle-aged woman suspected of starting 15 trash-can fires in Midtown on Monday ended Tuesday with the arrest of a man, not a woman, who has been living on the streets outside Pennsylvania Station, the Fire Department said.

title: Turning Giggles and Snickers Into a Hoot
description: Its hard to imagine anything funnier on a New York stage right now than a man struggling to stuff his body through a clothes hanger.

title: Dutch Church Is Accused of Castrating Young Men
description: BRUSSELS  A young man in the care of the Roman Catholic Church in the Netherlands was surgically castrated decades ago after complaining about sexual abuse, according to new evidence that only adds to the scandal engulfing the church there.

title: An Early Start to Allergy Season
description: A mild winter that ended with a flourish of warm weather was a welcome surprise for many Americans. But for the 25 to 35 percent of people who suffer from hay fever, the early arrival of warm weather meant an unusually early start to allergy season.

title: From a Forgotten Composer, A Familiar Romantic Story
description: It is often clear why works that arts organizations might describe as forgotten gems have gathered dust. But Franz Schmidts two-act opera Notre Dame proved a worthy find during a vibrant concert performance by the American Symphony Orchestra, conducted by Leon Botstein, on Sunday afternoon at Carnegie Hall.

title: My Big Italian Dream Party
description: EVER since my first dinner party, when I lived in a tiny flat in London and struggled over a menu of shrimp Creole while making sure I had eight forks for the eight people squeezing around my budget Ikea dining slab, few things have made me happier than sitting around a table with a hand-selected group of friends.

title: Corn Chips, Garnished and Sauced. Loco? Right.
description: Escondido, Calif.

title: Gracious Dining, Alive and Well at NoMad
description: For the past few years, the Breslin and the John Dory Oyster Bar in the Ace Hotel have made a good case for heading to the largely commercial wedge of Midtown Manhattan between Madison Square and Herald Square. A new restaurant called the NoMad, set to open on Monday in the hotel and the neighborhood of the same name, clinches the argument. The areas cobbled-together nickname (it means North of Madison Square Park) might even stick.

title: A Tour of Paintings, in Verse
description: The concept of the museum audio guide, with an expert nattering on in your ear, telling you what to think and why, has always seemed particularly loathsome. But if more such guides contained ekphrastic poetry, the idea might be a little more appealing.

title: Broadway Musicals Hang on for Payoffs Beyond Weekly Gross
description: Why are the musicals Sister Act, Priscilla Queen of the Desert and Godspell still running on Broadway?

title: In North Brooklyn, Another Gay Bar Closes
description: One Wednesday in February at Veronicas, the boss lined up shot glasses on the bar, opened a bottle of tequila and passed it down the line to her 14 employees.

title: A Conversation With the Mad Men Cast and Creator
description: If youre a fan of the AMC series Mad Men, you still have five more excruciating days to wait for that shows long awaited fifth-season premiere on Sunday. In the meantime, you can tide yourself by watching a recording of a a Times Talk event featuring that shows cast members and creator. The conversation occurred on Tuesday evening with the Mad Men show runner Matthew Weiner and stars Jon Hamm, January Jones, John Slattery, Christina Hendricks, Vincent Kartheiser and Jared Harris, and was moderated by New York Times culture reporter Dave Itzkoff.

title: Off the Menu
description: Opening

title: Looking Back to the 1800s for a Properly Bitter Cocktail
description: In todays ramped-up bar culture, the sweetness of Curaao or Triple Sec, the orange liqueurs used in many classic cocktails, did not satisfy David Wondrich, the drinks historian and expert. So he worked with Alexandre Gabriel, the president of Cognac Ferrand in France, to develop a drier bitter orange Curaao, like the kind made back in the 1800s.

title: Pastry Straight to Your Door
description: Clarice Lam, the executive chef of the Chocolate Room in Park Slope and Cobble Hill, Brooklyn, has introduced her own oven-to-door pastry service, with delivery throughout New York City. Called the Baking Bean (her nickname is Bean, for her runway-ready figure), it takes orders by phone and online for an array of cakes, pies, tarts, cookies, croissants, chocolate bark and other candies, none of which duplicate what Ms. Lam makes for the Chocolate Room. The baked goods are high quality and handsome. Though seasonality is a core value, Ms. Lam said, she does stretch the boundaries, with several strawberry pies and tarts on her introductory lineup. She is also offering a dessert club, with delivery of a different indulgence every week.

title: U.S. Stores Learn How to Ship to Foreign Shoppers
description: Macys has long marketed itself as a shopping destination for visitors to the United States. It offers a savings card with a 10 percent discount for foreign shoppers, custom programs for tour groups and travel agents, and a tourism Web site that lists shopping events and recommended hotels near Macys flagship stores.

title: Romneys Slightly Exaggerated Advertising Edge
description: If Rick Santorum loses in Illinois on Tuesday, you might hear him or one of his advisers lamenting how badly he was outspent on the airwaves. There are ways to make the discrepancy seem very large.

title: A Taste of the New
description: Images from some of the films appearing in the New Directors/New Films series.

title: Dining Calendar
description: Benefit Dinners With Chefs

title: How Spring Break for President Obamas Daughter Became News
description: We can confirm that Malia Obama is safe and was never in danger.

title: Discovering Great Films Scaled Small
description: Street Vendor Cinema, a short film from Brazil that will be shown at the New Directors/New Films festival, spends some time with an energetic auteur practicing his art  and trying to hustle a little cash  in a busy So Paulo shopping area.

title: The Electric-Guitar Man and a Brooklyn Rock Quintet in Full Sonic Bloom
description: You can pick up some earplugs there on the left, an usher said, greeting audience members as they filed into Merkin Concert Hall on Saturday evening. Where Rhys Chatham, a composer, guitarist and trumpeter long associated with the outer reaches of New Yorks downtown music scene, goes, warnings about excessive volume will surely follow. This is, after all, a composer who wrote a symphony for 400 electric guitars.

title: Taking the Temperature of the New iPad
description: Is Apples new iPad too hot to handle?

title: Africas Daughters, With Stories To Share
description: George Balanchine once dismissed the notion of abstraction in dance, arguing that as soon as you place a man and a woman onstage, you have a story.

title: Its Own Supporting Line: Another Festival for the Warm and Generous Cello
description: LOS ANGELES  Strike up a conversation with one of the cellists playing in the New York subways on Wednesday to celebrate Bachs 327th birthday, and you may make a friend for life.

title: PGA Tour Announces Changes to Qualifying and Schedule
description: ORLANDO, Fla.  As much as Brett Wetterich hated the thought of going to the PGA Tours qualifying school, he loved the opportunity.

title: Captive in Cramped Box, and Cellphone Is No Use
description: Because Jeremy Reins (Stephen Dorff), the protagonist of Brake, finds himself confined in the trunk of a moving car with no memory of how he got there, the movie is already being compared to the 2010 thriller Buried. In that one, Ryan Reynolds played a nonmilitary truck driver in Iraq who awakens bound and gagged in a pine box under the desert sand. Jeremy is a Secret Service agent taken captive in New York in an elaborate terrorist plot to shut down Washington and assassinate the president.

title: Seeking an Elixir of Youth
description: THE Kids Dont Stand a Chance, one of the lighter, more ornery songs from the debut album of the neo-prep champions Vampire Weekend, filled the room at the newly reopened Rothmans as I happened to be fingering a pair of teal shorts by Ted Baker ($125) that were begging for boat shoes and a boat deck.

title: Alaas Streamlined Autumn
description: Does Azzedine Alaa have a sixth sense for knowing when poor old fashion is baroque?

title: Indie, Sure, but With a Disco Beat
description: First Wave, the final song on Itals debut album, Hive Mind (Planet Mu), clocks in at more than 10 minutes, one of three on this five-song album that do. It starts out clinical and tough, but its not long before it gives in to bliss: what sound like digitized strings begin to swell, buttressed by rollicking drums that provide a proper four-on-the-floor exuberance, carrying things forward.

title: TV Digs Will Harm Patrimony, Scholars Say
description: Ric Savage is accustomed to wrestling, but for most of his career it was against guys named the Junkyard Dog and Skull Von Krush.

title: Restoration Comedy, Of a Sort
description: Sometimes its best not to think too hard and just embrace the idiocy. If youre able to bring that mind-set to Bent, a screwy comedy NBC introduces on Wednesday night, youll have a pretty good time.

title: The Snails of War
description: The electric snail is here. Theres an electric cockroach too.

title: Viterra Deal Gives Glencore Influence in Global Wheat Trade
description: OTTAWA  Glencore International, the Swiss commodities trader, entered the North American agriculture market on Tuesday with a widely anticipated deal to acquire Viterra, the largest Canadian grain company, for $6.2 billion.

title: Justices Back Mayo Clinic Argument on Patents
description: WASHINGTON  The Supreme Court unanimously ruled on Tuesday that medical tests that rely on correlations between drug dosages and treatment are not eligible for patent protection.

title: Join Us for an N.C.A.A. Video Hangout
description: After a couple of days of madness in the form of Manning, Tebow and the Wilpons, its time to turn the sports conversation back to the N.C.A.A. tournament and the Round of 16, which begins Thursday night. The Timess college basketball experts  Pete Thamel, Greg Bishop and Connor Ennis  will be holding a Google-plus video hangout Thursday at 3:30 p.m. EDT to discuss the first weekend and look ahead to this weeks games. And wed like to invite selected readers to join them in the conversation. If you are available for 30 minutes beginning at that time and would like to hang out with us, use the comment area below to tell us what kind of a college basketball fan you are, who you root for, and what you think about the tournament so far. Please also include a link to your Google-plus profile page and note that to participate in the hangout you will need a Google-plus profile and a video camera-enabled computer.

title: Crime, Punishment and the Rutgers Case
description: To the Editor:

title: How We Went Nonnuclear: The Kazakh Envoys View
description: To the Editor:

title: A Call to Re-examine the Military Justice System
description: To the Editor:

title: Eventbrite Moves Into Mobile Payments With a Credit Card Reader
description: Eventbrite, a ticketing start-up based in San Francisco, is making a leap into the hardware business.

title: Small Donors Fuel Santorums $9 Million Month
description: Rick Santorum raised $9 million in February and spent $7.8 million as the Republican presidential contest narrowed to a battle with Mitt Romney for the nomination, according to documents filed with the Federal Election Commission Tuesday night.

title: FlipShare Videos Get a Reprieve
description: When Cisco Systems said it would stop making its popular Flip video cameras, it also announced that it would eventually shut down its FlipShare video sharing and storage service. Last May it put a 30-day expiration date on videos and photos stored there. Anything more than 30 days old would be erased.

title: Inside, Your Hooptie Sounds Like a Lamborghini
description: Anyone who has ever pretended to turn a bicycle into a motorcycle by putting playing cards in the spokes will want to take a look at the XLR8 app.

title: City Seeks to Become a New Internet Address
description: Businesses have long jockeyed for an address on Fifth Avenue  and the city is now hoping it can create a similar phenomenon online.

title: New Headphones From 50 Cent
description: Seeking to become the next hip-hop artist turned audiophile, the rapper 50 Cent recently unveiled a line of high-end headphones and accessories from SMS Audio.

title: Q&A: Visiting LinkedIn Profiles Unannounced
description: Q.

title: Justices Limit Suits Filed Over Family Leave Act Violations
description: WASHINGTON  By a 5-to-4 vote that split along ideological lines, the Supreme Court on Tuesday ruled that state workers may not sue their employers for money for violating a part of the federal Family and Medical Leave Act.

title: Live Coverage: the Illinois Primary
description: Welcome to FiveThirtyEights live blog of the Republican primary in Illinois. Well have updates throughout the night with exit poll results, data-driven analysis, historical context and the final verdict of Illinois voters.

title: For Indias Dominant Party, Electoral Setback Stirs Self-Doubt
description: NEW DELHI  After the policy paralysis and political acrimony of last year, Indias coalition national government had hoped this year would be different. Yet already the government is troubled by infighting among coalition allies. And the Indian National Congress Party, which leads the coalition, has been further weakened by lackluster showings in recent state elections.

title: Comparing Party Budget Plans
description: How the 2013 budget plan laid out by House Republicans on Tuesday compares with President Obamas proposal released last month.

title: At 49, Moyer Chases History
description: SCOTTSDALE, Ariz.  The oldest pitcher in major league history was Satchel Paige, who pitched three innings for the Kansas City Athletics on Sept. 25, 1965, when he was 59 years old. It is a nice distinction for Paige, a Hall of Famer whose best years were spent in the Negro leagues. But it was a stunt devised by the maverick owner Charles O. Finley.

title: Saudi Arabia May Include Women on Its Olympic Team
description: The Summer Olympics in London could be a watershed event for international sports as every participating nation is expected to field at least one female athlete, including three Muslim countries  Saudi Arabia, Qatar and Brunei  that have previously sent only male competitors.

title: As Israels Military Pursues Enemies on Twitter, Some Citizens Reach Out on Facebook
description: Updated | Wednesday | 5:28 p.m. Last week, as rockets were fired into and out of Gaza, the Israeli military also moved to take the high ground on what an official described as the second battlefield of social networking sites, by beginning a campaign to discredit Palestinian bloggers who had misidentified images on Twitter.

title: Software Licenses Help Oracle Beat Estimates
description: Oracle, the biggest maker of database software, exceeded analysts estimates for quarterly profit and new license sales on Tuesday, a sign of buoyant demand for programs that help companies organize data and run operations.

title: Getting Ad Agencies Into Reality TV
description: CONTESTANTS on reality competition shows perform tasks like seeking spouses, racing around the world, eating bugs, losing weight, living in houses rigged with cameras and working for Donald J. Trump. A new series is arriving with a contest all its own: wooing advertisers to say yes to campaigns.

title: In Louisiana, Ad Spending Heats Up
description: Mitt Romney had a significant spending advantage in Illinois as he and a super PAC supporting him outspent Rick Santorum and his allies by more than seven to one.

title: Inequality Undermines Democracy
description: Americans have never been too worried about the income gap. The gap between the rich and the rest has been much wider in the United States than in other developed nations for decades. Still, polls show we are much less concerned about it than people in those other nations are.

title: Kony Is Not the Problem
description: IN northern Uganda, the dry season is used to burn bushes; the fire drives snakes and other predators away. On the Ugandan side of the border with South Sudan, below a mountainous ridge along the Nile, is a village called Odrupele by locals. It is a place teeming with snakes.

title: California: Sheriff Wont Quit
description: Mayor Edwin M. Lee of San Francisco said on Tuesday that he would seek the removal of Sheriff Ross Mirkarimi, who was sentenced to counseling and probation on Monday after pleading guilty in a domestic violence case. Sheriff Mirkarimi said he did not intend to resign. Mr. Lee said Sheriff Mirkarimis behavior during an incident on Dec. 31, in which he grabbed and bruised his wifes arm, fell below the standards of decency and faith expected of elected officials. The mayor appointed Vicki Hennessy interim sheriff while the case is investigated by the San Francisco Ethics Commission.

title: Bill Meant to Help Start-Ups Hits Roadblocks in the Senate
description: WASHINGTON  The Senate postponed action Tuesday on legislation to ease the ability of small and start-up companies to raise money from investors after Democrats failed in two tries to make changes to the bill.

title: Reports Show Adelsons Enduring Support of Gingrich
description: Sheldon Adelson, the Las Vegas casino mogul, and his family gave another $5.5 million to the super PAC backing Mr. Gingrich in February, almost single-handedly financing his continuing bid for the White House.

title: Casting Begins for Tebow, the Sequel
description: Now that Peyton Manning has signed with the Broncos, it is time to speculate on where Tim Tebow will land after the Broncos inevitably trade him. Tebow speculation is similar to Manning speculation: no outcome is too far-fetched, and every team has something to gain  and perhaps a little to lose  by acquiring the incredibly popular, athletic, erratic-armed lefty. Here is a breakdown on what a Tebow trade could mean for each N.F.L. team.

title: Russia: President Urges Military to Defeat U.S. Missile Shield
description: President Dmitri A. Medvedev told top Russian military officials on Tuesday that they must be prepared to beat the United States missile defense system at all phases of its development, even as talks continue on modifying the system to assuage Russias concerns. We are not closing the door on dialogue, he said. But we need to prepare ourselves.

title: Analyzing the Illinois Exit Polls
description: The Timess polling unit is combing through the exit polls of voters leaving the Illinois primaries for insights. This post will be updated as we crunch numbers throughout the night.

title: In Barclays Centers Shadow, Awaiting Whats Next
description: Triangle Sports has occupied the same three-cornered site on Flatbush Avenue in Brooklyn since 1916. But in January, the stores owners put the 1,570-square-foot parcel on the market.

title: Longshoremens Union Remains Defiant Over Diversity Plan
description: Putting an end to discrimination in hiring on the docks around New York Harbor is proving to be nearly as hard as rooting out corruption.

title: Former Underboss Offers Primer on Mob Life
description: It was summer 1999, and a meeting between the leadership of the Bonanno and Colombo crime families was under way in an apartment off Third Avenue, in Fort Hamilton, Brooklyn.

title: A Quandary for Banks in Britain
description: LONDON  Quietly sipping coffee, 16 owners of small British businesses sat in front of their laptops listening to Ed Goodman, a business trainer, explain how best to buy Google ads and create a profile on Facebook to promote their companies.

title: Air Canada Supplier Says It Will Liquidate
description: OTTAWA  After rejecting an offer of emergency financing from Air Canada, Aveos Fleet Performance said on Tuesday that it was liquidating its aircraft maintenance business and laying off all of its 2,600 employees.

title: Mayoral Hopefuls All Make Time for Teachers Union Leader
description: Michael Mulgrew, the president of the New York teachers union, has not been the most popular figure at City Hall under Mayor Michael R. Bloomberg. They have been at odds over almost everything, like Mr. Bloombergs push to close underperforming schools and his insistence on putting charter schools in district school buildings.

title: At 49, Jamie Moyer Is Slower, but Not Stopping
description: SCOTTSDALE, Ariz.  On Sept. 13, 1932, in the first game of a doubleheader at Ebbets Field, a Brooklyn Dodgers pitcher named Jack Quinn threw five shutout innings to beat the St. Louis Cardinals. Quinn was 49 years 74 days old, the oldest pitcher to win a major league game.

title: Suspect in Staten Island Killing Is Held in Illinois
description: A suspect wanted in the fatal stabbing of a bridegroom-to-be on Staten Island Saturday was captured on Tuesday in Illinois by law enforcement agents who had tracked him to an aunts home there, the authorities said.

title: Generic Drugs Proving Resistant to Damage Suits
description: Debbie Schork, a deli worker at a supermarket in Indiana, had to have her hand amputated after an emergency room nurse injected her with an anti-nausea drug, causing gangrene. She sued the manufacturer named in the hospitals records for failing to warn about the risks of injecting it. Her case was quietly thrown out of court last fall.

title: Oil Under Our Noses
description: Durham, N.C.

title: Is a Calorie a Calorie?
description: I was looking forward to Why Calories Count, the new book by Marion Nestle and Malden Nesheim. I figured gaining an advanced education in calories might allow me to better understand diet and weight gain. These two are not faddists but clear thinkers: actual scientists. But of course there is more to weight gain than the calorie.

title: Bernanke, as Professor, Tries to Buff Feds Image
description: WASHINGTON  The Federal Reserves chairman, Ben S. Bernanke, spent the better part of an hour Tuesday afternoon carefully explaining to a class of college students why the United States abandoned the gold standard in the 1930s.

title: U.S. Exempts Japan and 10 Other Countries From Sanctions Over Iran Oil
description: WASHINGTON  The Obama administration on Tuesday exempted Japan and 10 European nations from the prospect of biting sanctions intended to punish countries that continue to buy oil from Iran, but it left open the fate of other major importers, including China, India and South Korea.

title: Broncos Soft-Sell Approach Helped Manning Make His Hard Decision
description: ENGLEWOOD, Colo.  John Fox and John Elway were discussing various personnel issues Monday morning, doing their best to take their minds off trying to figure out what decision perhaps the most prominent free agent in N.F.L. history might make.

title: The Careless House Budget
description: As he rolled out his 2013 budget on Tuesday, Paul Ryan, the House Budget Committee chairman, correctly said that he and his fellow Republicans were offering the country a choice of two very clear futures. The one he outlined in his plan could hardly be more bleak.

title: Romney Is Victor by Wide Margin in Illinois Vote
description: CHICAGO  Mitt Romney swept to victory in the Illinois Republican primary on Tuesday, using the full force of his campaign and an argument that he has the best chance of defeating President Obama to overcome doubts among the more conservative voters at the heart of his party.

title: Super PACs Supply Millions as G.O.P. Race Drains Field
description: The Republican presidential candidates are running low on campaign cash as expensive primaries in states like Maryland, New York and Pennsylvania loom, leaving them increasingly reliant on a small group of supporters funneling millions of dollars in unlimited contributions into super PACs.

title: Ex-Marine From Indiana Takes Deal on Gun Charge
description: A former Marine whose arrest at the Empire State Building on a gun-possession charge last September prompted outrage among supporters of gun rights pleaded guilty on Tuesday to a misdemeanor weapons-possession charge.

title: In Suns Glow, Its Still Business, but Not as Usual
description: It is a rhetorical question heard again and again in stuffy, sun-deprived offices on a beautiful day in spring. Man, wouldnt it be great to have our meeting outside today? Employees laugh, pause wistfully and then get down to business  inside. Well, most do.

title: Wrong Ways to Fight Assad
description: President Bashar al-Assad is so willing to kill his people that he could hold on to power for years. The forces opposing him have won support from the international community starting the moment they began standing up to Mr. Assad, but they can ill afford self-inflicted wounds. Some elements of the opposition now risk jeopardizing their cause and further stoking dangerous sectarian animosities if they adopt brutal and illegal tactics.

title: Jets Said to Show Interest in Making Room for Tebow
description: When General Manager Mike Tannenbaum hinted in the off-season at a shakeup among the Jets quarterbacks, it was presumed that his biggest move would be adding a younger and more credible backup to Mark Sanchez. That player might not wind up being Drew Stanton, who was signed last week, but Tim Tebow, the polarizing cross-cultural phenomenon made expendable when Denver signed Peyton Manning.

title: Pennsylvania Rises in Importance for Santorum After Loss in Illinois
description: GETTYSBURG, Pa.  It may seem an odd choice, holding a rally here in Pennsylvania to celebrate the results of the Republican presidential primary in Illinois.

title: Cruel and Unusual Punishment for 14-Year-Olds
description: The Supreme Court in 2005 justly banned the death penalty for minors convicted of murder. In 2010, it banned life without parole for youths convicted of crimes other than murder. In two cases argued before the court on Tuesday, the justices should take the next step and ban life without parole for youths convicted of murder.

title: Lottery Numbers
description: March 20, 2012

title: The Fairest of Them All?
description: A look back at some of the film and television adaptations of fairy tales.

title: Release Alan Gross
description: When he was arrested in Havana in late 2009, Alan Gross, a subcontractor for the United States Agency for International Development, was helping Cubas Jewish community get better access to the Internet. A Cuban court last year found him guilty of participating in a subversive project of the U.S. government that aimed to destroy the revolution through the use of communications systems out of the control of authorities, and sentenced him to 15 years in prison. He has languished in a military hospital ever since. His lawyer says he has lost more than 100 pounds and suffers from severe arthritis. As an act of mercy, the Cuban government should release Mr. Gross.

title: Want Loyal Customers? Giving Them Hope Helps
description: It is not a reach to say that over the last couple of years Fred Wilpon has made considerable efforts to convince news media folks and fans alike that he is a man of impeccable character. Consistent in his talking points, Wilpon, the Mets owner, has said time and again that beyond his consuming dedication to his team, he is a regular guy  as privileged guys go  and hardly the Madoff-enriched monster that Irving H. Picard was making him out to be.

title: Killings Could Stall Elections Nationalist Turn
description: PARIS  The Jewish school in Toulouse that was terrorized by an unknown gunman on a motorbike will reopen on Wednesday as a statement of courage and continuity. The hundreds of mourners who filled the stone courtyard of the palatial redbrick town hall there on Tuesday morning, joining others across the country in a moment of silence, will return grimly to their daily lives.

title: Supreme Court Revisits Issue of Harsh Sentences for Juveniles
description: WASHINGTON  At a pair of Supreme Court arguments on Tuesday, the justices returned to the question of what the Constitution has to say about harsh sentences imposed on juvenile offenders.

title: Ohio Universities Resume a Rivalry, 50 Years Later
description: The wait was almost unbearable. Before top-ranked Ohio State could take on No. 2 Cincinnati in the 1961 N.C.A.A. championship game in Kansas City, Mo., the consolation game had to finish.

title: In Speech, Romney Assails Obama for Lack of Leadership
description: Mitt Romney claimed an extraordinary victory in Illinois on Tuesday night and quickly attacked President Obama for a lack of leadership during the past several years.

title: Paul D. Taylor
description: Mr. Taylor, 56, is the president of Stonehill & Taylor, an architecture and interior design firm based in New York. The company specializes in the hospitality industry, and its projects have included the Ace and Crosby Street hotels, along with the Plaza Hotel before its recent sale. It is currently working on the NoMad Hotel in Manhattan and a new extended-stay brand for Hyatt.

title: Heart of Darkness
description: Washington

title: Pettitte Looks Sharp in His Official Return
description: TAMPA, Fla.  Andy Pettitte thought it was going to be a lot more awkward. What he felt instead, in his first official day back with the Yankees, was like I never left.

title: Hunger Games Brings Out Legions of Fans, and Inflatable Mattresses
description: Thankyouthankyouthankyou. Quick pause for breath. Ohmygodohmygodohmygod.

title: Save a Mind, Draft a Body
Alderson Sees the Mets Future, and Counsels Patience
description: PORT ST. LUCIE, Fla.  Fred Wilpon said Monday morning that his next order of business, with his legal issues now on the way to being settled, would be to travel to Florida to return the Mets to prominence.

title: Long Live the Queen
description: WEDNESDAYS PUZZLE  All hail THE QUEEN OF SOUL, ARETHA FRANKLIN!

title: For Syrians, No Easy Exit From Conflict
description: BEIRUT, Lebanon  Syria is locked in an ominous and violent stalemate: With overwhelming firepower and a willingness to kill, President Bashar al-Assad could hold on to power for months or even years, keeping the opposition from controlling any territory and denying it breathing space to develop a coherent, effective leadership, according to analysts, diplomats and Syrians involved in the uprising.

title: Gingrich Says He Will Stay in Race and Stop Romney
description: Newt Gingrich said Tuesday night that phase one for himself and Rick Santorum in the days ahead must be stopping Mitt Romney from getting enough delegates to claim the Republican presidential nomination.

title: Illinois Primary | Mitt Romney
description: Mitt Romney won in Illinois and used his victory speech to focus to the economy. Courtesy of MSNBC.

title: Ulu Grosbard, 83, Broadway and Film Director, Dies
description: Ulu Grosbard, a director whose affinity for naturalistic drama shaped critical successes like the original Broadway production of David Mamets American Buffalo and the film version of John Gregory Dunnes novel True Confessions, has died in Manhattan. He was 83.

title: Right to Work Bills Face Uncertain Future in an Election Year
description: ST. PAUL  For the first time in more than three decades, Minnesota Republicans are basking in majorities in both chambers of the state Legislature, so on matters that need no signature from the Democratic governor, they can do as they please. Priority No. 1, to some: put a measure on the ballot that would allow workers to avoid paying fees to unions they choose not to join. Critics view the proposed measure, which would amend the state Constitution, as a plain attack on unions.

title: Coptic Popes Death Adds to Fears in Egypts Time of Transition
description: CAIRO  A tearful crowd of thousands that included members of Egypts emerging political class attended a funeral service Tuesday for Pope Shenouda III, who spent four decades as the popular and charismatic leader of the countrys Coptic Orthodox Church.

title: U.S. Announces Olympic Qualifying Roster
description: United States Under-23 Coach Caleb Porter named his final 20-man roster for the Olympic qualifying tournament on Tuesday night. Fourteen of the players Porter chose play for M.L.S. clubs, and more than a dozen have competed in a World Cup at the youth level. Several  Brek Shea, Juan Agudelo, Freddy Adu  have played prominent roles with the senior national team.

title: Illinois Primary | Rick Santorum
description: Rick Santorum spoke to supporters in Gettysburg, Pa., after finishing second in Illinois.

title: Studies Link Daily Doses of Aspirin to Reduced Risk of Cancer
description: Taking aspirin every day may significantly reduce the risk of many cancers and prevent tumors from spreading, according to two new studies published on Tuesday.

title: Knicks Increase Intensity, and Winning Streak Hits Four
description: The smile is back on Carmelo Anthonys face, broad and beaming and wholly subject to interpretation. There is happiness there, to be sure, but also likely relief and perhaps some satisfaction.

title: As Reactors Age, the Money to Close Them Lags
description: WASHINGTON  The operators of 20 of the nations aging nuclear reactors, including some whose licenses expire soon, have not saved nearly enough money for prompt and proper dismantling. If it turns out that they must close, the owners intend to let them sit like industrial relics for 20 to 60 years or even longer while interest accrues in the reactors retirement accounts.

title: A Cheap Drug Is Found to Save Bleeding Victims
description: For months, a simple generic drug has been saving lives on Americas battlefields by slowing the bleeding of even gravely wounded soldiers.

title: Romney Wins Illinois Primary
description: Mitt Romney swept to victory in the Illinois Republican primary on Tuesday.

title: Despite Illinois Loss, Santorum Rallies Forces at Gettysburg
description: GETTYSBURG, Pa.  Rick Santorum delivered his own Gettysburg address twice Tuesday night after he lost the Illinois primary in a blowout to Mitt Romney.

title: New Zealand Reeling from Marmageddon
description: HONG KONG  Marmite is either vile or its black gold. A person on Twitter said it was ample proof of evils existence. Its Facebook page has 780,000 followers, although somebody on there said it tasted foul, like sugary truck grease.

title: Mistakes Were Made
description: Mitt Romney has good reason to be exasperated with the way his slow progress to the Republican nomination has been covered in the press. Again and again, hes won supposedly-decisive primary victories, only to have the press turn around and insist that actually, its the next big primary that is the crucial one, the make-or-break moment, the contest that could throw the whole race into chaos. First Florida was going to be decisive, then Michigan, then Ohio. Romney won all three, but the goal posts kept moving, and suddenly it was Illinois that threatened to cast his nomination into doubt.

title: Romney and Santorum: Illinois Primary Speeches
description: Mitt Romney and Rick Santorum spoke after polls closed in Illinois.

title: Mexico: Quake Rattles Country, but No Major Damage
description: A strong earthquake shook a large swath of central and southern Mexico on Tuesday, swaying buildings in Mexico City and sending office workers scurrying for cover but causing no major damage or injuries, the authorities said. The epicenter of the 7.8 magnitude quake was near the border of Oaxaca and Guerrero States, about 200 miles south of the capital. A pedestrian bridge in Mexico City collapsed on a small bus, but there were no reported casualties. The White House said President Obamas 13-year-old daughter Malia, who was on vacation in Oaxaca with classmates, was safe.

title: Santorum Campaign Takes New Tack on Gingrich
description: GETTYSBURG, Pa.  The Santorum campaign appears to be taking a slightly new tack on Newt Gingrichs continued presence in the race.

title: Reactors Facing Suspended Animation
description: Twenty operating nuclear power reactors across the nation lack sufficient funds for their decommissioning.

title: Corrections: March 21
description: FRONT PAGE

title: Close G.O.P. Primary in House Race; Jackson Survives Challenge to Defend Seat
description: Representative Adam Kinzinger, a freshman Republican, narrowly defeated Representative Donald Manzullo, who has served in the House for two decades, on Tuesday in the only primary between two sitting congressmen in Illinois and one of the most closely watched Congressional primaries in the nation.

title: The Closer: Time for Willis to Move On
description: At some point, being left-handed and having been named to two All-Star teams will no longer be enough to get Dontrelle Willis another chance. But it does not appear he has reached that point yet.

title: Lowdown Hudson Blues Festival Announces Lineup
description: Buddy Guy and Neko Case will be the headliners at the second annual Lowdown Hudson Blues Festival, which will be held July 11 and 12 in a plaza outside the World Financial Center in Lower Manhattan, organizers said. Buddy Guy, who is 74, is considered one of the most influential blues guitarists of modern times, having influenced everyone from Stevie Ray Vaughn to Jimi Hendrix. Other acts on the bill include Charles Bradley, the Brooklyn born R&B singer, and John Mayall, the elder statesman of British blues whose 1960s band was a launching pad for guitarists like Eric Clapton and Mick Taylor. The festival is free to the public and is presented by Brookfield Office Properties, which owns the World Financial Center. The concerts will run from 6 p.m. to 9:30 p.m.

title: Making the Case for Running Shoes
description: For the past few years, proponents of barefoot running have argued that modern athletic shoes compromise natural running form. But now a first-of-its-kind study suggests that, in the right circumstances, running shoes make running physiologically easier than going barefoot.

title: NYT Front Page for 03/21/2012
description: NYT Front Page for 03/21/2012

title: Word of the Day | omnipotent
description: omnipotent \m-ni-p-tnt\ adjective

title: Mediator Assigned in Dispute Over 33 Schools
Campaigning in Illinois
description: The contest in Illinois largely came down to a battle between Mitt Romney, who leads in delegates, and Rick Santorum, and in recent days the two campaigned furiously across the state.

title: For Indias Dominant Party, Electoral Setback Stirs Self-Doubt
description: After the policy paralysis and political acrimony of last year, Indias coalition national government had hoped this year would be different, Jim Yardley writes in The New York Times. Instead, things have gotten worse.

title: Both Sides Declare Victory in Bumpy Race for a Brooklyn Senate Seat
description: Wackiness turned to nastiness and back again in the short but bitter special election in South Brooklyn to replace a state senator who had pleaded guilty to corruption charges. But the biggest twist of the race was its outcome  or lack thereof when election night ended.

title: Brunei to Send Its First Female Athlete to the Olympics
description: HONG KONG  The International Olympic Committee banned South Africa from the Olympics for nearly 30 years, until 1992, because of the repugnant official policy of apartheid that kept black athletes from competing. Nevertheless, the I.O.C. has continued to allow three nations that discriminate against female athletes to continue to participate in the Games.

title: Veteran Crew Sets Imaginative Course
description: At times I wondered if North End Grill was trying to look dull on purpose, Pete Wells writes about Mumbai-born Floyd Cardozs newest restaurant in The New York Times.

title: Suspect in France Remains in Standoff With Police
description: TOULOUSE, France  A 23-year-old Frenchman of Algerian descent claimed responsibility on Wednesday for the methodical killings of four men and three children in this region over the past 10 days, officials said, after barricading himself in a small apartment building in Toulouse surrounded by hundreds of police officers.

title: News Quiz | March 21, 2012
description: See what you know about the news below. To prepare, you might scan the articles or summaries on todays front page.Good luck!

title: The Rising Death Toll in Syria
description: A calendar of the estimated number of deaths in the country each day since the beginning of the uprising.

title: Has Poverty Really Dropped in India?
description: Remember when the public was outraged at the idea that the poverty line should be 32 rupees, or 63 cents, a day in urban areas?

title: March 21, 1960 | South African Police Kill 69 Black Protesters in Sharpeville Massacre
description: On March 21, 1960, South African police officers opened fire on a crowd of black protesters who had surrounded a police station in Sharpeville, killing 69 people.

title: Test Yourself | Math, March 21, 2012
description: Test your math skills with this question created by Scott Matthews at Math for America from the article Budget Cuts May Threaten City Programs for Children.

title: The Death of Trayvon Martin
description: WHO was Trayvon Martin?WHO is George Zimmerman?

title: Fighting Returns to Areas Syria Had Declared Secure
description: BEIRUT, Lebanon  The Syrian militarys widening struggle against insurgents, even in places it had declared secure, again flared into deadly violence on Wednesday, as forces carried out a daylong bombardment in the city of Homs and deployed tanks and helicopters to rout rebels in clashes just outside the capital, antigovernment activists reported.

title: Photographing the World, Longing for Home
description: Ed Kashis new book Witness Number 8: Photojournalisms (Nazraeli Press 2012) is a collection of images, diary entries and letters to his wife, Julie Winokur. Mr. Kashi spoke about the book with James Estrin this month at the National Press Photographers Associations Northern Short Course in Fairfax, Va. Their conversation has been edited.

title: How Productive and Organized Are You?
description: Are you overwhelmed, with too many things to get to every day? How organized are you about your homework and the other tasks you have to perform? Are you distracted by technology, even while it sometimes helps you work more quickly? What systems do you have to accomplish your goals? What organizational tips would you give to others? Read what David Allen, author of Getting Things Done, says about how to focus and meet your goals, then tell us about your own experiences.

title: Rappers Welcome 2 Releases: An Albums and a Colleagues
description: There have been two Odd Future sagas unfolding over the last year and a half. In full public view this Los Angeles hip-hop collective has become an unlikely mini-juggernaut of the post-record age, creating a significant touring and merchandise business with only the Internet behind it  not radio or video  and redefining narrow ideas about the hip-hop underground.

title: Happier, Perhaps, to Attend a State University Instead of an Ivy League School
description: When I first started the application process, almost every day somebody would ask me if I was applying to Cornell University. It seemed to be the logical choice, with its top-ranked animal science program and veterinary school. I guess people just assumed that with my grades and ACT score, I would be shooting for an Ivy League school.

title: Marital Status and the Recession
description: Casey B. Mulligan is an economics professor at the University of Chicago.

title: Fantasy Focus: An N.F.B.C. Satellite League
description: Im excited to be back in the N.F.B.C. Main Event fold this season. Ill be drafting in the second Main Event weekend in Las Vegas on March 31. To help get ready for that, I participated Monday night in a Satellite event that essentially lays out the same as the main, at least in format. Its a 15-team mixed league with 30 roster spots (14 hitters, nine pitchers and seven reserves), with no trades allowed.

title: The Early Word: Split Focus
description: In Todays Times:Illinois primary voters decided on Tuesday that Mitt Romney had a better chance than other Republican candidates of beating President Obama in November, Jeff Zeleny and Jim Rutenberg wrote. But with his rivals showing no signs of stepping aside as the contest bounds to the next battleground, Louisiana, Mr. Romney cannot afford to turn his full focus to Mr. Obama for at least two months, they write.

title: Hines Ward Retires, Starting Hall of Fame Debate
description: Wide receiver Hines Ward announced his retirement on Tuesday

title: North Korea Warns It Will Not Tolerate Criticism at Nuclear Forum
description: SEOUL, South Korea  As global leaders prepared to travel to Seoul for a nuclear security summit meeting, North Korea warned on Wednesday that any criticism of its nuclear weapons program would be considered a declaration of war.

title: Should Jets Trade for Tebow?
description: The Jets helped start Tebowmania, allowing him to score a game-winning touchdown in November. Now, with the show about to close in Denver, is he headed to Broadway? (If this were a play, Jets fans, would it be a comedy? A tragedy?)

title: Tip of the Week: Going from Gmail to Google Docs
description: Gmail users who cut and paste e-mail messages from the Gmail Web site into text documents for printing may want to try out the optional Create a Document feature that lets you quickly create a Google Doc from a message.

title: Mark Leyner, World-Champion Satirist, Returns to Reclaim His Crown
description: There is a clip online of the Charlie Rose show from 1996, in which Rose invited three young novelists to talk about the future of American fiction, and this clip is often  and thanks to the Internet, may forever be  cited by anyone writing the history of Mark Leyner. Thats because Roses panel comprised David Foster Wallace, promoting Infinite Jest; a young and anxious-looking Jonathan Franzen, the author, at that time, of Strong Motion; and Leyner, the most intense, and in a certain sense, significant young prose writer in America.

title: Jungleland
description: We have snakes, Mary Brock said. Long, thick snakes. Kingsnakes, rattlesnakes.

title: From Young Adult Book Fans to Wizards of Change
description: This week, Suzanne Collinss The Hunger Games hits the big screen. As the latest wildly popular young adult (Y.A.) novel becomes a film franchise, its not just box office dollars that will be captured, but potentially nascent citizens. At least thats the goal of the social campaign called Hunger Is Not a Game which aims to connect fans to the global food justice movement.

title: The Micro-Multinational: Getting Started in Foreign Markets
description: Even though TerraCycle is a small business with just under $20 million in revenue and just more than 100 employees, we are operating in more than 21 countries and we have plans to open in five more in the coming months  all with local staff, operations, bank accounts, incorporations and headaches. All in all, about 35 percent of our annual revenue comes from outside the United States, and our foreign business is growing faster than our domestic business.

title: Convicted Fund Manager Ordered to Pay Morgan Stanley $10.2 Million
description: A federal judge has ordered Joseph F. Skowron, a onetime star hedge fund manager now serving jail time for insider trading, to pay $10.2 million to his former employer, Morgan Stanley.

title: Losing a Precious Sliver of East River Sky
description: The men of the Fulton Fish Market along South Street did not suffer outsiders gladly. In the early 1980s, however, they warmed to a newcomer from Brooklyn named Barbara Mensch. She was a photographer. She had just moved into an old salting house a block away on Water Street. They let her see the living market in its predawn hours and capture their words and faces: a loader named Philly, a retailer named Heschy, a journeyman named Sweet Pea and a fillet man named Vinny the Bone.

title: Daily Report: Shake-Up at Hewlett-Packard
description: 10:11 a.m. | Updated with official announcement.

title: A Hunger Artist
description: DHAKA, Bangladesh  On Monday, in a display of rank opportunism, the celebrity anticorruption campaigner Anna Hazare jumped onto the bandwagon of a leading Indian environmentalist who is on the 42nd day of a hunger strike to protect the Ganges River.

title: Kidnapped British Woman Is Freed in Somalia
description: LONDON  A British tourist seized by Somali raiders from a secluded, upmarket resort on the Kenyan coast more than six months ago in an attack that claimed her husbands life was set free on Wednesday, ending a gripping drama that had helped fuel Kenyas rationale for invading southern Somalia.

title: Repairing the Damage at Indias National Archives
description: When he took charge of the National Archives of India in May 2010, Mushirul Hasan inherited a rudderless institution. The job of director general had been vacant for several years, and past directors had been bureaucrats. Mr. Hasan became the first scholar in 30 years to oversee an institution that contained a dazzling array of material from the Mughal, British and post-independence periods of Indian history.

title: The Better to Entertain You With, My Dear
description: Fairy tales can come true, the old song goes; it can happen to you, apparently, if youre young at heart. Whether one believes this hopeful sentiment, and regardless of the age of ones internal organs, theres no doubt that fairy tales have for the past couple of years  and into the foreseeable future  been coming pretty regularly to screens both big and small, achieving, you could say, at least the kind of quasi-truth that movies and television can concoct.

title: On Our Radar: Obamas Energy Blitz
description: After taking heat over gasoline prices, President Obama plans to visit a photovoltaic plant in Nevada and oil fields in New Mexico to underline his all of the above energy policy. [USA Today].

title: Tech Mahindra to Merge With Satyam
description: The Indian software company Tech Mahindra plans to merge with Mahindra Satyam in a $1 billion deal that will create a top player in technology services.

title: Morning Take-Out
description: Convicted Fund Manager Ordered to Pay Morgan Stanley $10.2 Million | A federal judge has ordered Joseph F. Skowron, the onetime star hedge fund manager serving jail time for insider trading, to pay $10.2 million to his former employer Morgan Stanley.

title: Reconciling Gandhi With Ambedkar
description: Mohandas K. Gandhi and B.R. Ambedkar were the men of the hour at Columbia University on Tuesday evening.

title: Flim-Flam Fever
description: Way back in 2010 I declared that Paul Ryan  who was rapidly becoming the darling of the fiscal responsibility crowd  was a fraud, a flim-flam man. Very Serious People were very seriously annoyed  theyd anointed him, and they didnt want to hear anything negative. They even gave him a Fiscy, an award for fiscal responsibility.

title: A New Companion for Doctor Who
description: When you are an essentially immortal being from another planet who can traverse space and time, you dont always pick up on changes great and small. But a momentous transition is coming for Doctor Who, the popular BBC science-fiction series (shown in the United States on BBC America) and the enigmatic Doctor of its title: in its upcoming season, the Doctor, played by Matt Smith, will get a new companion, to be played by Jenna-Louise Coleman, the shows producers said on Wednesday.

title: Hindu Victory Could Ease Indian Anger With Russia
description: LONDON  Russia extricated itself from an embarrassing spat with India on Wednesday when a provincial appeals court definitively rejected an attempt to ban a version of the Bhagavad Gita, one of Hinduisms most holy texts.

title: Political and Construction Hurdles for Malaysia Rare Earths Plant
description: KUALA LUMPUR, Malaysia  A controversial rare earth metal refinery in Malaysia encountered further obstacles this week, with the countrys political opposition refusing to participate in a parliamentary committee set up to investigate the safety of the plant and with hints that the refinery could face further construction delays.

description: From the editorial page

description: 4:42 p.m. | Updated

title: Why Has India Become the Worlds Top Arms Buyer?
description: India has replaced China as the worlds largest arms buyer, accounting for 10 percent of all arms purchases during the past five years, a Swedish research group said.

title: Deputy Succeeds Greek Finance Minister, Now Socialist Party Leader
description: ATHENS  The Greek government on Wednesday appointed the deputy finance minister to run the ministry temporarily after his boss resigned to lead the countrys Socialist party.

title: The Breakfast Meeting: Romney Must Slog On, and Studios Pursue 50 Shades
description: Mitt Romney won the Republican presidential primary in Illinois, beating his nearest opponent, Rick Santorum, by a sizable margin and adding substantially to his lead in delegates, Jim Rutenberg and Jeff Zeleny report. But if Mr. Romney thought the victory would give closure to the nomination fight, there was no such indication from his opponents who continue to be buoyed by super PACs.

description: In which we bring you motoring news from around the Web:

title: G.O.P. Nomination Becoming a One-Man Race
description: Mitt Romneys big victories in Illinois and Puerto Rico this week have expanded his lead over Rick Santorum by roughly 60 delegates, putting him ahead by 300 delegates over all.

title: Drug Giants Back New Venture Capital Fund
description: Johnson & Johnson and GlaxoSmithKline, the pharmaceutical giants, are teaming up with the venture capital firm Index Ventures on a 150 million euro ($199 million) fund targeted at the life sciences sector.

title: Morning Buzz, March 21: Ex-Felon Is Admitted to Practice Law
description: Good morning. It will be partly cloudy today with patches of fog, but, hey, highs will be in the low 70s.

title: Obama Tours Four States to Defend Energy Policy
description: BOULDER CITY, Nev.  Against the desert backdrop of the nations largest solar energy installation, President Obama on Wednesday assailed Republican critics of his clean energy policies as the flat earth society even as he sought to demonstrate his own support for domestic oil and gas production.

title: Soul Sisters
description: Most of us dont think of craft as holy. But it certainly was for cloistered nuns of the 17th through 19th centuries, who made reliquaries of rolled or quilled paper that was adorned with beads, shells, coral, fabric and other materials. Nearly 150 of these pieces will be on view in Quilling: Devotional Creations From Cloistered Orders at the Pinacoteca Giovanni e Marella Agnelli in Turin, Italy, from April 5 through Sept. 2. A number of works in the show are owned by the photographer Nan Goldin, who shot some of the pieces in the exhibition. In addition to the reliquaries, the exhibition also includes miniature 19th-century reconstructions of nuns cells, like the one at right, which are as spare as the reliquaries are ornate.

title: What Were Reading
description: The New York Daily News: George Clooney will find time in his busy schedule of making movies and political activism to start his own brand of tequila.  Robert Simonson

title: Beijing Switches Sides in the Race for Hong Kongs Chief Executive
description: HONG KONG  Chinas leaders have begun actively supporting a populist to become the next chief executive of Hong Kong in elections this Sunday, abandoning their previous private support for a wealthy civil servant whose candidacy has been plagued by scandals, local politicians and political analysts said Wednesday.

title: Occupy Protesters Are Arrested at Union Square Park
description: Several protesters were arrested early Wednesday after scores of Occupy Wall Street demonstrators converged on Union Square Park in Lower Manhattan, the authorities said.

title: Tours of Asias Wild Side
description: CULTURAL trendsetters have long flocked to Asia for a taste of exotic cuisine, bustling cities and mystical temples. Now adventurous travelers are turning to the regions wild frontiers for stunning natural landscapes and wildlife diversity.

title: Wolfish
description: The Big Bad Wolf is a villain of long standing. But in recent picture books, the famed brute has taken a real punishing  belittled, undermined and otherwise made fun of.

title: JPMorgan Adds Small Foothold in China
description: JPMorgan Chase is poised to move further into China, agreeing to buy a 19.9 percent stake in a small Chinese trust company, according to a person briefed on the matter.

title: Americans Split Over Whether Recovery Will Endure
description: Despite recent improvements in the economy, Americans are divided about whether the upswing will continue for the rest of this year, In fact, Americans are split about evenly, a new survey shows.

title: Responding to Village Voice on Sex Trafficking
description: After my Sunday column criticizing Village Voice Media for providing a forum for sex traffickers on its Backpage.com websites, Village Voice has struck back. It has just gone on line with an article What Nick Kristof got wrong:

title: Pickle Tongs, a Melon Baller and Other Gadget Regrets
description: We asked readers to tweet us with the kitchen tools they bought but then abandoned to the closet, drawer or basement, or to share their tales of woe in the comments section here. Below are just a few of the neglected tools in question, culled from Twitter; well post more as the day progresses. Share yours by tweeting us at @nytdining with the hashtag #gadgetregrets.

title: Can You Say Grand Central in One Image?
description: The light at the end of the tunnel may be an illuminated clock face.

title: Jeb Bush Backs Romney and Urges End to G.O.P. Battle
description: 11:20 a.m. | Updated CHICAGO  Former Gov. Jeb Bush of Florida said Wednesday that he was endorsing Mitt Romneys bid for the Republican presidential nomination, and urged his party to bring the divisive primary to a close and coalesce behind Mr. Romneys candidacy.

title: Noah Hawley Talks About His New Novel, The Good Father
description: In Noah Hawleys novel The Good Father, a young man named Daniel Allen is accused of assassinating a popular Democratic senator running for president. Daniels father, Paul, a doctor who was absent for much of his sons childhood, sets out to prove Daniels innocence while contemplating how he may have failed as a parent. I recently spoke with Mr. Hawley about the book via e-mail. Below are excerpts of the conversation.

title: Proud to Be a Mompreneur
description: Why cant mompreneurs wear the label with pride?

title: Look of The Moment | Jennifer Lawrence
description: The Look: Jewel Toned. A bombshell silhouette with a pleated skirt and plunging neckline  in prefalls favorite emerald green  would make Marilyn proud.

title: Afghan Officials Deny French Suspect Escaped Their Prison
description: KABUL, Afghanistan  Countering reports that the suspect in seven killings in France was one of hundreds of men who escaped from an Afghan prison in 2008, Afghan officials said Wednesday that a man by the same name had indeed escaped then, but was a citizen of Afghanistan, not France.

title: Delle Donne and Delaware Make Early Exit
description: The run of Delaware and its scoring star, Elena Delle Donne, in the N.C.A.A. tournament ended Tuesday night when No. 11 Kansas pulled off a big second-round upset. The Jayhawks defeated the No. 3-seeded Blue Hens, 70-64, in Little Rock, Ark.

title: Leading Off: Tebowmania Shipping Out
description: Now that the great Peyton Manning relocation saga has settled to an orange-hued conclusion, the real fun is about to happen. Thats because Manning arriving in Denver means an entire circus has to pick up and leave. Somewhat surprisingly, the Manning-signing part was quite calm and, well, very Peyton-like. The Tim Tebow-leaving part is what could start to feel like an N.F.L. reality show run amok. Because anything involving Tebow never quite seems to go like everyone thinks it will. It might be the mans true genius.

title: Azalea Pond, Central Park, 8:22 A.M.
Business Day Live | March 21, 2012
description: Why generic drugs are proving resistant to lawsuits; the political and economic cost of tariffs on Chinese solar panels; and looking at Google Plus as a business application.

title: A Cloud of Ones Own
description: As consumers use their mobile devices more and more to enjoy music, television and movies, they are facing a capacity crunch as those devices quickly fill up. For instance, I cant fit even half of my iTunes library on my iPhone, and my iPad is near capacity with movies and TV shows.

title: What Took Him So Long?
description: Mitt Romneys victory in Illinois seems likely to finally finally! silence the its still wide open/anything can happen chorus. In this weeks Campaign Stops column, I look at three failures that prevented the Romney campaign from silencing that chorus much sooner:

title: Memo to House Republican Leaders: Stay Out of It
description: To: Republican House LeadershipFrom: Club for GrowthRe: Arizona Republican House PrimarySubject: Mind Your Own Beeswax!

title: British Budget Adheres to Austerity While It Cuts the Top Tax Rate
description: LONDON  The British government said Wednesday that it was sticking to its austerity program as it presented a budget of tax and benefit changes intended to spur economic growth. The opposition criticized it as benefiting higher earners.

title: The Pacifist Red Wings? Lets Go to the Tape
description: Critics of fighting in the N.H.L. should have their day in the sun at Madison Square Garden on Wednesday night, where the Red Wings will face the Rangers in what should be an exciting, fast-paced game played by two highly skilled teams.

title: Report Cites Continued Problems for Workers at Abu Dhabi Cultural Site
description: Conditions for migrant workers on Saadiyat Island in Abu Dhabi  the site of future branches of the Louvre and Guggenheim museums  have improved, but problems continue, Human Rights Watch said in a progress report issued on Wednesday. Activists, artists and others have been monitoring the treatment of workers who are building this sprawling cultural center and resort in the Arabian Gulf, where a New York University campus, a performing arts center, golf courses and hotels are also being constructed.

title: Stone Links
description: A gathering of recent philosophy-related links.

title: IFC to Unlock New Episodes of R. Kellys Trapped in the Closet
description: In the space of a blog post we couldnt possibly summarize the story to date of R. Kellys musical serial Trapped in the Closet, the continuing narrative of a homewrecker named Sylvester; Cathy, the married woman with whom he had an affair; her cuckolded husband, Rufus; and such dramatis personae as Roxanne, Twan, Pimp Lucius and Rosie the Nosy Neighbor. Its 22 chapters long (so far), and boy is it confusing, even if youve seen it. But R. Kelly will have further opportunities to untangle this narrative  or to complicate it even more  in a new series of Trapped in the Closet episodes that have been ordered by the IFC cable channel.

title: For Butler, a Different Tournament but a Familiar Opponent
description: In 2010 and 2011, the Butler Bulldogs were college basketballs favorite Cinderella story. But this season has sometimes been a struggle and the Bulldogs are now playing in the College Basketball Invitational tournament. Matt Rhinesmith, a sports reporter for The Butler Collegian, will file occasional posts for The Quad about the teams season.

description: There is, perhaps, no more enduring critique of Mitt Romney than the one about him having shaky principles that shift with the political winds.

title: Palmer Is Latest to Criticize Use of Belly Putter
description: ORLANDO, Fla.  Add Arnold Palmer to the growing number of golfers who are against the belly putters.

title: A Hindu Victory in Russia Could Heal Rift With India
description: Russia extricated itself from an embarrassing spat with India on Wednesday when a provincial appeals court definitively rejected an attempt to ban a version of the Bhagavad Gita, the Hindu holy book, Harvey Morris writes for the IHT Rendezvous blog in The New York Times.

title: Korean Oil Firm Is Part of Group Buying El Paso Assets
description: The consortium of firms buying the El Paso Corporations exploration and production businesses has grown a little larger and has drawn overseas interest.

title: Helping One Big Client, but Wanting to Spread Out
description: THE Four Horsemen Toy Design Studios is a toy company based in New Jersey that creates highly detailed action figures for Mattel while making its own toys that are sold online to adult collectors.
