title: How Do You Escape the One-Big-Client Trap?
description: Our latest case study looks at the Four Horsemen Toy Design Studio and the companys efforts to diversify its revenue streams so it is not dependent on one big client, Mattel. Based in Bloomington, N.J., the company is owned by four men  Chris Dahlberg, H. Eric Mayse, Jim Preziosi and Eric Treadaway  and has three other employees who help with sculpting, painting and shipping. The company takes in revenue of more than $500,000 a year, the bulk of it from its work for Mattel.

title: Patience Now, Offense Later
description: PEORIA, Ariz.

title: Mr. Phillips Goes to Washington
description: As his train pulled into Washington in March 1862, Wendell Phillips, the man known as abolitions golden trumpet, caught sight of one of those unfinished round buildings used to turn locomotives in, and asked his seatmate what that engine house was.

title: Toulouse Victims Buried in Israel
description: JERUSALEM  The journey from Toulouse, France, ended here, in the sprawling cemetery known as Har Hamenuchot, or the Mount of Rest, in the Jerusalem hills. The four victims of the shooting outside a Jewish school, three of them children, were buried on Wednesday in a joint funeral that was attended by thousands.

title: French Lawyer Says Shooting Suspect Was Petty Criminal Before Radicalization
description: 1:20 p.m. | Updated  As my colleague Scott Sayare reports, the French police early on Wednesday cornered a man suspected of killing seven people, including three children at a Jewish school this week, and kept him holed up in a Toulouse apartment during a tense and protracted standoff.

title: Myanmar Invites Americans and Europeans to Monitor Vote
description: The United States said on Wednesday that it was encouraged that Myanmar had invited American and European representatives to monitor elections on April 1, a milestone for Myanmar as it emerges from decades of military dictatorship.

title: Money Makes the Campaigns Go Round, and Round
description: The Republican primaries are starting to feel like the debates earlier in the election cycle  they keep happening and pundits declare a winner, but nothing seems to change. Last night, Mitt Romney won Illinois on the strength of the more moderate voters around Chicago. He stands to get three times as many delegates as Rick Santorum and has what looks like an insurmountable lead. And yet, Mr. Santorum keeps going  and going and going. And so does Newt Gingrich.

title: Voice Mail From Harvard Makes the Choice Tough to Call
description: Late on a Tuesday night, I take a break from homework. Glancing at my phone, I see I have a new voice mail from hours ago.

title: Need Experienced Teachers? Here's an Idea
TimesCast | March 21, 2012
description: French shooting suspect is cornered | Syrian conflict enters a period of prolonged instability.

title: Image of the Day: March 21
In Louisiana, Santorum Pushes for More Drilling
description: HARVEY, La.  Rick Santorum began his fight for the Louisiana primary here on Wednesday morning, telling a small crowd that he would deliver more jobs to the gulf region by easing the permitting process for oil and gas drilling.

title: Santorum Puts a Stress on History, in Hopes of Making It
description: In Gettysburg, Pa., on Tuesday night, Rick Santorum stood on the grounds where more lives were lost than in any other Civil War battle, and where Abraham Lincoln issued his stirring call for unity and democracy. Mr. Santorum, who had just lost the Republican primary in Illinois, called the presidential race the most important election since the election of 1860.

title: The Common Sense Catholics
description: Rick Santorum doesnt just wear his religion on his sleeve, he billboards it in neon. Still, for all the flash and sparks generated by an ostentatiously Catholic candidates crusade for the presidency, one thing has been missing from most discussions: the actual Catholic voter.

title: In Honor of Bachs Birthday, a Gift for Listeners
description: For all celebrants of Johann Sebastian Bachs 327th birthday (and all Bach lovers, for that matter), on Wednesday, a record label is offering a promotional gift: nine hours of Bachs music for 99 cents on Amazon, available through Friday. The company,  eOne Music  the label formerly known as Koch  says it is selling the downloads to publicize its plans to reissue recordings by the Bach Guild, a label started in 1948 to make the composers works more widely available. EOne Music said it also planned new recordings.

title: Stringer Calls for Immediate Removal of 'Pink Slime' Products
Saints Coach Is Suspended for a Year Over Bounties
description: In a powerful rebuke to one of the games most successful teams, the National Football League suspended New Orleans Saints Coach Sean Payton for a year without pay on Wednesday for his role in a bounty program that promised money to players if they injured opponents and knocked them out of games.

title: Motherlode: Anne and Sam Lamott
description: KJ DellAntonia interviews the mother and son duo who co-wrote Some Assembly Required.

title: Care by Consensus
description: Naomi Cotter finally retired at 73, after 24 years spent directing a student legal clinic at Harvard Law School and then several more more working for a mediation service. I was worn out, she told me. Id worked my entire life, and I just wanted time. Now 75, Ms. Cotter spends her days going to the theater and concerts and seeing friends; shes considering whether to take art courses.

title: After Hours of Uncertainty, Jets Complete Deal for Tebow
description: About eight hours after announcing a trade for Tim Tebow, the Jets actually completed it Wednesday night, ending a surreal day in which one of the most popular and polarizing athletes in the country was sent to the N.F.L.s most prominent city.

title: Stuckey, Detroits Holdover and New Hope
description: Rebuilding teams are not only tasked with scouting and development, but also with internal identification; every franchise in transition will inevitably have some remnants from the previous era, and its the charge of a discerning general manager to scour those holdovers for future value.

title: GSN Plans to Add Reality TV to Its Game Show Roster
description: The GSN cable channel plans to expand into reality television for the 2012-13 season, the channels programming and advertising executives said at an upfront breakfast on Wednesday.

title: Imagining Carbon Emissions in Underground Exile
description: In a perfect world, greenhouse gas emissions would be on the decline in the near future, with fossil fuels replaced by clean sources of energy like wind and solar. But current emissions are so daunting that the chances of the planets cleaning up its act in a timely manner are slim.

title: Vain Glorious | The Spa at Glenmere Mansion
description: Where: The Spa at Glenmere Mansion

title: Your Say: After Toulouse, Do You Feel Less Secure?
description: French and international media have been filled with reports of spreading insecurity across France: first, as a result of the assassinations last week of three French soldiers of North African descent; then, because of a shooting rampage on Monday outside a Jewish school that claimed the lives of three children and a rabbi.

title: Radulov Could Join Predators on Thursday
description: 5:32 p.m. | Updated Alexander Radulov is in Nashville and ready to go as soon as Thursday against the Penguins. As originally reported here and elsewhere and as confirmed by Radulov and Predators General Manager David Poile at Wednesdays Bridgestone Arena news conference, Radulov has no commitment to go back to the K.H.L. next season. Rather, his Russian club, Salavat Yulaev Ufa, retains his K.H.L. rights for 2012-13 if, and only if, he decides to return to Russia next season after the July 1 expiration of his N.H.L. contract with Nashville.

title: Did Punishment Fit Crime for Saints?
description: Here are the N.F.L.s punishments for the Saints system of paying players for hits that knocked opponents out of games.The sanctions for individuals were more harsh than most people probably expected, and perhaps lighter in terms of money and draft picks lost.

title: The Political Geography of Gasoline Prices
description: Many readers were not convinced by my article in Saturdays paper pointing out the lack of evidence that gasoline prices affect the outcomes of presidential elections.

title: At Daytona Bike Week, Demolition on Two Wheels
description: NEW SMYRNA BEACH, Fla.  With the Daytona 500 falling a week after its traditional third Sunday of February, another marquee event in the greater Daytona Beach area, Bike Week, was consequently pushed forward. The annual gathering of roughly 500,000 bikers, which concluded Sunday, fell smack in the middle of the traditional collegiate spring break and the N.C.A.A. basketball tourney, as bikers and co-eds shared the beach and the bars.

title: Prague Railways Introduces Ladies-First Compartments
description: Czech Railways recently rolled out a new feature that has raised more than a few eyebrows  Ladies Compartments. These designated six-seater areas, introduced at the start of the year, are part of a marketing strategy intended to improve service for women who want special assistance or priority seating. But the move was immediately criticized as being discriminatory against male passengers.

title: For Wisconsins Brianna Decker, Hockeys Top Honor
description: DULUTH, Minn.  Surrounded by her teammates, coaches, and family, Wisconsins junior forward Brianna Decker received the Patty Kazmaier Memorial Award on Saturday to honor her for season-long success.

title: Excerpt: 'The Big Meal'
description: A scene from Dan LeFranc's new play at Playwrights Horizons. (Video courtesy of the production.)

title: Atop a Volcano, the Ages of Red Pines
description: Kevin Anchukaitis, an assistant research professor at the Lamont-Doherty Earth Observatory at Columbia University, is conducting a tree-ring study to analyze drought patterns in Guatemala.

title: Scouting Report
description: Openings

title: Shopping Snapshots: March 22
description: Spring trench coats, Victoria Simes leather wrapped sterling coated wire, and small handbag fro Wendy Nichol.

title: U.S. Notes Europes Progress in Easing Its Debt Crisis
description: WASHINGTON  For the United States, the looming threat from the long-simmering European sovereign debt crisis seems finally to have started to subside.

title: New Focus on Publicizing Information About Political TV Ads
description: Local broadcasters, by law, have to disclose the identities of those who buy political advertisements, as well as detailed information about the purchases. They print out the data and store it at their offices for the public to see, theoretically. But few members of the public ever get a chance to.

title: Circus Aside, Can Tebows Rushing Help Rescue Jets?
description: Here is some initial reaction on Denvers trade of Tim Tebow to the Jets. It feels a little strange just writing it. The Broncos sent Tebow and a seventh-round pick for a fourth-round pick and a sixth-round pick in this years draft.

title: Bad Gun Laws
description: The Trayvon Martin killing has brought some much-needed attention to Floridas Stand Your Ground law, which did away with the longstanding legal principle that there is a duty to retreat from dangerous situations, and lowered the standard for using lethal force in response to a perceived threat. As The Times story put it, the law grants immunity to people who act to protect themselves if they have a reasonable fear they will be killed or seriously injured.

title: The I Know Nothing Defense
description: Michael W. Peregrine, a partner at the law firm McDermott Will & Emery, advises corporations, officers and directors on issues related to corporate governance, fiduciary duties and internal investigations.

title: After 2 Amendments, Senate to Vote on Jobs Bill
description: The JOBS bill, which aims to make it easier and quicker for small companies to raise money from investors, is scheduled for a vote on Wednesday afternoon after the Senate considers two amendments to tighten rules on how companies raise financing online, and to strengthen other provisions approved by the House.

title: In Zimbabwe, Sentenced for Watching News Reports
description: JOHANNESBURG  A court in Zimbabwe decided not to imprison six activists who had been arrested while watching news videos of the Arab Spring uprisings, sentencing them instead on Wednesday to 420 hours of community service and fining them $500 each.

title: Yankees Value Up, Mets Down
description: The Yankees are worth $1.85 billion, up nine percent from 2011, Forbes magazine said Wednesday.

title: A Season of Confounded Expectations
description: The north woods of Maine, where our family of five is spending a year, is a place defined by winter. The intense cold shapes everything that lives in these woods. The long legs of the moose enable it to walk in deep snow. The meadow voles and red squirrels tunnel through the snow. The local people are paragons of self-reliance. Winter is the defining season of northern New England. Even more so than football or baseball season.

title: MF Global Executive Subpoenaed by House Panel
description: A Congressional subcommittee voted on Wednesday to subpoena an MF Global executive at the center of a federal investigation into wrongdoing at the firm.

title: Boy Band Becomes First British Group to Open at No. 1 on Billboard Chart
description: Bring on the new boy-band invasion.

title: Descending to the Challenge: Developing Documentaries About the Deep Ocean
description: Overview | What do we know about the deepest reaches of the ocean floor, and how do scientists explore this remote habitat? In this lesson, students investigate deep-sea geology, chemistry and biology, learn about the technologies scientists use to explore these areas, and write a treatment for a documentary about the ocean floor.

title: Ristretto | We Are the 5 Percent
description: If you want to order the most unconventional, unexpected drink at an espresso bar, ask for an espresso.

title: Fox and MLB Network to Collaborate on Pregame Show
description: Fox Sports Saturday baseball 30-minute pregame show emanated from its Los Angeles studio for years. More recently, it was less a show than a 10-minute segment hosted from a game site by Chris Rose.

title: Wachtell Defends Staggered Boards
description: Despite a campaign led by a Harvard Law School professor to remove them, staggered boards still have an outspoken defender in Wachtell, Lipton, Rosen & Katz.

title: U.N. Council Backs Plan for Ending Syria Conflict
description: Overcoming months of bitter division, the United Nations Security Council delivered a diplomatic setback to President Bashar al-Assad of Syria on Wednesday, unanimously embracing efforts by Kofi Annan, the former secretary general, to negotiate a cease-fire in the year-old Syrian conflict, funnel aid to victims and begin a political transition.

title: Presidential Statement on the Joint Special Envoy on Syria
description: In this statement, which was read aloud during a formal session of the Security Council on Wednesday, expresses its gravest concern at the deteriorating situation in Syria, which has resulted in a serious human rights crisis and a deplorable humanitarian situation.

title: TimesCast | French Suspect Cornered
description: March 21, 2012  French police surrounded the apartment building of a man suspected of killing seven people in the last ten days.

title: TimesCast | Fighting Continues in Syria
description: March 21, 2012 - Some experts believe Syria has moved into a new stage of prolonged fighting and instability. Michael Slackman, a deputy foreign editor, interviews Andrew Tabler, a Syria specialist.

title: Photo Replay: March 21
description: The day in sports included greyhound racing in Brighton, England, and the French swimming championships in Dunkirk.

title: A Quiz Asks: How Insulated Are You?
description: Unless youve been living in a cave (as opposed to a bubble), you have probably heard about the new book by Charles Murray, Coming Apart, in which he describes a widening gulf between educated, wealthy white professionals and their less educated, less affluent, working-class white counterparts.

title: Justices Ruling Expands Rights of Accused in Plea Bargains
description: WASHINGTON  Criminal defendants have a constitutional right to effective lawyers during plea negotiations, the Supreme Court ruled on Wednesday in a pair of 5-to-4 decisions that vastly expanded judges supervision of the criminal justice system.

title: Excerpt: 'I Don't Know How to Love Him'
description: Chilina Kennedy as Mary Magdalene in a scene from the Broadway revival of "Jesus Christ Superstar" at the Neil Simon Theater.

title: A Muddled Narrative on Wall Street Presidential Donations
description: Political reporters covering the 2012 presidential race cant get enough of the drama surrounding Wall Street donations.

title: Little, and Learning to Be Artists
Is the New iPad Screen Too Good for the Web?
description: Apps, games and e-books may look great on the new iPads high-resolution retina display, but its unclear whether Web sites will get the same treatment.

title: European Union Plans Retaliation in Public Contract Bidding
description: BRUSSELS  In a move likely to increase tensions over protectionism in international trade, Chinese, American or Japanese companies could be blocked from bidding for public contracts in Europe if their home countries are thought to be excluding bids from European firms.

title: Gadget Regrets, Part II: Meat Pounders, Oyster Knives and Mandolines
description: Readers have been tweeting and posting comments naming the kitchen tools they thought they would cherish, but now barely use. A selection of tweets is below; you can read another batch here. Share your tale of kitchen-tool woe by tweeting us at @nytdining with the hashtag #gadgetregrets.

title: 2012 Fantasy Baseball Preview: Starting Pitcher
description: Jason and Justin Sablich provide fantasy sports advice on Bats, The Fifth Down and on Twitter (@5thDownFantasy).

title: Zynga Buys Mobile-Game Maker
description: Zynga announced on Wednesday that it has acquired OMGPOP, a mobile-game maker, for an undisclosed sum. The acquisition comes as Zynga, the maker of popular Facebook games like CityVille and FarmVille, tries to expand its mobile offerings and become less dependent on the social network.

title: House Hunting in Portugal
description: Outside Lisbon on the Estoril Coast, a five-bedroom villa is listed at 3.9 million euros ($5 million).

title: House Hunting in ... Portugal
description: FIVE-BEDROOM VILLA ON THE ESTORIL COAST

title: Lynton Will Take On Expanded Role at Sony in U.S.
description: 8:15 p.m. | Updated  LOS ANGELES  Michael Lynton, the chairman and chief executive of Sonys filmed entertainment unit, will soon take charge of the Japan-based companys United States operations in an expanded role as chief executive of Sony Corporation of America, according to people who were briefed on the expected change.

title: Somber Scenes in France and Israel as Shooting Victims Are Eulogized
description: While a tense standoff continued throughout the day on Wednesday in the French city of Toulouse  where a gunman who took responsibility for the methodical killings of four men and three children over the past 10 days was surrounded by hundreds of police officers  the victims of the attacks were remembered at services in France and Israel.

title: How Did TBS Become No. 1 on Cable? Its a Familiar Story
description: TBS has found the formula for cable television success. Buy repeats. Then repeat.

title: Holy Cow: Reacting to the N.F.L.s Punishment of the Saints
description: The news that the Jets had traded for Tim Tebow and that the N.F.L. had handed down draconian penalties against the Saints hit the Internet within minutes of each other Wednesday. Both were shocking in their own way, even though we had plenty of hints they were possible.

title: The Most Fun With an Etch A Sketch Since Kindergarten
description: A Romney advisers simile comparing the campaign to a very old toy utterly transfixed the new media.

title: It Has Come to This: Even NCIS Suffers Spring Dropoff
description: It seems that even CBSs venerable NCIS franchise is not immune to a spring downturn in the ratings. According to Nielsen, NCIS fell to a season low in the 18-to-49-year-old demographic on Tuesday night while NCIS: Los Angeles tied a season low in that advertiser-beloved category. The drop was unexpected, as the last new episodes from three weeks ago had better numbers despite facing stiffer competition in the form of a Tuesday edition of American Idol on Fox. The shows still maintained their dominance in total viewers, with 18.6 million and 16 million, respectively.

title: Romney to Lincoln: You Can Fool All the People (in the Fall)
description: Ive been covering politics for so long that I sometimes wonder if Im too cynical and if my expectations for politicians are too low. But then something happens to convince me that theyre not.

title: Low-Income Students Won't Have to Pay for A.P. Exams
Three-Play Cycle by Tom Murphy Among Highlights of Lincoln Center Festival
description: From the Olympics to Lincoln Center: A three-play cycle by the major Irish dramatist Tom Murphy will be offered at the Lincoln Center Festival this summer, after performances in Galway, Ireland, and the Cultural Olympiad in London, Lincoln Center said on Wednesday in announcing its 2012 program. The cycle, called DruidMurphy, is being presented by the Druid Theater Company of Galway and is directed by Garry Hynes. It will be the companys third visit to the festival. Other theatrical productions include a Sydney Theater Company presentation of Uncle Vanya, directed by Tamas Ascher. The cast includes Cate Blanchett. Mikhail Baryshnikov will star in a new play, In Paris, and Alan Cumming will appear in a one-person production of Macbeth by the National Theater of Scotland.

title: Santorum Plays to His Audience, Toy in Hand
description: MANDEVILLE, La.  Wielding a classic red Etch A Sketch toy on stage before a crowd of Tea Party supporters on Wednesday, Rick Santorum made a mockery of Mitt Romneys campaign, pointing out that he would not be redrawn.

title: How a Master of Stand-Up Sells the Joke
description: Close your eyes, and Todd Barry sounds like an impossibly cool combination of Jack Nicholson in his prime and a smug jazz D.J. after a few bong hits. Open them, and hes a short, middle-aged, bald comic with a paunch.

title: As Hoverflies Grow, So Do Their Acting Skills
description: Hoverflies dont sting, but to repel predators they sometimes pretend to. And to aid in the deception, they look remarkably like wasps and bees.

title: Rent Is the Least of This Landlords Worries
description: Chekhov once said that a gun appearing in the first act of a play shouldnt be left unfired. Heres a corollary: A character who says My gut tells me I can trust you probably shouldnt trust that person.

title: A Visitor Returns With Friends in Tow
description: New York has become accustomed to regular visits by the Nrityagram Dance Ensemble, which refines its art in a village outside Bangalore in southern India dedicated to that purpose. Each visit here is a gift, but for the one that began at the Joyce Theater on Tuesday, the group has brought something extra: friends.

title: Now Collaborating | Tommy Ton and Club Monaco
description: Tommy Ton, the street style photographer behind the big-time blog Jak & Jil, celebrated his collaboration with Club Monaco last night at the companys flagship on Fifth Avenue in New York. The idea was for me to design something that was essential for everyday use, Ton says. I pretty much dont go anywhere without a backpack, so that style was instant. Traveling almost constantly to fashion weeks around the world requires a lot from the shutterbug, and his carryalls. Which is, perhaps, why it took almost two years to get the two bags  a backpack for guys, a canvas messenger for gals  off the ground. They were refined again and again to make sure that they were functional and not too throwaway, Ton says. Inspiration came from just observing friends and  no surprise here  people on the street!

title: Pictures of the Day: Israel and Elsewhere
description: Photographs from Israel, France, Bahrain and Myanmar.

title: Making Connections
description: Technology is a key to the shopping experience. Young buyers use e-mail and the Web not just for research, but also to build trust.

title: Tributes for Mikulski, Congresss Longest-Serving Woman
description: When Senator Barbara A. Mikulski was sworn into the Senate in 1987, there was no dean of women to mentor female lawmakers. One of two women in the Senate at the time, Ms. Mikulski wasnt even allowed in the Senate gym, Senator Mitch McConnell of Kentucky said Wednesday.

title: Armageddon and Other Playthings
description: Judith McPherson, the plucky heroine of Grace McCleens debut novel, The Land of Decoration, is a smart but extremely literal-minded 10-year-old English schoolgirl. She grows up, as Ms. McCleen did, in the midst of Christian fundamentalists. She has been raised with the guarantee that Armageddon is near.

title: Emulating Saxophone Styles Across Decades, in Standards and Abstractions
description: Theres an intriguing, good-humored wariness in the playing of the tenor saxophonist Bill McHenry. His tone is dry as cardboard but smooth and rarely stern, and as an improviser he treads meaningfully, choosing his moments, guarding against wasteful expenditure. As a bandleader he prefers soft direction, presenting loose guidelines and then letting the chips fall. This can make for a Zen logic of care and surrender, rigor and relinquishment. But it can also yield an aimless disconnect and a sense of vaguely unfulfilled intention.

title: Holy Cow: Reacting to the Jets Attempt to Trade for Tebow
description: Almost anything involving Tim Tebow draws such an inordinate amount of attention, its a wonder the man can step out of his house. Trade him to the walking-tabloid-headline Jets, as the Broncos are trying to do, and expect this to reach another stratosphere.

title: Back to Midwest Olive Garden After Tastes of New York
description: She came, she ate, she reviewed.

title: Girl Scout Leaders to Parents: Stop Selling Cookies
description: Who sold you your last batch of Thin Mints? Judging by the response to my frustrated tweet, Im not the only one buying cookies from colleagues and friends who are distinctly not girls. Weve restocked our annual supply of crispy, chocolate-coated, Girl Scout-branded disks annually for years now  and I cant remember the last time either I or my husband was asked to buy a box of cookies by an actual Girl Scout.

title: Hungary Pressed to Ease Judiciary and News Media Laws
description: BUDAPEST  The Council of Europe is pressing Hungary to make further statutory changes to protect the independence of the judiciary and the news media, saying that recent amendments, while welcome, are not enough.

title: Designing for Women in the Know
description: In the United States, Giambattista Valli has only recently come into his own.

title: Catering to the Valli Girls
description: IN the season between his last show for the house of Emanuel Ungaro in the fall of 2004, and the start of his own business in the spring of 2005, Giambattista Valli adopted a curious look that has since become one of his many signatures. On almost any occasion at which Mr. Valli, 45, appears, he wears a pearl necklace, usually contrasted against his thin frame, a fitted black sweatshirt and loose black jeans. It is hard to say whether the look is more Coco Chanel or Barbara Bush.

title: Homes for $530,000
description: Properties in Richmond, Va., Washington State and Columbus, Ohio.

title: What You Get for ... $530,000
description: RICHMOND, VA.

title: In Terms of Web Traffic, Its Obama in a Landslide
description: Political campaigns might be using sophisticated digital advertising techniques to attract potential voters to their Web sites, but data released by Nielsen on Wednesday shows that it is President Obama who still holds the lions share of Web site visits.

title: Plan to Search for More American Remains in North Korea Halted
description: WASHINGTON  The on again, off again effort to recover from North Korean territory the remains of Americans killed in the Korean War is off again, the Pentagon said Wednesday, a victim of the deteriorating diplomatic and security relations of the moment.

title: A Youth at Home at the Keys
description: Benjamin Grosvenor, the 19-year-old English pianist who made his New York recital debut at the Frick Collection on Sunday afternoon, seemed the picture of casualness and humility when he walked onstage fresh faced, tieless and dressed in black. But no one who has heard his recent recording of Chopin, Liszt and Ravel works (from Decca) would have been surprised by the contrast between his easygoing appearance and the ferocity of his sound. At the Frick, as on the recording, he proved a formidable technician and a thoughtful, coolly assured interpreter.

title: The Eye of Beauty, Revisited
description: HERB RITTS died nearly 10 years ago, at age 50. Since then the world that he dominated as a photographer  fashion, beauty, celebrity  has changed dramatically, leaving a stillness where his energetic ideas once existed. As the years go by, as images of a hyper-glamour become the norm, as visual memories seem almost a grab bag of tricks, you become more aware of what a giant the man was. He was certainly a link to George Hoyningen-Huene and Edward Weston; he also belongs in the tradition of Richard Avedon, Louise Dahl-Wolfe and Irving Penn. More simply, you cannot imagine the 1980s and 90s in America without the photographs of Herb Ritts.

title: Kraft, Mondelez and the Art of Corporate Rebranding
description: Soon, people may have to learn how to pronounce a new name for the maker of Oreos and Cadbury Creme Eggs. Its mohn-dah-LEEZ.

title: Moving Into a Black-and-White World Where Graphic Texture Trumps Dialogue
description: Juliacks is a comic artist whose work  crude, ornate, subjective and dreamy  is not for those who prefer their narrative crisp and tidy. But Swell, her graphic novel about a bereaved family, a daughter in particular, is an immersive experience for brave readers. Now a production based on it has come to the Living Theater as part of the Culture Projects Women Center Stage Festival, straining mightily to conjure the storys lush stream of consciousness.

title: Eye on Beauty, Revisited
description: Last September, in an interview with Richard Gere, the actor mentioned that the Getty Museum was planning an exhibition of the photography of Herb Ritts. The two were good friends; Mr. Gere serves on the board of The Herb Ritts Foundation, and, of course, he is the guy in that iconic 1978 photo taken in a service station in the California desert, in front of a jacked-up Buick. The two had stopped to fix a flat, and Mr. Ritts had said, simply, Lets take some shots here.

title: Whitman: H.P.s Reorganization Is About the Stock
description: Paul Sakuma/Associated PressMeg Whitman, the chief executive of Hewlett-Packard.

title: Lessons Learned: How to Live la Vie Parisienne
description: Lessons From Madame Chic: The Top 20 Things I Learned While Living in Paris. By Jennifer L. Scott. 212 pages. Published by Jennifer L. Scott, on Amazon.com. $12.99.

title: You Write the Tebow Playbook
description: One thing about Tim Tebow that everyone can agree on is that he is not a conventional N.F.L. quarterback. Some even think hes better running the ball than passing it. How should the Jets use him? As a drop-back passer? As a third-down running back? Or as something entirely novel? Whether youre an offensive coordinator in the N.F.L., a high school coach or just a fan who likes to diagram plays on a napkin, send us your best idea for one that the Jets should incorporate into their playbook to take advantage of Tebows skills. Be serious. Or be whimsical. Give it a shot and use this form to send us your idea.

title: Hot Spots That Dont Stay Home
description: Ah, the Internet! The source of so much goodness. The font of e-mail, news, chat, TV, blogs, books and Facebook. What would we do without it?

title: In Full Swing
description: FASHIONS print train appears to be unstoppable. If you were so inclined, you could rock checks, dots, florals, batiks and digital prints from head to pointy toe. And among the freshest looks for spring are classic pumps in brashly graphic patterns.

title: It Pays to Hang in There if Portfolios Are Diversified
description: Diversified portfolios are good investments over the long haul

title: The Skirt, and Its Shape, Are in Play This Season
description: The flared minis, knife-pleated midis, below-the-knee pencil shapes and A-line each representing all offer a lively way to recharge a wardrobe and give a vigorous kick-start to spring.

title: Community on the Upswing
description: Edgewood, a working-class neighborhood about two miles east of downtown Atlanta, has had its ups and downs through the years. There are signs that the area is experiencing another revival.

title: Only the Half of It
description: MIRANDA BERMAN thinks of herself as treading fairly close to fashions cutting edge. When everyone is wearing leggings, youre automatically different if you wear a skirt, she said. Her own outfit on any given day might incorporate a schoolgirl mini, which she wears with tights; a long jersey column; or a leather skirt, its hemline dipping just below the knee.

title: Senate Delays Vote on Start-Ups Bill for 2 Amendments
description: WASHINGTON  The JOBS bill, which would make it easier for small companies to raise money from investors, is now scheduled for a vote on Thursday, after the Senate considers two Democratic amendments to tighten proposed rules on how companies raise financing online and to strengthen other provisions that were approved by the House.

title: What Goes Around (and Around)
description: AT a time when just about every toy has a screen, buttons and batteries, the must-have diversion among elementary school children is positively primitive: a top.

title: On Wall St., Keeping a Tight Rein on Twitter
description: Next stop Dow 57,757? Dont count on it but Tuesdays bullish session is in the books.

title: After a Layoff, Clijsters Finds Her Game
description: KEY BISCAYNE, Fla.  In only her sixth tournament since losing in the quarterfinals in Miami last year, Kim Clijsters struggled with rust early on, but eventually cruised to a 4-6, 6-1, 6-0 victory over an erratic Australian Jarmila Gajdosova in her first-round match at the Sony Ericsson Open.

title: How Do You Say Disagreement in Pirah?
description: In his 2008 memoir, Dont Sleep, There Are Snakes, the linguist Dan Everett recalled the night members of the Pirah  the isolated Amazonian hunter-gatherers he first visited as a Christian missionary in the late 1970s  tried to kill him.

title: App Smart Extra: Book Apps for Young Adults
description: The app market may tilt more heavily in the direction of young teenagers and preteens than any other demographic, but most of those apps seem to treat them only as game players or social networkers.

title: What Radulovs Departure Means for the K.H.L.

Doug Armstrong said last week.); and how he may disappoint on the ice simply because he is from the K.H.L.

They finished about three quarters of a board ahead of Thomas Bessis from France and Ishmael Delmonte from Australia, who had led after each of the first two days. Third were John Diamond of Boca Raton, Fla., and Brian Platnick of Evanston, Ill.

title: Shopping for Floor Lamps
description: The partners in the design studio Rich Brilliant Willing searched for lamps worthy of being the focal point of the room.

title: Floor Lamps
description: A DESIGN firm with a name like Rich Brilliant Willing creates certain expectations: if nothing else, one might assume the founders have a bit of attitude. In fact, they are just three amiable guys diligently turning out furniture and objects with a utilitarian edge in their Lower East Side studio. The company name is a play on their names: Theo Richardson, Charles Brill and Alex Williams.

title: Trays With Character
description: For its latest collection of trays, the Italian housewares company Alessi enlisted the help of eight Chinese architects. Were used to working with different industrial designers and cultural backgrounds, said Alberto Alessi, the companys managing director, noting that Alessi frequently collaborates with American, European and Japanese designers. But we were missing the Chinese, so I thought it was time to extend our scouting.

title: Comments
description: A selection of recent comments from readers of the Home section, drawn from letters and postings at nytimes.com.

title: Marfa Style Hits Los Angeles
description: Its hard to believe that Adam Silverman, a partner in Heath ceramics and studio director of Heath Los Angeles, had never been to Marfa before last year. The small Texas town, made famous by Donald Judd, has been a mecca for those in the worlds of art and design for decades.

title: Ready for Folding or Holding
description: The furniture produced by BDDW is unattainable for many. But Tyler Hays, the owner and designer, also makes lower-priced pieces for a new company called Lostine, the brainchild of the lighting designer Robert Ogden.

title: Sales at John Robshaw, Conran Shop and Others
description: John Robshaw bean bags and poufs are marked down 20 percent online, through March 29 (the Samoa bean bag, regularly $225, is $180); (212) 594-6006, extension 13, johnrobshaw.com.

title: Keeping the Clutter Busters in Line
description: This week, the National Association of Professional Organizers kicks off its 24th annual conference, held this year in Baltimore. NAPO, as the trade group of about 4,200 members is more colloquially known, aims to organize the organizers  organizing being a professional specialty that didnt have a name until the early 1980s. These days, however, thanks to Oprah and Dr. Phil, the Learning Channel and HGTV, there are few of us who dont have a passing familiarity with clutter busters and their ilk. In a secular culture, clutter may be the closest thing we have to original sin. Following this metaphor, the organizer is both clergy and personal savior.

title: The Road to the Round of 16 Included a Bloody Brawl
description: One player lay at midcourt, blood pouring off his face. Another was throwing punches at every opponent he could see. A third stood on the scorers table, egging on a howling crowd at the Cintas Center in Cincinnati. Expletive-laced challenges were hurled back and forth. All the while, a national television audience watched as one of college basketballs fiercest rivalries exploded into chaos.

title: FedEx Agrees to Pay $3 Million to Settle a Bias Case
description: The United States Department of Labor has reached a $3 million settlement with the ground delivery unit of FedEx to resolve allegations that the company discriminated against 21,635 job seekers at two dozen FedEx facilities in 15 states.

title: Chile: Landmark Gay Rights Ruling
description: The Inter-American Court of Human Rights ruled that Chile must pay damages to a judge who was denied custody of her three daughters by the Supreme Court in 2004 because of her sexual orientation. The ruling by the human rights court, a judicial entity of the Organization of American States, requires Chiles government to pay the judge, Karen Atala, left, $50,000, in addition to $12,000 in court costs. The February ruling, which was made public on Wednesday in Chile, is the latest development in a multiyear legal battle waged by Judge Atala, a lesbian who had lost custody of her daughters to her ex-husband, also a judge. Judge Atalas lawyer called the decision historic for Chiles legal system. Justice Minister Teodoro Ribera said Wednesday that Chilean authorities had acted to protect the superior interests of the children involved, but he also said Chile would respect the ruling.

title: Coach Surmounts Injury and Team Beats Odds
description: While preparing his Massachusetts-Lowell team for its first-round game in the N.C.A.A. mens hockey tournament Friday, Norm Bazin will not preach about seizing the moment or feeling lucky to be alive. Bazin has never used his personal story as motivation this season, his first with the River Hawks, who ended a 16-year drought by making the tournament.

title: Man for Man, Its a Clash of Styles
description: BOSTON  Wisconsin and Syracuse have played only twice in their long basketball histories, and the Badgers victory came in 1927. The score was 31-24. Sounds like Bo Ryans kind of game.

title: No-Show Jobs and Overstaffing Hurt New York Harbor, a Report Says
description: Corruption has been ingrained in the docks around New York Harbor for so long that the movie most identified with it was filmed in black and white. But 58 years after the release of On the Waterfront, no-show jobs held by relatives of mobsters and other well-connected people continue to vex government officials trying to make the ports more efficient and more competitive.

title: Fox Show Will Start Worldwide
description: Television shows typically have their debuts in the United States first and arrive in other countries later  sometimes months or even years later.

description: ORLANDO, Fla.  It was a sight seen too often lately: Tiger Woods wincing in pain on the golf course.

description: A Frenchman suspected of recent shootings in Toulouse barricaded himself in a small apartment building surrounded by hundreds of police officers. The standoff lasted more than 30 hours.

title: Conservative Activist Fails to Notice Bono Impersonator Is Not Bono
description: Jason Mattera, a conservative activist known for ambushing liberal celebrities and politicians  by pretending to be a fan in search of a picture, and then firing off confrontational questions at close range  was forced to retract a video interview with Bono he unveiled with some fanfare this week, when it emerged that the man he mistook for the lead singer of U2 recently was, in fact, a Bono impersonator.

title: Why Panic? A Couples Nest Egg Better Left Alone

title: 3 Years On, Ponzi Scheme Still Haunts a Victim
description: Marble Falls, Tex.

title: In Overtime, Tight Race for Senate Rests With Vote Counters
description: The drama of a contentious Brooklyn special election for a State Senate seat moved into an unmarked warehouse on Wednesday, and as officials began reviewing votes, uncertainty increased alongside absurdity. Because the longer the contest drags on, the shorter the time the winner will serve the 27th District, which will cease to exist in its current form in 2013.

title: Closing of Far Rockaway Charter School Will Go to Court
In March, the Spartans Thoughts Turn to Winning
description: PHOENIX  Last week, Coach Tom Izzo and the Michigan State Spartans advanced to the regional semifinals of the N.C.A.A. tournament. That is almost the same as saying there is an N.C.A.A. tournament. Izzos teams so often find themselves among the final 16, he should have his own region: East, South, West and Izzo.

title: French Gunman Seen as Homegrown Militant
description: PARIS  For European law enforcement officials, Mohammed Merah, the 23-year-old suspect in the killing of seven people in southwestern France, represents the kind of insidious terrorist threat that they fear most: a homegrown militant consumed by visceral grievances who identifies with Al Qaeda but operates on his own.

title: Never Before
description: Journalistic convention requires that when there are two identifiable sides to a story, each side gets its say, in neutral fashion, without the writers thumb on the scale. This rule presents a challenge when one side of a controversy obviously lacks merit. But mainstream journalism has learned to navigate those challenges, choosing evolution over intelligent design, for example, and treating climate change naysayers as cranks.

title: Brotherhood Reconsiders Plan to Sit Out Presidential Race in Egypt
description: CAIRO  Muslim Brotherhood officials said on Wednesday that the group was debating whether to field its own candidate in Egypts upcoming presidential contest, after failing to persuade several outside figures to run with the groups backing.

title: Draw Something Draws a Bundle in Sale to Zynga
description: It took six years for the game developer Omgpop to become an overnight sensation  and only six weeks to cash in to the tune of $200 million. With its simple yet endearing Draw Something mobile app generating massive traffic, Omgpop surveyed its potential suitors and sold itself Wednesday to the biggest social media player, Zynga.

title: A Sluggish Star Finds New Energy
description: Philadelphia

title: Seeking Empowerment
description: Buying a first car is a milestone. Young car shoppers tell how they want to be treated (or acknowledged) in a dealers lot or showroom.

title: Mayor Warns of the Pitfalls in Social Media
description: On Twitter, he is @MikeBloomberg, a popular online avatar with more than 230,000 followers. His official Foursquare account leaves tips about Shake Shack and Kennedy International Airport. And his Facebook page energetically promotes the programs and values of New York City Hall.

title: Henry Drops In on Muamba
description: Red Bulls striker Thierry Henry paid a trans-Atlantic house call to London Wednesday, dropping in on his former Arsenal teammate Fabrice Muamba, who suffered cardiac arrest last Saturday playing for Bolton in a game in Englands Premier League.

title: Libya Resists International Courts Claim on War Crimes Case
description: TRIPOLI, Libya  Libyas interim authorities escalated their face-off against the International Criminal Court on Wednesday over custody of the most significant confidants to Col. Muammar el-Qaddafi taken prisoner since his ouster and death: his son Seif al-Islam el-Qaddafi and his brother-in-law Abdullah Senussi. The battle over the mens fate is an early test of the former rebels commitment to the rule of the law.

title: Respecting Differences
description: Avoid the fist bump: younger customers are looking for respect from sales personnel, not someone who is trying to act young.

title: Killing, With the Law on Your Side
Shot to Death in Florida
description: It would have been tragic enough if the shooting of an unarmed teenager by a self-appointed neighborhood watch captain in Florida were the first to show the lethal folly of so-called Stand Your Ground laws. But, in fact, these outrageously dangerous laws have been adopted in many states, making it easy for shooters who kill to claim self-defense.

title: The Fight Against Modern Slavery
description: President Obama, in convening the annual meeting of his cabinet-level task force on human trafficking last week, noted the work the administration has done in law enforcement, aid to victims and diplomatic pressure to help the millions around the world who toil under the boot of modern slavery.

description: FRANKFURT  Havens can pose their own risks.

title: Samuel Glazer Dies at 89; Popularized Drip Coffee
description: Samuel Glazer, a co-founder of the company that gave the world Mr. Coffee, one of the first and most popular automatic drip coffee makers to appear on American kitchen counters, died on March 12 in Cleveland. He was 89.

title: Please Stop Apologizing
description: THIS week, Robert De Niro made a joke about first ladies, and Newt Gingrich said it was inexcusable and the president should apologize for him. Of course, if something is inexcusable, an apology doesnt make any difference, but then again, neither does Newt Gingrich.

description: KEY BISCAYNE, Fla.  Two women who have battled illnesses produced victories in first-round matches at the Sony Ericsson Open.

title: Mets Start Getting Their Financial House in Order
description: Fred Wilpon and Saul Katz looked relieved as they entered the Manhattan federal courthouse shortly after 8 a.m. on Monday even though a trial that could have cost them more than $300 million was scheduled to begin in about an hour.

title: Mel Parnell, 89, Dies; Dominated Yanks
description: Mel Parnell, who won more games for the Boston Red Sox than any other left-handed pitcher and who especially endeared himself to Sox fans as a Yankee killer, died on Tuesday in New Orleans. He was 89.

title: Sanford McDonnell, Aerospace Leader, Dies at 89
description: Sanford N. McDonnell, who succeeded his uncle as chairman of the aerospace company McDonnell Douglas and, through the 1980s, modernized its management systems, remade the corporate culture and sharply increased earnings, died on Monday at his home in Clayton, Mo. He was 89.

title: State Senator Loses Support of Local G.O.P.
description: ALBANY  Senator James S. Alesi, one of four New York State Republicans who voted in favor of same-sex marriage last year, is unlikely to receive the nomination of the main Republican committee in his district, setting the stage for a difficult re-election race that could have implications in the fight for control of the State Senate.

title: No Livelihood, but One Lively Soundtrack
description: You know those thoughts that wake you up at 3:35 in the morning? The ones that so many Americans are having now, in this age of high unemployment and rising prices, about the bottom falling out of their safe little worlds.

title: A High-Gear Trip Through Life, From Soup to Nuts
description: It would probably be wise to eat dinner before attending The Big Meal, a new play by Dan LeFranc that opened Wednesday night at Playwrights Horizons. The consumption of plates of everyday foods  chicken fingers and fries, spaghetti, mashed potatoes  becomes charged with ominous portent in this comic drama about love, marriage, child rearing and the general brisk rush of human life, in which you turn around and find that youth has vamoosed and taken with it a lot of your dearest held assumptions about the way things would turn out.

title: Aching For Punning Accuracy
description: THURSDAYS PUZZLE  A soundalike theme today, courtesy of Alan Arbesfeld, with one twist: the pairs of homophones are all mixed up. Its your job to straighten them out. Wait, strike that: Its your job to appreciate the punny cluing that results from the mix-up.

title: With Film Pass, Fujifilm Highlights Its Other Units
description: FUJIFILM, seeking to recast its film-centered identity, is starting a brand campaign featuring medical imaging and other technological innovations that stem from its long history of chemical coatings research.

title: Romneys Day to Relish Is Marred by Aides Gaffe
description: WASHINGTON  Mitt Romney sought to use the coveted endorsement of Jeb Bush on Wednesday to amplify his call for Republicans to rally behind his candidacy and get on with the mission of ousting President Obama.

title: Pushing Back Against Austerity
description: Political leaders across Europe have begun to push back against the campaign of Chancellor Angela Merkel of Germany to put the Continents economies into a straitjacket of unrelenting fiscal austerity. It is about time. Two years of insisting that weak economies carry out tax increases and spending cuts have brought nothing but recession and deepening indebtedness.

title: Death of Florida Teen Spurs Outcry and Action
description: Last Updated | 10:50 a.m. Thursday Outrage over the fatal shooting of Trayvon Martin, 17, in central Florida continued to grow across the country on Wednesday, with at least two thousand people rallying Wednesday night in New York City and Miami. Civil rights leaders are planning more demonstrations in other cities in the coming days, including a rally Thursday night in Sanford, Fla.

title: Faith Has Often Had a New York Accent
description: New York often gets a bad and clichd rap for being a godless city. Isnt Brooklyn, after all, the borough of churches? In all likelihood, there are more seriously religious people of more differing faiths in New York than in any city in America. Tim Tebow will have plenty of company, and he will be joining a robust and eclectic lineup of religious New York athletes.

title: Toll of Mexican Crime Wave, Written in Faces on the Wall
description: ECATEPEC, Mexico  When residents of this poor industrial city look to the hills, they now see the faces of crime victims staring back at them. Enormous photographic portraits cover concrete homes as part of a community art project that captures what has become a Mexican obsession: visualizing victimhood or, more broadly, turning cold, mind-numbing data back into real people.

title: Hooking Up a New TV: Which Wire Goes Where?
description: A map to navigating which cables go where in the back of a modern television.

title: Where the Famous Shop, Cycling Is the Cause Clbre
description: On any given day, you might see Jake Gyllenhaal. Or Matthew Broderick or David Byrne. David Beckham has been said to swing by, just for some much-needed air.

title: To Quinn, No City Child Should Miss Kindergarten
description: Not everyone in Christine C. Quinns hometown went to kindergarten when she was growing up in the early 1970s. Her family parish, St. Patricks, in Glen Cove, N.Y., on Long Island, did not even enroll students for parochial school until first grade.

title: Bike-Sharing at N.Y.U. Offers a Hint of How City Program Could Work
description: It is the kind of news the citys Transportation Department would love to report someday: a New York City bike-share program that attracts all types of cyclists, from budding entrepreneurs to university professors, and does not lead to stolen bikes or injured riders.

description: If N.F.L. success were measured by jerseys sold and attention garnered, by winning not the turnover battle but the competition for most magazine covers, the Jets would have more than one Super Bowl championship, from more than 40 years ago.

description: PHILADELPHIA  A storied N.B.A. rivalry, long dormant and coated in cobwebs, rumbled back to life Wednesday night, with enough tension, tenacity and promise to last deep into the spring.

description: LITTLE ROCK, Ark.  The last Democratic stronghold in the South is in the care of a new set of guardians: graduate students, mostly.

description: WILLISTON, N.D.

title: On His Birthday, Callahan Gives Rangers Breathing Room
description: Ryan Callahan celebrated his 27th birthday Wednesday night by scoring 2 minutes 42 seconds into overtime, giving the Rangers a 2-1 victory over the Detroit Red Wings at Madison Square Garden and putting them 3 points ahead of the Pittsburgh Penguins in the race for Eastern Conference supremacy.

title: With a Strong Spring, Hughes Makes His Case
description: PORT CHARLOTTE, Fla.  Joe Girardi wants a difficult decision, and Phil Hughes is doing his best to accommodate him.

title: Heres to Mr. Coffee, Known to Some as Sam
description: There is a great dividing year in the history of coffee in America, and it is 1972. Before it, the percolator. After, automatic drip.

description: HONG KONG  China is Eldorado for the worlds major hotel companies, which, among them, have opened hundreds of multistar hotels across the country in recent years.

title: The Convention of 76
description: As the Republican race goes on longer and longer, with Rick Santorum and Newt Gingrich hoping to keep Mitt Romney from getting to their convention in Tampa with enough delegates to lock up the nomination, theres a wary sense of excitement among reporters whose fondest dream is of a convention where a nominee is actually chosen, instead of merely being royally acknowledged. So its worth thinking back to 1976, the last time a race was actually settled at a Republican convention.

title: No More Dancing for Buzz Williams

title: Maker Pulls Pesticide Amid Fear of Toxicity
description: SAN FRANCISCO  A manufacturer has pulled a controversial pesticide from the American market, surprising both growers and environmentalists who have warned that it poses serious hazards.

title: Ban Lifted, R.O.T.C. to Return to Harvards Campus
description: Harvard announced on Wednesday that it would open a campus office for the Army R.O.T.C. later this year, a move the Army believes will lead to greater participation in the program by Harvard undergraduates.

description: This column appears in the March 25 issue of The New York Times Magazine.

description: Do you like waking up at night to care for a crying baby? How about changing diapers? Did you complain last time you had to cancel plans because you had a sick child?

title: Study Shows House Members Profit
description: WASHINGTON  One accusation long directed at Congress is that lawmakers come to this capital city not just to serve the American people but also to enrich themselves and their families.

title: Paul Allen Gives Millions for Brain Research
description: Paul G. Allen, a co-founder of Microsoft, announced on Wednesday that he would commit $300 million over the next 10 years to turn the Allen Institute for Brain Science, a nonprofit organization he established to build a database of neural information, into a center for basic neuroscience investigation.

title: For Romney, a Long Drive to a Likely Finish
description: Mitt Romneys victories in Illinois and Puerto Rico this week have expanded his lead over Rick Santorum by roughly 60 delegates, putting him ahead by 300 delegates over all.

title: Indicators Fall in China and Europe
description: FRANKFURT  A main indicator of business sentiment in Europe unexpectedly fell deeper toward recession territory Thursday, compounding concerns about the global recovery after signs of slowing manufacturing in China.

title: City Criticizes Police Chief After Shooting
description: MIAMI  Facing mounting protests over the shooting death of an unarmed black teenager by a neighborhood watch volunteer, the Sanford City Commission voted on Wednesday that they had no confidence in the citys police chief.

title: Justices Allow Challenge to E.P.A. Control of Wetlands
description: The Supreme Court ruled unanimously on Wednesday that an Idaho couple had the right to file an immediate court challenge to a federal Environmental Protection Agency decision designating their property as wetlands and forbidding them from building a home there.

title: Tebow Pledges to Put Team First With Jets
description: There was a moment during the Jets internal discussions about Tim Tebow when General Manager Mike Tannenbaum looked at his coach, Rex Ryan, and his new offensive coordinator, Tony Sparano, and a thought washed over him. Both coaches were left dazed last season by a patented last-minute comeback by the Tebow-led Denver Broncos, Ryan on Nov. 17, and Sparano, formerly of the Miami Dolphins, on Oct. 23.

title: NYT Front Page for 03/22/2012
description: NYT Front Page for 03/22/2012

title: House G.O.P. Budget Riles Some on the Right, and Democrats See a Campaign Issue
description: WASHINGTON  House Republicans pressed forward on Wednesday with a politically freighted budget and tax plan, taking fire from the left and the right, as well as from the powerful senior citizens lobby, AARP, which said the plan lacks balance and jeopardizes the health and economic security of older Americans.

title: Challenge to Gay Marriage Fails in New Hampshire
description: CONCORD, N.H.  An attempt to repeal New Hampshires same-sex marriage law failed on Wednesday in the House of Representatives, with members of the Republican-dominated chamber voting 211-116 to kill the bill.

title: Court Appears to Be Wary Hearing Free-Speech Case
description: WASHINGTON  The Supreme Court on Wednesday seemed unsympathetic to the claims of a protester who said his free speech rights had been violated when Secret Service agents protecting Vice President Dick Cheney arrested him after he made critical remarks about the Bush administrations war policies.

title: To Cut Costs, Postal Service Turns to Rural Stores
description: WASHINGTON  The Postal Service, which has proposed closing 3,700 offices, is setting up services inside small grocery stores as it tries to maintain service while trimming billions of dollars in costs.

title: White Teenager Who Drove Over and Killed Black Man Is Sentenced to Life
description: ATLANTA  Deryl Dedmon, a white teenager who drove a pickup truck over a black man in the parking lot of a Jackson, Miss., motel, pleaded guilty to murder on Wednesday and was sent to prison for life.

title: Liter by Liter, Indians Get Cleaner Water
description: As evening falls in Chuddani, a village of about 500 homes, 45 kilometers, or 28 miles, from Delhi, people arrive by bicycle, motorbike, tractor and on foot with jugs that they fill with water from faucets outside a neat blue shed, Amy Yee writes in The International Herald Tribune.

title: U.S. Exempts Some From Iran Oil Sanctions, but not India
description: The Obama administration on Tuesday exempted Japan and 10 European nations from the prospect of biting sanctions intended to punish countries that continue to buy oil from Iran, but it left open the fate of other major importers, including China, India and South Korea, Steven Lee Myers writes in The New York Times.

title: Naming Your India Book: A Pocket Guide
description: On 05 May Faber is publishing the new book from Oliver Balch, India Rising: Tales from a Changing Nation. Im attaching information but in brief, Balch has traveled India in search of the human stories behind the countrys huge expansion and booming economy.   E-mailed press release, March 21

title: New York State Draft Report on Abuse
description: The report was commissioned by Gov. Andrew M. Cuomo in response to The Timess investigation of abuse, neglect and fraud at state homes for the developmentally disabled.

title: State Faults Care for the Disabled
description: ALBANY  Nearly 300,000 disabled and mentally ill New Yorkers face a needless risk of harm because of conflicting regulations, a lack of oversight and even disagreements over what constitutes abuse, according to a draft state report obtained by The New York Times.

title: News Quiz | March 22, 2012
description: See what you know about the news below. To prepare, you might scan the articles or summaries on todays front page. Good luck!

title: Hunt Called Off for Thousands of U.S. Soldiers in North Korea
description: HONG KONG  There are 5,500 missing American soldiers buried in North Korea. Buried, of course, is not exactly the right word.

title: Suspect in French Killings Slain as Police Storm Apartment After 30-Hour Siege
description: TOULOUSE, France  Mohammed Merah, a 23-year-old former garage mechanic who claimed responsibility for the brutal slayings of four men and three children, was shot dead on Thursday when security forces stormed the apartment where he had barricaded himself for more than 30 hours.

title: March 22, 1972 | Equal Rights Amendment for Women Passed by Congress
description: On March 22, 1972, the Senate passed the Equal Rights Amendment to the United States Constitution, which proposed banning discrimination based on sex. The E.R.A. was sent to the states for ratification, but it would fall short of the three-fourths approval needed.

title: Test Yourself | English, March 22, 2012
description: This question was written by Shannon Doyne. It comes from the article In Suns Glow, Its Still Business, but Not as Usual.

title: Must-Have Gadgets for the Kitchen? Think Again
description: WHO is Gail Simmons?

title: Soldiers Overthrow Mali Government in Setback for Democracy in Africa
description: DAKAR, Senegal  Soldiers in Mali, a West African nation often cited as a democratic model, overthrew the elected government on Thursday, looted the presidential palace, arrested ministers and declared that they had seized power.

title: Post-Traumatic Stresss Surprisingly Positive Flip Side
description: Sgt. Jeffrey Beltran pulled a heavily creased Post-it note from the pocket of his fatigues, unfolded it and looked over a list he jotted down earlier that day: pick up an order of beef lo mein, take his dress uniform to work (jacket, pants and boots), do schoolwork. Beltrans Army-issue organizer is also filled with these reminders, and he checks them every so often to jog his memory  folding and unfolding them throughout the day. Beltrans life is filled with sticky notes because his short-term memory is no longer reliable, a result of what the Army calls a mild traumatic brain injury that he suffered in an I.E.D. attack in Iraq in 2005.

title: The Limits of American Exceptionalism
description: Simon Johnson is the Ronald A. Kurtz Professor of Entrepreneurship at the M.I.T. Sloan School of Management and co-author of White House Burning: The Founding Fathers, Our National Debt, and Why It Matters to You.

title: A Hard Trek to Humility
description: Time operates curiously in Afghanistans remote and inhospitable Wakhan Corridor. Tucked away in the countrys northeastern corner, the regions 12,000 residents live very much the same as their ancestors did centuries ago.

title: N.F.L.s Full Report on Discipline for Saints
description: Any hopes the Saints had of becoming the first N.F.L. team to play in the Super Bowl on their home field inSuper Bowl XLVIIdisintegrated with todays news. Jeff Duncan, Nola.com

title: Whats the Coolest Thing Youve Ever Seen in a Museum?
description: Yes, weve asked this question before, back in 2010, but we loved the answers we got. Inspired by a recent special section on museums, were asking again. Have you ever been to a science, art, history or childrens museum? What are some of the most interesting or memorable things you saw there? Why?

title: On Hunting for Scholarships, and Coming Up Empty
description: I am still sitting at my desk, pondering the decisions Ive made in my application process. I am still logging in to my different student accounts to check my application status, and of course. I am still waiting. Beside me on my white desk are two large books that will play a heavy role in deciding the school I will eventually attend: Petersons Scholarships, Grants & Prizes and College Boards Getting Financial Aid.

title: The Early Word: Etch A Sketch
description: In Todays Times:With an endorsement in hand from former Gov. Jeb Bush of Florida, Mitt Romney is seeking to rally the Republican establishment around what his campaign sees as his inevitable nomination so he can get on with the task of challenging President Obama, Jeff Zeleny and Jim Rutenberg write.But even as Mr. Romney tried on Wednesday to parlay the endorsement from Mr. Bush into wider gains, a campaign aide made a remark that turned into a major distraction, comparing the campaigns pivot from the primary campaign to the general election to an Etch A Sketch.

title: Tim Tebow Speaks About Trade to  Jets
description: One of Tim Tebows main goals is to spread the word of God. He has been given the biggest stagein the country in which to do it: New York.

title: Sean Payton Meets Enemy: Its Us
description: Coach Sean Payton had reportedly been expecting a four-game ban and was very upset by the season-long suspension over the Saints bounty system. If hes moved to pass blame, he should look not at Commissioner Roger Goodell but rather to the American people. (This after he first looks in the mirror, of course.)

title: Caramelized Endive Soup With Blue Cheese
description: Time: 45 minutes.

title: Hangop met Boerenjongens (Drained Buttermilk With Soaked Raisins)
description: Time: About 24 hours, largely unattended.

title: Old-Fashioned Dutch Hutspot (Potato-and-Carrot Mash) With Brisket
description: Time: 3 hours or more, largely unattended.

title: Who Doesnt Love Boerenjongens?
description: When I was in the Netherlands, looking for someone with whom I could cook Dutch, I expected to find a grandmother. You know, some kind of stolid old-timer to show me the way of traditional Dutch home cooking. Yet I kept being steered by friends and journalists to the 43-year-old food writer Janneke Vreugdenhil, who grew up near Rotterdam and now lives in The Hague.

title: Watching Mad Men With My Mother
description: My mom didnt watch Mad Men. Despite the insistence of television critics, her bohemian friends, my siblings and myself, she held out. Your father and I watched the first episode, she said. It was slow. She shrugged. I shrugged it off, too  until we went shopping together at Banana Republic. I had taken her there to drop a hint about what I wanted for my birthday, happily trying on dresses from the Mad Men collection, frocks in bright floral prints with skirts as wide as bells or as tight as snakeskin. I twirled.

title: A Business Coach Joins the Business Group (and Raises the Vision Thing)
description: At the last meeting of our business group, we were joined by Susan Martin, a business coach who has worked with entrepreneurs for 12 years. Before becoming a coach, she ran her own sweater design and manufacturing company. Based on her experience and those of other entrepreneurs, Ms. Martin finds thatowners often become mired in the minutiae of running their businesses, neglecting their long-term visions for their companies. The result can be working in a business that doesnt meet your needs.

title: Debate Is Over on Tebows True Value
description: Last seasons relentless arguments over Tim Tebow are finally, decisively over.

title: P.T.S.D. Can Yield Positive, Yet Sometimes Deadly, Results
description: Just as my story about the Armys program designed to help boost resilience in soldiers was approaching its final edit for The Times Magazine, news broke of the killing of 16 Afghan civilians by an American soldier. As details emerged, and Staff Sgt. Robert Bales was accused of committing this atrocity, I was stuck by the similarities between him and many of the soldiers I interviewed for this article.

title: Sea Lions and Sustainable Development
description: Aliette Frank, a postdoctoral scholar at Royal Roads University, explores sustainable community development on the coast of British Columbia.

title: Why Choose a Womens College?
description: Debora L. Spar is the current President of Barnard College, a liberal arts college for women affiliated with Columbia University, located in New York City. Founded in 1889, Barnard attempts to give young women both the intimate setting provided by a small liberal arts college, and the resources of a large university. Debora Spar became President of Barnard College in 2008 after a teaching career at Harvard Business School. Spar is the also the author of six books and numerous articles. She recently visited the Cathedral and John Connon School in Mumbai, where she spoke to students from ten different institutions.

title: Why We Look to Distinguish Robert Bales From Mohammed Merah
description: LONDON  Misfit, lunatic or cold-bloodied terrorist? As the presumed Toulouse serial killer Mohammed Merah died during a police raid on Thursday, France was searching for the true motivation behind his murderous rampage.

title: Watson Nears $6.6 Billion Deal for Actavis
description: Watson Pharmaceuticals is expected to bid as much as 5 billion euros ($6.6 billion) for the Swiss drug maker Actavis Group in a deal that would create one of the worlds largest generic drug manufacturers, according to people with direct knowledge of the matter.

title: Coyotes in New York City: A Bonus?
description: In March 2010, a wild coyote led the police on a chase through Lower Manhattan. The vagabond was ultimately caught in a parking lot in TriBeCa.

title: Romney Campaign Gaffe Steps on Good News, Again
description: If Mitt Romneys Etch A Sketch moment on Wednesday taught his campaign anything, its probably this: There is little room for missteps.

title: Tested by a Picturesque Dystopia
description: Theres a short anxious scene in the new film The Hunger Games when its 16-year-old heroine, Katniss Everdeen (Jennifer Lawrence), races through a deep, dark forest; falls down a hill; and rolls and rolls, only to rise up and thrust herself again into the unknown. Katniss, the lethally tough linchpin from Suzanne Collinss trilogy and now a rather less imposing film heroine, is a teenage survivalist in a postapocalyptic take on a familiar American myth. When she runs through that forest, and even when she falls, theres something of the American frontiersman in her, as if she were Natty Bumppo reborn and resexed.

title: Examples Show That Tebow Could Make Sanchez Better
description: Chase Stuart is a contributor to SmartFootball.com, Footballguys.com and Pro-Football-Reference.com.

title: A Conversation With: Former Railways Minister Dinesh Trivedi
description: Dinesh Trivedi, the now ex-railways minister, proposed an increase in passenger fares last week citing safety and modernization of the railways as primary concerns. The move resulted in his dismissal by West Bengal chief minister and his boss, Mamata Banerjee, who said the fare increase was unacceptable and demanded a rollback.

title: Morning Take-Out
description: TOP STORIES

title: Quinn's Quest for 'Kindergarten for All'
Indias Archives: How Did Things Get This Bad?
description: Why has modern India had such a difficult time preserving its history?

title: Opinion Report: Stand Your Ground
description: From the editorial page

title: Bain Affiliate to Buy Leveraged Loans From Lloyds
description: LONDON  Sankaty Advisors, a unit of the private equity firm Bain Capital, agreed on Thursday to buy a portfolio of leveraged loans from the Lloyds Banking Group with a value of 500 million, or $793 million.

title: Thursday Reading: Early Spring Brings Pollen and Pests
description: A variety of consumer-focused articles appears daily in The New York Times and on our blogs. Each weekday morning, we gather them together here so you can quickly scan the news that could hit you in your wallet.

title: Styled to a T | Oeuffice
description: The Guys

title: With a Third Title, Cornell Wrestler Kyle Dake Records a First
description: At the N.C.A.A. tournament in St. Louis last weekend, Cornell junior Kyle Dake became the first wrestler to win three national titles in three weight classes. Wrestling at 157 pounds for the Big Red, Dake went 35-0 this season. Last season he won the title at 149 pounds and as freshman he took it at 141 pounds.

title: To Stop Iran, the G.O.P. Should Back Obama
description: These days, Republicans are seizing every opportunity to hammer President Obama for both high gas prices and his Iran policy.

title: Producers Exit Adds to Uncertainty at The Office
description: The executive reshuffling and air of uncertainty that have lately dominated Dunder Mifflin are now a behind-the-scenes reality at The Office as well. Paul Lieberstein, the show runner on that NBC sitcom (who also plays the twitchy human resources officer, Toby Flenderson), is preparing to leave the series to work on an Office spinoff, The Hollywood Reporter said.

title: A Balancing Act for the Police Department
description: In the binary system offered by Machiavelli  it is better to be feared than loved, if you cannot be both  the New York Police Department loses on either count.

title: Teslas Ambitions Fueled by Customer Down Payments
description: After reading about Tesla Motors new electric sedan three years ago, Rob Stelling drove 100 miles to the carmakers showroom in Menlo Park, Calif., and put down $40,000 in cash to make an early reservation for the Model S.

title: Introducing the Romney Magic Numbers Calculator
description: The Republican nomination race, as we have noted, has become less a battle between Mitt Romney and Rick Santorum  and more one between Mr. Romney and the math: how certain is Mr. Romney to reach the 1,144 delegates required to clinch the nomination before the convention in Tampa, Fla., and when will he do it?

title: The Breakfast Meeting: A Serious Turn for Etch A Sketch and the Muppets
description: The comment on CNN by a senior adviser to Mitt Romney that the candidate would be like an Etch A Sketch, easily resetting his campaign for the general election, became an instant Internet meme. The distraction from the comment, made Wednesday morning, had serious consequences for Mr. Romney, Jeff Zeleny and Jim Rutenberg write: it shifted the focus from his argument that he had, in effect, won the nomination with his victory in Illinois on Tuesday. And it diluted the lift he received from the endorsement by Jeb Bush on Wednesday. By the end of the day there were interactive Web sites, mocking Twitter hashtags, a Web ad for Democrats, Sarah Wheaton writes; also, Mr. Romneys opponents, Rick Santorum and Newt Gingrich, brought Etch A Sketch toys to their campaign events.

title: Clip: 'The Raid: Redemption'
description: A scene from the martial arts film "The Raid: Redemption," directed by Gareth Evans.

title: For Indian Women, Divorce Is a Raw Deal
description: Much has been written about divorce being on the rise in India, sometimes accompanied by hand-wringing about the egos and inflexibility of younger couples, who seem less willing than their parents to stay in marriages they are not happy with.

title: On Our Radar: A Very Warm March
description: Gambling that no frosts will materialize, some farmers are taking advantage of the warmest March since record-keeping began to plant what they hope will be bumper crops. [Reuters]

title: Surface Tension Revisited
description: Using a little math, a few partial dry runs and Google street view, the New York Times revisited the route taken in the 1968 Hollis Frampton film Surface Tension.

title: Following, and Filming, in Hollis Framptons Footsteps
description: By now youre either with us or not in our recent obsession with the filmmaker Hollis Framptons Surface Tension, in which he captured 1968 Manhattan in 160 seconds of stop-motion.

title: Morning Buzz, March 22: A 32-Year-Old Case Is Solved
description: Good morning. Today will be mostly sunny and climb to 75 degrees, which means you can celebrate thisInternational Goof-Off Dayproperly: outside.

title: Goldmans Muppet Scan and the Innocent E-Mails
description: In an odd footnote to the Greg Smith fracas, Reuters reports that Goldman Sachs has started scanning internal e-mails for instances of the term muppet and other derogatory phrases.

title: Image of the Day: March 22
Eye Candy | Supreme Beings
description: var data;function jsonSlideshowCallback(response){data = response;}NYTD.options = {source: data,cropType: 'blog480',appendTo: 'fullScreenSlideShow',showHeadLine: 'false', renderstyle: "embeddedSlideShowTmag"}

title: What Were Reading
description: The New York Daily News: The feds say pink slime (in meat shown above, right)  filler made from beef scraps and connective tissue  is safe and not all that prevalent. But the New York City schools are banning it all the same, following the example of McDonalds and Taco Bell.  Patrick Farrell

title: Poetry Pairing | Secret Life
description: This weeks Poetry Pairing matches Li-Young Lees Secret Life with a March 20 City Room blog post, Spring Comes to a City Woodland.

title: Images of French Gunman Joyriding in 2010 Broadcast on French Television
