description: Updated | 11:59 a.m. As my colleagues Scott Sayare, Steven Erlanger and Richard Berry report, the 23-year-old Frenchman who claimed responsibility for killing four men and three children died on Thursday, after jumping from a window as security forces stormed the apartment in Toulouse where he had been holed up, the French interior minister said.

title: The Politics of Nostalgia
description: JOHANNESBURG  Nostalgia for former President Thabo Mbeki is washing over South Africa these days. A book about his presidency by the civil servant who ran his office sold out before it even hit the shelves last week. Weeks earlier, a prominent Sunday newspaper had boldly asserted on its front page, Mbeki Is Back.

title: Daily Report: Watching Twitter Use
description: While Twitter has become an enormously influential communication tool around the world, especially with marketers, Wall Street firms are wary of it because of regulatory concerns, reports William Alden in The New York Timess DealBook.

title: Photo Essays From the Magazine
description: Slide shows by renowned photographers.

title: CME Board to Shrink  to 30 Directors
description: Many hands make light work, but the CME Group seems to have decided that theres a limit, at least in the boardroom. The Chicago-based exchange plans to pare down its unusually large board  to an expected 30 members after its May 23 annual meeting, from 32 today.

title: Groundwater Crisis Unfolds in Times Square
description: To mark World Water Day, digital animations conveying the gravity of global declines in groundwater just went on display on two billboards in Times Square. The animations, based on satellite data provided by NASA and the University of California, Irvine, and statistics from the United States Geological Survey, will be shown several times each hour through April 22.

title: NYSE Wont Appeal E.U. Rejection of Deutsche Borse Merger
description: While Deutsche Brse is appealing European antitrust regulators rejection of its planned merger with NYSE Euronext, its would-be partner wont join the legal battle.

title: Chinese Lawyers Chafe at New Oath to Communist Party
description: BEIJING  Chinas Justice Ministry has issued a requirement that new lawyers and those reapplying for licenses swear an oath of loyalty to the Communist Party, another step in a campaign to rein in lawyers who continue to challenge the political and legal systems by which the party maintains power.

title: Business Day Live | March 22, 2012
description: FedEx agrees to settle bias case; Tesla Motors' interesting approach to financing its operations; and an end to easy money, as interest rates rise.

title: Construction Worker Killed in Building Collapse in Manhattan
description: A construction worker died Thursday after a century-old, two-story warehouse under demolition as part of Columbia Universitys expansion collapsed in a hail of concrete, bricks and steel that engulfed three workers.

title: Business Day Live: Financing an Electric Car
description: FedEx agrees to settle bias case; Tesla Motors interesting approach to financing its operations; and an end to easy money, as interest rates rise.

title: Room for Growth
description: A look at New York Universitys proposed building plans for their superblock near Washington Square Park in Greenwich Village.

title: A Land-Use Battle
description: New York Universitys latest expansion plan has inspired neighborhood protests.

title: Common Sense in New Hampshire
description: When David Bates, a New Hampshire state representative, first introduced a bill aimed at overturning the states marriage equality law, he was dismissive of public opinion polling that showed about 60 percent of New Hampshire residents opposed repeal.

title: Painting by Numbers, to Whitney Biennial
description: San Francisco

title: Color and Light
description: A look at the work of the artist Andrew Masullo.

title: Another Etch A Sketch Gaffe?
description: 5:12 p.m. | Updated Etch A Sketch, a toy known to generations of children, makes it easy to wipe away the past. There is an investor who might wish he or she could use it to void a trade made Thursday.

title: Dont Cry for Her, Argentina; She Landed the Big Role
description: EVITAS tend to be formidable women  Patti LuPone, Madonna, Elaine Paige  so Elena Roger, the Argentine actress who stars in the Broadway revival that opens April 5, stuns at first glimpse.

title: Spotted on the Street | Hazel Honeysuckle
description: The Girl:  Hazel Honeysuckle, a burlesque performer, pinup/fashion model and graphic designer.

title: Chronicling Americans Comeback From the Great Recession
description: The Great Recession has officially been over since June 2009, but a slow recovery and lingering unemployment continue to pose challenges for many Americans. On Thursday, the crew of Your Money told some of these stories from around the country in a special section, The Comeback Chronicles.

title: Motherlode Book Club Video: Anne and Sam Lamott on His Unexpected Fatherhood
description: Sam, I asked, Whats the first thing your mom said to you when you told her Amy was pregnant?

title: Amid Threats, BMW Guggenheim Lab Withdraws Plan for Installation in Berlin Neighborhood
description: The BMW Guggenheim Lab, a touring think tank of sorts that stopped on New Yorks Lower East Side last summer, is devoted to exploring issues of future cities. But in Berlin, the project has run up against an issue very much of the present: gentrification.

title: Video of Mali Coup Announcement
description: As my colleague Adam Nossiter reports, junior army officers took control of the presidential palace and a television station in the West African state of Mali in what appeared to be a coup attempt.

title: Dubai to Build Modern Art Museum and Opera House
description: In 2008 Dubai announced plans to build a series of cultural projects including libraries, theaters, museums and an opera house. But when the global economic crisis hit that year, the projects stalled.

title: Northwestern Lacrosse Stars Provide Two-Way Dominance
description: EVANSTON, Ill.  Remember Tim Tebows Heisman season for Florida? The quarterback dominated the Southeastern Conference, tearing down records held by both quarterbacks and running backs.

title: But I Love My Pizza Stone: Defending the Dismissed Gadgets
description: We asked readers to share their regrets about the kitchen gadgets they bought with enthusiasm, only to abandon them soon afterward. Hundreds of comments and tweets later, a few tools have turned up over and over again, tools that other cooks may rely on, even cherish: pizza stones, food processors, mandolines, pasta machines, bread makers, slow cookers, rice cookers, garlic presses, copper pots and pans and ice cream makers.

title: How Far Would You Go for a Financial Comeback?
description: How far would you go to pull yourself and your family back from the financial brink? Thats the question I explored for an article that appears in the Comeback Chronicles, in the special Your Money section on Thursday.

title: Another Gaffe at Etch A Sketch?
description: The day after an aide to Mitt Romney referred to Etch A Sketch in what was widely viewed as a gaffe, the stock traded for its highest price in eight years. It is at least possible that the buyer did not understand how rare that was  or what a high price he or she was paying, Floyd Norris reports for The Timess Economix blog. Read more

title: It Riles a Village
description: I WENT to find my aunt Ruth in Judson Church among the disgruntled at a public hearing last month about New York Universitys latest proposal to expand its Greenwich Village campus. It was a couple of weeks before the local community board denounced the proposal outright. A light mist was falling. I climbed the church steps. Beyond the long tables, where children drew with crayons, a bobbing sea of homemade placards demanded, Flowers Not Towers.

title: The Case of the Talkative Parrot
description: Between raucous beach crowds and demented traffic, Miami wasnt an obvious choice for a writing retreat. But when my husband and I came here on vacation 12 years ago, I felt it capture me, a jinns twist from the bottle. I fell for the emerald drip of palm fronds, the braiding scents of gardenia and plumeria. We bought a house on a quiet street. Our neighbors played daylong tournaments of dominoes in the backyard, the hours marked by the slapping of tiles. Blocks away at the Biltmore, the quinceaeras posed beside the turquoise pool, dressed in their whipped-cream gowns. And we settled in, happy with our decision.

title: Shes Gone Missing
description: I gawk at the chair where Id left Mom waiting for me. Shes gone. I scan the lounge, a midsize room of muted grays and whites. Theres a disheveled young man stretched out on the blue sofa, a few students eating lunch at the tables, a row of anonymous computer stations by the wall. Panic flutters in my throat.

title: Michigan Basketball Defections May Include Burke
description: The optimistic glow that had enveloped Michigans mens basketball team in the final weeks of the season has quickly faded, after a poor showing and loss in the first round of the N.C.A.A. tournament and now the news of three players transferring and one thinking of bolting early to the N.B.A.

title: Former Goldman Employees Form Union in Japan
description: TOKYO  A Goldman Sachs employee on Thursday recounted in a faltering voice how he toiled away in the back offices of the banks Japanese operations for nearly a decade before being told last year that his job was being eliminated.

title: Greeces Sovereign Debt Lesson
description: The credit default swaps auction on Monday drew a curtain on Act 1 of the Greek sovereign debt drama.

title: At Delta Terminal, Restaurants Line Up for Takeoff
description: As part of its expanded presence in New York, Delta Air Lines has taken over Terminal C at La Guardia Airport  the former U.S. Airways terminal, adjacent to its own Terminal D, and is adding a huge roster of restaurants, cafes and takeout spots, many steered by big-name chefs.

title: An Ad That Never Was
description: An ad created by George W. Bushs team in 2000 featured the comedian Ben Stein reprising his role from Ferris Buellers Day Off and mocking Al Gores accomplishments in a pop quiz.

title: Unaired D.N.C. Ad
description: An unaired ad from the 2000 presidential campaign that featured a song titled "The Ballad of George W. Bush."

title: Unaired McCain-Palin Ad
description: An unaired ad from John McCain's 2008 presidential run attacked Barack Obama for never serving in the military.

title: Business Day Live | Tesla Financing
description: March 22, 2012 - Tesla Motors' interesting approach to financing its operations.

title: Guilty Plea Expected in New York Housing Agency Bribery Case
description: A former senior official at the New York City agency that helps build affordable housing is expected to plead guilty on Friday to charges related to accepting $600,000 in bribes and kickbacks.

title: In Defense of Boomerang Kids
description: Boomerang kids  those young adults who left the family home only to move back in because they cant make it on their own  have gotten a bad rap.

title: Behind the Action of The Raid: Redemption
description: In the Indonesian action thriller The Raid: Redemption, a SWAT team gets more than it bargained for when it raids an apartment building in the slums of Jakarta to take down a drug lord. The gangsters and thugs who inhabit the building wont go down without a fight, or several of them. The action mixes martial arts with gunplay, and throws in a few machete swings for good measure. The film has been winning over genre enthusiasts on the film festival circuit, playing at Toronto, Sundance and South by Southwest. Before its release on Friday, it will have two screenings tonight as part of the New Directors/New Films festival in New York.

title: Digital Notes: Spotify Adds Apps, and Kim Dotcom Gets His Benz Back
description: More Spotify Apps: Last year, Spotify introduced a dozen or so apps to make browsing for music easier on the service (and also to make it look more like iTunes). On Thursday, 12 more apps arrive, most from record labels and distributors promoting their music, including Sony Legacy; the Warner Music Group; Def Jam; and the indies Domino and Matador. Also among the new apps: the Complete Collection, which displays full album artwork and liner notes; TweetVine, which makes playlists from Twitter trends; and Classify, a guide to classical music from X5, a maker of digital compilations.

title: Red Meat Blues
description: A question that Im constantly asked by people who know that I spent more than five years as The Timess restaurant critic is what my most memorable meal was. Its impossible to single one out. But a dozen or so experiences indeed eclipsed the others, and they included an evening at Alain Ducasse at the Essex House, a Manhattan restaurant that has since closed. I recall the night so vividly because it was such an insanely over-the-top paean to the farthest reaches of fatty excess.

title: RIMs BlackBerry Dethroned by Apple on Its Home Turf
description: Research in Motion can no longer say Theres no place like home. The BlackBerry maker is losing adoring fans in its own territory, Canada, to Apples iPhone.

title: Gregory Doran Named New Artistic Director of Royal Shakespeare Company
description: After a six-month search for a new artistic director, the Royal Shakespeare Company has chosen Gregory Doran, who has been affiliated with the ensemble, first as an actor and then as a stage director, since 1987.

title: Orcel to Join UBS as Co-Head of Investment Banking
description: LONDON  Andrea Orcel, the chairman of global banking and markets at Bank of America, has been tapped to be the co-head of investment banking at UBS, the bank announced on Thursday.

title: The Real Artists of Marfa | AdventuresOf
description: var data;function jsonSlideshowCallback(response){data = response;}NYTD.options = {source: data,cropType: 'blog480',appendTo: 'fullScreenSlideShow',showHeadLine: 'false', renderstyle: "embeddedSlideShowTmag"}

title: Are the Good Times Never Coming Back?
description: There is growing chatter in economics circles about the unsettling possibility that the nation may never recover completely from the recent recession.

title: Wright Talks About Chipper Joness Retirement Announcement
description: PORT ST. LUCIE, Fla.  David Wright on Thursday expressed his longtime admiration for Chipper Jones, who announced earlier in the day that he would retire after the 2012 season.

title: In Oklahoma, Obama Declares Pipeline Support
description: RIPLEY, Okla.  President Obama stood in a red-dirt field before acres of stacked pipeline pieces on Thursday to illustrate his support for expedited construction of the southern leg of the Keystone XL oil pipeline. But his public declaration for the project pleased neither the industry and its Republican allies nor environmentalists.

title: TimesCast | March 22, 2012
description: The French slaying suspect is killed | Soldiers declare a coup in Mali | The rising cost of youth sports.

title: 36 Hours: Vientiane, Laos
description: Now is the time to explore this citys small-town charms before it joins the modern world.

title: 36 Hours in Vientiane, Laos
description: NESTLED in a curve of the Mekong River, Vientiane, Laos, is a place where monks in orange robes outnumber tourists, and French colonial roofs and gilded temples form the skyline. Along the dusty streets of the capital of Laos, youre more likely to spot a polished Volkswagen bug puttering along than a traffic jam. And in the town center, butterflies and birds flutter among the frangipanis. But with the recent introduction of more international flights, several ambitious infrastructural and commercial projects, and an increasingly cosmopolitan restaurant and cafe scene, Vientiane is quickly changing. Now is the time to explore the citys small-town charms before it joins the modern world.

title: U.S. Coach Is Going From Sonnets to Scrums
description: Mike Tolkin, the newly appointed head coach of the United States mens national rugby team, steps in front of his audience and begins speaking.

title: In Resolution, U.N. Council Presses Sri Lanka on Civilian Deaths
description: GENEVA  The United Nations Human Rights Council passed an American-backed resolution on Thursday pressing the Sri Lankan government to investigate the deaths of tens of thousands of civilians in the final stages of the civil war with the Tamil Tigers.

title: U.S. Intelligence Report Warns of Global Water Tensions
description: WASHINGTON  The American intelligence community warned in a report released Thursday that problems with water could destabilize countries in North Africa, the Middle East and South Asia over the next decade.

title: Leading Off: Seeing Good in the Tebow Trade
description: As Dinah Washington once sang, what a difference a day makes (you can assess the Esther Phillips uptempo version here, if you want). Aftera Wednesday afternoon of sniping and head-scratching about the trade of Tim Tebow to the Jets (not to mention a little suspense over whether the deal would actually get done), the mood definitely took a Tim turn.

title: 7-Year Manhunt Ends in Rural Australia
description: SYDNEY  A police raid in an isolated stretch of the Australian outback early Thursday morning led to the capture of one of the countrys most wanted men, a murder suspect who had evaded arrest for nearly seven years by hiding out and living rough in some of the regions most inhospitable land.

title: How a Retired Couples Portfolio Weathered the Recession
description: Back in 2008 and 2009, when the financial markets seemed as if they might tumble indefinitely, it took a lot of discipline to remain invested  particularly if you were retired or nearing retirement.

title: Learning From Other Patients
description: Several years ago, I was invited to give a lecture to a group of patients who had received organ transplants at the hospital where I was working. The evening started well  patients I had cared for greeted me warmly, and everyone seemed interested in the talk I had prepared. But as soon as I was finished, the audience started asking questions, and I began to feel a creeping sense of doubt about my performance.

title: Steven Millhauser Wins Prize for Short Stories
description: Steven Millhauser won the Story Prize on Wednesday for his collection We Others, a book that the judges called a powerful and intriguing collection of stories, marked by page after page of beautifully written, intelligent and sensitive prose. The award, which is given annually to the author of an outstanding collection of short fiction, is accompanied by a $20,000 prize. Mr. Millhauser, who teaches at Skidmore College, is the author of several short story collections and seven novels, including Martin Dressler, for which he won a Pulitzer Prize in 1997.

title: Looks Arent Everything, but They Make College Acceptance Letters More Enticing
description: Over the past few weeks I have been meticulously checking my mail, both physical and digital, and so far I am extremely happy with the results. I have been accepted into all of my SUNYs (Stony, Geneseo, Binghamton and University at Buffalo) and still wait for the privates (Vassar and Wesleyan). As for CUNYs, I have been accepted into Hunter, Baruch, City College and Brooklyn. But, I have been accepted through regular decision and not into the Macaulay Honors program, which makes finances of greater importance.

title: Senate Passes Start-Ups Bill, With Amendments
description: WASHINGTON  Depending on who is speaking, a bill approved by the Senate on Thursday to make it easier for small companies to raise money will either improve the economy by creating jobs or cause unwitting investors to get swindled.

title: G.M. Tries to Understand a New Generation
description: To help General Motors adapt to young car buyers, researchers at MTV Scratch talked to thousands of people from the so-called millennial generation about their impressions of cars, technology and what makes them different from their parents generation. Watch a few of the research interviews that informed Scratchs five-year strategic plan for Chevrolet.

title: As Young Lose Interest in Cars, G.M. Turns to MTV for Help
description: DETROIT  Ross Martin, 37, is a published poet and a former drummer in an alternative rock band. Wearing Nike high tops and loosefitting jeans, he is the kind of figure who wouldnt attract a second glance on the streets of Brooklyn, where he lives.

title: Notes From a New Zealand Newbie
description: Compared with the culture recalibration required of Americans when they travel to some far-off parts of the world, arriving in New Zealand is a rather smooth experience. Kiwi society functions in a way both recognizable and reassuring to Americans: everyone speaks English, people shake hands when they meet, and they eat bacon and eggs for breakfast. There is no bowing or cheek-kissing or shoulder-covering or rampant unpunctuality to get used to. New Zealanders even call soccer soccer. (The sport played by hand  and foot  with an oblong ball is rugby.)

title: 15-Year Inquiry Faults Ex-Leader and Finds Corruption Widespread in Irish Politics
description: DUBLIN  After 15 years of hearings, a tribunal in Ireland has concluded that corruption affected every level of Irish political life and that a former prime minister, Bertie Ahern, had failed to tell the truth about more than $275,000 he received while in office. But the tribunal said it could not conclude that Mr. Ahern had taken bribes.

title: Insider Trading Ban for Lawmakers Clears Congress
description: WASHINGTON  The Senate gave final approval on Thursday to an ethics bill that bans insider trading by members of Congress, clearing the measure for President Obama, who called for such legislation in his State of the Union address two months ago.

title: Unaired Negative Bain Ad
description: An ad from Ted Kennedys 1992 Senate campaign attacked Mitt Romney over his tenure at Bain capital.

title: Right Message. Wrong Messenger.
description: In December, Senator Dick Durbin introduced legislation that would authorize the televising of oral arguments before the Supreme Court. It went nowhere. Yesterday, Sen. Kirsten Gillibrand called on lawmakers to approve the bill, saying that accountability doesnt end with Congress or the President.

title: Transatlantic Recovery Stories
description: Just a thought: the latest conservative line is that America may be recovering, but the recovery would be much faster if it werent for Obama. Also, the same people believe that the Cameron government in the UK is wonderful, and we should be doing austerity here too.

title: A Superstar Standard
description: The song I Dont Know How to Love Him, from the Andrew Lloyd Webber-Tim Rice musical Jesus Christ Superstar, has crossed over from the world of musical theater to become a standard covered by singers from the worlds of jazz, pop and rock.

title: Seeking a Sustainable Path for Coffee, and Coffee Farmers, in Haiti
description: Todd Carmichael, a founder of the coffee roaster La Colombe Torrefaction, is an interesting mix of entrepreneur, adventurer (Antarctic speed trekker), showman (a reality TV show on coffee hunting is coming) and philanthropist. His latest venture combining all of these traits is a line of coffee, called Lyon, sales of which will generate money for environmental initiatives supported by the Leonardo DiCaprio Foundation. The coffee blend includes beans that Carmichael is obtaining from Haitian sources that, he says, sidestep predatory loan sharks and middlemen who have hampered the climb out of poverty by Haitian coffee growers. I recently had an e-mail exchange with Carmichael about his experience building relationships with coffee growers in rural Haiti.

title: The Etch A Sketch Doctrine
description: Gail Collins: David, Mitt Romney won big in Illinois. Does this mean we dont have to talk about Rick Santorum and Newt Gingrich anymore? I have to admit Im getting pretty tired of them.

title: Reading Transtromer
description: To the Editor:

title: Rezzori and Cervantes
description: To the Editor:

title: A Not-So-New Genre
description: To the Editor:

title: Chinese Art? All Roads Lead to Hong Kong
description: FROM the moment you walk into the annual spring sale, there is a tension, bracing even for Hong Kong. Money, beauty and power mingle; paddles flash as serene Song dynasty bowls and exuberant Ming vases go under the gavel for millions of dollars.

title: The Irish Model Continues to Shine
description: Remember how Irelands vigorous recovery proved Keynesian economics  and smarty-pants Keynesian economists  wrong?

title: Behind the Scenes at The New York Times Magazine Photo Show in Amsterdam
description: The staff at Foam museum in Amsterdam have been hard at work this week hanging The New York Times Magazine Photographs exhibition, which opens tonight at 6. If you are in Amsterdam, join us tomorrow at 7:30 p.m. for a panel discussion with our photo director, Kathy Ryan, along with contributing photographers Hellen van Meene and Erwin Olaf, led by Marcel Feil of Foam.

title: So You Want to Go to Myanmar?
description: ITS rare that a country bursts onto the tourism scene with quite as much vigor as Myanmar. After decades of isolation, it is Asias newest hot spot, offering richly layered history, spectacular natural beauty and the edginess that comes with a country still in transition. Since the ruling military junta began to loosen its grip on the government in November 2010, signs of progress  like the release of some political prisoners earlier this year and elections scheduled for April 1, with the opposition leader Daw Aung San Suu Kyi running for a seat in Parliament  have led Western nations, including the United States, to consider dropping long-held economic sanctions.

title: Edible Selby | Crude Awakening
description: In the stripped-down interiors at the Brooklyn restaurant Isa  exposed tree branches, piles of firewood  there is a hint of the menu to come. All the tapas-size dishes and entrees at the woodsy eatery are studiously simple: raw scallops with apple and celery; sardines roasted with olives; beef tartare with smoked oil and juniper berries. Its the newest (and much buzzed-about) vision from Taavo Somer, the architect behind the downtown New York institution Freemans, and Ignacio Mattos, the former chef of Il Buco, both of whom use the word primitive to describe the space and the food. Its nothing that a home cook couldnt do, Mattos says. You can do it with two hands, a knife and a little bit of fire. More

title: Credit Suisse Names Sole Head of Investment Banking
description: LONDON  James L. Amine took over as sole head of Credit Suisses global investment banking department on Thursday after Luigi de Vecchi, who ran the unit with him, took a sabbatical for personal reasons.

title: Restaurant Review: Hortensia, in Tokyo
description: Upon leaving this tranquil subterranean Tokyo restaurant, you might be moved to write a haiku.

title: Now Is the Season for Japan
description: ONE bright early spring morning this month, I took myself to Ryoanji, the Kyoto temple that is home to the worlds most celebrated rock garden. There was not a single other foreigner in the place. Not even many Japanese were visible across the 120-acre compound (Id scheduled my trip for spring break, when clamorous school tours are less in evidence).

title: For Wisconsin, It Could All Come Down to the 3
description: In the Sweet 16, Wisconsins success could ultimately be defined by its outside shooting.

title: With High Gas Prices, Buyers Shift Their Focus Downward
description: The Toyota Prius C, with a combined E.P.A. fuel-economy rating of 50 miles per gallon, is in such demand that a dealer in Florida reportedly levied a $7,000 premium on the $19,710 vehicle, a scaled-down version of the class-leading hybrid. Toyota, which began sales of the C on March 12, moved more units in its first three days than either Chevrolet, with its plug-in-hybrid Volt, or Nissan, with its purely electric Leaf, managed in all of February.

title: The Lure of History in a Malaysian City
description: ON the tranquil grounds of the Cheng Hoon Teng Temple, Malaysias oldest Taoist house of worship, late afternoon visitors bowed and offered burning wands of incense to a gilded statue of the Goddess of Mercy, the deity for whom the temple was founded in the 1600s. Tourists quietly watched or focused cameras on the structures ornate, figurine-covered roof.

title: Booming Again in West Texas
description: A combination of rising oil prices and new technology has set off a new oil boom in the Permian Basin in West Texas, reviving fields once thought to be played out.

title: A Tally of Green Jobs
description: For the first time, the federal government on Thursday released an estimate of the number of so-called green jobs in the United States economy, saying that 3.1 million people are employed in the production of goods and services that benefit the environment.

title: Theater Talkback: Mike Daisey, Continued
description: The fracas that has erupted over truth, lies and The Agony and the Ecstasy of Steve Jobs continues to percolate through the news media, as commentators air their views on the discovery, thoroughly dissected on an episode of the radio program This American Life, that Mike Daisey, the author of the monologue, had essentially fabricated some portions of his expos about abusive practices at a Chinese factory where Apple products are manufactured.

title: Professionals Eye, Tourists Perspective
description: AS a photographer in Southeast Asia, Ive been to Ha Long Bay, in northern Vietnam, many times for work and on vacation, hosting visiting friends. After accepting an assignment to shoot the bay for the Travel sections annual Where to Go issue, I decided to approach the trip simply as a tourist, going on the same tour as everyone else. Rather than work from a distance, looking for the best overall shots of the bay itself, I shot everything from a tourists perspective.

title: U.S. Inches Toward Goal of Energy Independence
description: MIDLAND, Tex.  The desolate stretch of West Texas desert known as the Permian Basin is still the lonely domain of scurrying roadrunners by day and howling coyotes by night. But the roar of scores of new oil rigs and the distinctive acrid fumes of drilling equipment are unmistakable signs that crude is gushing again.

title: Sense, Sensibility and Sentences: Examining and Writing Memorable Lines
description: Overview | What can a single sentence accomplish? In this lesson, students share favorite sentences, look closely at what makes them great, paraphrase them, then evaluate the results. They also work with sentences that are mini-narratives and write some of their own, before writing full-fledged short stories based on other students sentences.

title: Cuomo and Bloomberg Rescue a Lawmakers Conference
description: ALBANY  Gov. Andrew M. Cuomo and Mayor Michael R. Bloomberg are bailing out a conference for Latino state legislators after several major labor unions pulled their support over the Legislatures approval last week of reduced retirement benefits for newly hired public workers.

title: Using Patient Surveys to Rate Hospitals
description: To the Editor:

title: John Edwards Denies Prostitutes Claims
description: John Edwards, the former United States senator and presidential candidate, adamantly denied on Thursday a claim by a prostitute who worked for an upscale Manhattan escort service that she slept with Mr. Edwards in 2007.

title: When Scouting Film Locations Leads to Asia
description: SINCE the late 1970s, Dow Griffith has traveled to 86 countries as a location manager for the film industry. Its a fast-paced job that at any given moment has him scouting the world for a place that could look like Earth 1,000 years after humans abandoned it or the surface of Mars or a prehistoric jungle. Once he has found the right spot, he puts down roots and gets to know the area intimately, he said in an e-mail from Manila, where he recently spent time working on The Bourne Legacy, which will be released on Aug. 3.

title: Letters to the Travel Editor
description: To the Editor: Regarding How to Avoid That Cramped Seat (Practical Traveler, March 18), I recently flew to London on a Delta 767 with a frequent-flier ticket. I had a selection of lousy seats to choose from when I got my ticket online. But at the check-in counter I asked for a better seat and was given a premium economy seat. It turned out that I had two seats, window and aisle, to myself that were also in an exit row with five feet of leg room.

title: Deadline Nears for World Bank Nominees
description: The deadline for nominations to become president of the World Bank is 6 p.m. Friday. Thus far, the only named candidate is Jeffrey Sachs, the development economist and director of the Earth Institute at Columbia University.

title: NBC Renews Smash, Its Much-Hyped Broadway-Based Drama
description: Undoubtedly with some sense of relief and satisfaction, NBC announced Thursday it would bring back Smash for a second season.

title: Bloomberg Pledges $220 Million to Global Antismoking Effort
description: Mayor Michael R. Bloomberg committed $220 million of his personal wealth on Thursday to fighting tobacco around the world, which brings the total he has donated to the cause to more than $600 million.

title: The Playwright and the Radical
description: SNACKING on pastries and tea at her cloth-covered dining table, Leepee Joseph, 95, worked to put into words the odd experience of seeing her longtime home, a light-filled apartment on the eighth floor of a sturdy brick building on West 10th Street in Greenwich Village, recreated onstage in the play 4000 Miles.

title: Lawsuit Seeking Information on Cyclists Death Gains Support
description: For as long as there have been bicyclists and motorists sharing the streets of New York City, there have been cyclist deaths. Bicycle safety advocates have long criticized the New York Police Department for not thoroughly investigating the deaths of cyclists and for not being aggressive in pressing criminal charges against drivers.

title: Fretting Over Carbon Footprints
description: The critically acclaimed stories in Helen Simpsons earlier books have featured glittering, economical portraits of women in contemporary Britain, but immediately recognizable on this side of the Atlantic  women who are navigating the treacherous shoals of romance, or juggling careers and children, or dealing with the discontents of domesticity. Over the years these women have grown older, transiting the vain decade of their 20s and the more sober decade of their 30s, and slowly settling into the slough of middle age.

title: The Disruptive Power of iMessage
description: You could argue that Apple has changed the way we do things several times. The way we buy music, use our phones, operate our computers and so on. But the world has pretty much overlooked one of Apples greatest ideas yet: messages.

title: Tebow Joins the Circus
description: Regardless of Tim Tebow's abilities on the field, the Jets just traded for a journalists' dream, says William C. Rhoden.

title: Teenagers Today! When I Was Young, I Loved My Dork-Mobile
description: It was a royal blue, 1992 Honda Civic that I embellished with bumper stickers to proclaim my political views and music tastes, proclamations that these days we routinely make via Twitter. My sister called it the dork-mobile.

title: Video: Tebow Joins the Big Apple Circus
description: Regardless of Tim Tebows abilities on the field, the Jets just traded for a journalists dream, says William C. Rhoden.

title: Happy Birthday, Klimt: Neue Galerie Celebrates
description: Beginning in May the Neue Galerie, whose collection of paintings and drawings by Gustav Klimt is considered by many to be the best in the country, will honor the 150th anniversary of his birth with an exhibition of his work. On view will be greatest hits from the collection, like the gold-flecked 1907 portrait of Adele Bloch-Bauer that the museums co-founder Ronald S. Lauder bought for $135 million in 2006. The show will also feature paintings and drawings from Mr. Lauders personal collection and that of his family.

title: Are Unpaid Internships Fair?
description: Readers were divided over the question of unpaid internships in response to a recent column by The Ethicist, The Internship Rip-Off.

title: More Data Thefts Affect Individuals, Verizon Report Finds
description: Of the 855 data thefts that were reported to law enforcement authorities last year, 97 percent could have been avoided through basic, relatively inexpensive safety measures, according to an annual report released on Thursdayby Verizon.

title: Barney Frank Wants Simpler Volcker Rule by Labor Day
description: Barney Frank, the Massachusetts Democrat who is the co-author of the Dodd-Frank financial regulatory overhaul, is questioning how regulators will enforce a central provision in his law.

title: Hunger Games Ticket Sales Are on Fire
description: At midday Thursday, Fandango said it was selling 10 tickets per second for The Hunger Games, the latest indicator of off-the-charts interest from moviegoers for the PG-13 tale of Katniss Everdeen and her survival skills.

title: Structure, Not Numbers
description: When Paul Ryan and the House Republicans released their budget proposal last year, most of the criticisms from liberals focused on the budgets sweeping and controversial Medicare overhaul. In this years budget, the Medicare reforms have been amended in ways that address at least some of last years critiques, and so the smartest liberal commentary (see, for instance,Ezra KleinandJonathan Cohn) is focusing instead on everywhere else that the Republican budget envisions reducing spending  slowing Medicaid growth, rolling back Obamacare, keeping discretionary spending nearly flat, etc.  and how implausible, irresponsible and cruel these cuts would inevitably be.

title: An Urbane and Unexpected Leap From West to East
description: Japanese Art Deco sounds like an oxymoron. Rightly or wrongly, we  we Americans, that is  are likely to envision the Japanese in the 1920s and 30s as almost entirely focused on militarism and expansionism. Yet, as an exhibition at Japan Society proves, there were more than enough time and resources in that era for Japanese artists, designers and consumers to cultivate their own version of Art Deco, that excruciatingly suave Western style of art, design and dcor.

title: On the Market in the Region
description: A four-bedroom colonial in Huntington, N.Y., and a four-bedroom Tudor in Westfield, N.Y.

title: On the Market in New York City
description: A Morningside Heights co-op, a Chelsea co-op and a Ditmas Park Victorian.

title: In Singapore, Head for the Hill, Hip Duxton Hill
description: Duxton Hills tranquil, pedestrian-friendly streets make for an easy afternoon stroll among independent shops and cafes.

title: A Pop Shop for a New Generation
description: Entering the Brooklyn Museums Keith Haring: 1978-1982, which focuses on his early career, I worried that the show was going to be one big, marketable nostalgia trip. The loud strains of David Bowie, Grace Jones and the B-52s emanating from the galleries were not auspicious. Nor was the sight of a Pop Shop full of merchandise just outside the exhibition. (Haring didnt open his first one, on Lafayette Street, until 1986.)

title: Radish Moons Enchanting Childrens Illustrations
description: var data;function jsonSlideshowCallback(response){data = response;}NYTD.options = {source: data,cropType: 'blog480',appendTo: 'fullScreenSlideShow',showHeadLine: 'false', renderstyle: "embeddedSlideShowTmag"}

title: Dismal Premiere for Bent on NBC
description: The series premiere of Bent on NBC could only muster 2.6 million viewers. In the 18-to-49 category, it was NBCs lowest-rated in-season comedy premiere ever.

title: New York Arts of Pacific Asia Show
description: 7 W New York

title: Thomas Kovachevich: Alpenglow
description: Showroom 170

title: Josephine Meckseper: Manhattan Oil Project
description: Art Production Fund

title: Oded Hirsch: nothing new
description: Thierry Goldberg

title: Florida Police Chief Steps Aside in Fatal Shooting
description: Updated | 7:50 p.m. The embattled Florida police chief overseeing the investigation into the fatal shooting of 17-year-old Trayvon Martin temporarily stepped down Thursday, a day after the Sanford City Commission voted 3-to-2 that it no longer had confidence in him.

title: The Ads That Never Were
description: Every presidential campaign has commercials that never make it to the airwaves (or YouTube), for reasons including national affairs and inconsistent messages. Below is a selection of four ads from recent presidential campaigns that never got final approval.

title: After a False Start, a Progressive School Gets Ready to Open
Environmental Jeremiad, Complete With Ukulele
description: Outfitted in caps and gowns, the singer Nellie McKay and her musicians trouped onto the stage of Feinsteins at Loews Regency on Tuesday evening with mischievous smirks on their faces. Along with the shows title, Silent Spring  Its Not Nice to Fool Mother Nature, the costumes signaled what was ahead: a zany homemade one-woman musical comedy with an educational agenda and more wardrobe changes to come.

title: An Ebullient Mozart Sets Up a Ferocious Beethoven
description: There is no easier sell in classical music than the late quartets of Mozart and Beethoven.

title: In Cuba, Churchs Uneasy Balancing Act
description: HAVANA  Just in the past few days, with a visit here by Pope Benedict XVI looming, the Rev. Roberto Betancourt has witnessed firsthand the difficult position Cubas Roman Catholic Church finds itself in as it wields its newfound influence but still struggles to fill its pews.

title: The Selling of a Politician, and the Ads Almost Broadcast
description: Modern campaigns are often scientifically plotted operations that leave little to chance. Nowhere is this more obvious than with advertising, which is carefully fashioned from polling, focus groups and demographic research.

title: Karl Rove Is Not Impressed
description: There is no disputing Karl Roves political skills. I dont mean to say I admire him: Hes dedicated to causes I find repugnant. But when Mr. Rove strikes, you have to pay attention, because hes wicked goodin the Massachusetts and original sense of that wordat playing the public.

title: Pictures of the Day: France and Elsewhere
description: Photographs from France, New York, Belgium and Indonesia.

title: Motown Restoration for Ebony and Ivory
description: Special Piano has been scrawled on masking tape across a pile of broken parts at the Steinway & Sons factory in Astoria, Queens. Since December, with financing from Paul McCartney, the companys restorers have been rebuilding this Victorian rosewood instrument used for recordings by Motown stars including Marvin Gaye, Smokey Robinson and Stevie Wonder.

title: Beware an Internet Lothario
description: To all the women out there looking for love or at least a date on the Internet, be on the lookout for any prospects going by the name Hayden.

title: Workouts on (Virtual) Water
description: WHEN it comes to cardio equipment at the gym, the treadmill and elliptical take center stage. Though many fitness clubs have a few rowing machines, theyre often relegated to a forgotten corner. In New York, however, some workout centers are trying to give more attention to this overlooked way of staying in shape.

title: Time Out New York Lounge at New World Stages
description: There is a latent performer in every New Yorker: a burgeoning jazz singer, a part-time musician, a student of improvisation. Perhaps thats part of what attracted us to the bright lights and big stages of this city in the first place. Havent we all been caught singing some classic Queen or Jesus Christ Superstar on the gym treadmill at one time or another?

title: Quandary Considered: My Sons Girlfriend Is Bulimic
description: D.s quandary: her sons 18-year-old girlfriend throws up in her house after every meal. The young woman is bulimic, and its an open secret, if its a secret at all: D. has talked to her son, who has talked to his girlfriend, as has D.s older sons girlfriend. Theyre dealing with it, the teens insist. Theyll handle it. And at 18, maybe D. should let them  or maybe she should contact one of the girls divorced parents, even though her son has asked her not to.

title: Shell Take Manhattan, but Hold the Jeans
description: DARKNESS fell on a brisk Saturday night, and droves of the young and the raucous flooded the entrance and lobby of the Dream Downtown hotel in Chelsea. It happened to be my hotel for this stay, since Id gotten a killer deal on the Internet.

title: Rentals Offered, With Bragging Rights
description: A DEVELOPER that has played a big role in converting boardrooms into bedrooms in the financial district is preparing to leave its largest mark yet on the neighborhood.

title: While the U.S. Moves Toward Energy Independence ...
description: The nations reliance on foreign oil has fallen sharply since 2005, when imports made up 60 percent of the liquid fuel used. A surge of new domestic production and a decline in consumption has transformed the United States energy outlook.

title: A.I.G. Repays Additional $1.5 Billion to Government
description: The American International Group said on Thursday that it had repaid an additional $1.5 billion owed to the Treasury Department, further reducing the bailed-out insurers government lifeline.

title: For Paganini, a Wild and Devilish Lifestyle Fueled Some Virtuoso Compositions
description: With his sex, drugs and rock n roll lifestyle, Paganini (1782-1840) provided plenty of fodder for 19th-century gossipmongers. A womanizer and gambler, he further fueled his legend by frequent concert cancellations, often stemming from a range of ailments including syphilis and depression. His prodigious technique gave rise to rumors that he was in league with the Devil.

title: Spiders and Bacteria Are Tops in Space Lab Contest
description: A zebra spider spins no webs, but instead catches its prey by leaping onto it. But in space, a zebra spider would zip off in a straight line instead of a trajectory curved by gravity, missing its target.

title: Living In | Throgs Neck, the Bronx
description: The landscape in Throgs Neck has been transformed over the last several decades. But it is still largely a working- and middle-class neighborhood, relaxed and friendly.

title: Fluid Reasons for a Constant Allure
description: THE landscape in Throgs Neck, in the southeastern corner of the Bronx, has been transformed over the last several decades. Before, open fields flanked areas of three-season bungalows overlooking Long Island Sound and other expanses of water. Now the area is mostly bustling and built up  and sewn into the city fabric by expressways.

title: Building Sonic Textures On Buzzes and Pulses
description: Collaboration, the odder the better, is the engine that drives the Ecstatic Music Festival at Merkin Concert Hall. You can think of Judd Greenstein, the composer who assembles its programs, as a mischievous matchmaker who dreams up blind dates that seem as likely to create sparks as to create harmony.

title: Heading to Auction, a Rocket That Launched a Legend
description: The Toleman TG184-2 racecar driven by Ayrton Senna da Silva in 1984, his first full season in a career that would include three world championships, is part of a sale scheduled for May 16 conducted by Silverstone Auctions.

title: Changes in F.H.A. Fees
description: FEES charged on mortgages backed by the Federal Housing Administration are set to change this spring; theyll go up for some and down for others.

title: Xaviers Wells Is Still a Question Mark for Friday
description: ATLANTA  Xavier guard Dez Wells tried to bounce around on the court as best he could here Thursday during the Musketeers light practice at the Georgia Dome in preparation for Friday nights Round of 16 game with Baylor in the N.C.A.A. tournament.

title: Oblivious to the Battle Raging Outside
description: There was no question that Mad Men would get around to the civil rights movement. From the start, racism was the carbon monoxide of the show: a poison that couldnt always be detected over the pungent scent of cigarettes, sexism, anti-Semitism, alcoholism, homophobia and adultery, but that sooner or later was bound to turn noxious.

title: Mummy Dearest
description: Perhaps every autobiographical first novel serves its author as Jeanette Wintersons did  as a story I could live with. But Oranges Are Not the Only Fruit, buoyant and irrepressible, was published in 1985, for its author half a lifetime ago, and what one can live with changes over time.

title: For Indianas Sheehey, an Assist from Fab Melo
description: Fab Melo, the Syracuse center, heard the news that Tom Crean, the Indiana coach, would be in the south Florida gym that September day in 2009. Melo already had his ticket punched; he had his pick of Division I schools. Now, Melo wanted to help a not-so-well-known guard, Will Sheehey, who was a senior and new teammate at Sagemont High School in Weston, Fla.

title: Boozy Nights of a Ravaged Dreamer
description: The ravaged James Tyrone on display at City Center Stage II in the Pearl Theater Companys sure-footed revival of A Moon for the Misbegotten, as played by Andrew May, has got a certain quality. Hes downright ... unexceptional.

title: Movie Listings for March 23-29
description: Movies

title: A New Vision of a Visionary Fisherman
description: The art of Forrest Bess (1911-77), like that of Vincent van Gogh, may be in danger of being overtaken by his life story. Especially now, when the work of this eccentric visionary painter  who spent the bulk of his maturity as a fisherman  on the Gulf of Mexico, living on a spit of Texas beach  is having an especially intense New York moment.

title: TimesCast | A Coup in Mali
description: March 22, 2012  In Mali, unexpected unrest as a group of junior military officers attempt a government coup.

title: Student Communicators Tackle Deadly Plastics, Dirty Water
description: Here are two videos that caught my attention today. The first, above, portrays how plastic trash can end up killing marine life. It was created by Alexis van Dijk, a student at Marymount Manhattan College whom I met after speaking there last night on my notion of a Knowosphere. I like it because it avoids overstatement and simply reminds viewers that its worth considering the long-distance impacts of choices we make every day.

title: Fantasy Focus: When Punting Saves Might Make Sense
description: In a typical 55 Rotisserie league, and by this I mean one with nine generic pitching slots, it can make a lot of sense not to draft any closers. (This is emphatically not the case in a league with specific relief slots to fill, or one with a low innings cap, which enhances closers value.)

title: Pop/Rock Listings for March 23-29
description: Pop

title: A Heart Needs One Thing, Society Wants Another
description: I thought, I know what this one is about, Terence Davies said at a recent screening of his new film, The Deep Blue Sea, adapted from a play by Terence Rattigan. He was explaining why, when he was invited by the Rattigan Trust to film one of that playwrights works, he had chosen this 1952 tale of adultery and romantic despair. (It was previously brought to the screen in 1955, starring Vivien Leigh in a role performed, in Mr. Daviess version, by Rachel Weisz.)

title: Jazz Listings for March 23-29
description: Jazz

title: Classical Music and Opera Listings for March 23-29
description: Classical

title: Dance Listings for March 23-29
description: Dance

title: Robert Bales and the Case for a Measured Approach to Alcohol in Combat
description: When we first heard the news that a lone American soldier was accused of killing 16 Afghan civilians, and desecrating the corpses of nine, we had the same gut suspicion: alcohol had to be involved.

title: Where the Streets Smelled Like Beer
description: THE New-York Historical Societys exhibit Beer Here: Brewing New Yorks History, to open on May 25th, is another example of the societys novel approach to presenting local history, in this case with beer tastings. In portraying this foamy story, the exhibit also covers the tale of two of New Yorks most important brewers, George Ehret and Jacob Ruppert. They competed for the same markets with back-to-back breweries in Yorkville, but were anything but rivals.

title: A Sliver of a Silver Lining for the Movie Industry
description: The Motion Picture Association of America, releasing its annual snapshot of global moviegoer trends on Thursday, looked on the bright side, as its job requires.

title: Museum and Gallery Listings for March 23-29
description: Art

title: A Harlem Resurgence
description: Sales seem to be rebounding in Harlem. Prices are rising, and inventory has fallen.

title: After a Short Nap, Harlem Is Back
description: FOR a time, Claudia Aguirre and Joel Feazell lived happily in a two-bedroom one-bath co-op on the Upper West Side with their two daughters. But as the children grew, the space became increasingly cramped. In particular, they needed another bathroom. They began to hunt for a larger apartment, which eventually led them north of 110th Street. There, they spent months researching condominiums, co-ops and, finally, brownstones.

title: Brooklyn Race Will Change Route to Accommodate Bigger Field
description: New York Road Runners will reconfigure the course of the Brooklyn Half Marathon so that nearly three times as many runners can join the race in May. At the same time, Road Runners will nearly double the entry fee to offset the higher amount it must pay the Police Department to direct traffic.

title: Gifts With Strings Attached
description: IN her will, Sonja Stein, a Manhasset resident who died in 2009, bequeathed her twin East Marion summer homes  a five-bedroom Victorian with a broad front porch, and a similar four-bedroom shingle house next door that she used as a guesthouse  to the Oysterponds Historical Society. She asked that the historic homes, along with 14 acres next to Dam Pond, be preserved in perpetuity and that the land remain unencumbered by development.

title: A Photographer Who Never Sees a Mayors Bad Side
description: Over 25 years, as one of New Yorks official photographers of mayors, Ed Reed has shadowed four. They have struck contrasting poses and projected divergent personalities. He has photographed them from every angle. But he is the kind of guy who doesnt volunteer a negative word about any of them.

title: High Marks for Transit Hubs
description: WANT to know which New Jersey train stations have the most plentiful supply of parking spaces relative to town population? Theres a list for that. Or what about stations in the areas with the greatest number of jobs? Theres a list for that. Or transportation hubs with the densest populations? Theres a list for that as well.

title: Slowdown in Fairfield County
description: LIKE the relatively warm weather that has caressed Connecticut in the past few months, the brightening economic picture has put many people in an upbeat mood, especially in the real estate industry.

title: Q & A
description: Leaky Bathtubs: Who Pays?

title: Tibetan Self-Immolations Rise as China Tightens Grip
description: MAQU, China  Like many children of Tibetan nomads, Tsering Kyi started school relatively late, at age 10, but by all accounts she made up for lost time by studying with zeal.

title: In Attack Mode, Santorum Leaves Himself Open
description: Important presidential campaign lesson of the day: When trying to score off your rivals supposed gaffe, avoid being hit by the rebound.

title: Jumps, Turns and Breathtaking Feats, Aligned With Dense Structures
description: What everyone soon notices in Paul Taylors choreography is the striking simplicity of his dance language. Its remarkable how frequently basic features recur in many of his finest works: walking, running, falling, tilting, kneeling; opening arms from a halo position or holding them in one large upturned arc; shifts of weight through the pelvis. Since some of them also feature athletic jumps and turns that obviously call for very strong training, theres no question these dancers are virtuosos. The vocabulary, however, is not especially sophisticated. The jumps and turns, though often breathtakingly fast, dont extend the lexicon.

title: Spare Times for March 23-29
description: Around Town

title: Access to the Country and to Croissants
description: BACK in 2007, when housing prices were at their peak, Herv and Dacotah Rousseau couldnt afford a place in Manhattan. Instead, for around $400,000, they bought a house in Putnam County.

title: Bad Guys Upstairs, Gore Down the Hall
description: If its not obvious from all the bashing, smashing and machete-ing in the frenetically violent The Raid: Redemption where the redemptive part kicks in, theres a reason. As it happens, the title of this Indonesian action flick was changed because The Raid alone wasnt available in the United States. Thats too bad because the apartment complex teeming with villainy in which much of the story takes place  and into which some dozen and a half Special Forces officers storm  turns out to be a massive roach motel. Characters check in, but they dont check out. Its no wonder that so many of the dead, who pile up quickly, register as a queasy, macabre joke.

title: Choose Your Adventure: Ending the Unfinished
description: The Brentano String Quartet has consistently offered imaginative programming ideas, and the most memorable have been about juxtaposing old and new works. Its current project, celebrating the groups 20th anniversary, is Fragments, a two-part series in which unfinished works by great composers of the past are paired with responses to those pieces by living composers, commissioned for the occasion.

title: Bagging the Bag
description: A friend and neighbor is developing a line of yoga bags. When she finished her samples, she gave me one. I offered her some feedback and thanked her. But I knew Id never use the bag, so I offloaded it to my cleaning lady. My brother thinks this was wrong. If I didnt want it, she could have given the sample to someone else. But I think returning the bag would have been insulting. Arent we free to do with gifts as we like?

title: Lumire | YSL in the U.S.A.
description: var data;function jsonSlideshowCallback(response){data = response;}NYTD.options = {source: data,cropType: 'blog480',appendTo: 'fullScreenSlideShow',showHeadLine: 'false', renderstyle: "embeddedSlideShowTmag"}

title: Spare Times: For Children, March 23-29
description: The Neverending Story

title: Tax Policy: Much Talk, Few Details
description: If approached the right way, there could actually be some widespread agreement on tax reform coming out of the current election.

title: U.S. Relaxes Limits on Use of Data in Terror Analysis
description: WASHINGTON  The Obama administration is moving to relax restrictions on how counterterrorism analysts may retrieve, store and search information about Americans gathered by government agencies for purposes other than national security threats.

title: TimesCast | French Suspect Killed
description: March 22, 2012  After a 30-hour standoff, French security forces shot and killed 23-year-old Mohammed Merah, who claimed he killed seven people over 10 days and that he had Al Qaeda training.

title: A Family Fairy Tale, Twice Told
description: MAC and I met on Craigslist, but not in the usual way. At the time I was 22, manically conducting the sputtering finale of a relationship I wasnt ready for, and living in my first postcollege apartment, the type of place one rarely finds in a lifetime, at least in New York: two floors at the top of a converted brownstone in Park Slope, Brooklyn, half a block from Prospect Park and ridiculously inexpensive. It came with four bedrooms, two bathrooms, a winding staircase (up which box springs did not fit), and a roof deck with a view of the Statue of Liberty. It also came with three roommates, one of whom moved out a few months after I moved in.

title: How Do You Measure the Spark of Creativity?
Goodbye Malaria, Hello Condos
description: IT can seem hard to believe, but there was a time when people didnt value Central Park for its views.

title: I Realized Colleges Look Beyond Grades
description: Jonathan O., a college student, shares his experience on the College Board's BigFuture website.

title: When a Rental Needs a Repair
description: ONE of the advantages of being a renter is that when the roof starts leaking or the hot-water heater dies, the repair is not your responsibility  in theory, that is.

title: Adobes Photoshop CS6 is Free, for Now
description: As of today you can get about $700 worth of the latest Adobe Photoshop software free. But there is a catch.

title: Heat, Humidity, Rain and Excitement as Formula One Arrives in Kuala Lumpur
description: KUALA LUMPUR  The Formula One circus arrived in Kuala Lumpur Thursday for the Malaysian Grand Prix on Sunday and it was promptly treated with a massive contrast in atmosphere to that in Melbourne last weekend: As I write, the air temperature is above 30 degrees Celsius and the humidity 68 percent.

title: How Much Is Public School Costing Your Family?
description: Any public school parent knows free doesnt really mean free when it comes to education: whether the supply list or the prom tickets, the extras (and sometimes the not-so-extras) cost money.

title: Longtime Wall Street Lobbyist to Retire
description: Steve Bartlett, one of Wall Streets go-to lobbyists in the industrys fight over financial regulation, has announced that he will retire at the end of the year.

title: Experts Debunk College Search Myths
description: College experts weigh in on common college search myths in a video on The College Board's BigFuture website.

title: Q&A: Going Back Into a Time Capsule for a Password Reset
description: Q.

title: In a Divided City, Many Blacks See Echoes of White Superiority
description: CAPE TOWN  For countless foreign visitors, Cape Town is an indelible symbol of the beauty and promise of post-apartheid South Africa. Beyond its gorgeous scenery and great wines, its very logo  an outline of majestic Table Mountain superimposed over a rainbow  emphasizes its historic mix of races and cultures, and its most famous resident, Desmond Tutu, is revered as a symbol of tolerance, inclusiveness and forgiveness.

title: The World Is Ending; Check Your To-Do List
description: Live every day as if it were your last is a piece of corny wisdom I never quite understood until Abel Ferraras new film explored an obvious corollary: Your last day  or, as it happens, the whole planets last day  will be just like every other one. Mr. Ferrara makes this point with ingenuity and characteristic thrift by using found news footage to provide images of apocalypse. Crowds gather in St. Peters Square; candlelight processions wind through the streets of unidentified cities.

title: Blunder of Blunders
description: DeLong and Summers on fiscal policy in a depressed economy is out. The headline point is the argument that austerity when youre in the liquidity trap may well worsen, not improve, your long-run fiscal position; Ive been making the same point for a couple of years, but Brad/Larry present some evidence from the birth of Eurosclerosis and the downgrading of US potential output estimates since the crisis began.

title: Manicure Part Deux
description: Stephanie Rosenbloom removes the top layer of her polish and gets a few bonus days of wear.

title: Theater Listings: March 23-29
description: Theater

title: Keith Haring: 19781982
description: Images from a new exhibition at the Brooklyn Museum.

title: Hurtful Words: Take Offense, or Turn Away?
description: To the Editor:

title: A Deadbeat, Hell Never Live Up to His Name
description: The Lower East Side of Manhattan depicted in The Trouble With Bliss is neither the hip, bohemian enclave nor the emerging yuppie frontier of popular imagination. It is more like a zanier downscale version of the Upper West Side of Seinfeld, itself an anachronism, given the areas real estate boom.

title: BATS Goes Public at $16 a Share, at the Low End of Expected Range
description: BATS Global Markets, one of the largest stock market operators in the country, priced its initial public offering on Thursday at $16, at the low end of expectations, according to people briefed on the matter.

title: Affordable Housing
description: To the Editor:

title: The Great Reinvention of That Sceptred Isle
description: NEW HAVEN  It is easy to mock the entire enterprise, as the caricaturist George Cruikshank did in 1812, in a satirical print on display at the Yale Center for British Art here. At a meeting of Cruikshanks Antiquarian Society, its president ecstatically holds forth without anybody paying him the slightest bit of attention.

title: N.C.A.A. Hangout
description: Pete Thamel, Greg Bishop and Connor Ennis of The Times talk college basketball with readers.

title: The Diaspora Is Remixed
description: For all its professed liberalism and even radicalism, the art world is considerably less diverse than many of the institutions its products criticize. Government agencies, large corporations and the military  at least in this country  can make the art world look like a segregation-era backwater. This puts enormous pressure on young black artists who have come up through the system to speak not only as individuals but also for a large population  particularly when they show in museums, which dont just exhibit art but also frame it in the context of a larger historical narrative.

title: Facebook Gobbles Up Patents From I.B.M.
description: The patent chest held by an old technology giant, I.B.M., is proving to be a good war chest for the new technology giant, Facebook.

title: Talking N.C.A.A. Tournament With Times Reporters
description: Weve been experimenting with video hangouts on Google-plus, setting up our sports reporters with readers for conversations about the N.C.A.A. tournament. On Thursday, Pete Thamel, Greg Bishop and Connor Ennis of The Times and five readers talked about the opening weekend, looked ahead to the Round of 16 and ventured into some other college sports topics. We said that weve been experimenting, so please excuse some of the technical glitches. Youll notice, for instance, that the camera seems to have a particular affection for Mr. Thamel early on. Turns out we had it locked. We hope you enjoy the conversation and consider joining us for future hangouts.

title: A Dance Movie Without a Lot of Moves
description: Tempting as it is to believe that no disability is insurmountable when you have a slavish Latin lover by your side, it will take a better film than Musical Chairs to convince us. Pairing Mia (Leah Pipes), an Upper East Side ballroom dancer, with Armando (E. J. Bonilla), a lithe Puerto Rican striver from the Bronx, this mawkish rom-com mines class, ethnic and ambulatory boundaries for cheap laughs and cheap-looking visuals.

title: Whitney Houston Drowned, Coroner Says
description: LOS ANGELES  The singer Whitney Houston, who was found dead in her hotel room on the eve of the Grammy Awards last month, accidentally drowned in a bathtub, the Los Angeles County coroner said on Thursday. Cocaine and heart disease also played a role in her death, the coroner said.

title: Todays Scuttlebot: Apple Buyback Math and Pictures of Desolation
description: Here are some interesting items that the tech reporters and editors of The New York Times found on the Web on Wednesday. There are more here.

title: Previously Unpublished Vonnegut Novella to Be Released
description: A previously unpublished novella by Kurt Vonnegut will be released on Friday by RosettaBooks, close to 60 years after it was written, the publisher said on Thursday. The 22,000-word novella, Basic Training, was rejected by the Saturday Evening Post in the late 1940s, long before Mr. Vonnegut had become famous through works such as Slaughterhouse-Five and Cats Cradle. After Mr. Vonnegut died in 2007, a trove of his unpublished work remained in Indiana, where he was born. RosettaBooks chose the novella from hundreds of other works that Mr. Vonneguts literary executor had made available.

title: The Domino Effect of Just One Drink
description: There is something appealingly messy about Come On Eileen, the first feature from Finola Geraghty and one of the few to face alcoholism from a female point of view  and a middle-aged one at that. Unlike Meg Ryans sloshed housewife in When a Man Loves a Woman, whose adorable inebriation prompted us to wonder if gin could make our complexions glow like that, Jackie Howes Eileen wears her wrinkles and thickening waist with the same pride as her abundant auburn hair.

title: Hangover Part III Is Coming Next Summer
description: Consider the competition slate for the Cannes Film Festival officially scrambled. Or, you know, maybe not: on Thursday, Warner Brothers announced that it was preparing a third installment in the Hangover series, its bawdy, billion-dollar grossing comedy franchise about three friends whose travels invariably result in collective memory loss followed by farcical efforts to retrace their troublemaking steps.

title: Federal Charges in the Death of James C. Anderson
description: Prosecutors unsealed federal hate-crime charges for the racially motivated murder of James Craig Anderson in Jackson, Miss.

title: A Documentary in Which All Bets Are Good Ones
description: All In: The Poker Movie needs one more word in its title, in the interest of accuracy. It ought to be All In: The Poker Propaganda Movie.

title: An Eccentric World
description: Two exhibitions in New York shed new light on the artist Forrest Bess.

title: Proof That Science Cant Find You Love
description: More of a stridently insistent pitch than a fully engaging movie, Losing Control centers on a young scientist who gets the engagement jitters and decides to test whether there are other fish in the sea. Armed with a performance chart and the oblivious belief that her China-bound boyfriend will stand by and wait, Samantha (Miranda Kent) seeks out and judges men when shes not plugging away at a stalled doctoral project involving sperm samples in a Harvard Medical School laboratory.

title: Obsessed by the Circumstances of Her Birth
description: More slickly packaged than most faith-based fare, October Baby gussies up its anti-abortion message with gauzy cinematography and more emo music than an entire season of Greys Anatomy. But not even a dewy heroine and a youth-friendly vibe can disguise the essential ugliness at its core: like the bloodied placards brandished by demonstrators outside womens health clinics, the film communicates in the language of guilt and fear.

title: General Says Afghans Need Big U.S. Force Beyond 2012
description: WASHINGTON  The senior allied commander in Afghanistan suggested on Thursday that he might not advocate any further drawdown of the American force in Afghanistan going into 2013 once the so-called surge forces ordered by President Obama leave this fall.

title: Tebow Who? Giants Re-Sign David Carr
description: One day after the Jets made Tim Tebow the most famous backup quarterback in the N.F.L., the Giants also addressed their reserve quarterback situation with significantly less fanfare.

title: Drug Dosage Was Approved Despite Warning
description: Four months before a best-selling Alzheimers drug was set to lose its patent protection, its makers received approval for a higher dosage that extended their exclusive right to sell the drug. But the higher dosage caused potentially dangerous side effects and worked only slightly better than the existing drugs, according to an article published Thursday in the British Medical Journal.

title: U.S. Sergeant Faces 17 Counts of Murder in Afghan Killings
description: Staff Sgt. Robert Bales will be charged on Friday with 17 counts of murder and various other charges, including attempted murder, in connection with the March 11 attack on Afghan civilians, a senior United States official said on Thursday.

title: PBS Agrees to Revisit Documentary Schedule
description: Under intense public pressure from independent documentary filmmakers, including a Twitter campaign, PBS on Thursday agreed to find a new home next season for the award-winning film series Independent Lens and POV.

title: In Search of a French Philosopher, and Herself
description: As the title of Julia Hasletts unsatisfying documentary suggests, An Encounter With Simone Weil is as much about Ms. Haslett as it is about Weil, the French philosopher, mystic, teacher, labor sympathizer and, briefly, worker in a Renault factory. Weils statement that attention is the rarest and purest form of generosity resonated so strongly for Ms. Haslett that she set out to discover more about Weil, who died in England in 1943 at 34. (Afflicted by tuberculosis, she often refused food in solidarity with those suffering under German occupation.)

title: Bank of America Tests Rental Program as Alternative to Foreclosure
description: Bank of America said Thursday that it would offer a small number of customers facing foreclosure the option to remain in their homes and rent the property instead. The program highlights how investors are increasingly interested in becoming landlords on troubled properties.

title: Top State Court Says Judges Cant Demand Cash-Only Bail
description: ALBANY  Responding to concerns that low-income defendants often have trouble making bail, New York States highest court ruled on Thursday that state judges may not require that defendants post bail in cash.

title: 9 Graduates Lose Case Against New York Law School
description: Amid a challenging time in the legal industry, a growing chorus of law-school graduates are bemoaning the lack of job opportunities.

title: Putts Elude Els, and So Could Masters
description: ORLANDO, Fla.  The 8-iron from the right rough had a chance to go into the hole on the ninth green, narrowly missing by a couple of inches. The birdie putt from 4 feet, however, had no chance, sliding by for a painful par.

title: Neighborhood Joint | Louis Shoe Rebuilders
description: Louis Shoe Rebuilders, on the ground floor of the Empire State Building, was founded a decade before the skyscraper towering over it was completed.

title: Where the Sheen on Your Shoes Says, Respect
description: ITS 8 a.m. in the Empire State Building, and a businessman is getting his shoes shined. The avalanche of his day will soon begin, but now the weight of his worries rests on two brass foot fixtures. Other men, wearing crisp suits and attention-grabbing watches, ease into the stations next to him, thumbing through Playboy magazines and newspapers. The sharp scent of worked leather wafts from the back room, where old repair machines with names like the Landis Aristocrat stitcher and the Auto-Soler toil away.

title: N.F.L. Players Union Wants to Conduct Its Own Inquiry Into Bounty Program
description: The N.F.L. players union said Thursday that it still wanted to conduct its own investigation into the New Orleans Saints bounty system after Commissioner Roger Goodell suspended Coach Sean Payton for a year.

title: Nissan Promotes Next New York Taxi as a Sign of Its Innovation
description: TAXICABS crowd the movies and TV shows about New York just as they crowd the streets of New York, as evidenced by On the Town, Taxi, Taxi Driver, Night on Earth and Cash Cab. Now comes a campaign that celebrates the citys taxi fleet, or at least what it is to look like beginning in fall 2013.

title: The Severability Doctrine
description: THE Obama administration has made a curious strategic choice in its defense of the constitutionality of the health care reform act. The central issue before the Supreme Court, which will begin hearing oral arguments on Monday, is whether the acts requirement that everyone buy health insurance  the so-called individual mandate  exceeds Congresss constitutional power.

title: The Relationship School
description: Usually when you visit a school you walk down a quiet hallway and peer in the little windows in the classroom doors. You see one teacher talking to a bunch of students. Every 50 minutes or so a chime goes off and the students fill the hallway and march off to their next class, which is probably unrelated to the one they just left.

title: House Votes to Kill a Medicare Cost Panel
description: WASHINGTON  In a rebuff to President Obama, the Republican-controlled House passed a bill on Thursday to abolish a Medicare cost control board created by the new health care law.

title: A Transgender Candidate Is Hoping to Make History
description: Zoning. School overcrowding. The design of New Yorks transportation system.

title: AT&T Accused of Improperly Billing for Service for Deaf
description: The Justice Department has accused AT&T of knowing that a calling service it offered for the deaf was being used by Nigerian swindlers and others to steal from American merchants.

title: Democrats Reject Christie Choice for New Jerseys Top Court
description: TRENTON  Democrats voted down one of Gov. Chris Christies two nominees to the New Jersey Supreme Court on Thursday, handing the hard-charging Republican governor an unusual high-profile defeat.

title: Paranoia Strikes Deeper
description: Stop, hey, whats that sound? Actually, its the noise a great political party makes when it loses whats left of its mind. And it happened  where else?  on Fox News on Sunday, when Mitt Romney bought fully into the claim that gas prices are high thanks to an Obama administration plot.

title: The Church Lady State
description: When people complain about liberal overreach they always bring up the nanny state. You know, sorting your garbage to see if a banana peel slipped in with a cellophane wrapper; energy-efficient light bulbs; neutered language in the public square to make sure no one is ever offended.

title: North Carolinas Marshall Does Not Practice
description: ST. LOUIS  North Carolinas standout point guard Kendall Marshall (right wrist surgery) did not practice Thursday and still does not know if he can play against Ohio in the Round of 16 on Friday night.

title: Nearly 22 Months Later, Kendrys Morales Returns to Angels
description: TEMPE, Ariz.  Albert Pujols might not be the only slugger the Los Angeles Angels add to their lineup this season. On Thursday, for the first time since May 29, 2010, the Angels used Kendrys Morales in their lineup.

title: A Broader Right to Counsel
description: The right to a jury trial is extolled as a fixture of American justice, but a vast majority of people charged with crimes never see a trial. Plea bargaining defines the criminal justice system: 97 percent of federal convictions and 94 percent of state convictions come through guilty pleas negotiated between prosecutors and offenders.

title: Jets Facing a Tricky Situation at Quarterback
description: It often happened to Doug Flutie when his Calgary Stampeders needed a quarterback sneak.
