How are the Yankees going to squeeze seven legitimate starting pitchers into a five-man rotation, for instance, and will Joba Chamberlain pitch this year after mangling his ankle in a trampoline accident? (A flabbergasting event. I mean, has any professional athlete ever been so badly hurt playing with a 5-year-old?)

title: Good Deeds in Afghanistan Interrupt the Grim Narrative
description: KABUL, Afghanistan  The story of Specialist Dennis Weichel could easily serve as a counternarrative to the gruesome account of the American soldier charged with 17 counts of murder in Kandahar on March 11.

title: If Bynum Practiced 3-Pointers, He Could Make Fans Forget Wang Zhizhi
description: The latest striking turn in the Los Angeles Lakers tumultuous season came when Andrew Bynum, the teams young center, was benched after a failed 3-point attempt.

title: Less Visible Occupy Movement Looks for Staying Power
description: WASHINGTON  Six months after the Occupy movement first used protests and encampments to turn the nations attention to economic inequality, the movement needs to find new ways to gain attention or it will most likely fade to the edges of the political discourse, according to supporters and critics.

title: Singular Approach to a Signature Hobby
description: If you wanted to buy an official Rawlings baseball from MLB.com, it would cost $16.99. But if you were willing to let Hayden Penn write his name on it first, the same ball could be had for $5. For those scoring at home, that would make the value of Penns autograph negative $11.99.

title: Islamist Group Breaks Pledge to Stay Out of Race in Egypt
description: CAIRO  The Muslim Brotherhood nominated its chief strategist and financier Khairat el-Shater on Saturday as its candidate to become Egypts first president since Hosni Mubarak, breaking a pledge not to seek the top office and a monopoly on power.

title: Long, Cold Summer for Maple Leafs and Canadiens
description: Two of the N.H.L.s oldest and most renowned franchises  the Montreal Canadiens and the Toronto Maple Leafs  will be missing from the postseason, once again unable to build on their increasingly distant championship traditions, and having alienated their local and worldwide followings.

title: Panic in Paradise
description: When friends ask about my Maui honeymoon, I tell them that Brian and I didnt leave our hotel. Wink, wink. You must have had a really great time! everybody chuckles. I want them to imagine that we enjoyed a tantric Hawaiian escapade, frolicking like soap stars in 600-thread-count sheets.

title: 30 Seconds: Steve Kerr Watches the Bouncing Balls, College and Pro
description: Steve Kerr, one of the busiest men in basketball this time of year, does not play or coach. He is a TNT game analyst for the N.C.A.A. mens tournament and the N.B.A.Kerr, 46, played 15 N.B.A. seasons. He won three championships with the Chicago Bulls and two with the San Antonio Spurs before retiring in 2003, then moved to the Phoenix Suns front office from 2007 to 10.

title: How the Cholera Epidemic Spread
description: The outbreak started in the mountains of central Haiti, where untreated sewage from a United Nations camp is believed to have contaminated a tributary of the Artibonite River in October 2010.

title: Cholera Grips Haiti
description: A devastating cholera epidemic struck Haiti 10 months after the earthquake of 2010. The New York Times traces the origins of the outbreak.

title: Educations Hungry Hearts
description: Batesville, Va.

title: Sharapova Loses in Final, Making 45 Unforced Errors
description: KEY BISCAYNE, Fla.  Agnieszka Radwanska was an 18-year-old unknown from Poland the first time she defeated Maria Sharapova, during the 2007 United States Open.

title: Why Am I The One
description: The latest video from the band Fun. An interview with the lead singer, Nate Ruess, is featured in this week's Sunday Review.

title: Yankees Pineda Heads to Disabled List
description: KISSIMMEE, Fla.  Before leaving to have a magnetic resonance imaging test on his right shoulder, Michael Pineda sat at his locker in the Yankees clubhouse Saturday with ice strapped to the affected joint and worry creasing his face.

title: Experts Recommend Single Registry to Oversee Kidney Transplant Donations
description: HERNDON, Va.  Leaders in the field of kidney transplantation recommended last week that a single nationwide registry should oversee the complex matching process needed to expand the use of transplant chains and other forms of paired donation.

title: Santana Sets His Sights on Opening Day Start
description: PORT ST. LUCIE, Fla.  The classic rock that boomed from the loudspeakers and washed over an otherwise empty field gave the moment the feel of a cinematic sports training montage.

title: A Sontag Sampler
description: Art Is Boring

title: A Recipe for Heartbreak
description: Kati Jos Heartbreak Pie Crust (makes one 9-inch crust)

title: Regular-Season Supremacy Not Enough for Rangers
description: The Rangers can clinch the Eastern Conference title, and the top playoff seed that goes along with it, as soon as Sunday. They might even become the first Rangers team to win the Presidents Trophy as the N.H.L.s top regular-season team since Mark Messiers group in 1994, not that Coach John Tortorella or any current Ranger has even mentioned it.

title: In Haiti, Global Failures on a Cholera Epidemic
description: MIREBALAIS, Haiti  Jean Salgadeau Pelette, handsome when medicated and groomed, often roamed this central Haitian town in a disheveled state, wild-eyed and naked. He was a familiar figure here, the lanky scion of a prominent family who suffered from a mental illness.

title: A Conversation With Nate Ruess
description: Singer Nate Ruess takes more questions.

title: Nate Ruess
description: Nate Ruess is the lead vocalist for the indie-pop band Fun. The groups hit single We Are Young has topped Billboards Hot 100 and Digital Songs charts with more than two million downloads.

title: Finance Ministers Clear Way for Credit Rating Competition in Europe
description: COPENHAGEN  European Union finance ministers agreed on Saturday to increase competition among credit ratings agencies and to continue difficult discussions on taxing certain financial transactions.

title: Where Have All the Neurotics Gone?
description: SOME cultural archetypes leave the stage with a flourish, or at least some foot stomping. All those pith-helmeted colonialists, absinthe-addled poets and hippie gurus founding 1970s utopias: They made some noise, if not always much sense, before being swallowed by history.

title: Romney Makes His Pitch to Social Conservatives and Attacks Obama
description: PEWAUKEE, Wisconsin  At a Faith and Freedom Forum here Saturday morning just three days before the Wisconsin primary, Mitt Romney continued his attack on President Obama, but also sounded some more socially conservative themes, which were popular with the attendees of the Christian conference.

title: Young Writers Dazzle Publisher (Mom and Dad)
description: The television news feature about Ben Heckmann, an eighth grader from Farmington, Minn., was breathless in its praise. At 14 years old, he has accomplished something many adults cant achieve, the reporter said. Ben is a twice-published author.

title: The Roberts Court Defines Itself
description: For anyone who still thought legal conservatives are dedicated to judicial restraint, the oral arguments before the Supreme Court on the health care case should put that idea to rest. There has been no court less restrained in signaling its willingness to replace law made by Congress with law made by justices.

title: Tax Fantasy
description: Congressman Paul Ryan, the author of the House Republican budget, is not the first politician to go long on promises and short on details. But his budget, which passed the House last week with no Democratic votes, takes untruth in taxes to a new level.

title: Let N.Y.U. Expand in Its Backyard
description: New York Universitys 44,000 students and 16,000-plus employees need more space. Over the next two decades, the university wants to expand ambitiously, with new sites around the city, but mostly with another 2.5 million square feet in Greenwich Village.

title: Now, the Seventh-Inning Swim
description: Good riddance, March, and take your upside-down weather with you: the bizarre heat, the early blossoms in Detroit, the hailstones in Hawaii. Welcome, April and baseball! After a couple of season-opening games in Tokyo, the major leagues come home this week, starting on Wednesday night in Miami, where the Marlins are breaking in a new name, new uniforms and a brand new downtown ballpark against the World Series champion St. Louis Cardinals.

title: Whos the Bully in Wisconsin?
description: The Wisconsin primary on Tuesday is widely seen as Rick Santorums last chance of stopping Mitt Romney from winning the Republican nomination. The states Republicans, however, are far more concerned with the furiously contested recall election of Gov. Scott Walker, now set for June 5.

title: The Grilling Season
description: The members of Congress, 535 of them, return home for two weeks of pulse-taking and pre-election campaigning. Those brave enough to venture beyond their circle of political allies should not expect cheers. What they deserve are pointed questions about why they spend so much time in ideological posturing and so little in actually helping people.

title: Sunday Dialogue: How We Decide When to Go to War
description: Readers debate how recent military interventions abroad have swayed public sentiment.

title: Why a Haggadah?
description: I SPENT much of the last several years working on a new Haggadah  the guidebook for the prayers, rituals and songs of the Seder  and am often asked why I would want to take time away from my own writing to invest myself in such a project.

title: About All That War Buzz
description: Re Lessons From Another Way (March 11):

title: A Triangle of Racial Identity
description: Which other racial groups do blacks, whites, and Latinos in Durham, North Carolina each identify with most?

title: Sunday Breakfast Menu, April 1
description: The Sunday talk shows will again focus on the presidential race just a couple of days ahead of the Wisconsin primary.

title: Training Materials for Tracking Cellphones
description: Law enforcement in three states use educational materials to learn how to track cellphones and text messages.

title: In Florida, a Death Foretold
description: Tampa, Fla.

title: Why Nations Fail
description: IM reading a fascinating new book called Why Nations Fail. The more you read it, the more you appreciate what a fools errand were on in Afghanistan and how much we need to totally revamp our whole foreign aid strategy. But most intriguing are the warning flares the authors put up about both America and China.

title: Fan Power: Hunger Is Not a Game, Revisited
description: The Hunger Games film, which debuted just over a week ago, has exceeded all box office expectations, taking in nearly $200 million to date and making Lionsgate, its distributor, very happy. But it isnt just the on screen battle that has caught the attention of fans.

title: The Genius of the Mandate
description: WHEN the Obama White House set out to make the liberal dream of universal health coverage a reality, it faced two obvious political obstacles. The first was the power of the interlocking interest groups  insurance companies, physician associations, pharmaceutical companies  that potentially stood to lose money and power in a comprehensive reform. The second was the price tag of a universal health care entitlement, which promised to be high enough to frighten vulnerable members of Congress.

title: Shes Fit to Be Tied
description: WHEN I was 14, I sneaked into the empty bedroom of my scholarly older brother to poke around in his bookcase. Tucked behind his law school tomes and Winston Churchill memoirs, I found the Story of O.

title: The Bleaker Sex
description: THE first time you see Lena Dunhams character having sex in the new HBO series Girls, her back is to her boyfriend, who seems to regard her as an inconveniently loquacious halfway point between partner and prop, and her concern is whether shes correctly following instructions.

title: Naked in New York
description: Lena Dunham, the 25-year-old star, writer and director of the new HBO series Girls, has extensive, definite thoughts about sex. The weekly half-hour show, which debuts on April 15th, makes that clear. A recent interview with her made it even clearer.

title: Financiers and Sex Trafficking
description: THE biggest forum for sex trafficking of under-age girls in the United States appears to be a Web site called Backpage.com.

title: Womens Final Four Matchups
description: Taking a deeper look at the pairings for the Womens Final Four, which will be held in Denver:

title: A Quantum Theory of Mitt Romney
description: THE recent remark by Mitt Romneys senior adviser Eric Fehrnstrom that upon clinching the Republican nomination Mr. Romney could change his political views like an Etch A Sketch has already become notorious. The comment seemed all too apt, an apparent admission by a campaign insider of two widely held suspicions about Mitt Romney: that he is a) utterly devoid of any ideological convictions and b) filled with aluminum powder.

title: Patience Abbe, 1924-2012
description: Ms. Abbe co-wrote books about her familys world travels and became a celebrity at age 12 in 1936 with the publication of Around the World in Eleven Years.

title: Call Me Irresponsible  Please
description: Paul McCulley has written a magisterial survey (pdf) of responsible and irresponsible policies in liquidity traps past and present, making the case  familiar to my regular readers  that there are times when violating orthodoxy is very much the right answer. And this is one of those times.

title: In Event Full of Mishaps, No. 4 Seed Does Himself In
description: The European Individual Chess Championship has become one of the strongest tournaments in the world, partly because the top finishers earn spots to the World Cup. But this years event, which ended Saturday and had more than 175 grandmasters in competition, seemed to have been jinxed.

title: Of Course!
description: SUNDAYS PUZZLE  And you thought it was going to be an April Fools Day puzzle. April Fool!

title: As Mayor Cultivates New Business, Treatment of Backer Is Questioned
description: Two days after the Nov. 8, 2011, San Francisco mayoral election, Mayor Edwin M. Lee and his top campaign contributor, the Silicon Valley investor Ron Conway, met for a two-hour dinner at Caf des Amis in San Franciscos tony Marina District.

title: Police Are Using Phone Tracking as a Routine Tool
description: WASHINGTON  Law enforcement tracking of cellphones, once the province mainly of federal agents, has become a powerful and widely used surveillance tool for local police officials, with hundreds of departments, large and small, often using it aggressively with little or no court oversight, documents show.

title: A Big Day for Bichette
description: KISSIMMEE, Fla.  Dante Bichette Jr. grew up in Orlando, about a 20-minute drive from Osceola County Stadium here, and played many games here as a child and a teenager. But on Saturday, instead of being on a local travel team, he was playing for the Yankees, and the manager was Joe Girardi, one of his fathers closest friends, while his parents and younger brother watched from box seats next to the dugout.

title: Ghosts of Iraq Haunting C.I.A. in Tackling Iran
description: WASHINGTON  At the nations top spy agency, the ghosts of Iraq are never far away.

title: Knicks Push for Playoffs Will Go On Without Lin
description: Jeremy Lins rise was swift and magical, an N.B.A. fairy tale played out on a global stage, one enchanting chapter at a time, its conclusion a captivating mystery. That epilogue came Saturday night, much sooner than anticipated, with a shockingly cruel twist.

title: As Kitten Season Approaches, City Agency Finds New Partner to Help Adoptions
description: Spring has sprung  in all its rainy glory in the Bay Area  but animal shelters are steeling themselves for the beginning of a dreaded annual event: kitten season.

title: As Logjam at Top Weakens, Republican Ambitions for State Offices Break Loose
description: Ross Ramsey, the executive editor of The Texas Tribune, writes a column for The Tribune.

title: No One Else for Animals, So Retirement Must Wait
description: For 40 years, Roberto Margo has been the only veterinarian in the border town of Rio Grande City, which not long ago had more cattle than people.

title: Masked Figures Invite Riders at 8 Subway Stations to Ride Free
description: A group of masked individuals gave subterranean vandalism an activist tinge this week: They tampered with subway entrance equipment with the aim of letting commuters in Manhattan and Brooklyn ride free, the police said on Saturday.

title: After 100 Years, Muni Has Gotten Slower
description: The San Francisco Muni is turning 100 this year. And in that century of great technological progress, in which an aircraft broke the sound barrier in 1947 and a supersonic car did the same in 1997, Muni has actually become slower.

title: The Caucus Click: The Week in Pictures
description: A look back at the week on the campaign trail in Wisconsin, Vermont and California.

title: The Caucus Click: The Week in Pictures
description: A look back at the week on the campaign trail in Wisconsin, Vermont and California.  Go to the slide show.
